10453.description: Help our Health Education and Dental teams hold at a Dental Hygiene workshop for homeless children. Many of our clients have major health concerns as a result of their homelessness and dental hygiene is often neglected. While our Dental team conducts much needed dental exams, volunteers will support our Health Education team as they share important dental health information and distribute incentives for participation to our homeless clients. Volunteer duties include, but are not limited to, client outreach, clinic sign-ups, and crowd management. Care for the Homeless is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization that operates medical clinics in partnership with homeless shelters, soup kitchens, and drop-in locations throughout the city. We also operate a 200-bed, transitional residence for homeless women in the Bronx called Susan's Place.
10453.title: Help Support a Dental Hygiene Workshop for the Homeless!

10452.description: Program Overview: South Bronx United's (SBU) Global Youth League aims to partner with immigrant youth in the Bronx as they transition to life in the United States. By providing a meeting place for youth to acclimate to life in New York through the familiar vehicle of soccer, we aim to add value to their experience through the provision of additional legal and social services support and referrals. We are able to provide this support through partnering with committed volunteers and our network of community based organizations in the Bronx. Position Overview: Coach Mentors work with one team of girls or boys who participate in the intramural SBU Global Youth League during the Fall and/or Spring Seasons. Coaches run short practices and manage games for youth that compete against the other teams within the SBU league. Coaches not only share the joy of playing the sport, but also reinforce the values that sport helps develop, including teamwork, discipline, and empathy. Most importantly, Coach Mentors play a vital role in mentoring youth in the program adjust to life in New York. When: Saturday morning/afternoon in Fall and Spring. Coaches volunteer a set 1.5-2 hour slot between 12pm-5pm. The time slot is dependent on the age group being coached. Fall runs from September - November Spring runs from mid-March - June Where: Mullaly Park: Jerome Avenue at 165th Street. Park is on the north side of Yankee Stadium Commitment: Coach Mentors must be able to commit to being present for at least a 1.5 hours every Saturday(excluding holiday weekends) during the season. Attend Coach Mentor Orientation Training prior to the commencement of the season. Additional optional training sessions will be provided during the season. One season commitment minimum, but two seasons is preferred. Coaches should understand they will be the point person for contact with families and players and willing to make phone calls home to ensure plays are aware of games and to provide other additional support where necessary. Qualifications: No formal coaching experience but passion for the game and enthusiasm for working with children is a necessity. Passion for and prior experience working with immigrant youth a plus
10452.title: YOUTH SOCCER COACH MENTOR, SOUTH BRONX UNITED GLOBAL YOUTH LEAGUE

10451.description: The Damon Runyon Cancer Research Foundation is currently seeking volunteers for the eighth annual Runyon 5K at Yankee Stadium. Volunteering is a fun way for friends, co-workers and family members to take part in this unique event and we need your help to knock it out of the park! We're looking for enthusiastic and reliable people to help out with everything from set-up and breakdown to cheering on participants as they run or walk a 5K through Yankee Stadium. We welcome individuals as well as corporate and community groups for what promises to be a great day in support of young scientists and innovative cancer research. Most of the volunteer activities take place on the day of the event - S aturday, July 15, from 7am until approximately 2pm. Breakfast and lunch will be provided.
10451.title: Runyon 5K at Yankee Stadium

10451.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at The Concourse PLaza Multiplex. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
10451.title: Volunteer for the Jimmy Fund at Concourse Plaza Multiplex in Bronx, NY!

10451.description: South Bronx United is seeking energetic individuals with a passion for youth development and sports to join the Americorps Up2Us Coaching program. Each South Bronx United Americorps Up2Us member will serve as the Team Mentor and head or assistant soccer coach for a team of youth within the SBU Academy Program. In addition to mentoring and coaching a competitive soccer team, the Up2Us member will have an additional focus area, either helping with coordination and coaching of SBU’s Community Soccer Programs OR assisting with coordination and program delivery of the SBU After School Tutoring/College Prep Programs. Up2Us members will have the opportunity to see the inner working of a small, growing non-profit and gain professional experience and skills in the fields of education, teaching, counseling, and coaching. This is a part time position requiring approximately 15-20 hours/week. A living stipend will be offered in accordance with the AmeriCorps part-time position policies. Those who complete the year long Americorps term in support of South Bronx youth, also receive an educational award to go towards future or past educational loans. Additionally, those who complete the year will be considered for further paid SBU coaching positions. In addition to site-specific duties at South Bronx United, members are also responsible for the following Up2Us program requirements: Completing timesheets; Attending the Up2Us National Coaching Institute, Attending professional development and training seminars every other month; Reflecting on their work in guided reflection logs; and Participating in a National Day of Service. The Americorps Up2Us program is an intense experience and members are asked to go above and beyond each and every day at their host site (South Bronx United). Being a part of the Up2Us program connects members both with their local communities and a larger national movement of people dedicated to serving youth through sports. Responsibilities As a Team Mentor & Coach, the Americorps member will: -Serve as first point of staff level contact for a group of approx 20 youth (mentees) -Help plan, set, and keep students on their program schedule -Maintain weekly contact with each mentee in person and via phone -Maintain regular contact with mentees’ parent(s)/guardian(s) -Monitor student academic performance, and assist in the collection of student report cards, transcripts, and school documents -Work with SBU Youth Counselor and Education Director to identify social, emotional, and academic issues or concerns -Check email daily and maintain good communication with SBU office staff -Enforce attendance and program policies -Serve as a head or assistant coach for 1 SBU travel soccer team, planning and leading training sessions, coaching at games, and travelling with students to games and events. -Track attendance data from soccer and academic sessions. -Complete progress reports for each mentee two times per year. Additionally Americorps Up2Us Coaches will either: -Assist with coordination and program delivery of the After School Tutoring Program and/or College Prep program, helping managing the learning environment, tracking student attendance and providing direct academic support OR -Assist with the coordination of the SBU recreational program, supporting volunteer soccer coaches, leading recreational practices, and helping with coach trainings. Location* SBU Office: South Bronx United, 594 Grand Concourse, Suite 2, Bronx, NY 10451 Academic Site: Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY Primary Soccer Site: Macomb’s Dam Park, 161st Street, Bronx, NY 10451 *Most service will be performed at soccer or academic sites Schedule The term of service runs August 1, 2017-July 31, 2018. The following hours are approximate, times may change slightly. Team Coach & Mentor w/Soccer Focus -T/Th, 6-8pm (Academy Soccer Practice) -T/W/Th, 3:30-6pm (Recreational Practice) OR Sat, 8-3pm (Recreational Games) -Sun (dependent on game schedules) Team Coach & Mentor w/Academic Focus -M/W, 5:30-8pm OR T/Th, 3:30-6pm (Tutoring/College Prep) -T/Th, 6-8pm (Academy Soccer Practice) -Sat or Sun (dependent on game schedules) Compensation Coaches will receive a $7,770 living stipend for their service over the course of 12 months as well as an educational award of $2,907 to go towards loan repayment or future educational costs. All HR related matters are handled by Up2Us. Learn more about the Up2Us program at https://www.up2us.org/coach- across-america Qualifications Enthusiastic to work with youth, committed to holistic youth development with a strong knowledge of soccer. Previous coaching experience is not a necessity. Coach/Mentors with an Academic Focus should have a strong academic background and feel comfortable with SAT level Math and English. How to Apply To apply email info@southbronxunited.org with a cover letter and resume
10451.title: Team Mentor & Coach - Americorps Up2Us

10451.description: OVERVIEW The Coach Across America staff member would become a Team Mentor for one or two teams of youth within the SBU Academy Program. She/he would serve as an assistant or head coach for one or two teams, help with coordination of the SBU Recreational Soccer Program, and assist with program delivery of the SBU After School Tutoring or College Prep Programs for middle and high school students. Team mentors are the first point of contact for issues or questions concerning a youth on their team. This is a part time position requiring approximately 20-25 hours/week. A living stipend will be offered in accordance with the AmeriCorps part-time position policies. The Coach Across America program is operated by Up2Us. In addition to site-specific duties, Coach Across America Coaches are also responsible for the following Up2Us CAA program requirements: Completing timesheets; Attending professional development and training seminars; Reflecting on their work in guided reflection logs; and Participating in a National Day of Service Coach Across America is an intense experience and Coaches are asked to go above and beyond each and every day. Being a part of Coach Across America connects Coaches both with their local communities and a larger national movement of people dedicated to serving youth through sports. RESPONSIBILITIES As a Team Mentor, individual will: * Serve as a mentor and adviser for 18-40 youth on 1-2 soccer teams. * Set and communicate their mentees’ program schedule and plan, * Collect report cards, transcripts, and school documents, * Maintain weekly contact with each mentee in person and via phone, * Maintain regular contact with mentees’ parent/guardian * Communicate with students’ schools or outside programs as needed, * Work with SBU youth counselor and education staff to identify social, emotional, and academic issues or concerns * When applicable, collaborate with Education Director and Director of College Placement and Alumni, to support students with high school and college placement process (including public, charter, parochial, prep, and boarding schools). * Serve as a head or assistant coach for 1-2 SBU travel soccer teams, planning and leading training sessions, coaching at games, and traveling with students to games and events. * Track attendance data from soccer and academic sessions. * Complete progress reports for each mentee two times per year. * Assist with the After School Tutoring and/or College Prep programs, tutoring youth, managing the learning environment, and tracking student attendance. * Help supervise the SBU Recreational Soccer Program on Saturday mornings/afternoons, setting up the field space and games, overseeing youth participants, and supporting volunteer rec coaches & referees. * Assist with several major SBU events including volunteer appreciation nights, an end of the year awards ceremony, a winter celebration, the City Showcase Tournament and Symposium, and the SBU Annual Benefit. LOCATION South Bronx United, 594 Grand Concourse, Suite 2, Bronx, NY 10451 SCHEDULE The following hours are approximate, times may change: * Tuesdays & Thursdays, 3:30-8:00pm * Saturdays & Sunday mornings/afternoons for games and leagues COMPENSATION Coaches will receive a $7,700 living stipend (approx) for their service over the course of 12 months, as well as an educational award of $2,865 (approx) upon completion of service to go towards loan repayment or future educational costs. All HR related matters are handled by Up2Us and AmeriCorps. Learn more about the CAA program at https://www.up2us.org/coach-across-america How to Apply Email info@southbronxunited.org with a cover letter and resume. Please put \"Americorps Team Mentor\" in the subject line.
10451.title: Soccer Coach & Team Mentor - Americorps CAA Program

10451.description: Regents Prep Tutors work with seniors within the SBU college prep program, 1 on 1 or in small groups, to assist them in completing their high school graduation requirements of which passing the NY State Regents Exams is the main obstacle. Regents exam topic areas cover the core academic subject areas (Math, History, Science, English); however most students primarily need the extra support with respect to Math, mainly algebra, and English. Tutors will work with the same student(s) week to week, providing the opportunity to build relationships and serve as positive role models in youths' lives, promoting the importance of education. When: Seniors: Mondays or Wednesdays, 6:00-8:00pm, January-June Where: Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, Mott Haven HS Campus, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY 10451 Commitment: Tutors are asked to commit to tutoring student(s) in at least one of the regents subject areas, English, math, or history, for 2 hours, one evening a week from Jan - early June. However, if a tutor would like to be more involved, he/she is always welcome. Qualifications: South Bronx United is looking for highly motivated, energetic volunteers who want to make a difference in the lives of South Bronx youth. Tutors should possess either strong math or English skills, and feel comfortable breaking down and explaining processes for problem solving. Tutors should also be willing to review the provided weekly Regents math, English, or history material beforehand so that they are prepared for working with the students. Training: An orientation and training at the beginning of service will be run for all tutors to give general guidelines, tutoring tips and to go over the specific needs of the students. Additional training and \"check ins\" will be conducted intermittently throughout the course of the year. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow underserved students to thrive in school, SBU is happy to connect with your school to see if your volunteer hours can work towards school service or academic requirements. Beyond Tutoring: The boys and girls participating in the program are also members of the South Bronx United Travel Soccer Teams. Tutors are welcome and encouraged to come out and see a game or get involved in a practice as youth are extremely passionate about the sport and its a great way to connect with them.
10451.title: Regents Prep Tutor

10451.description: Overview: Tutors for the SBU youth college prep programs work with small groups of Sophomores, Juniors, or Seniors in providing them with the academic support needed to graduate high school and go to college. Tutors for Sophomores and Juniors follow a set curriculum developed by SBU in teaching weekly lessons in either math or English, while also helping students with school homework and Regents exam preparation. Senior tutors assist with homework, regent’s exam preparation, and college and scholarship applications. All College Prep Tutors work with the same group of students week to week, providing the opportunity to build relationships and serve as positive role models in youths' lives, promoting the importance of education. When: Sophomores: Mondays - English OR Wednesdays - Math, 6:00-8:00pm Juniors: Mondays - Math OR Wednesdays - English, 6:00-8:00pm Seniors: Mondays, 6:00-8:00pm 1st Semester: mid September - mid January 2nd Semester: early February - early June Where: Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, Mott Haven HS Campus, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY 10451 Commitment: Tutors are asked to commit to teaching either English or math for 2 hours, one evening a week for at least one semester (Sept-Jan or Feb-June). However, if a tutor would like to be more involved, he/she is always welcome. Qualifications: South Bronx United is looking for highly motivated, energetic volunteers who want to make a difference in the lives of South Bronx youth. Tutors should possess either strong math or English skills, and feel comfortable breaking down and explaining processes for problem solving. Tutors should also be willing to review the provided weekly math or English lessons beforehand so that they are prepared for working with the students. Training: An orientation and training at the beginning of service will be run for all tutors to give general guidelines, tutoring tips and to go over the specific needs of the students. Additional training and \"check ins\" will be conducted intermittently throughout the course of the year. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow under-served students to thrive in school, SBU is happy to connect with your school to see if your volunteer hours can work towards school service or academic requirements. Beyond Tutoring: The boys and girls participating in the program are also members of the South Bronx United Travel Soccer Teams. Tutors are welcome and encouraged to come out and see a game or get involved in a practice as youth are extremely passionate about the sport and its a great way to connect with the kids.
10451.title: College Prep Tutor

10451.description: Overview: South Bronx United (\"SBU\") is looking for highly motivated, energetic volunteers who want to make a difference in the lives of South Bronx youth. PSAT/Sophomore skills tutors follow a set curriculum in tutoring small groups (3-4 students) of Sophomores one evening a week to build their fundamental knowledge and skills in English. SBU SAT Prep tutors follow a set curriculum in tutoring small groups (3-4 students) of juniors one evening a week to improve their level in the Verbal/Writing sections of the SAT in preparation for the spring exam (May or June). Tutors will also assist students with homework and NY Regents Exam preparation when relevant. Tutors work with the same group of students week to week, allowing tutors to build relationships with the youth and serve as positive role models in youths' lives, promoting the importance of education. When: PSAT Sophomore Skills Tutors Mondays 6-8PM; SAT Tutors Wednesdays 6-8PM 1st Semester - September-January 2nd Semester - February-June Where: Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, Mott Haven HS Campus, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY 10451 Commitment: Tutors are asked to commit to one evening a week for 2 hours for at least one semester. However, if a tutor would like to be more involved, he/she is always welcome. Training: An orientation at the beginning of service will be run for all tutors to give general guidelines and tutoring tips and to go over the specific needs of the students. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow under served students to thrive in school, SBU is happy to connect with your school to see if your volunteer hours can work towards school service or academic requirements. Beyond Tutoring: The boys and girls participating in the program are also members of the South Bronx United Travel Soccer Teams. Tutors are welcome and encouraged to come out and see a game or get involved in a practice as youth are extremely passionate about the sport and its a great way to connect with the kids.
10451.title: PSAT/SAT Prep - Verbal & Writing Tutor

10451.description: Overview: South Bronx United is looking for highly motivated, energetic volunteers who want to make a difference in the lives of South Bronx youth. Tutors for Sophomores & Juniors follow a set curriculum developed by SBU in teaching weekly lessons in Math, while also helping students with school homework and Regents exam preparation.Tutors have the opportunity to build relationships with the boys and girls and serve as mentors in promoting the importance of education. When: SAT Prep Tutors Mondays, 6:00-8:00PM; PSAT/Sophomore Skills Prep Tutors Wednesdays, 6:00-8:00pm 1st Semester - September-January 2nd Semester - February-June Where: Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, Mott Haven HS Campus, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY 10451 Commitment: Tutors are asked to commit to one evening a week for 2 hours for at least one semester. However, if a tutor would like to be more involved, he/she is always welcome. Training: An orientation at the beginning of service will be run for all tutors to give general guidelines and tutoring tips and to go over the specific needs of the students. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow under served students to thrive in school, SBU is happy to connect with your school to see if your volunteer hours can work towards school service or academic requirements. Beyond Tutoring: The boys and girls participating in the program are also members of the South Bronx United Travel Soccer Teams. Tutors are welcome and encouraged to come out and see a game or get involved in a practice as youth are extremely passionate about the sport and its a great way to connect with the kids.
10451.title: PSAT/SAT Prep - Math Tutor

10451.description: Special Events Interns work closely with South Bronx United’s Executive Director in planning and managing nonprofit fundraising events with a focus on SBU’s Annual Benefit. The Annual Benefit, which raised over $50,000 last year, represents a significant and essential portion of SBU’s operating budget allowing SBU to keep pace with growing programming needs of Bronx youth. When: Exact hours are flexible and will fluctuate according to key periods with more hours likely needed immediately prior to the Benefit in early November. Where: SBU Office, 594 Grand Concourse, Bronx, NY 10451. Work can often be done remotely if needed. Qualifications: Along with possessing a passion for supporting non profit work and serving urban youth, an intern should have strong communication and writing skills and comfort using Microsoft Excel and Google Documents. Additionally, an ideal candidate should have or be working towards a BA in communications, non profit management, marketing or another related field, as well as experience in event planning and/or fundraising. Commitment: 10-15 hours a week, one semester. The workload of the position is expected to fluctuate around key periods, but is often flexible for a candidate to choose their hours. Training: All interns will be trained, supervised by the Executive Director. Benefits: While the position is unpaid, interns have the opportunity to see the inner workings of a small but growing non profit and the process of planning and managing a major fundraising event. Responsibilities in Detail: * Support the SBU Benefit Committee and Supporters Clubs in planning and promoting events (annual benefits, charity cup, happy hour fundraisers, volunteer recognition events) * Interns help solicit donations for events (venue, food, drinks, auctions items, etc), managing event logistics (catering, registration, recruiting and training volunteers, music, awards program, etc.) and creating event materials (save the date, evite, sponsor letters) * Create financial reports for event * Managing social media and appropriate mainstream media
10451.title: Special Events Internship - Fall 2016

10451.description: South Bronx United Education Interns work closely with SBU educational staff in coordinating and supervising the SBU After School Tutoring Program. The program provides homework help and academic enrichment activities for approximately 80 youth ages 10-15. Interns work 3-5 days a week from 3:45-6:45 pm and get hands on experience administering an educational program, counseling and tutoring youth, and developing educational resources. The internship is perfect for those looking to gain experience in the fields of education or school counseling. When: Fall Internship: September - early December Spring Internship: mid/late January - May Where: The Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, 2nd Floor, Mott Haven Campus, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY 10451. Qualifications: Enthusiastic and caring with a specific interest in social work, counseling, and youth empowerment. Should have a background in working with youth. Education, social work, psychology, sociology, or related majors are preferred. No soccer background necessary. Commitment: A minimum of 3 days a week from 3:45-6:15, Monday-Friday for at least one semester (NY public school semester, not college semester). Training: All interns will receive training from our Director of Education and Youth Counselor prior to working in the classroom. Benefits: While the position is unpaid, interns have the opportunity to work directly with veteran educators and a licensed mental health counselor in an educational setting. Interns will get hands on experience in developing learning resources, managing a classroom, and working with students who have the greatest educational and/or emotional needs. Responsibilities Detailed: Interns assist in three major program areas. Depending on the specific interests and skill set of the intern the job can be focused on one or more of these areas: Education * Provide tutoring to youth within the program with a focus on Special Education students * Support staff with classroom management * Help build the database of educational resources and develop lesson plans * Support the Education Director in building a middle school curriculum Programmatic * Track student behavioral incidents and progress * Organize and maintain classroom space, program records and academic resources * Support staff in tracking academic progress at tutoring and school * Assist with volunteer recruitment and management Counseling * Help resolve conflicts between youth and manage behavior * Work with youth in setting behavioral goals
10451.title: Education Internship

10451.description: South Bronx United College Prep Interns work closely with SBU educational staff in coordinating and supervising the SBU College Prep Program. The program provides academic support and mentorship for approximately 60 students in grades 10-12. Interns work 3 days a week and get hands on experience administering an educational program, tracking student progress towards college, and advising students on academic needs. The internship is perfect for those looking to gain experience in the fields of educational administration and school counseling. When: Fall Internship: September - December Spring Internship: mid/late January - May Where: The Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, 2nd Floor, Mott Haven Campus, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY 10451. Qualifications: Enthusiastic and caring with a specific interest in education and youth empowerment. Should have a background in working with youth. Commitment: A minimum of 3 days a week for one semester (NY public school semester, not college). 6-8pm on Mondays and Wednesdays is required. 3rd day is flexible. Training: All interns will receive training from our Director of College Placement and Recruitment. Benefits: While the position is unpaid, interns have the opportunity to work directly with our Director of College Placement and Education Director and learn firsthand best practices for ensuring a pathway to college for all students. Responsibilities in Detail: * Track program attendance and progress of all students * Family outreach/student outreach to improve student attendance at programs * Manage procurement and entry of student records and documents(transcripts, report cards, tax returns, waivers) * Research important college prep resources needed for each student (relevant scholarships, trade schools, additional SAT Prep & Regents Prep resources, GED options)
10451.title: College Advisory Internship - 2017/18

10451.description: Overview: Rec League Coaches work with one team of girls and boys within the SBU Recreational Soccer League during Fall and/or Spring Seasons. Coaches run short practices and manage games for youth that compete against the other teams within the SBU league. Coaches not only share the joy of playing the sport, but also reinforce the values that sport helps develop (teamwork, discipline, respect, etc). When: * Saturday morning in Fall and Spring. Coaches volunteer for at least 1.5 hr with practices and games held between 9-10am. * Fall runs September 10-November 19 * Spring runs mid-March - June Where: * Macomb's Dam Field: 161st St between River and Jerome Avenues. The field is on the South side of Yankee Stadium across from Gate 4. Commitment: * Coaches must be able to commit to being present for at least a 1.5 hours every Saturday (excluding holiday weekends) during the season. * One season commitment minimum, but two seasons is preferred. * Coaches should understand they will be the point person for contact with families and players and willing to make phone calls home to ensure plays are aware of games/other important news. Qualifications: Previous soccer knowledge is not required, but enthusiasm for working with children is a necessity. Training: We will provide volunteers with orientation materials, coaching training, and a coaching manual. A formal orientation/ training will be held prior to each season. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow under resourced youth the opportunity to participate in an organized sport, coaches will have opportunities for professional coaching trainings and will be connected to a network of caring volunteers for fun soccer related events throughout the year
10451.title: Coed U6 Recreational soccer coach

10451.description: To provide assistance to the professional staff so that the management of the program will run smoothly. To provide timely communication and assistance to the organization’s members and supporters. Responsibilities: Enters Senior Center activity sign-in information into STARS Databases Answers the telephone; record and deliver messages Makes copies, sends faxes, and do filing, as needed Assists with putting out and picking up sign-in sheets Enters short intakes and member applications into PSS/STARS database Checks to ensure that the units are accurately placed in the STARS database Creates information packets Creates member charts Opportunities at two sites.
10451.title: Clerical and Data Entry Assistant

10451.description: ESOL teachers work with a small group (5-10) of students in the South Bronx United Youth Development Program that are currently designated as English Language Learners (ELL) to provide homework help and weekly English lessons. ESOL Tutors meet with the boys and girls, ages 11-18, for 2 hours on a set day every week. Tutors work with the same group week to week, having the opportunity to build relationships with the youth and serve as positive adult role models in their lives, promoting the importance of education. When: Dates: September - June, Mondays and Wednesdays, 6-8pm Where: Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, Mott Haven HS Campus, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY 10451 Qualifications: South Bronx United is looking for highly motivated, energetic volunteers who want to make a difference in the lives of South Bronx youth. Volunteers with some experience teaching ELL students are preferred. Proficiency in Spanish and/or French is also a plus. Volunteers should possess a general knowledge of 6th-10th grade subject areas and feel comfortable teaching youth how to utilize the resources available to solve problems, guiding them through the process rather than simply providing answers. It is not expected that tutors will be experts in all subject areas or know the answers to everything! Commitment: ESOL Teachers are asked to commit to 2 hours, one day a week for at least one semester (Sept-Jan or Feb-June). However, if a teacher would like to be more involved, he/she is always welcome. Training: An orientation and training will be provided before beginning service to provide general guidelines, best practices, tutoring tips and to go over the specific needs of the students. Further meetings with our Education Director will be held to plan the curriculum and lessons ahead working in the classroom. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow underserved students to thrive in school, SBU is happy to connect with your school to see if your volunteer hours can work towards academic requirements. Beyond Tutoring: Youth participating in the program are also members of the South Bronx United Travel Soccer Teams. Tutors are welcome and encouraged to come out and see a game or get involved in a practice as youth are extremely passionate about the sport and its a great way to connect with them.
10451.title: ESL Tutor 2017-2018

10451.description: Overview: SBU College Prep Mentors provide program youth with the tools necessary to graduate high school and attend college. College Prep Mentors are matched with small groups (3-4 students) of SBU high school seniors as they prepare for senior year exams and navigate the college application process. Mentors focus primarily on assisting with applications, but may be called on to provide support with homework and SAT, ACT and/or Regents exam preparation. Mentors promote the importance of education and serve as positive role models in youths' lives. When: Wednesdays, 6:00-8:00pm, September - June Where: Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, Mott Haven HS Campus, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY 10451 Commitment: Mentors are asked to commit to one evening a week for 2 hours for the entirety of the school year (Sept-June). However, if a tutor would like to be more involved, he/she is always welcome. Qualifications: South Bronx United is looking for highly motivated, energetic volunteers who want to make a difference in the lives of South Bronx youth. Volunteers should have gone through the college application process themselves, with a preference for those who have already obtained a bachelor's degree. It's not expected that mentors will be experts on the process, but they should be willing to work hard to help students with finding answers and staying on track throughout the process. Training: A orientation and training will be held before the start of the program to provide an overview of the program and start to cover some of the ins and outs of the application process. Further training will be held throughout the year to cover specific topic areas of the application process in more depth. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow underserved students to thrive in school, SBU is happy to connect with your school to see if your volunteer hours can work towards school service or academic requirements. Beyond Tutoring: The boys and girls participating in the program are also members of the South Bronx United Travel Soccer Teams. Tutors are welcome and encouraged to come out and see a game or get involved in a practice as youth are extremely passionate about the sport and its a great way to connect with them.
10451.title: College Prep Mentor 2017-2018

10451.description: South Bronx United is seeking energetic and committed volunteer coaches with a passion for youth development and soccer to coach one of it's travel teams (Girls: U14 and U19 & Boys: U12, U14, U16, U17, U19) that play year-round in the Cosmopolitan Junior Soccer League or Westchester Youth Soccer League, affiliates of US Youth Soccer. In addition to helping youth develop technical and tactical skills on the field, coaches serve as mentors and role models for the players encouraging their attendance at SBU academic programs and stressing the importance of education. When: Fall Season: mid August - early December Winter Season: January - early March (Only one practice a week) Spring Season: mid March - June Where: Practices: Generally held at Macomb's Dam Field, 161st Street across from Yankee Stadium. Games: Home games are generally held at Randall's Island. Away games are played across the 5 boroughs (boys), Westchester County (girls), and occasionally beyond (tournaments/special events). Positions Available: Boys: U10, U11, U12, U14, U15, U17, U19 Girls: U11, U14, U19 Commitment: Head Coaches lead practices twice a week, generally Tuesday and Thursday evenings and manage games on Saturdays or Sundays during the season (Fall and Spring). One weekend practice a week is held during the winter months. Assistant Coaches should have consistent availability as well and help support the Head Coach at practices and games. Coaches are asked to be able to make a minimum commitment of at least one season. Qualifications: Previous coaching experience is not a necessity, but enthusiasm for working with children, a commit to holistic youth development and a strong knowledge of soccer is. Benefits: * A small volunteer stipend is provided each season to head coaches * Opportunities for professional coaching development in sports based youth development practices ------- South Bronx United uses soccer as a tool for social change. South Bronx United aims to help youth build character, teamwork, and leadership so that they can succeed in high school, college, careers, their community and beyond. South Bronx United strives to promote educational achievement, health and wellness, and character development through activities on and off the soccer field and to UNITE a diverse group of individuals and an incredibly diverse community toward common positive goals. For more information on South Bronx United, please visit www.southbronxunited.org.
10451.title: Travel Soccer Coach & Mentor

10451.description: Girls Soccer Coach and Mentor South Bronx United is seeking volunteer coaches for SBU's three girls' competitive travel soccer teams. In addition to helping a team of girls develop technical and tactical skills on the field, coaches serve as mentors and role models for the players, sharing the joy of playing the sport, but more importantly reinforcing the values that sport helps develop (teamwork, discipline, respect, etc) and emphasizing the importance of education. When: Travel Program: Fall Season: mid August - early December Winter Season: January - early March (Only one practice a week) Spring Season: mid March - June Where: Travel Program: Practices are generally held at Macomb's Dam Field, 161st Street across from Yankee Stadium. Home games are generally held at Randall's Island. Away games are played in Westchester County, and occasionally beyond (tournaments/special events). Positions Available: Girls: U14, U16, U19 Commitment: Travel Program: Head Coaches lead practices twice a week, generally Tuesday and Thursday evenings and manage games on Sundays during the season (Fall and Spring). One weekend practice a week is held during the winter months. Assistant Coaches should have consistent availability as well and help support the Head Coach at practices and games. Coaches are asked to be able to commit through the end of the school year at minimum (end of June). Qualifications: Previous coaching experience is not a necessity, but enthusiasm for working with children and a strong knowledge of soccer is. Benefits: Travel Program: A small volunteer stipend is provided each season to head coaches. Opportunities for professional coaching development in sports based youth development practices. --------- South Bronx United uses soccer as a tool for social change. South Bronx United aims to help youth build character, teamwork, and leadership so that they can succeed in high school, college, careers, their community and beyond. South Bronx United strives to promote educational achievement, health and wellness, and character development through activities on and off the soccer field and to UNITE a diverse group of individuals and an incredibly diverse community toward common positive goals. For more information on South Bronx United, please visit www.southbronxunited.org.
10451.title: Girls Soccer Coach & Mentor

10451.description: Wishgranting volunteers work directly with wish children and their families to live out the mission of Make-A-Wish through granting wishes! You will work with a volunteer partner, and meet with your wish child and their family. You will then have the magical conversation about your wish kid’s wish! Volunteers work with each child to determine his or her heartfelt wish and complete the granting of the wish with Program staff. Following your initial interview with a wish child, you and your volunteer partner maintain communication with the family and Make-A-Wish staff about the status of the wish. This helps build excitement and anticipation for the wish experience until the day the wish comes true! Wish granters are required to be a minimum age of 21, interview the wish child at their home or in the hospital, work collaboratively, and have excellent communications skills. This role does not require a specific number of volunteer hours per week but requires each volunteer to see the experience through from start to finish. Interviews with wish children are scheduled at the convenience of the volunteers and wish families. The wish process, from start to finish, can take anywhere between six months to two and a half years to reach completion.
10451.title: Wishgranting Volunteers
10451.org: Make-A-Wish Metro New York and Western New York

10451.description: Overview: Rec League Coaches work with one team of girls and/or boys within the SBU Recreational Soccer League during Fall and/or Spring Seasons. Coaches run short practices and manage games for youth that compete against the other teams within the SBU league, which consists of 9 age groups and 62 teams. Coaches not only share the joy of playing the sport, but also reinforce the values that sport helps develop (teamwork, discipline, respect, etc). When: * Saturday morning/afternoon in Fall and/or Spring. Coaches volunteer a set 1.5-2 hour slot between 9am-5pm. The time slot is dependent on the age group being coached. * Fall runs September 10 th -November 19th * Spring runs mid-March - June Where: (Coaches are only required to be at one site) * Macomb's Dam Field: 161st St between River and Jerome Avenues. The field is on the South side of Yankee Stadium across from Gate 4. * Mullaly Park: Jerome Avenue at 165th Street. Park is on the north side of Yankee Stadium * South Bronx High School: 701 St Anne's Ave Bronx, NY 10455 Commitment: * Coaches must be able to commit to being present for at least a 1.5 hours every Saturday (excluding holiday weekends) during the season. * One season commitment minimum, but two seasons is preferred. * Coaches should understand they will be the point person for contact with families and players and willing to make phone calls home to ensure plays are aware of games/other important news. Qualifications: Previous soccer knowledge is not required, but enthusiasm for working with children is a necessity. Training: We will provide volunteers with orientation materials, coaching training, and a coaching manual. A formal orientation/ training will be held prior to each season. Coaches will be assigned to age groups (age 4-19) based on experience, availability, and preference. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow under resourced youth the opportunity to participate in an organized sport, coaches will have opportunities for professional coaching trainings and will be connected to a network of caring volunteers for fun soccer related events throughout the year.
10451.title: Youth Soccer Coach (Recreational) 2017-2018

10451.description: Overview: South Bronx United is seeking coaches that not only want to share the joy of playing the sport but also want to reinforce the values that sport helps develop (teamwork, discipline, respect, etc) for its after school soccer program. SBU, a sports based youth development organization, runs after school practices for boys and girls ages 6-14, 3 days a week. Coaches work with one age group of 10-20 youth for 2 hours at least one day a week. When: Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, 4-6pm Fall Season: Early September - Early November, Spring Season: Mid March - Mid June Where: Mullaly Park, Jerome Avenue at 165th St, Bronx NY 10452 Commitment: Coaches must be able to commit to being present for at least a 2 hours, one day a week (4-6pm on either Tuesdays, Wednesday or Thursdays) for one season. Qualifications: Previous coaching experiences is not required, but enthusiasm for working with children and background playing the sport is needed. Training: We will provide volunteers with orientation materials, coaching training, and a coaching manual. A formal orientation/ training will be held prior to each season. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow underserved and under-resourced youth the opportunity to participate in a safe, structured environment, coaches will have opportunities for professional coaching trainings and will be connected to a network of caring volunteers for fun soccer related events throughout the year.
10451.title: After School Soccer Coach 2017-2018

10451.description: PSS Senior Centers need a Health Educator to: Provide health and wellness education for aging older adults and advocacy for health care. Design, present, evaluate, recommend, and disseminate high quality, culturally appropriate health education information and materials.
10451.title: Health Educator

10451.description: Overview: South Bronx United is seeking energetic and committed volunteer coaches with a passion for youth development and soccer to coach one of its travel teams (Girls: U14 and U19 & Boys: U12, U14, U16, U17, U19) that play year-round in the Cosmopolitan Junior Soccer League or Westchester Youth Soccer League, affiliates of US Youth Soccer. In addition to helping youth develop technical and tactical skills on the field, coaches serve as mentors and role models for the players encouraging their attendance at SBU academic programs and stressing the importance of education. Those who are coaching through a work study program are also required to commit at least half a day to working at the SBU office for staff meetings. When: Fall Season: late August - early December Winter Season: January - early March (Only one practice a week) Spring Season: mid March - June Where: Practices: Generally held at Macomb's Dam Field, 161st Street across from Yankee Stadium. Games: Home games are generally held at Randall's Island. Away games are played across the 5 boroughs (boys), Westchester County (girls), and occasionally beyond (tournaments/special events). Positions Available: Boys: U10, U11, U12, U14, U15, U17, U19 Girls: U11, U14, U19 Commitment: Head Coaches lead practices twice a week, generally Tuesday and Thursday evenings and manage games on Saturdays or Sundays during the season (Fall and Spring). One weekend practice a week is held during the winter months. Assistant Coaches should have consistent availability as well and help support the Head Coach at practices and games. Coaches ideally are able to commit to at least one soccer year (late August - mid June). Qualifications: Previous coaching experience is not a necessity, but enthusiasm for working with children, a commitment to holistic youth development, and a strong knowledge of soccer is. Benefits: Opportunities for professional coaching development in sports based youth development practices
10451.title: Travel Soccer Coach and Mentor

10451.description: Overview: Academic Coaches work with small groups (3-4 students) of boys & girls in the South Bronx United Youth Development Program to provide homework help and support the youth in reaching their grade levels in math and the English Language Arts. Academic Coaches meet with the boys and girls, ages 11-14, for 2 hours on a set day every week. Tutors work with the same groups week to week, having the opportunity to build relationships with the kids and serve as a positive adult role model in their lives. Dates: September - June, Monday-Friday, 4-6pm Where: Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, Mott Haven HS Campus, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY 10451 Qualifications: South Bronx United is looking for highly motivated, energetic volunteers who want to make a difference in the lives of South Bronx youth. Volunteers should possess a solid general knowledge of 5th-9th grade subject areas and feel comfortable teaching youth how to utilize the resources available to solve problems and guide them through the process rather than simply providing answers. It is not expected that tutors will be experts in all subject areas or know the answers to everything! Commitment: While the program runs every school day, Academic Coaches are only asked to commit to 2 hours, one day a week for one semester. However, if a coach would like to be more involved, he/she is always welcome. Training: An orientation at the beginning of service will be run for all Academic Coaches to give general guidelines and best practices. Additionally, a training will be held at or near the beginning of service to provide tutoring tips and to go over the specific needs of the students. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow underserved students to thrive in school, SBU is happy to connect with your school to see if your volunteer hours can work towards school service or academic requirements. Beyond Tutoring: Youth participating in the program are also members of the South Bronx United Furia Azul, Strikers, and Shooting Stars Travel Soccer Teams. Academic Coaches are welcome and encouraged to come out and see a game or get involved in a practice as youth are extremely passionate about the sport and its a great way to connect with the kids.
10451.title: Academic Coach (After School Tutor) - 2017

10451.description: Do you like interacting with people and helping others? Our Morrisania Air Right Senior Center is looking for help serving food to the seniors. Lunch service is part of our healthy living for seniors initiative.
10451.title: Kitchen Aide

10451.description: If you could go anywhere, meet anyone, be anything, or have anything you most wanted . . . what would it be? Become a wishgranting volunteer and help create moments of hope, strength, and joy for children in the Metro New York area. As a Wishgranting Volunteer, you will be paired up in teams to interview children with life-threatening illnesses to determine their heartfelt wish. You will assist in the granting of each wish with Make-A-Wish staff and your volunteer partner.
10451.title: Help Make Wishes Come True! Become a Wish Granting Volunteer at Make-A-Wish!
10451.org: Make-A-Wish Metro New York and Western New York

10451.description: South Bronx United is looking for highly motivated, energetic volunteers who want to make a difference in the lives of South Bronx youth. South Bronx United runs an afterschool tutoring program for youth and is seeking SAT Prep tutors to work one on one or in small groups with it's high school seniors who will be taking the October and November SATs. SAT tutors will work with the student(s) for 90mins - 2 hours at least once a week on a set day(s) every week. The program is run M-F from 3:30-6pm at the Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY 10451. However, there's is also possibility of tutoring on weekends if it's a better fit for the tutors schedule. Youth participating in the program are also members of the South Bronx United Travel Soccer Teams. Tutors are welcome and encouraged to come out and see a game or get involved in a practice as youth are extremely passionate about the sport and its a great way to connect with the kids. ------- South Bronx United uses soccer as a vehicle for social change, aiming to help youth build character, teamwork, leadership, and academic skills so that they can succeed in high school, college, careers, their community and beyond. South Bronx United strives to promote educational achievement, health and wellness, and character development through activities on and off the soccer field and to UNITE a diverse group of individuals and an incredibly diverse community toward common positive goals.For more information on South Bronx United, please see our webpage at www.southbronxunited.org.
10451.title: SAT Prep Tutor

10457.description: The Salvation Army of Greater New York provides free or very low-cost day care to families in need. We would like to give our daycare centers a bit of a facelift with a fresh coat of paint and need your help. No experience painting required, just the desire to make a difference and the motivation to work hard for a few hours. An experienced painter will be there to give instructions.
10457.title: Painters Needed to Beautify Daycare Center

10457.description: Volunteer chaplains will assist in making pastoral visits to patient in the hospital and residents in the nursing home. Training to prepare for making visits will occur as visits are occuring. These visits will have as a goal to befriend the patient/resident and to listen to them compassionately. Experiences had by the volunteer will be processed to see the affect the visit is having on them. The minimum age to volunteer at thi facility is 18.
10457.title: Volunteer Chaplain

10456.description: We will be holding our Annual Family Sports Day on July 22, 2017 and need help with managing the children (and adults!), helping out with sports, serving and grilling food; assisting with general organization on that day. We also need some face painters.
10456.title: GAN Family Sports Day!

10455.description: Breaking Ground is looking for four (4) to help set up, serve food and drinks, interact with tenants, take photos, help with clean-up, etc. for our residents at the Brook. The Brook is Breaking Ground's first residence in the Bronx, which provides supportive housing for 120 formerly homeless single adults, many of whom have special needs.
10455.title: Independence Day BBQ  at the Brook

10455.description: Masa is seeking dedicated volunteers who are interested in working as part of a team to help support our six-week Summer STEM program where Masa Scholars will hone their creativity and engineering skills by designing innovative robots with a focus towards the local community. The Summer STEM Program will end with an interactive showcase open to students and their families. Where: Masa South Bronx Community Center, easily accessible by the 2 and 5 trains to the 149th Street-3rd Avenue train station (just 2 stops into the Bronx). When: The Summer Robotics Program will begin on July 10th, 2017 and will end on August 17th, 2017. Time: The Summer Robotics Program will operate on Mondays and Tuesdays from 10:30 am - 1:30 pm, and Wednesdays and Thursdays from 10:30 am - 1:00 pm. What: We are looking for dedicated volunteers to help support our Robotics instructor. Volunteers will help facilitate daily lesson plans and activities, as well as help manage participating scholars. Prior background in STEM or Robotics is NOT required but a strong interest and knowledge of STEM subjects is highly welcomed. TRAINING will be provided. Requirements are as follows: Ability to volunteer at least once a week on a consistent basis. Willingness to work with scholars going into grades 4 to 6 (ages 9 to 12). Attend a training which will take place prior to program start date. Willing and able to help facilitate lesson plans to students, in small group settings, and under the leadership of our Robotics instructor. Help manage behavior and lead scholars through daily instruction. Attend summer interactive showcase (if schedule permits). Provide feedback on student progress and/or concerns to Masa staff. Fill out volunteer application and attend a meeting/interview with Masa staff. HOW TO APPLY Visit our interest form: bit.ly/masa-vol Email us at volunteeropportunities@masany.org
10455.title: Volunteer at a Summer Robotics Program!

10455.description: Masa invites you to join our summer math program! By tutoring for 1.5 hours a week you can be a part of the change. Join us in transforming communities through education -one family, one child at a time! We are seeking dedicated volunteers to be a part of our summer literacy program, 1.5 hours a week. Volunteers will work with students going into grades 4-6 to help improve their literacy and math skills, and prevent a summer slide! About Masa: Masa is a non-profit organization that partners with Mexican and Latino children, youth and families to create strong learners and leaders who fully contribute to the broader community. About the Literacy/STEM Intensive Program: Starting in July, Masa will begin their six-week summer program to help support students going into grades 4-6 with their literacy and STEM. Students in this program are already struggling academically, so it's crucial that they receive additional instruction to help boost their confidence and prevent the \"summer slide\"! Volunteer Duties: · Work with small groups of students going into grades 4-6 to provide intensive literacy instruction, specifically: o Support students in using tools to recognize the relationship between letters and sounds o Practice fluent reading with students using instructional level reading material o Perform daily read aloud to encourage reading comprehension and foster a love of reading · Work with small groups of students going into grades 4-6 to facilitate math/science activities · Create an environment in which children develop trusting and accepting relationships with adults and peers that foster growth and development · Collaborate in devising strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on an understanding of individual students, their needs, interests, and abilities · Maintain and model high academic and personal expectations for all students Additional duties identified by Literacy Specialist as needed Volunteers should: Be available at least one afternoon a week Mondays through Thursdays from 4 PM - 5:30 PM beginning July 10th 2017 through August 17th 2017 Communicate observations regarding students' academic, social and behavioral status Be flexible, creative, organized and able to respond to change as needed HOW TO APPLY Interested? Fill out our interest form at bit.ly/masa-vol For more information you may also visit: www.masany.org or e-mail us at volunteeropportunities@masany.org
10455.title: Help boost literacy skills for students in grades 4-6 this summer!

10455.description: Masa invites you to join our summer program! By tutoring for three hours a week you can be a part of the change. Join us in transforming communities through education - one family, one child at a time! We are seeking dedicated volunteers to be a part of our literacy initiative, 1.5 hours a week. Volunteers will work with students going into grades 1-3 to help improve their literacy skills, so they go into the next school year as confident learners and readers. About Masa: Masa is a non-profit organization that partners with Mexican and Latino children, youth and family to create strong learners and leaders who fully contribute to the broader community. About the Literacy Intensive program: During the summer, Masa will help students struggling in literacy to boost their phonemic awareness, vocabulary and reading comprehension. In the area where Masa operates, just 10% of third-graders read at grade level - so additional support is critical! Literacy volunteers will: Work with small groups of students going into grades 1-3 to provide intensive literacy instruction, specifically: Work with students to identify, hear and manipulate sounds in words using games Support students in using tools to recognize the relationship between letters and sounds Practice fluent reading with students using instructional level reading material Perform daily read aloud to encourage reading comprehension and foster a love of reading Create an environment in which children develop trusting and accepting relationships with adults and peers that foster growth and development Collaborate in devising strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on an understanding of individual students, their needs, interests, and abilities Maintain and model high academic and personal expectations for all students Additional duties identified by Literacy Specialist as needed Volunteers should: Be available at least one afternoon a week Mondays through Thursdays from 2 pm to 3:30 pm beginning July 10th 2017 through August 17th 2017 Communicate observations regarding students' academic, social and behavioral status Be flexible, creative, organized and able to respond to change as needed How to apply Fill out our interest form: bit.ly/masa-vol For more information, visit our website at www.masany.org, or email volunteeropportunities@masany.org
10455.title: Volunteer at a Summer Literacy Program: Grades 1-3

About Masa: Masa is a non-profit organization that partners with Mexican and Latino children, youth and families to create strong learners and leaders who fully contribute to the broader community. About the Literacy/STEM Intensive Program: Starting in July, Masa will begin their six-week summer program to help support students going into grades 4-6 with their literacy and STEM. Students in this program are already struggling academically, so it's crucial that they receive additional instruction to help boost their confidence and prevent the \"summer slide\"! Volunteer Duties: · Work with small groups of students going into grades 4-6 to provide intensive literacy instruction, specifically: o Support students in using tools to recognize the relationship between letters and sounds o Practice fluent reading with students using instructional level reading material o Perform daily read aloud to encourage reading comprehension and foster a love of reading · Work with small groups of students going into grades 4-6 to facilitate math/science activities · Create an environment in which children develop trusting and accepting relationships with adults and peers that foster growth and development · Collaborate in devising strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on an understanding of individual students, their needs, interests, and abilities · Maintain and model high academic and personal expectations for all students Additional duties identified by Literacy Specialist as needed Volunteers should: Be available at least one afternoon a week Mondays through Thursdays from 4 PM - 5:30 PM beginning July 10th 2017 through August 17th 2017 Communicate observations regarding students' academic, social and behavioral status Be flexible, creative, organized and able to respond to change as needed HOW TO APPLY Interested? Fill out our interest form at bit.ly/masa-vol For more information you may also visit: www.masany.org or e-mail us at volunteeropportunities@masany.org
10455.title: Help boost literacy skills for students in grades 4-6 this summer!

10455.description: Masa is seeking dedicated volunteers who are interested in working as part of a team to help support our six-week Summer STEM program where Masa Scholars will hone their creativity and engineering skills by designing innovative robots with a focus towards the local community. The Summer STEM Program will end with an interactive showcase open to students and their families. Where: Masa South Bronx Community Center, easily accessible by the 2 and 5 trains to the 149th Street-3rd Avenue train station (just 2 stops into the Bronx). When: The Summer Robotics Program will begin on July 10th, 2017 and will end on August 17th, 2017. Time: The Summer Robotics Program will operate on Mondays and Tuesdays from 10:30 am - 1:30 pm, and Wednesdays and Thursdays from 10:30 am - 1:00 pm. What: We are looking for dedicated volunteers to help support our Robotics instructor. Volunteers will help facilitate daily lesson plans and activities, as well as help manage participating scholars. Prior background in STEM or Robotics is NOT required but a strong interest and knowledge of STEM subjects is highly welcomed. TRAINING will be provided. Requirements are as follows: Ability to volunteer at least once a week on a consistent basis. Willingness to work with scholars going into grades 4 to 6 (ages 9 to 12). Attend a training which will take place prior to program start date. Willing and able to help facilitate lesson plans to students, in small group settings, and under the leadership of our Robotics instructor. Help manage behavior and lead scholars through daily instruction. Attend summer interactive showcase (if schedule permits). Provide feedback on student progress and/or concerns to Masa staff. Fill out volunteer application and attend a meeting/interview with Masa staff. HOW TO APPLY Visit our interest form: bit.ly/masa-vol Email us at volunteeropportunities@masany.org
10455.title: Volunteer at a Summer Robotics Program!

10455.description: Masa invites you to join our summer program! By tutoring for three hours a week you can be a part of the change. Join us in transforming communities through education - one family, one child at a time! We are seeking dedicated volunteers to be a part of our literacy initiative, 1.5 hours a week. Volunteers will work with students going into grades 1-3 to help improve their literacy skills, so they go into the next school year as confident learners and readers. About Masa: Masa is a non-profit organization that partners with Mexican and Latino children, youth and family to create strong learners and leaders who fully contribute to the broader community. About the Literacy Intensive program: During the summer, Masa will help students struggling in literacy to boost their phonemic awareness, vocabulary and reading comprehension. In the area where Masa operates, just 10% of third-graders read at grade level - so additional support is critical! Literacy volunteers will: Work with small groups of students going into grades 1-3 to provide intensive literacy instruction, specifically: Work with students to identify, hear and manipulate sounds in words using games Support students in using tools to recognize the relationship between letters and sounds Practice fluent reading with students using instructional level reading material Perform daily read aloud to encourage reading comprehension and foster a love of reading Create an environment in which children develop trusting and accepting relationships with adults and peers that foster growth and development Collaborate in devising strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on an understanding of individual students, their needs, interests, and abilities Maintain and model high academic and personal expectations for all students Additional duties identified by Literacy Specialist as needed Volunteers should: Be available at least one afternoon a week Mondays through Thursdays from 2 pm to 3:30 pm beginning July 10th 2017 through August 17th 2017 Communicate observations regarding students' academic, social and behavioral status Be flexible, creative, organized and able to respond to change as needed How to apply Fill out our interest form: bit.ly/masa-vol For more information, visit our website at www.masany.org, or email volunteeropportunities@masany.org

10455.description: Come help out with childcare for a fun, sweet group of 10-15 kids while their parents are in an Organizing Committee meeting! By providing childcare on Thursdays from 6-8 PM over the summer months, you'll get to engage an awesome group of kids in play -- and ensure their parents are able to focus on the work of the Organizing Committee. About Masa: Masa is a non-profit organization that partners with Mexican and Latino children, youth and families to create strong learners and leaders who fully contribute to the broader community. Volunteer Duties: Childcare volunteers will engage with a group of students ages 18 months - 10 years old: play games, blocks, and trains; coloring and doing light art projects; and reading. Volunteers should: Be available most Thursdays from 6-8 PM, from June 8th - August 31st Enjoy working with children Be flexible, creative, organized and able to respond to change as needed
10455.title: This summer, help take care of fun, sweet kids on Thursdays!
