10455.description: Masa is looking for a yoga teacher to join us this summer to teach beginners' yoga to adults or children. We can work with the volunteer to identify the appropriate target age group, as well as work out a mutually agreeable schedule (weekends or early mornings would probably be best). We have run summer yoga classes in the past and parents frequently ask if we can bring them back. We'd love to make it happen this summer!
10455.title: Teach yoga this summer to adults or kids in the South Bronx!

10455.description: Patient Care Volunteer: provide compassionate companionship and emotional support for Hospice patients and their families. Music Therapy Volunteer: Use your voice or musical talent to heal and comfort. Pet Therapy Volunteer: Your team of you and your dog will make \"therapy\" visits with our Hospice patients. Art Therapy Volunteer: Use your drawing, painting, sculpting, graphic arts skills to engage Hospice patients or provide legacies for family members. Alternative Therapy Volunteer: Use your special passion and skill to support Hospice patients and their families: Massage Therapy Accupuncture Reiki / Energy Therapy Yoga / Meditation Aroma & Sound Therapy Office / Administrative Volunteer: assist in the day-to-day administrative tasks of a manged care Hospice operation Bereavement Volunteer: assist surviving family with loss and grief issues. End of Life Support for Veterans: \"Veteran-centric\" end-of-life support. CCH is a Level Three participant in the Hospice-Veterans Partnership and We Honor Veterans Program. Comprehensive training and supervision provided for all Volunteer positions.
10455.title: Find your compassionate calling-we all have it; we just need to develop it more!

10455.description: Please note that this internship is available only to students under the age of 25 as part of our internship program \"The Guild.\" Fluent in both English and Spanish a plus! Position Summary: The Program Coordinator will work with the HR Manager to manage and help supervise the youth participating in our work experience program, the Guild, and the children participating in our school age programs under the Youth Enrichment Project. Duties and Responsibilities Be knowledgeable of organization's mission statement, history, and active programs; Be an active participant in the achievement of long and short-term goals and objectives; Relieve management of administrative detail, in most to all projects; Produce required weekly and monthly reports as directed by the Executive Director; Actively participates in the promoting and networking process to build awareness of our services; Provides guidance to support staff and children to ensure that both have an enriching experience; Organizes orientation sessions that outline goals, procedures and current events for Support Staff, parents and children; Oversees and assists with participant screening, training, matching, support, supervision, recognition and closure activities for interns, mentors, mentees and YEP participants with HR Manager; Secures all consent forms, applications, and other required documentation; Maintains records of attendance and outcomes for Support Staff and youth; Organizes initial and ongoing support and training sessions for Support Staff and Youth; Communicates with supervisor on a weekly basis concerning site or individual issues or new projects; Prepares and provides training materials for Guild and YEP training events; Contributes to program evaluation efforts; Handle all inquiries within capacity; Take down phone messages and arrange \"callbacks\" to protect supervisor's time; Perform to earn supervisor's full confidence; Assure discreet handling of all business; Seek greater role in projects within administrative and other areas of competence; Keep office organized, clean, and presentable; Perform other duties as assigned by the Executive Director Qualifications Fluent in English (and Spanish plus) Computer literacy including MS Office products: Word, Excel, and Power Point Exceptional time-management, planning, and administrative skills Ability to organize and prioritize workload Demonstrate high level of diplomacy, sound judgment, and discretion when dealing with donors, clients, volunteers, and community professionals High degree of energy, self-motivation, and flexibility
10455.title: Program Coordinator Internship - After School (Leadership Role)

10455.description: - Experience working in marketing, advertising, public relations, party planning and decoration, or community/social/health services. - Currently a student specializing in marketing, advertising, public relations, party/event planning and decoration, or community/social/health services. - Responsible for developing and maintaing fund raising ideas as well as carryout the specific responsibilities to ensure a successful event. - Must be able to attend meeting once a week which will be held either during a weekday evening or a weekend afternoon.
10455.title: Special Events/Public Relations Committee Members

10455.description: - Certified or have experience in Anger Management, Domestic Violence, Family Development, Art therapy [Art] or other counseling. - Currently a student or pursuing a career in counseling and therapy. - Able to come evenings and/or Saturdays. - Contribute to curriculum. - Keep up with of clientele completing programs. - Visit our website for schedule of programs. www.sbccinc.org
10455.title: Facilitators in Anger Management/Domestic Violence/Family Development/Parenting Skills

10454.description: We have several projects in need of volunteers, each focusing on either, (1) online/ social media marketing, (2) donor outreach/ management, (3) partnership/ sponsorship building, or (4) public relations. Depending on your unique skill sets and project assignment, you may be responsible for: following up with community contacts in order to help build business-to-business relationships; creating captivating images or writing persuasive, fact-based articles for our quarterly newsletter; establshing a YouTube channel that strengthens our cyber presence. Bring your passion, talents and creativity to Every Day is a Miracle, and let's forward the fight against hunger together! Please send your resume to Maria Estrada, Executive Director at mestrada@edmnyc.org
10454.title: Communications Associate-give poverty a voice, a face, a story

10454.description: Through this position, volunteer(s) handle fundamental aspects of our financial record keeping processes, including but not limited to maintaining ledger entries, preparing financial statements, assisting with budget preparations/ reports, and assisting with 1099's and annual tax filings.
10454.title: Accounting/ Bookkeeping Volunteer needed

10454.description: On November 5th, 2015, Every Day is a Miracle will celebrate FILL THE PLATE--our annual gala to end hunger and eradicate poverty. Funds raised will benefit hunger-relief/ anti-poverty programs in the community. We are looking for volunteers to join our Event Committee and help us reach out to prospective sponsors, businesses, and donors for the gala. This is a great opportunity to gain real world experience with business relations, communications, marketing, fundraising, and event management. You must be able to exercise professionalism, be comfortable speaking with individuals in the corporate world, have a great phone presence, and be able to manage your time wisely when working on specific tasks. The hours are EXTREMELY flexible, however, we ask that you be reliable and commit to whatever schedule we agree upon. Join the team and let's start making a difference today!
10454.title: Development Intern—Help End Poverty

10454.description: We are looking for bright, passionate professionals who are willing to volunteer their time and energy ending hunger and making a difference in the local multi cultural community. Individuals should be creative, open to new ideas, be a team player and have a strong work ethic. As this nonprofit is 100% volunteer based, everyone on the Steering Committee have busy day jobs but are still able to dedicate themselves to running this organization. Ideally, we want people who is experienced with grant writing and fundraising. The organization is undertaking an impressive campaign to expand its services, partnerships, and presence to have a larger impact on the community. This is a fantastic opportunity to gain a wealth of experience in multiple aspects of research, external relations and fundraising. Your position and role will be assisting with the following duties: Conduct research on existing and prospective prospects; Write and edit letters of inquiry, grant proposals and reports, program summaries, and other funding correspondence. Work with Donor Database Coordinator and Lead Researcher to find new grant opportunities and funders. Track institutional giving patterns and funding deadlines. Ensure donors are appropriately thanked and acknowledged This position provides a stipend and may lead to paid part-time or consultant position by end of the year Length of term: One year minimum commitment with weekly time commitment to be discussed. Qualifications: Bachelor of Arts Degree Outstanding writing and editing skills. Must demonstrate creativity and passion in their writing. Must have the ability to glean information from previous proposals to meet specific funder requirements. Ability to work quickly and produce a polished piece of work requiring little editing. Exceptional organizational and time management skills. Strong interpersonal skills.
10454.title: GRANT WRITER NEEDED

10454.description: The Latinas On the Verge of Excellence - L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program would like to invite university female students to serve as mentors in our 2016 L.O.V.E. Mentoring Programs. The L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program aims to enhance academic performance and high school graduation rates among young Latinas by providing them with the support of positive role models. Mentoring sessions concentrate on developing study skills, enabling college access, and facilitating self-empowerment activities. This year we will be offering the exciting opportunity to mentor a student from public high schools throughout New York. Mentors will meet with mentees on schools' campuses weekly. A semester commitment (February - June) is required of mentors who wish to participate in these school-based programs.
10454.title: L.O.V.E. Volunteer Mentor
10454.org: LATINAS ON THE VERGE OF EXCELLENCE LOVE INC

10459.description: Help provide groceries to 100+ families on Thursdays by packing fresh produce, taking orders on tablets, assembling and distributing food packages, and other activities as needed.
10459.title: Help Pack Groceries for Families (Bronx)

10459.description: We are looking a volunteer Citizenship teacher that can dedicate 2 hours on Fridays from 2 to 4pm Our organization is located in the South Bronx and we serve a large community of immigrants. Many of our clients seek to prepare for their upcoming Citizenship exam and interview. Our class was created to assist those students with preparing them for the 100 questions for the citizenship exam and the oral portion of the test. Students also learn about American culture and history and enhance their abilities to read, write, and speak English. We are looking for someone that has worked in a small group setting before. Preferrably speaks 2 or more languages, has the ability to create and/or follow a curriculum, prepare and grade student work. This person must be reliable and follows the schedule agreed upon at the time of volunteering. Someone that has experience with preparing documents for the citizenship test would be a plus. We are looking for a volunteer that will be dependable and able to teach every Friday (excluding holidays) for each 6 week session (two in total): Class dates are TBD and class times are preferred 3-5pm but can be negotiated. We ofcourse are happy to have someone that will be willing to work longterm as a volunteer teacher but atleast expect 2 sessions covered each term. We provide groceries twice a month to the volunteer teacher as a thank you.
10459.title: Bilingual Civics Teacher
10459.org: The HopeLine Resource Center for Community Development

10459.description: Help low income families receive free groceries by packing fresh produce, taking orders on tablets, assembling and distributing food packages, and other activites as needed. We can schedule volunteers from 9am-12pm or 11:30am-2:30pm starting July 15th
10459.title: Help Pack Groceries for Families (Saturday)

10459.description: The Guild Internship program provide an opportunity for young men and women to experience of being in a working enviornmet so to prepare them for job market. The volunteer 4 hours daily from 2 PM to 6 PM as many days of the week as they can. The interns can volunteer for the After School Program, SBCC Kids Summer learn & Play program or as Office Aids.
10459.title: The Guild Internship Program/youth from 16 to 24 years of age

10459.description: Duties of an outreach coordinator An outreach coordinator is responsible in organizing various outreach events which includes sales, marketing and planning on activities in order to promote services and receive donations. They create activities so as to supplement the staffing needs and attain community members that are involve with the mission of an organization. Duties also include training, recruiting and managing outreach volunteers. There are some organizations that recruit many volunteers for special events. Specific job may include advertising, screening and recruiting volunteers, providing training and orientation for volunteers, providing support, tracking performance of volunteers and keeping exact record of volunteer activities. Daily duties include contacting volunteers regarding their availability, scheduling meetings, receiving feedbacks on volunteer’s experiences, recognizing efforts of volunteers with thank you letters or awards and responding to the inquiries of their volunteers. The coordinator should work closely with some other departments within their organization in order to make sure that the needs of the volunteers are met.
10459.title: Community Outreach Coordinator

10459.description: Located in the South Bronx, our community consists of residents who are striving to learn new skills to enter the work field. Some of our clients do not have access to a computer and need our assistance in teaching them the basic computer skills. We are currently offering free 6 week classes that meet twice a week. We are looking for a bilingual computer teacher that can help provide this introductory class. We expect that students will be at the basic level of learning about email, navigation, and the internet. The teacher must be fluent in both english and spanish and available to work Mondays and Thursdays 3-5 or 4-6pm. Each session is 6 weeks but we are looking for a commitment of atleast 2 sessions (12 weeks of class times) Days during the week can be negotiated as well as times. The ideal candidate will be detail oriented and able to provide a curriculum and establish relationships with partner agencies and community members. We are also looking to start more advanced levels of computer training and would be looking to further our working relationship to possibly include those levels.
10459.title: Bilingual Computer Teacher
10459.org: The HopeLine Resource Center for Community Development

10459.description: The South Bronx Concerned Citizens, Inc is an organization serving as a bridge between diverse cultures, providing human services and resources in health that foster community interaction and collaboration. These services will empower the youth and adults in the community; thus increasing youth awareness, rebuilding family unification and restoring community pride. Position: SBCC Kids After School Program Counselor This opportunity is for high school and college students interested in teaching/community development/social services between the ages of 16 and 24. Every Monday through Friday from 2 to 6PM, we provide parents with an affordable and quality after school program. Here, young students have a place to relax, get homework help, and play with friends. Our guarantee to parents and guardians is to provide a safe, educational, and fun environment for their children. Youth workers will assist with helping students with their homework, facilitating the children during educational activities, and keeping the office tidy and organized. Skills academic (math, spelling, grammar): Student over the age of 16 must be able to know the proper elementary math, spelling and grammar. You will be responsible for checking homework and checking that the homework is done correctly. personal: Volunteers are asked to be courteous, polite, and friendly. You are not only helping students with academic responsibilities, but they must be comfortable around you. Behavior that causes friction amongst other volunteers, staff, or our clients is not tolerated. professional: Your responsibility may strictly be in assisting the children in our organization but your commitment to our organization means you are also the face of our organization. We expect professional and mature behavior at all times.
10459.title: Help kids with homework; be a mentor too.

10458.description: The Care Management program is seeking Data Entry Specialists who are able to perform extensive data entry into 3 different electronic health records and a variety of Microsoft Excel spreadsheets in order to accurately track and manage the care coordination services provided to our clients. We seek volunteers who: - Are computer literate and knowledgeable of recent Microsoft Excel updates. - Have experience with data entry. - Are able to treat Protected Health Information confidentially & with good judgment. - Are willing to be trained to utilize electronic health records. This opportunity is available on Mondays-Fridays from 9am-5pm. Time commitment and hours are flexible within the hours of operation.
10458.title: Data Entry Specialist
10458.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10458.description: WeThrive is an entrepreneurial mentoring program that pairs college students with middle school students at local schools nearby. Youth participants will create ventures of their own and earn real revenues. Currently, we are looking for Fordham University students, who are passionate about social change and entrepreneurship, to mentor youths at a local middle school. If interested, please click on this link to fill out our interest form https://wethrive.typeform.com/to/N9XYE1. We will be in touch shortly! You can also send an email to tally@teamwethrive.org
10458.title: Fordham University Students Mentor Youths

10458.description: Protect our environment and the special world in which we live. Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Together we can protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. Want to know more? Please join our weekly Introductory Conference Call. The next one is on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. It is a live call, about an hour long, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. Please register for the call at this link so that we can follow up with you: https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/ We look forward to working with you!
10458.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Bronx NY

10458.description: To encourage people to develop healthier eating habits and to participate in fun and free activities in the community, fostering cooperation and trust. There is also the opportunity of the community participating in recruiting for Bronx community participants in the Fresh Air Fund .
10458.title: Spanish Bilingual Canvasser in the Bronx

10458.description: Seniors in nursing facilities tend to have few visitors, but with a few hours of your time, you can provide the social interaction that is important to keeping their spirits soaring. There are a variety of projects with seniors such as knitting, gardening, and even teaching basic computer skills. Just a few hours of your time can help brighten up a senior’s week. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
10458.title: Seniors Projects with New York Cares in the Bronx

10458.description: Volunteers on New York Cares' Hunger projects do more than just serve a meal -- they provide a warm smile, friendly conversation, and the reassurance that someone cares. These projects serve hundreds of men, women, and children at homeless shelters, churches, and senior centers each day. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. 10458.description: On New York Cares' Health and Wellness projects, volunteers bring much-needed companionship to long-term hospital residents and individuals living with devastating illnesses, such as HIV/AIDS. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
10458.title: Health and Wellness Projects with New York Cares in the Bronx

10458.description: Keeping kids active is an important part of their development, so help us get them off the couch! Some projects available for volunteers include sports, field trips, and even culinary activities. Sports and fitness projects keep children healthy and active, arts and culture projects help them discover their creativity, and recreational outings expose them to the unique activities and culture of New York City. Search our projects here: http://www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at http://www.newyorkcares.org.
10458.title: Children's Recreation Projects with New York Cares in the Bronx

10458.description: Help give kids a strong foundation for academic achievement. New York Cares' Children's Education projects help New York City's underserved children develop their academic skills at an early age, improving their chances of getting into college and preparing them for future success. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
10458.title: Children's Education Projects with New York Cares in the Bronx

10458.description: New York Cares offers many programs serving adults and children with special needs. Our volunteers provide a little extra care and attention to the physically disabled, who often face limited recreational activities and educational opportunities. These projects provide important social interaction while teaching essential independent living skills. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
10458.title: Adults and Children with Special Needs Projects with New York Cares in the Bronx

10458.description: Planning for a better future starts by believing that one is possible. On New York Cares' Adult Education projects, volunteers help capable but struggling New Yorkers, many of whom are transitioning out of homelessness, build a brighter future for themselves and their families. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
10458.title: Adult Education and Job Readiness Projects with New York Cares in the Bronx

07849.description: The Gruenert Center is a daytime vocational / activity center for adults with developmental and intellectual disabilities. Volunteers are utilized in assisting the staff and clients in all aspects of the day from contract work, ceramics, art, to lunch and social time. A great place to volunteer! Volunteers are welcome Monday -Friday between 10:00am and 3:00pm. Volunteers make their own schedules.
07849.title: Perfect for daytime volunteering!

07740.description: Assist MOCEANS Center for Independent Living (https://www.moceanscil.org/) staff members manning a table/booth at OCEANFEST. Distribute brochures and flyers advertising the services provided by MOCEANS on behalf of persons with disabilities. You will be provided with a basic set of information about MOCEANS's mission to help answrer questions, and refer people requesting information to MOCEANS staff, which will be on site. Volunteer shifts are between 10:00 AM - 6;00 PM, with a minimum of 2 hours and a maximum of 4 hours per shift. All times are available. OCEANFEST is the premiere yearly fair/event for the JERSEY Shore and this is the perfect opportunity to help spread word of the services and assistance available to those with disabilities as provided byMOCEANS Center for Independent Living. MOCEANS is a certified 501(c)3 charitable organization.
07740.title: OCEANFEST 2017 (Long Branch NJ)- Help distribute materials for MOCEANS Center for Independent Living
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: Did you know that colorectal cancer is the 2nd leading cause of cancer death in the US, yet it is one of the most preventable forms of cancer? By volunteering for our 5k, the Undy Run/Walk you can help change that! We have found that by getting people talking about this disease, we can save lives. Date: Saturday, July 15, 2017 Location: The Great Lawn at Pier Village, Long Branch, NJ HOW WE NEED YOUR HELP THE DAY OF THE EVENT: -Early Shift- Set up expo area Registration and runner check in Food & Beverage Tent Kids Fun Zone -Later Shift- Water stations Course cheering Course marshaling Clean Up Event Photographer Please note we are also happy to validate or confirm any hours needed for school or community service. About The Colon Cancer Alliance: The Colon Cancer Alliance is a community that provides hope and support to patients and their families, while saving lives through prevention, research, and patient support services. www.ccalliance.org TO SIGN UP AS A VOLUNTEER, CONTACT: Joanna Anastasio, Special Events Coordinator janastasio@ccalliance.org 202.207.0267
07740.title: Help Us Kick Colon Cancer's Butt - Volunteer for the Jersey Shore Undy Run/Walk

07740.description: The Nonprofit Management Intern will assist the Executive Director in all aspects of nonprofit management including but not limited to strategic planning, revenue generation, public relations, event planning, and fundraising. Business management Actively engage MOCEANS’ volunteers, board members, event committees, alumni, partnering organizations, and funders Support Board of Directors, as needed Track progress and measure successes that can be effectively communicated to the board, funders, and other stakeholders Analytics and reporting Compile all data and necessary reports to comply with State and Federal guidelines Track donor and community engagement in company database, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail Maintain and update company information resource files as a complete, organized and usable database of members, donors, funders, and other community stakeholders Capacity-building Execute strategic business planning processes for program expansion Research prospective donors and funding sources, building strong community partnerships Expand revenue-generating and fundraising activities to support existing program operations and regional expansion Plan and support fundraising events, as needed Qualifications Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Public Administration, or similar Advanced computer skills including typing, Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Apps Ability to relate effectively with the public, fellow staff, and members in a professional manner Excellent verbal, written, and organizational skills Proficiency using at least one social media channel preferred
07740.title: Nonprofit Management Intern - Summer 2017
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: Outreach and recruitment Proactively partner with marketing team to promote MOCEANS’ programs and services within the community Work with the marketing team to plan and execute fundraising and informational events Partner with the social media team to design and implement social media strategy Initiate speaking engagements and presentations to community organizations, schools, volunteer groups and others as necessary Analytics and reporting Compile all data and necessary reports to comply with State and Federal guidelines Track donor and community engagement in company database, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail Maintain and update company information resource files as a complete, organized and usable database of members, donors, funders, and other community stakeholders Development Research prospective donors and funding sources Develop program proposals for submission to grantors Identify and develop new revenue streams that are consistent with MOCEANS’ mission and strategic plan Qualifications Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Public Administration, or similar Advanced computer skills including typing, Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Apps Ability to relate effectively with the public, fellow staff, and members in a professional manner Excellent verbal, written, and organizational skills Proficiency using at least one social media channel preferred
07740.title: Development & Marketing Intern - Summer 2017
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: Assist the Director of Independent Living in his role which includes: assisting persons with disabilities to receive appropriate services, developing connections with community organizations and service providers, and providing the five core services services to consumers in the assigned area Direct work with consumers Conduct intake and assessments of consumers seeking services through MOCEANS CIL Work with the consumer to provide the five core services: information & referral, peer support, independent living skills training, individual and systems advocacy, and transition support services Follow ­up with past consumers, as needed Outreach and recruitment Initiate speaking engagements and presentations to community organizations, schools, volunteer groups and others as necessary for recruitment purposes Proactively partner with marketing team to promote MOCEANS’ programs and services within the community Analytics and reporting Compile all data and necessary reports to comply with State and Federal guidelines Track and document consumer progress and success in our database system, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail Maintain and update the information resource files as a complete, organized and usable database of disability­related services and organizations General Support Cross­train with other staff members as appropriate and time­ permitting Qualifications Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Public Administration, or similar Advanced computer skills including typing, Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Apps Ability to relate effectively with the public, fellow staff, and members in a professional manner Excellent verbal, written, and organizational skills Proficiency using at least one social media channel preferred
07740.title: Independent Living Specialist Intern - Summer 2017
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: We are a non-residential, consumer-controlled, community-based, 501c3 nonprofit organization . We provide information, instruction and support for people living with disability, their families, friends and allies in the community . It is our mission to promote public awareness and barrier-free access in the community while supporting individual choice, advancing the independent living philosophy, promoting the civil rights and inclusion of all people living with disabilities. This opportunity involves helping to facilitate and assist with the conduct of various scheduled activities, including special presentations, activities, community events etc. Sample activities include health, diet, exercise, financial education, etc. As a volunteer you will attend the activity and support the staff and participants as needed, also allowing you to participate and learn about the topic at hand. Events typically last 1-2 hours and take place during weekday mornings or afternoons. You may sign up to assist with as few or as many activities as you wish.
07740.title: Activity/Workshop Support
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: QUALIFICATIONS Excellent organizational, written and verbal skills Detail oriented and committed to meeting deadlines Ability to relate effectively with the public, fellow employees, and consumers in an appropriately professional manner Ability to adapt to shifting priorities and manage multiple deadlines Ability to problem-solve in a fast paced work environment Advanced computer skills including typing, Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Apps Bilingual in Spanish a plus Ability to strictly adhere to confidentiality policies RESPONSIBILITIES Handle incoming phone calls and written correspondence, providing prompt responses and forwarding to appropriate staff member where necessary Perform general clerical duties including photocopying, fax and mailing Handle requests for information and data and follow up with appropriate staff member Assist with volunteer and outreach coordination as required Update social media sites, as directed Update consumer records in database and ensure all hard files are accurate and up-to-date ORIENTATION/TRAINING MOCEANS will provide both online and in-person training. Orientation will occur on the first day of volunteer hours and will last approximately one hour. On-going training and support will be provided as needed. TIME AND PLACE The volunteer administrative assistant will work at the Long Branch office during normal business hours, unless otherwise agreed. COMMITMENT This position requires a minimum commitment of 6 months and a set schedule. ON-THE-JOB SUPERVISION As assigned upon acceptance into program. BENEFITS This position provides valuable experience for business management, communications, and/or marketing students and anyone with a passion for protecting the rights of people with disability. Volunteers are highly valued members of the MOCEANS team and contribute to making a significant difference in MOCEANS' ability to serve our community. MOCEANS will provide reference letters for all volunteers who successfully complete a placement MOCEANS is EEOC compliant and we strongly encourage people with disabilities to apply. MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc. We are a private 501c3 nonprofit promoting the civil rights and inclusion of all people with disabilities since 1989. Our mission is to support choice, promote public awareness and barrier-free access in the community while advancing the independent living philosophy in the lives of all people with disabilities. For more information, visit http://www.moceanscil.org or our Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/MoceansCIL
07740.title: Administrative Assistant
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: VOLUNTEER JOB DESCRIPTION Community Advocate - Event Representation MAJOR OBJECTIVES The volunteer community advocate will work within his/her local community to promote MOCEANS and our mission by actively engaging community members and sharing news, information, and resources related to the Center. Support outreach activities by attending community events and represent MOCEANS by helping to staff a MOCEANS tent/table. Engage the public to help recruit new memebers for MOCEANS, distribute brochures and other material. Participate in events as appropriate and based on volunteer interest (runs/walks, etc), wearing MOCEANS branded shirts, etc and helping to publicize MOCEANS QUALIFICATIONS Live and/or work in Monmouth or Ocean County, NJ Works well independently and as part of a team Excellent interpersonal and verbal communication skills Experience and/or interest in promoting the human and civil rights of people with disabilities RESPONSIBILITIES Be a positive and informed spokesperson for all people with disabilities Consistently promote MOCEANS CIL and its mission serving as a champion of our cause ORIENTATION/TRAINING MOCEANS will provide both online and in-person training. TIME AND PLACE The volunteer community advocate will work at ciommunity events throughout Monmouth and Ocean County ON-THE-JOB SUPERVISION Stuart Schwartzman, Volunteer Coordinator ( coordinator.moceans@gmail.com ) BENEFITS This position provides valuable experience for community or human rights advocates and anyone with a passion for protecting the rights of people with disability. Volunteers are highly valued members of the MOCEANS team and contribute to making a significant difference in MOCEANS’ ability to serve our community. MOCEANS will provide reference letters for all volunteers who successfully complete a placement
07740.title: Community Advocate
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: We are currently accepting applications to serve on our Board of Directors. If you live in Monmouth or Ocean County, are experienced in your field, have a passion for helping others and have the time to devote to the leadership of a nonprofit such as ours, then please contact us for more information.
07740.title: Board Members Wanted
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07747.description: Contact us for more information on working with hospice patients close to where you live. We provide FREE volunteer training for you along with free TB and Rubella/Rubeola testing. Your pet will need to be a certified pet therapy animal. You and your pet will bring joy and love to the lives of our patients and will receive so much love and joy in return!
07747.title: Share your pet's unconditional love with hospice patients!

07746.description: This is an internship or volunteer position, great opportunity for gaining additional experience. Want to get management experience? You will plan, direct, and manage camp's food service and complete additional duties as requested by the Camp Director. Provide food to campers and ensure food area is fully clean before and after food distribution. This includes but is not limited to dish and trash duties, mopping, and sweeping. Ensure safety of youth at all times by following all safety guidelines and precautions as required by the Department of Health’s policies and procedures for day camp. Ensure all required paperwork is completed from parents. Complete documentation as required by the summer food service program. Candidates must be enrolled in or seeking a career in the food/hospitality field. Minimum one year experience working in the food/hospitality field required. Experience working with youth a plus. Community Center & Sportsplex, is a 501c3 nonprofit academic, arts & athletic center for youth & families founded on Christian principles, and is dedicated to instilling in each member that they have been specifically chosen by God to do magnificent things! We specialize in improving the self esteem of youth and families in surrounding suburban as well as underrepresented and underprivileged communities. We promote integrity and stewardship, and offer an innovative opportunity to train, excel, and compete academically, artistically, and athletically. We are seeking a SUPER FANTASTIC employees who will produce work that will directly affect the growth of our organization while also gaining experience in areas which are important to you. Benefits of working with BGCM: * Gain professional work experience, while also meeting personal/professional goals. * Gain experience at a unique social entrepreneurship that has a global impact. * Learn about the industry from all levels of BGCM management. * Network with other for-profit and nonprofit professionals in an open office environment. * For students, class credit can be arranged according to school requirements. * Room for growth is available. Responsibilities * Must have reliable transportation, a passion for helping students succeed, be personable, punctual, friendly, patient, and sensitive to the needs of a diverse student population; have strong communications skills, and a passion for serving the community. * Work in-person, one on one or in small group settings. * Keep detailed electronic records of tutoring sessions and file weekly with BGCM. * Track and analyze student progress. * Prepare lessons to meet student needs. * Work closely with Executive Director (or equiv staff) to meet students’ academic goals. * Additional responsibilities as assigned by manager. Communicate Effectively: Deliver information in a clear, compelling, and concise manner, while actively listening and checking for understanding. Drive Engagement: Build immediate rapport with students by inviting participation and making students feel that their contributions are valued. Passion for Results: Be personally committed to the success of students guiding them to face any challenges head on and with a positive attitude. Prior tutoring experience and Bachelor’s Degree or higher is a plus. AP-level knowledge in at least one or more subjects (ex: English, Math, Science, etc). High SAT or ACT scores preferred. Tutors who have scored at or above the 95 percentile is a plus. Tutors needed for: Literacy, Math, Test Prep (SAT, SSAT, ACT, AP Exams, etc.) and more. Requirements **PLEASE DO NOT APPLY UNLESS YOU HAVE RELATIVE EXPERIENCE IN TEACHING/TUTORING ANY GRADE FROM 3 THROUGH 12. - CANDIDATE MUST BE ABLE TO DRIVE TO LOCATION IN MARLBORO, NJ. - ALL APPLICANTS MUST: Email references and resume to chosen@bgcme.org and visit www.bgcme.org to learn more about our organization. - Candidate MUST work proficiently with a great level of autonomy. - Must be available for an interview this week and available to begin reviewing curriculum and lesson planning shortly thereafter. - Must be assertive. - Must have experience and demonstrated success in a professional setting. - Must have outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written, and excellent computer skills. - Must have at least one year experience working with students in grades 3-12. - Must have a passion for youth and a heart to serve. - Must be enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree Program or be employed in education or relative field. - Must be independent, open-minded, enthusiastic, adaptable, and must be able to work in a team environment, independently, and with a great deal of autonomy. - Must welcome new challenges, come up with fresh ideas and future focus, and be able to work in a fast paced environment in a deadline-oriented environment.
07746.title: IMMEDIATE OPENING: ﻿﻿Tutors (Literacy, Math, Test Prep)

07746.description: Description BGCM! (Because God Chose Me!) Community Center & Sportsplex, is a 501c3 nonprofit academic, arts & athletic center for youth & families founded on Christian principles, and is dedicated to instilling in each member that they have been specifically chosen by God to do magnificent things! We specialize in improving the self esteem of youth and families in surrounding suburban as well as underrepresented and underprivileged communities, while promoting integrity and stewardship, and offering, to youth an innovative opportunity to train, excel, and compete academically, artistically, and athletically. We are seeking a SUPER FANTASTIC EXPERIENCED Intern who will produce work that will directly affect the growth of our organization. Our office is located in Jackson, NJ but our 8-week summer camp will be held in Marlboro, NJ. Visit http://www.bgcme.org/summer-camp.html to learn more. CONTACT US TODAY AT (732) 707-7336 if you meet the qualifications. Benefits of working with BGCM: Gain professional work experience in an area related to your degree. Work in a positive, well-balanced environment. Learn about the industry from all levels of BGCM management. Potential opportunity, for full-time employment with a successful, fast-growing company! ALL APPLICANTS MUST COMPLETE AN APPLICATION AT http://www.bgcme.org/job-application.html IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED. WE WILL NOT CONSIDER YOUR RESUME IF YOU DO NOT COMPLETE THE APPLICATION AND SEND A RESUME AND COVER LETTER NO EXCEPTIONS. RESUMES AND COVER LETTERS MUST ALSO BE SUBMITTED TO CHOSEN@BGCME.ORG, and applicants MUST visit www.bgcme.org to learn more about our organization in preparation for an interview. APPLICANTS MUST ALSO INCLUDE EXPERIENCE relating to the position Responsibilities - Oversee all medical issues and emergencies that occur on site. - Manage all documentation relating to all medical occurrences. - Work closely with campers, staff and families on a daily basis. - Follow all Department of Health rules and regulations. - Create safety systems throughout the site to prevent illness and injury. - Manage all medical supplies. - Provide minor medical treatment and keep related records. - Additional responsibilities as assigned by manager. Requirements - CANDIDATE MUST BE ABLE TO DRIVE TO OUR SUMMER CAMP LOCATION IN MARLBORO, NJ. - THIS IS AN UNPAID INTERNSHIP. - ALL APPLICANTS MUST COMPLETE AN APPLICATION AT http://www.bgcme.org/job-application.html IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED. WE WILL NOT CONSIDER YOUR RESUME IF YOU DO NOT COMPLETE THE APPLICATION AND SEND A RESUME AND COVER LETTER NO EXCEPTIONS. RESUMES AND COVER LETTERS MUST ALSO BE SUBMITTED TO CHOSEN@BGCME.ORG, and applicants MUST visit www.bgcme.org to learn more about our organization in preparation for an interview. - MUST HAVE OR OBTAIN CPR/AED for Professional Rescuers and Health Care Providers. - Candidate MUST work proficiently with a great level of autonomy. - Must be available for an interview this week and available to manage camper's documents and start shortly thereafter. - Must be assertive. - Must have experience and demonstrated success in a professional setting. - Must have outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written, and excellent computer skills. - Must have educational training in the medical or pre-med field. - Must have a passion for youth and a heart to serve. - Must be enrolled in a certificate program or Bachelor's Degree Program in the medical field or a similarly related field of study. - Must be independent, open-minded, enthusiastic, adaptable, and must be able to work in a team environment, independently, and with a great deal of autonomy. - Must welcome new challenges, come up with fresh ideas and future focus, and be able to work in a fast paced environment in a deadline-oriented environment. Skills Required - CPR/AED Certified

07746.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
07746.title: Marlboro, NJ: Autism Volunteer

07748.description: We are looking for volunteers in the Middletown, NJ area to help us spread the awareness for the American Cancer Society and our local Relay For Life program. Relay For Life is the signature fundraiser for the American Cancer Society. Relay is staffed and coordinated by volunteers in more than 5,200 communities and 20 countries. Volunteers give of their time and effort because they believe it's time to take action against cancer. Join us at our Middletown event to bring our community together to remember loved ones lost, honor survivors of all cancers, and raise money to help the American Cancer Society make a global impact on cancer. The money raised through Relay For Life events helps realize the American Cancer Society's mission: to save lives and celebrate life. Every day. When you join a Relay For Life event, you're helping the American Cancer Society fund groundbreaking research, crucial patient care programs, and education and prevention information. When you Relay, you help save lives. Our local Middletown event takes place every annually in June, and is hosted at Middletown North. It is open to the entire Middletown community and all those surrounding it. We have teams of family and friends, from schools, local businesses, larger companies, and thensome.
07748.title: Middletown Volunteers Needed!

07932.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07932.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07932.description: Do you like to help organize events? Help us at any one of our upcoming events: Wine and Food Pairing Benefit Night on June 24, 2017, Golf Event and/or Halloween Trick or Trot. Put your creative skills to work, and help us to make our events successful to help those in need! Our next event is on June 24, 2017. Help us make our Wine and food Pairing event a fun and successful evening.
07932.title: Special Events Coordinator

07932.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07932.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07932.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07932.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07932.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.
07932.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Florham Park

07932.description: RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties is a comprehensive community service organization sponsored by JFS MetroWest designed to mobilize members of the community who are 55+ to give back to their own neighborhoods in Essex and Hudson counties through volunteer services. For potential volunteers, RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties provides a single location where they can review a number of local volunteer opportunities and receive the help of a trained Volunteer Coordinator. This assistance ensures that volunteers are placed in a position that matches their skills, desired time commitment and interests. RSVP has a need throughout Essex County for Senior Companion Volunteers. Each volunteer is matched one-on-one with a homebound senior living in their own home or a managed care facility. Volunteers visit the same senior once a week or once every other week for an hour. Volunteer provide companionship, friendship and a listening ear to someone who is often isolated and overlooked. Senior Companions make a real difference in the lives of the people they visit. To learn more, please contact the RSVP Director Stephanie Grove at 973-637-1766 or sgrove@jfsmetrowest.org.
07932.title: Senior Companion

07932.description: The Retired & Senior Volunteer Program Center (RSVP) Center of Essex and Hudson Counties is a comprehensive community service organization through JFS MetroWest NJ designed to mobilize members of the community who are 55 and older in giving back to their own neighborhoods through volunteer service within Essex and Hudson Counties. For potential volunteers, RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties provides a single location where they can review a number of local volunteer opportunities and receive the help of a trained Volunteer Coordinator. This assistance ensures that volunteers are placed in a position that matches their skills, desired time commitment and interests. RSVP also provides volunteers with supplemental insurance while volunteering, annual volunteer recognition events and connection to a nationwide network of volunteers. We are currently placing volunteers in opportunities where they can assist childen, people with developmental disabilities, domestic violence victims, aging adults, hungry families, etc. Our placements occur throughout local hospitals, non profits, daycares, food pantries, public agencies, and many more. Contact us for a full listing of opportunities.
07932.title: RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties

08540.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE The Fiscal Reviewer is part of a team of about 8 people who review each of the cases opened for clients after a fire. Normally it takes only a few minutes to check each case and certify that it meets the requirements for financial assistance; however, there are times the Team Member must get in contact with the Manager in charge of the county where the fire was, to get information corrected before the case can be passed through. OPEN TIME DAYS There are four 3 hour shifts each day, Monday through Friday; however, you don’t have to be available during the full hours, unless we are trying to meet a deadline. Shifts needed now are 9 to noon and/or noon to 3. REQUIRED TRAINING Disaster Cycle Services: An Overview Recovery Services: An Overview Direct Client Assistance Fundamentals Casework & Recovery Planning Fundamentals Meet the Client: What is a Family? Two Youtube videos (optional): Creating a Case and Recovery Planning Familiarization with a  job tool : ｠Fiscal Review Job Tool After you’ve finished the training, you will work with the Team Manager one on one to make sure you understand the whole process.｠ Once you are comfortable, you can take a couple shifts, always being able to communicate with the Manager if you have｠questions. ｠｠
08540.title: Are you ready to put your head, your heart and your love of finance/accounting to work supporting th

The children and families teach our facilitators a great deal about life, resiliency, hope, and the need for supporting each other. Many volunteers say they receive much more than they give. 08540.description: arketing, Social Medial Summer/Fall/ Winter/Spring Internships The DoughMain Education Foundation was created to teach children basic financial and economic literacy skills to promote life-long financial health. The Foundation works closely with educators, opinion makers, business leaders and families to dramatically improve financial literacy and better prepare the next generation for a lifetime of good financial decisions. DMEF creates and makes available free lessons, activities, and assessments of the highest quality to schools and teachers. We are currently developing a student-centered financial literacy program that is standards-based and provides 60 hours for high school students. The DoughMain Education Foundation offers unpaid internships to current students and recent graduates interested in learning the inner workings of a nonprofit organization. Interns will be paired with a Foundation team member for one-on-one mentorship to gain hands-on experience in their area of interest. Requirements Applicants must: * Be available to work 15-20 hours per week during regular business hours at DoughMain Education Foundation HQ Princeton, New Jersey. * Have excellent verbal and written communication skills and a high level of computer competency. * Be self-motivated, organized, willing to help with any project no matter how large or small, and be able to balance multiple priorities at once. * Have a strong desire to make a difference, a passion for the DoughMain Education Foundation mission, a positive attitude, and a sense of humor. Application Process If you meet all of the above requirements and would like to be considered for an internship, please send a cover letter and resume and put INTERNSHIP and Focus Area in the subject line. Marketing and Social Media: Social media- Twitter, LinkeIn, Facebook, Pinterist, newsletter and editorial tasks as well as project management, including project initiation, working with the internal creative team stewarding the review and approval process, Updating promotional items, supporting active events, outreach etc. Use of Constant Contact, Hoot Suite schedulers and analytics.
08540.title: Marketing Social Media Internship
08540.org: DOUGHMAIN EDUCATION FOUNDATION INCORPORATED

08540.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE The American Red Cross Disaster Cycle Services (DCS) is launching the Home Fire Preparedness Campaign (HFPC) in October 2014. Its goal is to reduce the rate of deaths and injuries due to home fires by 25 percent over 5 years. Its strategy includes participating in a community coalition that targets neighborhoods at-risk for home fires; installs and tests smoke alarms; and provides fire safety and disaster preparedness education/planning. This position exists primarily to appropriately install new smoke alarms or batteries in working smoke alarms and to test them. It is part of a smoke alarm home visit team. OPEN TIME DAYS - 5-10 hours per weekend, once a quarter on average - Weekdays REQUIRED TRAINING American Red Cross Volunteer Orientation Disaster Services: An Overview Home Fire Preparedness Campaign Guidance and Training: Safety for Home Visists, Smoke Alarm Installation , and other required training.

08540.description: The DoughMain Financial Literacy Foundation was created to teach children basic financial and economic literacy skills to promote life-long financial health. The Foundation works closely with educators, opinion makers, business leaders and families to dramatically improve financial literacy and better prepare the next generation for a lifetime of good financial decisions. DMEF creates curriculum to teach financial literacy for High Schools and for Women. The DoughMain Financial Literacy Foundation is looking for a part time office and HR coordinator who can grow with the organization with strong organizational, writing skills, understanding of HR and intern management, CRM systems, Microsoft office suite and QuickBooks. Initially the position will be 20-30 hours per week Requirements Applicants must: * Be available to work 20-30 hours per week during regular business hours at DoughMain Foundation HQ Princeton, New Jersey. * Have excellent verbal and written communication skills and a high level of computer competency. * Be self-motivated, organized, willing to help with any project no matter how large or small, and be able to balance multiple priorities at once. * Have a strong desire to make a difference, a passion for DoughMain Financial Literacy Foundation's mission, a positive attitude, and a sense of humor. *Please check your commute time before applying Application Process: If you meet all of the above requirements and would like to be considered please send a cover letter and resume to rchurch@doughmainfoundation.org Departments/Areas of Interest * Executvie Support/HR--Development and Fundraising * Graphic Design, Game Creation, Marketing and Social Media Job Description Executive Support/HR: will assist with management of the organization- Support Executive Director- becoming the #2 leader within the organization, Manage CRM Database systems (Salsa, Eleo,Constant Contact, Microsoft Cloud, 365 and Sharepoint) Perform bookeeping payroll records, manage acquisition, interwiews and flow of interns and vounteers into the organization (6-15 Interns quarterly), manage volunteer and employment files, schedules etc. Executive Support may also be involved in research and development, grantwriting, major donor engagement and outreach.
08540.title: Exec. Support, HR, Office Manager-Paid

08540.description: lYou love to cook, you’re comfortable in a busy kitchen, so how do you feel about teaching what you know to people who must learn home food preparation to deal with their health? The Suppers Programs seeks people within an hour of Princeton to train as facilitators and run meetings from your home, church, or community kitchen. We avoid all processed food including milled grains and sugar. Suppers meetings involve whole food preparation, eating the meal, running food experiments to help people determine their personal best way of eating, and an educational piece which is usually driven by the special interests of the facilitator. They can be general or specific to a population, like people with diabetes or digestive issues or people who just want to learn healthy food preparation like mothers who want to feed their kids better. Meals can be vegan, vegetarian or omnivore. After you have the initial training, the volunteer obligation is about 2 hours a month for facilitator meetings and 5 hours per month of service (or 5 hours per week for weekly meetings). The training is free for people who start Suppers meetings and a nominal cost for those who just want the training. Check out www.TheSuppersPrograms.org . To set up a screening interview Contact Jane Milrod, adhdcoachjane@gmail.com 609-731-7556
08540.title: The future depends on cooks!  Will you help us heal others?
08540.org: The Suppers Programs
