08542.description: Outreach Supervisor (Volunteer Position) Position Summary : The Disability Allies (DA) is dedicated to providing social opportunities to connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. The Outreach Supervisor i s a part time volunteer position that involves a commitment of a few hours a week. You must be willing to join us at our monthly committee meetings at the Milltown Public Library at 10am on the Second S aturday of the Month. The Outreach Supervisor will lead a team in charge of building strategic relationships, conduct ing a variety of outreach ac tivities, and the recruitment of volunteers and members . Responsibilities: The Outreach Supervisor will lead a team in charge of building strategic relationships, conduct ing a variety of outreach ac tivities, and the recruitment of volunteers and members . The Community Outreach Team will be responsible for the following tasks: Create and implement our outreach plan Develop and strengthen relationships between the Disability Allies and the community Develop partnerships with universities, social groups and community organizations, in particular those that provide social opportunities to young adults with disabilities Recruit and place Disability Allies volunteers within our committees Qualifications & Competencies: Excellent public speaking and presentation skills Must be able to meet deadlines and adjust to changing priorities Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing Ability to connect with others and develop relationships Committed to the mission of serving young adults with disabilities Ability to perform several tasks concurrently Strong time management and organizational skills Ability to maintain detailed records and confidential information About the Disability Allies : The purpose of the Disability Allies is to plan team building activities that connect young adults and children with and without disabilities.   At our events we pair each individual up with a mentor. The job of the mentor is to help the participants with their social skills and insure that everyone interacts with each other. Our events are open to any young adult that has a disability, knows someone with a disability or is supportive of people with disabilities. Please visit www.disabilityallies.com to learn more. Disability Allies Anti-Discrimination statement : Disability Allies shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, gender identification or expression, or military status in any of its activities of operations. These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers, and selection of ven dors and provision of services.
08542.title: Outreach Supervisor

08542.description: Community Coordinator Job Description Position Summary : The Disability Allies (DA) is dedicated to providing social opportunities to connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. The Commu nity Relations Coordinator is a part t ime position. The Community Relations Coordinator reports to the Director and is responsible for DA outreach and recruitment. Responsibilities: The Community Coordinator’s primary responsibilities are to build strategic relationships, conduct a variety of outreach ac tivities, and recruit volunteers and members . Create and implement our outreach plan Develop and strengthen relationships between the Disability Allies and the community Develop partnerships with universities, social groups and community organizations, in particular those that provide social opportunities to young adults with disabilities Recruit and place Disability Allies volunteers within our committees Qualifications & Competencies: Excellent public speaking and presentation skills Must be able to meet deadlines and adjust to changing priorities Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing Ability to connect with others and develop relationships Committed to the mission of serving young adults with disabilities Ability to perform several tasks concurrently Strong time management and organizational skills Ability to maintain detailed records and confidential information About the Disability Allies : The purpose of the Disability Allies is to plan team building activities that connect young adults and children with and without disabilities.   At our events we pair each individual up with a mentor. The job of the mentor is to help the participants with their social skills and insure that everyone interacts with each other. Our events are open to any young adult that has a disability, knows someone with a disability or is supportive of people with disabilities. Please visit www.disabilityallies.com to learn more . Disability Allies Anti-Discrimination statement : Disability Allies shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, gender identification or expression, or military status in any of its activities of operations. These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers, and selection of ven dors and provision of services.
08542.title: Community Coordinator

08542.description: The Suppers Program Tech Support Intern Position Description and Skills Needed: * tape member testimonials for the archive on our web site * create audio files of our messages and prepare them to post on website * counsel us on social media to reach a younger demographic whose health issues demand that they eat well. * take charge of the tech side of creating video versions of our content * photograph events and post to Suppers Facebook pages * familiarize yourself with our mission and work Suppers http://www.thesuppersprograms.org/ * interest in the whole food and holistic health movement * attend 4 events per month including eating delicious organic food and manning the skype, or webinar, or audiofile aspects of our new distance learning modules. (We are mostly older people without the basic skills to do this) Important: Please send a cover letter describing your qualifications About the Suppers Program: Tech Support Internship for a Real Food Lover Combine your interest in whole healthy food with the tech skills you have because they come so naturally to young people. The Suppers Programs serve people with food-related diagnoses like diabetes, Celiac disease, IBS, and food allergies. We teach them how to prepare the kinds of food that will prevent and often reverse their diagnoses. Most of us are old enough that we don't use Skype; make videos create webinars and other vehicles for distance learning, or know how to figure out what apps could help us monitor our health. But we sure can cook! And we can share our meetings and meals with an intern who is interested in learning more about improving health outcomes with real food. All activity is in Princeton.
08542.title: Tech Support Intern - Video, Web, Skype, Audiofile

08542.description: For Princeton Area Residents: The Suppers Programs seeks a volunteer to help with traditional publicity outlets to promote our events in the Princeton area and get the word out about our organization. Tasks include: keeping track of free calendar listings and posting events every month, maintaining a media list of print media; researching possibilities for posting events among local churches and organizations, taking photos for fliers and distributing fliers and print newsletters. Our social media needs are covered; we need a volunteer for traditional media. Suppers is a network of peer-led support groups where people learn to develop a palate for, cook, and eat real, whole food. We serve people who have or are concerned about chronic illnesses that are largely preventable or reversible with diet and lifestyle change: diabetes, obesity, heart disease, digestive problems, autoimmune diseases and addiction. This 3.5 minute video describes our work: https://vimeo.com/96033924 Ours is a volunteer organization and this is an unpaid position. However, our publicity intern will enjoy fabulously delicious meals provided at our meetings and a chance to meet people who are interested in health and food. Contact: Dor Mullen, Dor@thesuppersprograms.org Hours: Irregular, entirely flexible hours, about 5 - 10 per month, more when you attend lunch meetings Location: Activity is in and around Princeton Requirements: * the intern will have an intense interest in healthy food and home food preparation. (interest is more important than experience) * the intern will be comfortable with the technical equipment and work well with older people (50s - 70s) * the ideal candidate will have personal experience of turning around a health challenge using natural methods such as whole food, meditation, stress management, etc. * the intern will need to watch these two videos prior to contacting us and state in their application why they are interested in serving a small non-profit that is dedicated to helping people lead a healthier life on whole food. https://vimeo.com/132381873 http://vimeo.com/96033924 Please send your resume to Janemilrod@gmail.com with a cover letter or email detailing your relevant experience and the reason for your interest.
08542.title: Public Relations Volunteer - Day time, Year round

08542.description: The NGO Lead takes point on developing and cultivating our relationships with National Non-Profit Organizations that are complementary to our brand. This individual would be required to identify and create value for working together. This position would own the relationship and be required to articluate the value proposition. This position would also work with the Marketing team to develop co-branded supporting documentation as well as create press releases. All engagments would need to be documented in Salesforce.com
08542.title: NGO Lead

08542.description: This volunteer works with the foundation in creating press releases and media kits, fielding media inquiries, working with our webmaster to make sure all events and press releases are updated on the website.
08542.title: PR Volunteer

08542.description: This position would work with the President to help enhance our marketing strategy. It would include securing print, radio and TV interviews, creating press kits, handing media inquiries and increasing our public awareness.
08542.title: Public and Press Relations Lead

08542.description: This position would be responsible for collecting donations and speaking with people about The Luca John Foundation and what we do. This position would require the indvidual to call companies, and ask for monetary as well as product donations to be used to fund our grants, as well as assist our chapters and member families.
08542.title: Fundraiser

11542.description: Love Kittens and kitties? Can't bring any (more) home?! Donate one hour a week and make a difference in the life of a shelter cat. Golden Paw Society rescues kitties from Long Island town shelters. Many of the cats rescued have spent years living poor crowded noisy cages. Golden Paw Society offered them a new lease on life. We provide them with quality medical care and rehabilitate those who need extra support- through the support of our volunteers!! Volunteers help make each of our rescued kitties feel loved and cared. Help us, help them. In return you'll get tons of kitty love! We are looking for help at our adoption center at PETCO in Glen Cove Volunteers help with litter box scooping, feeding, fresh water. Giving the kitties love, brushing them, petting them, playing with them, talking to them, often just giving them a lap to lay in. Volunteers are available to speak to potential adopters about the kitties that are available for adoption. Volunteers should be 18 years or older. Complete our short volunteer application via our website: http://www.goldenpawsociety.org/volunteer.html
11542.title: Help Care for Homeless Cats find a HOME to call their own!

11542.description: Winter 2017 Orientation session: Wednesday, February 15, 2017, 2 - 4pm HMTC of Nassau County has many different opportunities to volunteer with our programs: Museum Docents and Holocaust Educators are committed to Holocaust and Tolerance education. Docents are needed every day of the week, especially Friday and Saturday. They provide schoolchildren and unscheduled visitors with tours of the museum exhibit. Because the Holocaust and Tolerance Center is a small institution with irregular visitor flow, docents and educators are asked, in addition to giving tours, to provide visitors with information, check them in, monitor the book shop, and help with other duties as assigned. Special Events - the Center hosts special events and programs throughout the year. We need assistance with set-up, clean-up, registration, logistics, and greeting. This position is a perfect fit for people who are friendly and outgoing, can multi-task, and who want to help, but don’t have a lot of time. Most special events take place evenings or weekends. Adopt a Project - the Center has a wide array of projects from outreach to grant-writing just waiting for someone with initiative, creative thinking, and phone and people skills to move it along. We will match your talents and interests to our projects. Internships - there are also opportunities for high school and college students to intern with the Education and Development departments. For more information, please visit https://www.hmtcli.org
11542.title: Looking for energetic new docents and volunteer educators!
11542.org: Holocaust Memorial and Tolerance Center of Nassau County

11542.description: We are a Christian transitional home for women struggling with drug/alcohol addictions. We help them regain their lives by providing shelter, food, emotional support and basic life skills to succeed. We need people to be mentors and lead workshops on recovery, self esteem, health, finance management , job search, & computer skills. We need help in designing a new website for us- one that we can update ourselves!
11542.title: Help us give women back their dignity at our transitional home

11542.description: A museum and nature preserve emphasizing the geology of Long Island and American Indian archaeology..
11542.title: Garvies Point Museum and Preserve

07512.description: CALLING ALL CHEFS! Would you like an opportunity to help form the chefs of the future? Do you enjoy sharing your passion for food with younger generations? Do you have a sense of calling and understanding that God lead you to your profession? We are looking for FIVE CHEFS to donate ONE HOUR In which you will share: (1) Brief history of how you became a chef (2) One cool kitchen tip or skill (3) Teach one simple recipe In exchange: We promise you will have an amazing time You will be featured as one of our partners in all our social media outlets, press releases, and communications. Thank you!
07512.title: Chefs Needed

07512.description: Looking for volunteers who love children and cooking! Must be * 14 years or older You will be part of a team of culinary dreamers who will provide the most exciting and fun cooking experience this summer for children ages 3-12. Camp runs Aug. 14-18, 2017 from 8:30am -2:30pm. Lunch is provided. Positions Available Games Director: plans daily games and activities indoor/outdoor Snack Coordinator: plans and coordinates healthy daily snacks Sous Chefs: Assist chef/cooking facilitators in the kitchen Craft Director: plans and coordinates daily craft activities Service Project Director: coordinates food drive Training Required: Thursday, June 22, 2017 at 6pm Pizza Included. To Apply Please send an email to totowaumc@gmail.org with your information and a few sentences as to why you want to join this team. *Adult counselors must pass a background check and safe sanctuaries training.
07512.title: Earn Leadership Hours!

07512.description: This Vacation Bible School is like no other! \"Kingdom Cooks\" is a highly interactive camp that will explore the teachings of Jesus while learning the basics of cooking, serving, eating, and sharing! We are looking for high quality volunteers who love cooking/food to engage children in fun learning interactivities. Roles include: Station Facilitators, Group Guides by Age Groups, Snack/Kitchen Team, Craft Team, Decorations Team, Music & Dance Team, and Floaters.
07512.title: VBS Camp Helpers Needed

07512.description: The Chapter office needs volunteer assistance for: -Health Fair events to raise awareness for the Alzheimer's Association throughout North and Central NJ -Promotional events throughout North and Central NJ to raise awareness for our Walk To End Alzheimer's events in Ridgefield Park, Mercer County, Bradley Beach and Newark -Office help in Totowa, NJ
07512.title: Alzheimer's Association Greater NJ Chapter Volunteer Assistance

07512.description: We are seeking certified yoga instuctors who are interested in sharing their passion for teaching yoga with individuals who are striving to embark on having a more active and healthy lifestyle through our Active Life for a Healthy Mind program. We have a variety of regularly scheduled activities for individuals who self-identify with anxiety and/or depression. Volunteers would be expected to lead a yoga class on weekday evenings and/or weekends, based on thier availability. Candidates volunteering in this capacity should be proficient in teaching yoga to individuals with little or no experience with them. You should also hold the appropriate certification(s) and be willing to provide them for our records. These yoga sessions are open, free of charge, to individuals living with anxiety and/or depression, who are seeking an outlet for an active and healthy lifestyle.
07512.title: Volunteer Yoga Instuctor

07511.description: To care for patients in their final months or weeks of life, and their families, by a weekly visit in their home.
07511.title: Hospice Volunteer

07511.description: Volunteers with Passaic Valley Hospice visit our terminally ill patients in their homes throughout northern New Jersey. Our goal is to support patients physically, emotionally and spiritually, and their families, so those in their final months can live as fully and comfortably as possible and finish their journey with dignity and peace. Volunteers provide companionship for patients and families, and help with respite for caregivers. There are also needs for assistance with office work and making bereavement phone calls. Training is provided with continuing coaching available.
07511.title: Hospice Volunteers

10805.description: United Hebrew of New Rochelle is an outstanding, five-star nursing home and rehabilitation facility where teamwork and dedication are the two essential components of everyday operations. We are currently looking for someone with great clerical and organizational skills to assist our skilled health care agency in helping those residents who are successfully discharged from the facility to get back to their normal, everyday lives! Would you like to be a part of our caring, rewarding, ever-growing, and fun family? The hours are very flexible-- as long as you can help out Monday through Friday during regular, 9-5 business hours. Two days a week, 9-5-- would be ideal, but we are willing to consider ANY kind of regular schedule-as the demand for assistance is truly overwhelming! Responsibilities will including but are not limited to - Filing - Preparing admissions packets - Basic data entry of new residents - Insurance verification. Please feel free to e-mail mlevine@uhgc.org. We look forward to hearing from you!!!
10805.title: Our Skilled Health Care Agency Needs You!

10805.description: United Hebrew of New Rochelle--a five-start nursing home and rehabilitation facility in the Westchester, NY is looking for weekend volunteers. Our fun recreation department is especially interested in mature and responsible volunteers who would like to help with transporting/escorting residents to and from different units for facility-wide events/activities, conducting games, visits, or other activities, and simply enhancing the residents’ lives and safety through interacting and assisting our recreation staff. The most crucial hours when volunteers are needed are 1PM to 4PM on weekends, but we are open to other options as morning hours are also important! Please note that while we really need volunteers on weekends, we also need volunteers throughout the week-- especially when conducting visits and collecting resident stories. We look forward to hearing from you!
10805.title: Weekend FUN with Seniors!

10805.description: We are looking to add volunteers to our newly-developed dementia unit as well as to other units throughout the facility! We are looking for people with special talents to provide alternative therapies, such as yoga and tactile stimulation to our elderly residents. We are also looking for art music, and drama therapists or simply artists, musicians and actors to volunteer their time. This could be a great opportunity for a student to gain valuable or a senior yoga instructors looking to contribute to the community. You will be working side-by-side with amazing recreation staff. We are also looking for art therapy volunteers to assist our talented Art Therapists on the dementia floor and other units. We offer at truly friendly and supportive environment! Joins our team and you will see what teamwork is all about! We currently have Music, Art, and Dance/Movement Therapists on our team, and ALL of them would LOVE your assistance! We also have numerous volunteer opportunities available in ALL DEPARTMENTS! NO MATTER HOW YOU DECIDE TO CONTRIBUTE, YOU ARE GUARANTEED TO HAVE A REWARDING AND VALUABLE EXPERIENCE! WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU! Please call/e-mail Mila Levine at 914-632-2804x1234/mlevine@uhgc.org
10805.title: Call for ALL Creative Talents/Therapists: music, arts, drama, etc.

10805.description: Our Administration/Security Department is looking for volunteers to greet visitors, sort mail, and, occasionally, answer phones at the very busy front desk. Your primary responsibility will be assisting our amazing front desk staff. Friendly disposition is a must, and experience in the hospitality industry is strongly preferred. You will, at times, be escorting visitors and delivering packages or mail to the residents on the floors. You will also get a chance to work with numerous departments, family members, and residents. You will get to know virtually everyone in the facility! This is a one of those fun opportunities where no two days are alike! Are you ready to have some fun and fall in love with our five-star, customer-focused facility?! PREFERRED HOURS ARE WEEKDAYS 11AM-3PM (PLEASE NOTE THAT WEEKEND VOLUNTEERS ARE ALSO VERY MUCH NEEDED IN MANY DIFFERENT AREAS!) In addition, we have numerous volunteer opportunities available in ALL Departments! NO MATTER HOW YOU DECIDE TO CONTRIBUTE, YOU ARE GUARANTEED TO HAVE A REWARDING AND VALUABLE EXPERIENCE! WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU! Please call/e-mail Mila Levine at 914-632-2804x1234/mlevine@uhgc.org
10805.title: Are You Great at Customer Service?

10805.description: United Hebrew of New Rochelle is looking for greeters/ambassadors who will 1) Greet visitors at the front door; 2) Assist visitors and residents coming in the lobby; 3) Escort visitors and residents to their destinations within the facility; 4) Answer any questions visitors, family members, and newly-admitted residents may have upon arrival; 5) Serve as a liaison between newly-admitted residents and department representative to expedite residents/families’ requests in a timely fashion; 6) Perform other duties as required by administrative staff. The hours are flexible. We understand other commitments our volunteers may have. If you are available any time during the week between the hours of 1PM and 5PM and on weekends between 10AM and 6PM, we would love to hear from you!! Even one day a week will make a difference! Please contact Mila Levine, Director of Volunteers at 914-632-2894x1234 or at mlevine@uhgc.org. Visit us at http://www.unitedhebrewgeriatric.org
10805.title: Are You a Good Host/Hostess?

10805.description: United Hebrew - a five-star nursing home and rehab facility in New Rochelle, NY- has a rehabilitation department affiliated with the nationally-renown Burke Rehabilitation Center. We are currently looking for mature, responsible, and, preferably, long-term volunteers who would be able to assist with transporting residents to and from rehabilitation activities. We are especially interested in WEEKEND VOLUNTEERS who would be available Saturday and Sunday 9:30AM to 3:30PM. This role is crucial in helping our rehab residents get better faster and keep our amazing rehab staff on schedule! Join us in this rewarding role, and you will get to work with truly compassionate, hard-working, and FUN people! You will get to see how your efforts can have a direct effect on people's lives! You will also get to work side by side with our rehabilitation experts that will allow you to gain valuable experience. We look forward to hearing from you!
10805.title: Weekend Helpers for the Top-Notch Rehab Department!

10801.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
10801.title: New Rochelle>>>Advice Counselor

07044.description: Spectrum360 challenges expectations for children, adolescents, and adults across the full spectrum of autism and related disabilities through innovative special education, employment supports, and community-building. We have evolved over the last 50 plus years in part because of the passion and commitment of our Board of Directors. As the organization continues to progress and extend our programs to offer increased options to the individuals we serve we are looking to continue to grow our Board. We do not define individuals by their disabilities. Using evidence-based approaches, we push the boundaries of traditional programs and services, helping each person we serve to discover unique talents, develop self-worth, and maximize opportunities for independence, self-direction, citizenship, and community integration. We are seeking individuals to join our Board of Directors who have the passion to help us in fulfilling our mission. Desired qualities and abilities of a prospective board member include: Conducts business as a Board Trustee with the highest degree of integrity and confidentiality. Upholds high ethical/professional standards. Has a commitment to and serve as an advocate for Spectrum360 and the individuals we serve. Has a passion to introduce others to the mission of Spectrum360. Possess the ability to bring their own talents and the talents of others to benefit the Board of Directors. Has influence and/or affluence to provide financial support to Spectrum360. Displays a willingness to address the challenges facing Spectrum360 with creative and innovative solutions. Demonstrates a positive problem-solving approach. Follows through and ensures expectations are met. Has the ability to motivate others. Conducts oneself in a professional and positive manner and shows respect to others. Is a team player. Is enthusiastic. Listens actively and promotes straightforward, open communication. We expect the following commitment to being a Spectrum360 board member: Willingness to commit to a minimum of 6 hours monthly to the work of the organization. Attend board orientation, a minimum of 4 of 6 board meetings annually, and assigned committee meetings. Attend fundraising and other events throughout the year. Serve a three-year term with the opportunity to continue additional terms. In the words of a Board Member, \"Being part of Spectrum360 is inspiring on many levels. The students and clients are infectious as their unique abilities, challenges and triumphs make you see things like never before, and you want more of it. The staff and their choice to serve others with such a passion and commitment is amazing. And then there are the members of the Board who with their various talents, intellect, and huge hearts, do whatever they can to continue to move the organization forward.\" To learn more about our organization, visit Spectrum360.org. If you are interested in becoming a part of this amazing journey and the opportunities at the Board and Committee levels, please contact Diane Berry dberry@spectrum360.org.
07044.title: Join our Board!
07044.org: SPECTRUM 360 A NEW JERSEY NONPROFIT CORPORATION

07044.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
07044.title: Verona, NJ: Autism Volunteer

07044.description: Care at Home New Jersey helps socially isolated, homebound seniors. As part of our program, we give our clients free, easy to use computers that they can use to stay connected with family and friends through email and Skype. We send volunteers to spend time with these seniors, to keep them company, and also to help and encourage them to use the computer we have given them. We want them to get comfortable reaching out to family and friends through the computer. The computer is specially designed for seniors and is easy to navigate. Volunteer hours are flexible and are arranged between the volunteer and the client, but we do like to have a minimum regular once a week commitment for an hour or two. Initially we do a short training to aquaint the volunteer with the computer, which is very easy to use.
07044.title: Visit with homebound Seniors

07045.description: Be our community champion! Community Options seeks business people to help further its mission. Among the goals set for the Business Advisory Council, or COBAC: To assist Community Options staff in its fundraising endeavors, To assist Community Options staff in networking with the business community, To help individuals with disabilities integrate into their communities, To ensure utmost quality in Community Options services, To educate local business owners and the corporate sector about persons with disabilities and the role that the business community can play in their lives, To attain a societal understanding and acceptance of a person with a disability as a productive member of the community. As a member of COBAC in your community, you're our champion! Join us today. Learn more about COBAC here: http://www.comop.org/get-involved/cobac/
07045.title: Business Advisory Council Committee - NNJ

07045.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Grace Healthcare Services welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexology, music, imagery and touch therapies such as Reiki, massage, therapeutic touch and healing hands. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide certified/trained pets who visit with patients. These animals provide loving memories for some and give unconditional love helping our patients feel connected to a larger world. Administrative Volunteers provide help to the staff in our Edison office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, huggable dolls/bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Junior Volunteers consist of groups such as girl/boy scouts or young people who wish to honor our patients by making holiday cards, posters, wall hangings and memory books. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families and friends of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. Hospice training classes are required for Companionship and Complementary Volunteers. They are free of charge and offered on an ongoing basis. Grace Healthcare Services serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, contact our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Gracehcs.com!
07045.title: Become a Hospice Volunteer!

07046.description: Be a mentor. Change a life. There are many ways to help! Bring the magic of mentoring to a child, age 5-18, from Morris, Bergen, Passaic and Sussex counties (N.J.), by becoming a Big Brother or Big Sister. Mentors meet with their Little Brothers or Little Sisters for 2-3 hours weekly. Find out how you can change a life!
07046.title: Be a mentor
07046.org: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Morris, Bergen & Passaic, Inc.

07046.description: The Community Companions Program (CCP) provides one-to-one companionship and assistance in daily living to people with mental illnesses. The companion visits the client at least once a week, for a minimum of three months, participating in mutually agreeable activities. Together they find new social groups, learn about community resources, and share in a supportive friendship. Volunteers will receive training, which will include an orientation to mental illness and mental health, an overview of community resources and practice in successful communication skills. Upon completion of training, volunteers will have the opportunity to share skills and interests with someone who needs social support as a supplement to mental health services. Please call Marissa Ferrito 973-334-3496 ext. 113 for more information.
07046.title: Community Companion Program
07046.org: Mental Health Association of Morris County (MHAMC)

07046.description: The Mental Health Players, sponsored by MHAMC, are accepting volunteer applications. The Players are a group of volunteers who use improvisational role plays to portray real life situations. The players perform for various groups including schools, civic organizations, businesses, and church groups. Players come from all walks of life to help educate the community about mental health issues. The Players deal with a broad range of issues. These include mental health, substance abuse, peer pressure, aging, and other social issues. The performance usually lasts an hour and includes 3 role plays. To become a volunteer or to gather additional information, please call Tracy Cappiccille at 973-334-3496, ext. 112.
07046.title: Mental Health Players (MHP)
07046.org: Mental Health Association of Morris County (MHAMC)

07047.description: Our immediate goal is partnerships and collaborations with like minded groups and sponsors to expand and sustain our mission. We are looking for program directors to expand our apiary programs to new educational and municipal markets. Our focus is on training and assisting disadvantaged population, veterans and all students to support sustainable programs that teach a basic business model based on honey products and preserving honey bees as part of an environmental action. Our programs encompass interdisciplinary learning including business planning management and development, teaching, wood working, environmental, agriculture, health, habitat, food chain, apitherapy, apiculture, biology, and cross over into emotional support therapy and and treatments.
07047.title: Educating the public on preservation of honey bees through community actions

07047.description: Homeside Hospice is looking for volunteers to provide Music Therapy to our patients in assisted living and in nursing homes in Hudson County. If you are a Music Therapist, you can provide a loving experience for patients in lifes final journey. As a volunteer you will provide essential, quality of life services to patients. Your efforts will provide the sort of care and help that a loving friend provides and help insure that the Hospice promise is fulfilled. Music Therapy Students Welcome!
07047.title: Music Therapy Volunteers needed in Hudson County

Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
07047.title: North Bergen>>>Advice Counselor

07040.description: The traditional Maplewood 4th of July celebration relies on the support of the community for its success. This year's event will be bigger than ever, and we need your help! Come join our team! We need ticket sellers/takers, information guides, concession vendors, and more!

07042.description: If you have a passion for raising money for a good cause, you are a match for us! We are looking for someone with fundraising skills to help us with projects to raise funds for our organization. We are a non-profit residence for independent seniors. We currently have one major fundraiser a year, and would like to have several smaller ones. Let us know if you are interested in helping support the elderly! We look forward to hearing from you!
07042.title: Fundraising Professional Needed
07042.org: The Montclair Inn

07042.description: Be a Hospice Volunteer! Hospice Volunteers are needed for supportive visits to patients, offering emotional support and companionship. Volunteers can read to patients, hold their hand, talk and pray with them, write letters, be a good listener, or various other supportive acts. We offer free Hospice training. Compassionate Care Hospice is recruiting volunteers to work with our hospice patients and their families in home settings, assisted living settings, and nursing facilities near you! (Passaic County, Bergen County, Essex County, Hudson County, Union County) Please Call Volunteer Coordinator Jessicalee Huggins 973-916-1400 or email Jessicalee.huggins@cchnet.net
07042.title: Be a hospice volunteer in Essex County
07042.org: Compassionate Care Hospice

07042.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe, comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers.
07042.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice - Montclair
07042.org: Ascend Hospice

07042.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.
07042.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Montclair
07042.org: Ascend Hospice

07042.description: Ascend Hospice Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients ; mind, body and soul.
07042.title: Music Therapy for Hospice - Montclair
07042.org: Ascend Hospice

07042.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07042.title: Companion Hospice Volunteers - Montclair
07042.org: Ascend Hospice

07042.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE The American Red Cross Disaster Cycle Services (DCS) is launching the Home Fire Preparedness Campaign (HFPC) in October 2014. Its goal is to reduce the rate of deaths and injuries due to home fires by 25 percent over 5 years. Its strategy includes participating in a community coalition that targets neighborhoods at-risk for home fires; installs and tests smoke alarms; and provides fire safety and disaster preparedness education/planning. This position exists primarily to appropriately install new smoke alarms or batteries in working smoke alarms and to test them. It is part of a smoke alarm home visit team. OPEN TIME DAYS - 5-10 hours per weekend, once a quarter on average - Weekdays REQUIRED TRAINING American Red Cross Volunteer Orientation Disaster Services: An Overview Home Fire Preparedness Campaign Guidance and Training: Safety for Home Visists, Smoke Alarm Installation , and other required training.
07042.title: Save Lives by Installing Home Smoke Alarms in At-Risk Homes!:  Preparedness Member - Home Fire Campa

07042.description: Start Out Fresh Intervention Advocates, fondly referred to as S.O.F.I.A., is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that provides advocacy, support services, and referrals for temporary housing for \"at risk\" women and children of domestic violence. S.O.F.I.A is seeking volunteers. We are looking for empathetic individuals with great administrative, organizational, social media, marketing and communication skills. We are also seeking individuals to train to become certified domestic violence advocates and/or to answer calls for general inquiries. Ideally, we would like volunteers to start as soon as possible. Once you contact us, we will send you a brief volunteer application and be in touch with you shortly. Thank you!

07042.description: Retired & Senior Volunteer Program (RSVP) RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties is a comprehensive community service organization sponsored by JFS MetroWest designed to mobilize members of the community who are 55+ to give back to their own neighborhoods in Essex and Hudson counties through volunteer services. For potential volunteers, RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties provides a single location where they can review a number of local volunteer opportunities and receive the help of a trained Volunteer Coordinator. This assistance ensures that volunteers are placed in a position that matches their skills, desired time commitment and interests. Eligibility Adults who are at least 55 years of age are eligible for the RSVP program Benefits Participate in meaningful, challenging, and interesting volunteer opportunities Meet new people and make new friends Learn new skills or share current abilities with others Receive free supplemental accident, liability, and automobile insurance while traveling to and from volunteer assignments Attend an annual recognition event RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties has numerous volunteer opportunities available throughout our service area. Each volunteer opportunity is different; requiring different skills, level of commitment, and training.A few examples of some of the opportunities available are: Be a mentor to a student who is struggling in school Aid seniors with daily tasks such as bill paying Provide support to victims of domestic violence IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO LEARN MORE ABOUT THESE OR OTHER OPPORTUNITIES CONTACT STEPHANIE GROVE AT 973-637-1766 OR SGROVE@JFSMETROWEST.ORG.
07042.title: Volunteer Center for 55+
07042.org: Jewish Family Service of MetroWest

07042.description: Volunteers needed to tutor children afterschool Monday - Friday between the hours of 3PM - 6PM. Children range in age from 1st grade through high school depending on the program. Volunteers must commit to a minimum of volunteering one day a week. When able, volunteers will be matched with the same student each week. Students mostly need assistance with homework and staying on task. Volunteers with experience in math and science are especially in demand. Volunteers must be age 55 or over.
07042.title: Tutor Children
07042.org: Jewish Family Service of MetroWest

Deployment outside of NJ｠- requires a minimum of two weeks Regional Task Group｠- attend meetings as scheduled and work with the group as needed REQUIRED TRAINING Orientation to the American Red Cross is required. Disaster training is required, provided free of charge and is web-based and/or instructor-led in a classroom.｠ Initial basic courses include: Disaster Services: An Overview Disaster Action Team Fundamentals Shelter Fundamentals Feeding Fundamentals Casework and Recovery Planning Fundamentals Disaster Assessment Fundamentals Other courses are required for specific response roles.｠
07042.title: Respond to disasters: Disaster Responder Trainee
07042.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

07042.description: We are looking for academic tutors, as well as squash volunteers in Montclair, NJ! StreetSquash-Newark is an academic and athletic after-school program serving students in the 10th-11th grade. We are looking for volunteer tutors, and volunteer squash players for all weekdays in Montclair . Tutors: StreetSquash Newark Academic Tutors work with 1-2 students during after-school homework sessions. Our tutors assist 10th and 11th-grade students with math, English, history and science homework. These sessions occur from 3:45-5:50pm every weekday at the Montclair YMCA under the supervision of our Academic Director. Squash Coaches: StreetSquash Newark Volunteer Squash Player s join StreetSquash students on the courts for basic drills, training, and games. Squash players of all levels are needed for our practice from 3:45-5:50pm every weekday at the Montclair YMCA. These sessions are led and supervised by our Squash Director. The best thing about becoming a StreetSquash volunteer is meeting great young people and making a difference in their lives - whether you can make it once a week or once in awhile, we encourage you to get involved. Please contact us with your interest and availability to tutor in our academic sessions, or to assist with Squash practices! If you are interested in volunteering with StreetSquash Newark at our Montclair facility, please complete our volunteer application here: http://www.streetsquash.org/get-involved/volunteer/newark. If you have questions, please e-mail Taralyn at Taralyn@streetsquashnj.org or call 973.848.9600.
07042.title: Change a life- become a tutor!
07042.org: StreetSquash Newark

07043.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New Jersey citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
07043.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Montclair NJ

11545.description: The residents of the agencies Greenlawn house are interested in building a raised garden so they can grow their own vegetables. We are in need of an experienced volunteer who can help with the construction and maintenance of the garden as well as provide basic gardening tips and education for the residents. Ongoing volunteers would need to complete a one hour orientation, a screening for tuberculosis and a full criminal background check. All screenings are provided and paid for by the agency.
11545.title: Help Build a Garden

11545.description: The agencies ComeUnity Recreation and Sports programs is always looking for enthusiastic and active volunteers to asisst with one of many ongoing opportunities. Year round ComeUnity Recreation hosts bowlings nights, walking clubs and Yoga classes. From September through June there are recreation nights twice a week, dances three times a month, as well as multiple trips and outings. We have multiple sports teams that practice and compete throughout the year including Basketball, Track & Field, Softball and Skiing. Help us to ensure that the people that we support are able to maintain an active lifestyle in a fun, relaxed and welcoming environment.
11545.title: ComeUnity Recreation

11549.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
11549.title: Hempstead>>>Advice Counselor

10708.description: The HUGS Ambassador program is an intergenerational leadership and mentorship program for youth and young adults ranging from middle to college level students. The mission of the HUGS Ambassador Program is to increase awareness about students in need and provide the essential tools to help foster their academic success. By joining this program, students will become leaders within their communities and school campuses around the world! HUGS Ambassadors work with one another and adults in their community to learn how to engage and launch projects to help create a better opportunity for students in low-income communities. Students from different areas of the world are joining the Give More HUGS Movement to make a difference in their community! Together, we can change the lives of children by promoting the need for quality education for all. Help us provide students with the tools that inspire a love for learning, reading, and creativity! Ambassadors work together to plan events that inspire, motivate, and encourage change in the lives of students. These experiences give HUGS Ambassadors an opportunity to conduct community service hours while making a positive difference. Visit http://www.givemorehugs.org/hugs-ambassador to learn more and apply before the July 15, 2017 deadline.
10708.title: Helping Unite Giving Souls Ambassador: Opportunity for Middle School, High School & College students

07950.description: This outdoor hands-on class teaches the safe, easy and effective way to learn to ride on two wheels. Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers will be given training on how to fit a helmet and how to make minor bike adjustments. As a volunteer at this event, we need your help with the following: o Assist instructors with bicycle preparation o Removing bike pedals o Lowering seats o Bike sizing o Tire inflation o Brake check o Provide assistance guiding children through the course o Ability to work and stand in the sun for 3-4 hours o Ability to bend o Ability to jog behind the children’s bikes if necessary
07950.title: Help Kids Learn to Ride a Bike

06897.description: Our volunteers fill two critical rolls in helping seniors in Wilton: 1. Providing local transportation for those who do not drive - in getting to medical appointments, grocery shopping, social events, and any other activity. 2. Provide simple homes fix-ups that do not require a proefessional such as changing light bulbs and getting computers working. In addition, we can use adminsitrative help for our operation: Fund Raising Membership Acquisition
06897.title: Supporting the needs of members of Staying at Home in Wilton
06897.org: Stay at Home in Wilton, Inc.

10703.description: Communicate Knowledge INC is 501(c)3 non for profit organization whose aim is to democratize access to science. We provide world’s leading classes on Robotics, Math, Big Data and 3D design for children and college students. Our classes are designed in an intuitive way of teaching Digital and Applied science. We strive to teach kids how to create and solve math problems in no failure way, make Robotics/3D easy to construct and exploit, organize team work, and sharpen leadership skills. Dates: July 10th - September 1, 2017 Scheduled Dates: 8.45 am-6.00 pm every day 5 days a week with shifts availability. Evening or weekend training for additional 2 hours will be provided for two or three weeks during the camp time and will be scheduled according to the personal preferences of the employees. All our staff with our students help out with games and camp events and serve as teachers/mentors/counselors. Please, be aware, that we strive to create and promote an atmosphere of the safe, coherent and careful place to stay and learn for our children, and employees/volunteers, and we must take measures to fulfill it. REQUIREMENTS AND WORK DESCRIPTION Teachers/Counselors/Volunteers are expected to: - teach and/or organize, interact, assist with the teamwork of 8-14 students in classes and during the breaks; - teach according to daily lessons curriculum, provide instructional support and use our creativity tools to create their own tasks if they feel confident and capable; - follow up the strategies that were proposed or develop their own that can be implemented when got approved by the leadership of Communicate Knowledge INC. - Provide feedback to students’ parents after the day stay, - be agile in various methods of engaging students into a teamwork and make recommendations for students as they move through the program. - Do you best to think and generate new and better ways to do things, drawing on what they've seen, read, and experienced, who replace \"I can't do that\" with \"Let's make it happen!\". - look for the opportunities and foster students with a passion for entrepreneurship who might be capable of helping lead their startups with an additional compensation of any positive initiatives proposed and executed. According to personal circumstances some compensations could be provided. APPLY HERE https://docs.google.com/a/knsacademy.org/forms/d/114bvTtXAobdXfl0DgYJIvjkH-sbuN5UNH4rD3WQ0mpM/prefill?pli=1 or email to: knowledgeexcels@gmail.com
10703.title: Intern, teacher or volunteer in Robotics, Math, Big Data, 3D classes

10703.description: Simply by using your vehicle you can save animals - Volunteer your time to transport animals along what is called a \"Rescue Relay Transport\". Each week there are hundreds of animal rescue transports taking place where animals are moved from high-kill shelters to no-kill shelters and rescue organizations, as well as foster homes and adopters. It's easy for you to get involved and help save more animals simply by driving a leg in this relay. How it works: 1. Sign-up on Doobert.com or use the Facebook plug-in (search for \" Doobert Rescue\" on Facebook) and specify the days you're available, the distance you're willing to drive, and then sit back and we'll do the rest. 2. When an animal rescue organization posts a transport request, the system will automatically search to see if it matches your profile (if you're available and within the distance) and then it automatically sends you an e-mail. 3. Then you simply click on the leg that you can cover and everyone else will see that you've signed up for that leg. 4. You'll get communications from the transport coordinator and, once the transport is a \"go\", you simply drive to the meeting place, load up the animals, and drive them to the next meeting place to hand them off to the next volunteer. You'll get plenty of doggy kisses and thank you's along the way as the animals know you are there to help them. There are videos on www.doobert.com that walk you through the process and give you tips and tricks on how to do transport. It's simple - and we need volunteers across the country, so share with your friends and help save an animal today!
10703.title: Drive a leg – Save a life! - Yonkers, NY

10703.description: Loaning an animal your couch can save their life! - Every 16 seconds an animal is euthanized simply due to overpopulation. Shelters do not have unlimited space and unfortunately have to make room. Rescue groups do not have the facilities and rely on fosters to help. Simply by agreeing to foster you can save an animal’s life. ARF’s German Shepherd Rescue is partnering with Doobert.com, the leading online forum for animal rescues, animal shelters and volunteers, to help get more foster homes for rescue animals. How it works: 1. Sign up on Doobert.com or use the Facebook plug-in (search for \"Doobert Rescue\" on Facebook) and build your foster profile for how you can help foster animals. You get to pick the type, duration and tell potential shelters and rescues about your situation. It’s up to you what information you share. 2. We allow approved animal welfare organizations (Shelters and Rescues) to search for volunteers like you, based upon distance and your foster profile. They can see the information you’ve shared and reach out to you if there is a match. 3. You’ll be contacted by them directly and can determine if you are able to help that particular organization with fostering either overnight, short-term or longer-term. It’s up to you whether you help when you’re contacted. You'll get plenty of doggy and kitty kisses and thank you's along the way as the animals know you are there to help them. And there are many more ways to help volunteer to save animals on Doobert.com. It's simple and we need volunteers across the country - so share with your friends, family, and co-workers and help save an animal today!
10703.title: Let me crash on your couch… please? - Yonkers, NY

10703.description: Pilots to the Rescue is seeking active and inactive pilots to help save animals. Even if you lost your medical, are not able to be PIC, or just can't afford to fly regularly, we need pilots to help coordinate animal rescue transport flights for other pilots that are transporting animals. Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals to safety but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Pilots to the Rescue is partnering with Doobert.com to manage these transport requests to get the animals where they need to go. For longer distances it’s more ideal to have pilots involved, but to plan these requests you need to have a working knowledge of General Aviation airports, how weight & balance works, and how to incorporate volunteer pilots’ needs into the transport request. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll send you information to get up to speed on being a volunteer pilot, or training videos to be a coordinator. If you're interested in being a coordinator we'll get you connected with a Rescue or Shelter to plan the transports. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10703.title: Punch holes in the sky & save animals! - Pilots Wanted! - Yonkers, NY

10703.description: We need animal rescue transport coordinators to help organize rescue transports. So whether you are retired, not able to travel, or just looking for a way to save animals, we need you! Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals around but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Rescues and Shelters use Doobert.com to create their transport requests to get the animals where they need to go, but we need volunteer transport coordinators to help set up and manage the trip. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll connect you with one of our experienced transport coordinator volunteers to set up time to get you trained on the Doobert.com system. When there’s a transport request, we’ll connect you with the requesting organization to help them effectively plan and manage their transport. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10703.title: Do you have a computer and a phone?  You can save animals! - Yonkers, NY

10703.description: We need pilots to help coordinate animal rescue transport flights for other pilots that are transporting animals. So whether you are a current pilot, retired pilot or you lost your medical, we still need you! Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals around but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Rescues and Shelters use Doobert.com to create their transport requests to get the animals where they need to go. For longer distances, it’s more ideal to have pilots involved but to plan these requests you need to have a working knowledge of General Aviation airports, how weight & balance works, and how to incorporate volunteer pilots’ needs into the transport request. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll connect you with one of our experienced transport coordinator volunteers to set up time to get you trained on the Doobert.com system. When there’s a transport flight request we’ll connect you with the requesting organization to help them effectively plan and manage their flight. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10703.title: Are you a pilot?  Then you can save animals! - Yonkers, NY

10701.description: Volunteers should expect to work with several children during each 2 hour session. The children will have selected a book and then be matched up with a volunteer. After introductions the \"buddies\" will find a spot where they can work together for 20 minutes. The volunteer will encourage the student to read, help with specific words, pronunciation and comprehension. When they’ve finished the book the volunteer will help the child complete a worksheet. We give out \"passports\" to every child who registers for Summer Reading Buddies and each child gets a stamp on his passport for each day they attend. The volunteer will then bring the child back to our staff who will match them up with their next \"buddy\". Summer Reading Buddies volunteer opportunties are also available at the Mt Vernon Public Library and the Ossining Public Library. Please contact us for further information. Everyone enjoys this program. Take a look at coverage by WPIX 11: http://www.jcy-wcp.com/summermediacraze.html
10701.title: Summer Reading Buddies

10701.description: Mentor wil develop supportive, consistent mentoring relationship with a child through recreational play and paraprofessional therapeutic techniques. Help children explore and cope with social and/or family struggles. The Reach & Rise program has changes the lives of many young people in Yonkers. We want to continue that trend, but we can not do it without your help. Come and bring a revolutionary change to Yonkers youth and become a mentor today.
10701.title: Volunteer Mentor

As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
10701.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Westchester County NY

10701.description: Are you bi-lingual? Do you love to work with high school students? This program is for you. We need bi-lingual mentors (English/Spanish, English/Portuguese, English/Bengali) for our Introduction to America program. If you can commit to one hour once a week in Yonkers we will pair you up with a newly arrived teenage immigrant. Volunteers meet with their students once or twice a week, accompany them to their ESL class and help them with their converstational skills. This is an opportunity you don't want to miss - changing the life of a young immigrant by helping him succeed in school and a new culture.
10701.title: Bi-Lingual Mentor
