07005.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07005.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07005.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07005.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07005.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07005.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07734.title: Pet Therapy Volunteers for Hospice Patient - Keansburg

07734.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07734.title: Companion Hospice Volunteers - Keansburg

07734.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe, comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers.
07734.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice - Keansburg

07734.description: Ascend Hospice Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients ; mind, body and soul.
07734.title: Hospice Musicians - Keansburg

11691.description: Purpose Lead seniors in weekly arts and crafts activities that allow them to explore their creative side. Responsibilities Prepare weekly arts & crafts lessons for seniors Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills Experience teaching arts & crafts is a must Experience working with seniors is helpful, but not required Comfortable leading individuals with varying ability through activities Patience Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11691.title: Art Instructor - JASA Roy Reuther Senior Center

11691.description: Purpose Regular exercise is an essential part of a healthy lifestyle. Lead a weekly exercise class for seniors at Roy Reuther Senior Center to help keep them in top shape. Responsibilities Lead a group of seniors in a weekly exercise - can be dance, stretching, yoga, zumba and more! Create exercise routines suitable for varied physical abilities Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills Exercise certification Experience leading seniors in exercises Experience with group exercise classes Knowledge of several light exercise techniques Comfortable leading a group of varying skill levels Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11691.title: Fitness Instructor - JASA Roy Reuther Senior Center

08502.description: Want to help, but not interested in becomming an EMT or driver? Although we are 100% volunteer and do not charge for out service as in any small business There are lots of things that need to be done behind the scenes to keep things running smoothly. We would expect our Associate Members to be local as depending on assignment, there would be times you would be expected to come to our building. Do you have a passion or skill you think can assist us? Please let us know. We always would appreciate people to help organize events, maintaining/order our equipment, assist in outreach, maintain the building and/grounds.
08502.title: Associate Member

08502.description: Ambulance Drivers are part of the responce team. In addition to transporting the team, you will assist the EMTs on calls. To become a Driver you must: * Be at least 21 years old * Hold a Valid Drivers License * Complete a background check including an Acceptable Driving Record * Completed a Squad Approved Driver Training Program * Have CPR to the level of Professional Rescuer
08502.title: Ambulance Driver

08502.description: EMT's (Emergency Medical Technitions) are our responders to a 9-1-1 call in Montgomery Township NJ. In an emergency our EMT members respond via by either Ambulance of First Responder to the scene. EMTs have completed a 200 hour training course and have been certified by the NJ Department of Health. As a member we will arrange initial training needed to become an EMT. once trained volunteers must live or work in Montgomery Township, NJ and must be willing to volunteer a shift a week (approximately 12 hours per week), responding to calls in Montgomery Township NJ.
08502.title: Neighbors Helping Neighbors- Become an EMT

07856.description: Hospice volunteers visiting nursing home patients lessen the burden on family members who may be too far away to play an active role in their loved one’s life. With hospice training, you will find that your skill sets are sharpened and new ones emerge. Hospice volunteers are trained in communication skills, family dynamics and how to make a positive difference for patients and their caregivers. After you complete the required orientation, VITAS-trained volunteers are prepared to visit nursing homes and assisted living facilities to provide relief care for caregivers, offer companionship and pampering to the patient, sit vigil, provide love with Paw Pals visits and help in other meaningful ways.
07856.title: Offer Companionship and Pampering to Hospice Facility Patients

07856.description: Can you imagine how awful you'd feel if forced to reuse disposable diapers on your child because you couldn't afford to buy enough? Perhaps you have to save the fresh ones for child care so you can work. Most child care centers won't accept non-toilet-trained children without a supply of diapers. Next month it might be the expense of repairing your car so you can work. Whatever the situation, it's probably something. There's never enough money to go around. And then there's the diaper rash and the crying from discomfort that wears on your nerves and your resolve. And now you're both crying... The CFR Diaper Bank has been helping alleviate this situation for over ten years in Morris County. We are members of the National Diaper Bank Network. We supply 18 partner organizations to distribute diapers to families in need. Our volunteers create awareness of the huge unmet need for diapers, run diaper drives themselves, or support those who do. We can use your help...
07856.title: It's Human Nature...We often take the littlest things for granted

07856.description: We want to reach more people who need child care assistance, advice on special needs children, parenting help, or just wish to volunteer for the Morris Diaper Bank or our Annual Holiday Shop event. Videos can help us expand our reach beyond what we can do personally. We need somebody with expeience (and preferably equipment) that can get us started and train us in effective techniques. We would set up specific times once or twice a month to produce the videos. Our staff would prepare the content and be ready for each session. The videos could be posted as soon as available thereafter via website and social media.
07856.title: Help Us Make Videos!

07652.description: Compassus Hospice offers undergraduate human service and family service internship opportunities throughout Bergen, Passaic, Morris, Essex and Sussex counties. Interns are trained to provide physical, psychosocial, and spiritual support to the hospice patient and family. Interns visit with our patients to provide socialization, companionship, respite care, and helping caregivers with errands. As an integral member of the hospice interdisciplinary team, the intern’s interventions relieve patients’ symptoms of depression and anxiety by offering interactive music, reading to patients, leisure activities and expressive art and writing activities. In addition to patient care, intern’s responsibilities often include volunteer recruitment, program planning and community outreach activities. Our interns work in the office as well as in the field to provide support to both the staff and our patients. To us, hospice care is not about the end of life, it is about inspiring life - making each moment meaningful. Contact us to learn more.
07652.title: Human Service and Family Service Internships

07652.description: Massage Therapy Volunteers, Reiki Volunteers and Alternative therpay volunteers are certified and/or are professionally trained. The volunteer provides comfort and relaxation to our patients and their families. Any of these specialities are a great benefit to our patients. Join our TEAM as a Volunteer. Locations available in Bergen, Passaic, Hudson, Essex, Morris, Union, Warren, Sussex and Hunterdon Counties in NJ. Companion Volunteers Contribute to our patients' quality of life Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Provide Massage therapy, hand rubs, Reiki, or Aromatherapy to patients and families Give your time to someone in need.
07652.title: Massage Therapist, Reiki Trained and/or Alternative Therapy Volunteers Needed

07652.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07652.description: Seeking volunteers to assist with our grant research and fundraising/development department. This is a multifaceted position where you would gain experience in grant research and writing, donor development, planned giving, marketing research, strategic marketing, and general knowledge of fundraising. These skills would allow you to learn the duties and challenges of a non-profit while learning how to expand a marketing and development department. Duties would include: Statistical Research Creating letter and calendar templates Donor Research Social Media Strategic Marketing And much more! Position is: On-going Position is suitable for court-ordered volunteers: No Time of Volunteer Position: Availability during the business day or early evenings, Monday through Friday Number of Volunteers Needed For This Position: Flexible Area of Impact: Health and Wellness, Other (Can Serve As Intern Experience) Skills Required: Telephone skills, computer skills- as mentioned Age Group Served: All Ages
07652.title: Marketing and Fundraising/Development Volunteer or Intern

07652.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07652.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07652.description: Assist with 5-6 major annual fundraisers which generate funds for critical diabetes medications, children’s camp scholarships, education and patient support services. Duties include staffing events, assisting with event planning and post-event activities Data entry, registrations and recordkeeping), obtaining donations and raffle items, and more. There is also room for those interested in creating new fundraisers to do so, as we rely so heavily on these funds to continue our programs and patient assistance.
07652.title: Fundraising and Special Events Volunteer

07652.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07652.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07652.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.
07652.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Paramus

07652.title: Hospice Volunteer

07652.description: Looking for volunteers to attend health fairs & events within the community, organizing and maintaining outreach material, researching health fairs and other relevant events, and providing support to community programs where there is an opportunity to educate the public. The ideal volunteer should possess: Strong communication, interpersonal and organizational skills Compassionate, articulate and patient demeanor Computer proficiency using Microsoft programs Bilingual Spanish skills a plus but not required Community-based, per diem (days, nights or weekends). 1 year commitment. Flexible hours- we will work with your schedule!
07652.title: Outreach and Community Education

07652.description: Seeking volunteers to assist with phone calls in our Patient Support Services Program. These individuals work to connect people living with diabetes that are uninsured or underinsured to long-term prescription assistance programs, medical facilities and ongoing health and wellness resources. Helping patients who have utilized the Foundation’s short-term emergency medical assistance find long-term assistance is critical to ensuring that each patient will not experience a lapse in their diabetes treatment plan. Bilingual English/Spanish proficiency a plus but not required. Experience speaking with patients or customers via phone, and/or familiarity with diabetes is a huge plus, but also not required. Basic computer proficiency and typing skills are required.
07652.title: Patient Support Services

07652.description: Our organization works feverishly to help people in New Jersey with diabetes to obtain affordable medication, education and additional resources so they can live healthier lives. Maintaining patient information, educational resources, spreadsheets, data entry, event data organization, fundraising mailings- these are just some of the things that need to happen everyday to make our office run! We need great people to help us keep the workflow going and to reach as many people in need as possible. If you are comfortable using Microsoft Office, we need you!
07652.title: Love office work? Your skills are needed in a busy diabetes organization!

07652.description: Put your specialized database skills to work for a great cause! The Diabetes Foundation, Inc. is seeking a volunteer with considerable experience using Microsoft Access, great data entry ability, and some spare time to volunteer at our office in Paramus. The Foundation is looking to consolidate the Excel documents of contact information that has been collected over the years and transfer this information into Access. It is a big job that requires time and patience, but when the project is complete, there will be an organized database that will save the staff a lot of time - and headaches! We are a small non-profit dedicated to improving the care and quality of life for people living day to day with diabetes through medical assistance, diabetes education programs, and a campership program. We rely on volunteers like you to help keep our programs moving forward. Please contact us if you think you are the right person for this position by emailing info@diabetesfoundationinc.org. For more information on the Diabetes Foundation, please visit www.diabetesfoundationinc.org
07652.title: Microsoft Access "Whiz"

11042.description: Manage Google Adwords and Search Optimization by optimizing content, ad text, titles and keywords. General summary of duties: Plan, manage, and execute paid search campaigns including strategy development, keyword research, campaign buildout and ongoing optimizations. Track campaign performance at a detailed level and perform weekly analysis to identify successes and shortcomings associated to each account. Apply optimizations based on performance analysis and anticipate how the optimizations will impact account performance. Conduct A/B testing Track results from optimizations made and tweak as necessary to achieve performance goals. Prepare and present reports, providing performance analysis and action plans. Skills & Qualification Proficiency with AdWords Editor 1+ years of Google AdWords experience Experience reaching performance metrics (CTR, CPC, etc.) Google AdWords Certified (preferred) Knowledge of Google Analytics (preferred) Knowledge of Facebook ads (preferred) Experience with WordPress (referred) This description is intended to provide only basic guidelines for meeting job requirements. Responsibilities, knowledge, skills, abilities and working conditions may change as needs evolve.
11042.title: Search Engine Marketing Google Adwords (New Hyde Park)

11042.description: Help edit advice-oriented health and medical pieces on topics related to Addiction, Cancer, HIV/AIDS, Medical Marijuana, Neurology and Sleep Medicine. Editors should be able to review in-depth articles and guide readers on understanding diagnosis, treatment options and more. We are looking for editors to review one to two 800 to 1,100-word pieces a week. Topics are directed towards various audiences including patients and healthcare professionals. Requirements: Ability to edit materials to ensure conformity with established grammar, punctuation, and spelling rules, and adherence to AP and other style guidelines Edit articles of varying complexity (mostly basic, targeting health consumers) and collaborate with writers to ensure accuracy and fact-checking as needed. Help improve clarity, accuracy, format, style, and consistency Samples/Portfolio of prior editing/writing (health writing a plus) Expertise and knowledge of medical conditions Experience editing for a consumer publication a plus Ability to turn in work well within deadlines and set deadlines for others Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s OR 3 years of experience with healthcare communications editing Experience communicating technical information to non-technical audiences Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in life sciences or clinical sciences Bachelor’s Degree in English, journalism, communications or media Advanced Degree in life sciences field Experience as a medical editor/writer Experience as an editor/writer in the biopharmaceutical or pharmaceutical industry Knowledge of evidence-based medicine research techniques and programs Experience generating/editing publications, from blogs to both non-peer-reviewed and peer-reviewed scientific articles Location Depending on the volunteering opportunity, some or all of the volunteering may be done remotely with communication via email and phone rather than in-person.
11042.title: Copy Editor (New Hyde Park)

11042.description: Help write advice-oriented health and medical pieces on topics related to Addiction, Cancer, HIV/AIDS, Medical Marijuana, Neurology and Sleep Medicine. Writers should be able to review in-depth articles and guide readers on understanding diagnosis, treatment options and more. We are looking for one to two 800 to 1,100-word pieces a week. Topics are directed towards various audiences, including patients and healthcare professionals. Requirements: Ability to self-edit and self-check facts, and turn in clean copy that adheres to AP Style guidelines and is devoid of errors and grammatical issues Samples/Portfolio of prior writing (health writing a plus) Expertise and knowledge of medical conditions Experience writing for a consumer publication a plus Ability to turn in work by deadlines set by editor Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s OR 3 years of experience with healthcare communications writing Experience communicating technical information to non-technical audiences Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in life sciences or clinical sciences Bachelor’s Degree in English, journalism, communications or media Advanced Degree in life sciences field Experience as a medical writer Experience as a writer in the biopharmaceutical or pharmaceutical industry Knowledge of evidence-based medicine research techniques and programs Experience generating publications, from blogs to both non-peer-reviewed and peer-reviewed scientific articles Location Depending on the volunteering opportunity, some or all of the volunteering may be done remotely, with communication via email and phone rather than in-person.
11042.title: Writing Staff (New Hyde Park)

11040.description: Parker Jewish Institute’s Comprehensive Community Hospice has been providing highly specialized care to terminally ill patients since 1997 and welcomes volunteers of all ages and backgrounds. Hospice volunteers are a special group of people that use their time and talents to enrich the quality of life for our patients and their families as the end of life approaches. Hospice volunteers enhance the quality of life and help reduce the burden for family caregivers by providing support, assistance, in patient’s homes, in nursing homes, and assisted living facilities. To be a volunteer, there is no special requirement other than a sincere desire to help people and the ability to listen. The most important thing you can do is be there for patients to reassure them they are not alone. It is not an easy undertaking, but it can enrich your life well as patients and families. Hospice volunteers can commit to as little or as much time as they wish. Some volunteers provide several hours of service each week while others commit to a few hours each month. Serving as valued members of the hospice team, for just a few hours of your time you can make a significant impact on the lives of patients and their loved ones. There are many opportunities to share your time and talents as a volunteer and support patients, their loved ones dealing with end of life. Opportunities include: Hospice Doulas Bereavement/Grief Patient Friendly Visits Legacy Projects Administrative Support Community Education Help Recruiting Other Volunteers Note: We ask that those who have recently lost a loved one wait a year before becoming a hospice volunteer. You are welcome to participate in our bereavement programs during this time. All hospice volunteers receive extensive training. Depending the type of volunteering, training is can range from 6-18 hours. All volunteers must complete our new volunteer orientation. Those volunteers who choose to work directly with hospice patients or their loved ones must complete additional hospice specialized training.
11040.title: Hospice Volunteers Needed
11040.org: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care

11040.description: Do you want to give back to our SENIORS? Now here is an opportunity for you to be part of the AmeriCorps caregiving respite program called Willing Hearts, Helpful Hands! To qualify, you will need to: * offer respite and support services to the elderly population * volunteer 1 0-12 hours per week in your community. You will receive in return a: * monthly transportation allowance of $125.00 per month. * qualify for an educational award of $1527.78. Spaces are limited in this program. To find out how you can be a hero, contact us today at 718-289-2100 ext. 4296.
11040.title: Get Paid to Be a Hero!
11040.org: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care

11040.description: Willing Hearts, Helpful Hands community service program of the Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation that recruits and trains volunteers to step in for the family caregivers of someone with Alzheimer’s disease and dementia. Whether you are a friend or a family member, caring for an older adult can be a challenge. There times when caregivers need a break from caregiving. Volunteers converse with their senior, reminisce, read to them, play cards/games, do puzzles, listen to music, etc. Whether you provide companionship, assist in chores, provide telephone or shopping assistance, or offer your own very special talent, you’ll be one of today’s true heroes. The Willing Hearts, Helpful Hands program is designed to allow caregivers the time, personal space and freedom that is essential for healthy living. Plus, eligible volunteers can receive a stipend to help cover travel costs. Be a hero! Volunteer today!
11040.title: Be a Hero - Provide Assistance to the Elderly
11040.org: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care

11040.description: This volunteer opportunity is to visit a wonderful senior in New Hyde Park, Queens who has a wonderful outlook on life, great sense of humor, can speak perfect English but would love to converse in her native czech tongue. An hour during the week is all we ask. If this sounds like the volunteer opportunity for you, please call Suzanne Windland at 718 454-2100. Be the sun for a senior and brighten their day...
11040.title: Czech this out!- Friendly Visiting Volunteer

11040.description: We are looking for guitarists, singers, flutists, violinists to play on our Patient Units. If you have an hour to give you can make a tremendous difference in a patient's stay!
11040.title: Play for our Patients--Musicians

11040.description: Make a difference in a senior's life. Willing Hearts, Helpful Hands is a volunteer-based program which aims to help seniors and their families dealing with Alzheimer's disease or other dementias. We are looking for dedicated volunteers to provide companionship through friendly visits, shopping assistance, check-in calls, and more. We match volunteers to families living on Long Island who could use a 'helpful hand.' Email or call today if you're interested in this unique opportunity to make a difference!
11040.title: Be a Hero, Help a Senior in Your Neighborhood
11040.org: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care

11040.description: At the New Age Skin Research Foundation, a non-profit [501 (C) (3)] organization dedicated to research, education, and advocacy, there are internship opportunities available for students to gain experience in the research and administrative fields. Many of our researchers have gotten into medical and osteopathic schools. Others have gotten into dermatology fellowship programs or have used the research to help their advancement in the sciences. Research internships are available to college-bound or college students, medical students, and post-doctoral fellows. The New Age Research Foundation is currently conducting research studies on various skin conditions lasting anywhere between 2-10 months. We have availabilities in clinical research, website management, and administration. Upon successful completion of the internship, a letter of recommendation will be available for qualified candidates. If significant work is performed, the intern’s name may be published on the abstract, research paper, or other project worked on during the course of the internship.
11040.title: Administrative & Research Internships in Dermatology Research at a Nonprofit Organization

11040.description: If you can give a little time, we need musicians and artists for our Radiation/ Oncology suite. We want to offer some pleasant experiences to the patients and families in an often stressful environment. Strings, classical guitars, woodwinds would be appropriate; expressive art therapy techniques would be appropriate.
11040.title: Talent Wanted!

07076.description: Ascend Hospice is looking for individuals who are willing to share some of their time in bringing a little joy to others who are now at the end of their lives. All of us have gifts to share. Whether it be offering companionship by conversation, holding someone's hand, playing music, reading to them or just making they feel special. We ask you to share an hour a week, more if you are able to provide comfort and caring to those who will provide you with much more than you will ever imagine. Companions may read, reminisce with patients , play music (instrumental) if skilled, just be present with someone and connect with them. Companions can massage hands to provide human contact and relaxation.
07076.title: HOSPICE COMPANION - Scotch Plains

07070.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe, comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers.
07070.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice - Rutherford

07070.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.
07070.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Rutherford

07070.description: Ascend Hospice Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients ; mind, body and soul.
07070.title: Music Therapy for Hospice - Rutherford

07070.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07070.title: Companion Hospice Volunteers - Rutherford

07981.description: Come join us at the Morris County Library to learn about the variety of ways to help plan PurpleStride NJ or to learn more about ways to volunteer on event day. Please note--the event takes place on Sunday, November 12 in Parsippany. This is a pre-event planning and volunteer recruitment meeting.
07981.title: PurpleStride Kick-off planning and volunteer recruitment meeting
07981.org: Pancreatic Cancer Action Network - Northern New Jersey Affiliate

07981.description: Pet therapy is proven to provide therapeutic effects and elicit positive emotions. This is a fun and popular project that is great for your whole family. If you enjoy showing off your pet and spending time with others, then Pet Therapy in Hanover is the project for you. If you own a pet and know your animal can bring joy to everyone, please bring them along to make friends with the residents. Although, pets DO NOT have to be \"certified\", all pets must have proof of an up to date rabies vaccination. Please bring a copy of this certificate to keep on file. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07981.title: Pet Therapy in Hanover

07981.description: Games Galore and More is a team of volunteers who assist the staff of a long-term care senior facility with fun activities while engaging residents in meaningful and friendly conversation, board and card games and reading to the residents. This is a wonderful opportunity to brighten the life of someone who may normally not have the opportunity to connect with others outside of their families and the organization's staff. This is the perfect project for individuals, families, friends and loved ones. Volunteer today and let the games begin! You are welcome to bring you own games or use the Wii gaming system to play the following games: Family Game Night Sports Resort Party Also, calling all musicians who would like to perform informally for the residents. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07981.title: Games Galore and More in Hanover

11710.description: Help others and make a real difference! Long Island Crisis Center (Bellmore, NY) is seeking volunteers for its 24/7 Crisis Intervention & Suicide Prevention hotlines. All you need to start is the desire to help and time to give. You do not need any previous experience. LICC provides a free, comprehensive training program to all volunteers. For more information, please visit our website at longislandcrisiscenter.org/get-involved To schedule your volunteer interview, please call our business line at 516-826-0244 ABOUT LONG ISLAND CRISIS CENTER Long Island Crisis Center provides 24/7, free, high quality, confidential and non-judgmental programs and services to support and empower Long Islanders at critical times in their lives. These include our 24/7 hotlines, our community education workshops, and our Pride for Youth LGBTQ programs.
11710.title: Make a Difference As a Crisis Hotline Volunteer

11714.description: Would prefer someone who is bilingual (English and Spanish), but this is not required. Must have means of transpiration (car, means to access to rail, bus, etc.) The responsibilities would include: Answering phone Screening and transferring phone calls using basic switch board Experience with Microsoft Office (excel, word, outlook 365) Greeting clients and families, needs to be comfortable and friendly. Locking up at end of night (only if we need a volunteer for the late shift) Other requirements: Must be able to multitask and handle high pressure situations, it can get hectic up there Clerical experience (min 1 year) Submit to background check, etc. We are typically looking for someone who would be available to fill in for an hour or so when needed (all staff meetings, when we have events, retreats, etc.) We are usually able to give significant notice, but I would prefer someone with a very flexible schedule who is close enough in proximity to the agency to be able to come in with little notice.
11714.title: Reception

11714.description: Volunteers at the shelter are needed help out in a variety of ways which vary based on individual talents, interests and needs of the program. Anyone volunteering is at the shelter expected to keep the location confidential. Services include but are not limited to: Answer the phone and door. Interaction with clients. Organize and replenish the clothing closet. Outreach for and pickup clothing donations. Food shop and run other errands for the house. Cover for the House Manager when out on break Attending to the daily needs of the clients. Clean, organize and inventory the playroom. Perform other functions as determined between a volunteer and the Coordinator. Hours are 11AM - 3PM. Volunteers will report to the House Coordinator. More than one volunteer may be needed to cover the Monday through Saturday shifts.
11714.title: Shelter Home Volunteer

11714.description: THE TERRY FUND IS LOOKING FOR INDIVIDUALS TO HELP IN OUR WAREHOUSE, OFFICE AND AT PUBLIC EVENTS. WE NEED DRIVERS WHO CAN PICK UP AND DROP OFF NEEDED EMERGENCY GEAR TO FIRST RESPONDERS IN THE NEW YORK METRO AREA. WE NEED YOUNG ADULTS WHO WOULD LIKE TO HELP WITH THE WAREHOUSE AND GIVING OUT GEAR AND EQUIPMENT TO NEEDY FIRST RESPONDERS. WE SEEK VOLUNTEERS WHO CAN DONATE 4 TO 8 HOURS PER MONTH AT OUR BETHPAGE LOCATION OR WHO CAN HELP ON OUR TRAVEL TEAM WHEN WE DO SHOWS ON LONG ISLAND AND ACROSS THE REGION. WE ONLY WANT THOSE WHO KNOW HOW TO HAVE FUN AND KEEP IT LITE. WE LOOK FOR ADMINISTRATIVE HELP IN OUR OFFICE DURING THE DAY OR HELP WITH THE BUILDING INVENTORY ON WEEKENDS. IF YOU HAVE ALWAYS WANTED TO BE INVOLVED WITH THE EMERGENCY SERVICES AND WANT TO HELP GREAT FOLKS CONTACT US AT 516-390-5298 OR LCEGLIO@TERRYFUND.ORG THANK YOU
11714.title: VOLUNTEERS NEEDED TO HELP THOSE WHO HELP OUR COMMUNITIES

11714.description: Volunteers provide oversite of the Child Waiting Room while family members receive agency services. Typically children between the ages of 2 and teen years may be waiting for about an hours while their parent is in a session. Oversight may include reading to smaller children, assisting school age children with homework, playing games and attending to specific needs.
11714.title: Child Waiting Room

11714.description: Volunteers represent The Safe Center at health and/or information fairs located throughout Nassau County to provide information on programs and services, as well as information on domestic violence, child abuse and neglect, dating violence, sexual assault and elder abuse. Volunteers work with the agency's Education Department to advance the cause against family violence through awareness and education.
11714.title: Community Outreach

11714.description: Volunteers Needed to Work with Victims of Rape, Sexual Assault and/or Domestic Violence The Safe Center LI (TSCLI) provides resources for victims of rape, sexual assault and/or domestic violence at all the Nassau County Hospitals. TSCLI connects victims to advocates through the SAFER Program (Survivors Advocate For Emergency Response). This program makes it possible for trained volunteers to provide support and advocacy for victims in hospitals. TSCLI is looking for volunteers to be on-call and respond to the hospitals in Nassau County for victims of rape, sexual assault and/or domestic violence. Intense training is required and will be provided by TSCLI. For more information on becoming a SAFER volunteer please call 516-465-4700 and ask for the Education Department.
11714.title: Hospital Advocacy (SAFER Volunteer: Survivors Advocate for Emergency Response)

11714.description: THE TERRY FUND IS A ALL VOLUNTEER FORCE OF INDIVIDUALS WHO SEEK VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST AT TRADE SHOWS AND FESTIVALS, DRIVE OUR TRUCKS IN PARADES AND ASSIST WITH OUR SURPLUS GEAR PROGRAM WHICH BRINGS NEEDED FIRE SERVICE GEAR AND EQUIPMENT TO RURAL AND NEEDY DEPARTMENTS. WE ARE LOOKING FOR INDIVIDUALS INTERESTED IN WORKING WITH THE EMERGENCY SERVICES COMMUNITY WHO CAN DONATE 4 TO 8 HOURS PER MONTH. WE HAVE A JOB FOR EVERYONE FROM WORKING IN OUR OFFICE OR WAREHOUSE, DRIVING AND PICKING UP GEAR TO WORKING SHOWS AND EVENTS WE ATTEND. WE TRY TO MAKE IT FUN AND NOT WORK AND YOU MEET SOME OF THE BEST FOLKS IN THE WORLD FROM THE FIRST RESPONDER COMMUNITY. WE KEEP IT FUN AND YOU MEET SOME GREAT PEOPLE. WWW.TERRFUND.ORG 631-846-2742 OR EMAIL amtucker@TERRYFUND.ORG
11714.title: HELP US TO HELP THOSE WHO SERVE OUR COMMUNITIES

10065.description: We are seeking professionals from all industries to be part of the City Tutors mentorship program. As a mentor, you would be connected to one, or more City Tutor, who provides tutoring support to programs across Bronx, Manhattan and Brooklyn. Mentors help tutors with the following: career exploration/discovery, professional etiquette expectations, job/internship search strategies, and preparation for professional/academic opportunities. Mentors also coordinate with the on-campus professional development team. This is a 4-6 months commitment. At a minimum mentors are required to: meet with the tutor at least once every 8 weeks have a phone or virtual conference every 4 weeks City Tutors is a volunteer tutoring organization that leverages the incredible academic talent and enthusiasm to serve within the tri-state area to enhance and expand academic support for programs on CUNY campuses and in the surrounding communities in an effort to support increasing retention and graduation of New York City students across all academic levels. We provide tutoring support to the following spaces: CCNY College Now CCNY Colin Powell School for Civic and Global Leadership CCNY Black Male Initative CCNY Biology Department CCNY English Department CCNY Urban Scholars CCNY Continuing Professional Studies Department Youth Action Youth Build Sugar Hill Communities Childrens Aid Society Community Health Academy High School New Partners Include: Harlem RBI, City Tech's Adult Education Program, South Bronx Charter
10065.title: Professional Development Mentor

10065.description: Help your community to stop food waste and fight hunger by bringing excess food to homeless shelters. You will be taking bags of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. This is a great opportunity to gain community service experience while helping others at the same time!!!! Please sign up for events directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10065.title: Stop Food Waste & Help Feed The Hungry!

10065.description: Help your community to stop food waste and fight hunger by bringing excess food to homeless shelters. You will be taking bags of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. This is a great opportunity to gain community service experience while helping others at the same time!!!! Please sign up for events directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10065.title: Stop Food Waste and Feed the Hungry!!!!!!!!

10065.description: The City Tutors is seeking an individual who will support the communications unit of The City Tutors for the Summer of 2017. Note: Much of the work can be done virtually with some visits to campus. Goals: promote The City Tutors brand, allowing us to reach more prospective tutors and partners profile current and past City Tutors to help build stronger ties between tutors develop original content that grows our social media audience educate on and promote issues that we are tackling through our programs We are seeking someone who is in NYC to Write stories about CT that will be featured on our Facebook and website Create a newsletter covering events from summer and the fall semester Interview tutors for a \"Spotlight on a Tutor\" series Collaborate with our nascent Hunter chapter as they develop coherent marketing strategies Promote our partnerships with different educational sites Update website, and run our Twitter feed
10065.title: Summer 2017 Marketing/Communications Intern

10065.description: The City Tutors (CT) is working with College Now to support students in their Saturday Human Biology course for the Fall semester of 2017. We are currently looking for two embedded tutors to support two sections of this course. This is a great opportunity for a student studying science education or interested in tutoring science. In this role, you would work collaboratively with an instructor to improve students’ performance, while being supported and guided by an experienced academic support professional. As a tutor for the biology course in College Now, you would commit to three hours on Saturday, broken down as the last two hours of the 9-1:20PM course with the possibility of an extra hour after class. You would identify and support students who are struggling, participate during the lecture to support the class on the whole, and provide feedback to the instructor regarding students' concerns and difficulties that can lead to changes in future lessons. You might also design assignments, identify/track students who are struggling and create for them differentiated instruction. CT's embedded tutoring program has been successful in helping students gain access to support that they otherwise could not receive given their limited availability to be on campus Saturdays. Having a tutor in the class early in the semester will allow us to push to reduce withdrawals and student failure rates. Your work would not only help the class, but help us improve this model so that we can expand it across all the courses within College Now, and across departments where appropriate as well. To apply, you must: have received an A- or A in introduction to biology have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have completed a degree in biology/other natural sciences submit biweekly reports, and meet through Google Hangout/in person with the director on a biweekly basis. be willing to complete 10 hours of College Reading and Learning Aligned (CRLA) training. Training days will be determined based on your schedule and that of the Tutor Training Coordinators.
10065.title: Fall 2017 Saturday Biology Classroom Tutor for College Now

10065.description: The City Tutors seeks an individual who could come in once or twice a week for 5-7 hours to assist tutors with their professional development. This opportunity should be of particular interest to individuals desiring to enter career counseling, human resources or social work as a profession. Job Description: Assist tutors with resume and cover letter development, applications for scholarships/fellowships/graduate programs, personal statements, interviewing preparation Work closely with a licensed social work to create professional action plans for tutors. Maintain accurate case notes at all times Schedule appointments Occasionally participate in new tutor training classes and other events as supporting staff
10065.title: Professional Development Coach

10065.description: Every year, hundreds of students visit the MVHMG to learn about the history of New York City. Volunteer educators facilitate our classes that are developmentally appropriate for each age group and allow children to learn about social history during the 1820s and 30s, a time of important changes and growth for the city. Topics include immigration, urbanization, industrialization, diversity, and changing technology. While we provide training, we ask that educators have previous experience working with children. MVHMG volunteers need to be dependable, flexible, and have a sense of humor. They should be able to stand for periods of time and be able to walk up stairs. After training, volunteers need to teach at least three days a month for at least a year. Volunteers need email and internet access. Benefits: Training in interactive, informal teaching skills; complimentary admission to many NYC museums via Museum ID card; museum shop discount; and the opportunity to work with people interested in historic sites, teaching, and children's learning. The Mount Vernon Hotel Museum & Garden (MVHMG) preserves and interprets travel, leisure, work and play in diverse antebellum New York. The Museum shares and promotes historical knowledge for the education and enjoyment of the public through engaging interpretation and programs. The Museum presents its 1799 building and grounds as the Mount Vernon Hotel, which served day customers and travelers from 1826 to 1833.
10065.title: Volunteer Educator

10065.description: The City Tutors (thecitytutors.com) seeks individuals to fill key administrative positions across the organization. We are currently seeking: Professional Case Managers (should be interested or have a background in social work/professional development) Marketing Agents (outgoing and proactive!) Videographer (need to know Final Cut Pro, and own your own camera)
10065.title: Administrative position available. We will tailor to your interests and goals!

08873.description: Stein Hospice needs a Special Delivery Volunteer who will call our home based hospice patients and familes weekly and deliver soup provided through our Chicken Soup Project. Calls can be made in our office or from home. Once a soup order is taken, the volunteer schedules a delivery time convenient to the volunteer and patient. Volunteer must have a good clear phone voice, an active driver's license and a willingness to listen compassionately to others.
08873.title: Special Delivery Volunteer Needed for Stein Hospice

08873.description: Parker Home is a non-profit senior service organization, serving elders throughout the central Jersey area for over 100 years. Parker at McCarrick, is a Nursing Care and Post-Acute Rehabilitation Residence for elders in Somerset, NJ. We are seeking volunteers to assist with a variety of activities in the home such as assistance with meals in the dining rooms filing paperwork, resident activities, individual visits and more! If you are interested, please respond and fill out our volunteer application at: http://www.parkerlife.org/about-us/volunteers/volunteer-application
08873.title: Nursing Home in Somerset Seeking Volunteers!

08873.title: musician Hospice Volunteers - Franklin Township

08873.description: My name is Zachary Hill and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a non-profit educational organization that assists families with hosting international students. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are rewarded with a generous monthly stipend. A 1099 is availiable for tax purposes. Our International students need . . . -A private bedroom (not in the basement please) and a shared or private bathroom in a safe and clean environment. -Breakfast and dinner during the week. (The student would buy their lunch at school) and 3 meals during the weekend. (Most international students like to share meals with their American hosts every day. They benefit from speaking English in relaxed, natural situations outside of their English courses. ) http://www.anbeducation.com/

08873.description: If you have a passion for cooking and enjoy seeing the fruits of your labor, then Cooking Creations in Somerset County is the project for you. Midland Adult Services (MAS) was established to provide high quality community housing, job training and placement services, as well as social and recreational experiences to support and enrich the lives of adults with special needs. Volunteers are needed to help cook, prepare and serve a meal for approximately 15 residents. Note: The goal is to educate residents with special needs how to prepare healthy and easy to make meals. Please email the Project Coordinator (Opportunity Leader) for more information. Its the Project Coordinator who sets the menu a week in advance. This project is best suited for adult volunteers. Thank you! NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
08873.title: Cooking Creations in Somerset County

08873.description: Homeside Hospice is looking for volunteers to provide Music Therapy to our patients in assisted living and in nursing homes in Somerset County. If you are a Music Therapist, you can provide a loving experience for patients in lifes final journey. As a volunteer you will provide essential, quality of life services to patients. Your efforts will provide the sort of care and help that a loving friend provides and help insure that the Hospice promise is fulfilled. Music Therapy Students Welcome!
08873.title: Music Therapy Volunteers needed in Somerset County

08873.description: The Franklin Food Bank has partnered with Somerset County Master Gardeners to run a Community Farm Program on Canal Road. The 1 acre farm located in Franklin Twp.(not at the Food Bank warehouse location) is planted with vegetables that are then harvested to provide fresh, local produce to our food bank clients. We are looking for volunteers to help plant, maintain and harvest! Volunteers from schools, civic groups, businesses, as well as families and individuals of all ages are welcome. Youth volunteers 17 and under are welcome if they are accompanied by an adult. The program runs from June to October. Activities include planting, weeding and harvesting. There are usually volunteer opportunities mornings and afternoons 2-3 times a week Monday-Saturday. Gardening experience is welcome, but not necessary. Once you sign up a volunteer coodinator will be in contact with specific details including the location of the farm, dates and times.
08873.title: Franklin Food Bank Community Farm

08873.description: My name is Michelle and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a Non-Profit Organization looking for willing host families in your area. We wanted to reach out with this opportunity to host an international exchange student in your local community. Every year thousands of host families across the United States welcome International Exchange Students, AnB Education is grateful to be working with hundreds of host families across the country. An exchange student not only attends school, but becomes immersed in our world. Host families welcome a new sons, daughters, sisters and brothers from across the world. To us Host Families, you, are an essential part of helping create a better world! Through the personal relationships, language and cultural immersion we can help teach tomorrow’s leaders today. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are supported with a generous monthly reimbursement. Also, if you recommend a family to host, and A student is placed with the family we will send you a thank you of $200. http://www.anbeducation.com/
08873.title: Host Family Needed!

08873.description: My name is Katie and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a Non-Profit Organization looking for willing host families in your area. We wanted to reach out with this opportunity to host an international exchange student in your local community. Every year thousands of host families across the United States welcome International Exchange Students, AnB Education is grateful to be working with hundreds of host families across the country. An exchange student not only attends school, but becomes immersed in our world. Host families welcome a new sons, daughters, sisters and brothers from across the world. To us Host Families, you, are an essential part of helping create a better world! Through the personal relationships, language and cultural immersion we can help teach tomorrow’s leaders today. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are supported with a monthly reimbursement. Our International students need . . . -A caring and friendly host family who is willing to provide quiet space for studying, access to TV and internet, and access to laundry facilities. -A private bedroom (not in the basement please) and a shared or private bathroom in a safe and clean environment. -Breakfast and dinner meals with host family during the week. (The student would buy their lunch at school) and 3 meals during the weekend. (Most international students like to share meals with their American hosts every day. They benefit from speaking English in relaxed, natural situations outside of their English courses. ) http://www.anbeducation.com/become-a-host-family.html
08873.title: Help Change the Life of an International Student- Become a Host Family

08873.description: Stein Hospice is dedicated to bringing professional comfort care to terminally ill patients and their families. Even after the death of a patient, our team of social workers, chaplains and volunteers support the family and caregivers during their bereavement. We are looking for a trained social worker or psychologist, social work or psychology student who is interested in volunteering to make follow up bereavement calls to grieving family members. Your concern, support and objective listening skills can help people find their way through their loss. We could also use a computer savvy person to help maintain our database of bereaved loved ones and update on a regular basis.
08873.title: Volunteer, Student or Professional, Social Work or Psychology Background Needed

08873.description: Stein Hospice provides expert comfort care at home and in facilities to patients who are in the last few months or weeks of their lives. Comfort includes supporting the patient with the things they love, whether music, flowers, art, good conversation or simple volunteer compansionship. Right now Stein Hospice is looking for pet therapy trained dog and owner teams who are willing to learn about hospice and visit our patients at home and/or in facilities. Please contact us to learn more about the good work you can do and the smiles you can bring to a homebound, bedbound or chairbound patient.
08873.title: Pet Therapy Teams Needed!  Dog loving hospice patients would love a visit from you!

08873.description: Your role as a \"NJO Coach\" is critical to the success of our oratorical and reading literacy program. You are responsible for preparing our Orators to have confidence in themselves when speaking and writing. They learn from you skills and techniques of public speaking and reading/writing literacy and demonstrate them at competitions and community presentations. We train all our NJO Coaches. Responsibilities: Meet with students on a weekly basis to train them on developing public speaking and literacy skills. Register and track students in that chapter. Prepare them for community presentations and attendance at two annual statewide competitions.
08873.title: NJO Coach

08873.description: Your role as a \"NJO Judge\" is critical to the success of our oratorical and reading literacy program. You are responsible for providing independent, unbiased critiques to our Orator students who have demonstrated to you at competition their public speaking skills. We train all our NJO Judges. Responsibilities: Provide written critiques on the performances of students' presentations at the NJO competitions. As an independent Judge trained in our program, NJO Judges attend 4 competitions a year and provide objective feedback to Coaches, Orators, and parents about the Orator's performance and grasp of oratorical skills.
08873.title: NJO Judge

08873.description: Stein Hospice is looking for caring volunteers to visit with our terminally ill patients. As a caring companion you can bring a cheerful change in a dreary day. Your visit will also help relieve stressed family members and caregivers. Bring your compassionate nature into the lives of others and make a difference!
08873.title: Are you compassionate? Become a Stein Hospice Volunteer and make a difference!

08873.description: Bereavement phone calls are made from our office to check in on husbands and wives, children and friends of our deceased hospice patients. They require tender attention and are appreciative of the calls to check in on them and see how they are during their grieving. Scripted questions will be provided to assist you. Our social worker and chaplain will help train you.
08873.title: Are you calm and compassionate? Have a good phone voice? Become a support to a bereaved person.

08873.description: Are you compassionate, a good listener, comfortable with older people? If yes, Martin and Edith Stein Hospice is looking for you. Join our team of trained volunteers, nurse case managers, social worker, chaplain and aides. Offer non-medical support to patients and their families by becoming a regular friendly visitor. We are a faith based nonprofit hospice caring for patients throughout southern Union, Middlesex, Somerset and northern Monmouth counties.
08873.title: Bring a smile to a senior!  Become a hospice companion.

08873.description: Do you want to make a difference in someone's day? Martin and Edith Stein Hospice gives loving attention and professional care to terminally ill patients. We need compassionate volunteers to offer nonmedical one-on-one visits to our patients. If you can read aloud, listen sympathetically or simply hold a hand you can bring comfort into our patients' lives. Join our caring team of nurses, aides, social worker, chaplain, doctors and other amazing volunteers and help improve the quality of life for hospice patients and their families.
08873.title: Hospice Patient Companion

08873.description: Your role as a \"NJO Coach\" is critical to the success of our oratorical and reading literacy program. You are responsible for preparing Orator students in chapter locations to have confidence at all times when speaking or writing. We train all our NJO Coaches. They learn from you the skills and techniques of public speaking and writing literacy. Responsibilities: Meet with students on a weekly basis to train them on developing public speaking and literacy skills. Register and track students at an assigned chapter. Prepare students for community presentations and attendance at two annual statewide competitions with their peers.
08873.title: Teach confidence in speaking. Become a NJO Coach

08873.description: New people to join a dedicated core group who provide Basic Life Support ambulance service.
08873.title: Emergency Medical Technician

08875.description: Help us, Help our Neighbors! With the increased demand for our services in the past few years, we need your help more than ever! We have many volunteer opportunities available to suit individuals, families, and even large corporate groups. Whether you are looking to give back to your community or just have a few hours and would like to do something productive, the Franklin Food Bank has a volunteer opportunity for you. Volunteers assist with sorting, packaging, and distribution of food. Most jobs needed must be able to lift up to 15lbs and be comfortable standing during their shift. Volunteers are needed for 2-3 hours Monday-Thursday from the hours of 9am-3pm.
08875.title: Help us provide food to those in need in Franklin Township

08875.description: The Franklin Food Bank needs your help! This is an excellent opportunity for a college student 21 years old or older looking to give back to the community while home for the summer! We are currently looking for a volunteer driver to assist with pick ups and deliveries Monday,Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday from the hours of 9am-3pm. We provide a Franklin Food Bank van. Volunteer shifts for drivers are 9am-Noon and/or Noon-3pm. If you are avaialble on one or all of these days each week and would like to help the Food Bank plesae contact us today. Volunteers for this opportunity must be able to lift 50+pounds. Volunteers must be over the age of 21 to drive a Franklin Food Bank Van. A valid driver's license is required. Tasks/Duties -Pick ups from various local business -Assist in loading and unloading vans -Assist in stocking shelves and sorting donation
08875.title: Volunteer Driver helping those in need!

08876.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE The Fiscal Reviewer is part of a team of about 8 people who review each of the cases opened for clients after a fire. Normally it takes only a few minutes to check each case and certify that it meets the requirements for financial assistance; however, there are times the Team Member must get in contact with the Manager in charge of the county where the fire was, to get information corrected before the case can be passed through. OPEN TIME DAYS There are four 3 hour shifts each day, Monday through Friday; however, you don’t have to be available during the full hours, unless we are trying to meet a deadline. Shifts needed now are 9 to noon and/or noon to 3. REQUIRED TRAINING Disaster Cycle Services: An Overview Recovery Services: An Overview Direct Client Assistance Fundamentals Casework & Recovery Planning Fundamentals Meet the Client: What is a Family? Two Youtube videos (optional): Creating a Case and Recovery Planning Familiarization with a  job tool : ｠Fiscal Review Job Tool After you’ve finished the training, you will work with the Team Manager one on one to make sure you understand the whole process.｠ Once you are comfortable, you can take a couple shifts, always being able to communicate with the Manager if you have｠questions. ｠｠

Meet the immediate needs of disaster clients such as food, clothing, shelter and other services which may be needed. OPEN TIME DAYS Actively sign up for on-call shifts each month. ｠Choose your availability, three shifts per month minimum. 08876.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE The American Red Cross Disaster Cycle Services (DCS) is launching the Home Fire Preparedness Campaign (HFPC) in October 2014. Its goal is to reduce the rate of deaths and injuries due to home fires by 25 percent over 5 years. Its strategy includes participating in a community coalition that targets neighborhoods at-risk for home fires; installs and tests smoke alarms; and provides fire safety and disaster preparedness education/planning. This position exists primarily to appropriately install new smoke alarms or batteries in working smoke alarms and to test them. It is part of a smoke alarm home visit team. OPEN TIME DAYS - 5-10 hours per weekend, once a quarter on average - Weekdays REQUIRED TRAINING American Red Cross Volunteer Orientation Disaster Services: An Overview Home Fire Preparedness Campaign Guidance and Training: Safety for Home Visists, Smoke Alarm Installation , and other required training.
