10016.description: 80% of our volunteer force is made up of women. Without them, our volunteer program would not exist. Starting this year, we want to make special effort for our kids to see more male role models when they come to our Reading Parties. With Pajama Program, you will make a positive difference in your community and in a child's life. During our 70 minute Reading Parties, you will provide a child in need with the one on one story time that they rarely experience. We invite volunteers (18 or older), who have completed our volunteer application and passed our background check, to share their love of reading with the children we serve in NYC. Our Reading Parties begin with circle time introductions and then we dive into reading in pairs or small groups. During the Reading Party, the children receive a snack, a new book of their choice, and a new pair of pajamas. The age range of the children is from 4-12 years old. Reading Parties last about an hour and run throughout the year during business hours from Tuesday-Friday. How to Apply: You must fill out our volunteer application and sign up for your background check. Please email Najamah Abdullah at najamah@pajamaprogram.org to receive the appropriate links. Please know that ALL volunteers must pass the background check and fill out the volunteer application to be able to attend the Reading Parties. All personal information will be kept confidential. Please check out Pajama Program's website or email Najamah Abdullah at najamah@pajamaprogram.org to learn more about volunteer opportunities. Thank you for your interest!
10016.title: Be a Male Role Model for Children in Need!

10016.description: City Harvest offers volunteer-taught nutrition education courses for people of all ages across NYC. Our programs, including cooking demonstrations and classes, teach participants how to prepare healthy, delicious meals on a budget. Volunteers will receive a 3-hour training to prepare you to teach good nutrition and healthy cooking skills. No prior certification or professional experience is required - just an interest in cooking and healthy eating! Lend your skills and help New Yorkers live a healthier lifestyle.
10016.title: Cook for Good!

10016.description: When City Harvest was founded in 1982, it was run entirely by volunteers who connected a handful of neighborhood restaurants to food programs serving those in need. Now, more than 30 years later, City Harvest volunteers remain a critical part of our food rescue operations and our comprehensive Healthy Neighborhoods programming. Whether you are a member of your company’s volunteer team at Mobile Markets, teach one of our nutrition education courses, or help with mailings and data entry in the office - your time and passion are important resources in the fight against hunger. We offer a wide variety of individual and group volunteer opportunities - including our Nutrition Education Program, Mobile Markets, Greenmarket Rescues, Corporate Repacks, Office Projects, and Food Drives. If you haven't volunteered with us before, please sign up for one of our New Volunteer Orientations held bi-monthly at our NYC office.
10016.title: Volunteer with City Harvest!

10016.description: With Pajama Program, you will make a positive difference in your community and in a child's life. During our 70 minute Reading Parties, you will provide a child in need with the one on one story time that they rarely experience. We invite volunteers (18 or older) from a range of diverse backgrounds and ethnicities, who have completed our volunteer application and passed our background check, to share their love of reading with the children we serve in NYC. Our Reading Parties begin with circle time introductions and then we begin reading in pairs (1 child to 1 adult) or small groups. During the Reading Party, the children receive a snack, a new book of their choice, and a new pair of pajamas. The age range of the children is from 4-12 years old. Reading Parties last about an hour and run throughout the year during from Tuesday-Friday at 11 am - 12 pm. How to Apply: You must fill out our volunteer application and sign up for your background check. Please email Najamah at najamah@pajamaprogram.org to receive the appropriate links. Please know that ALL volunteers must pass the background check and fill out the volunteer application to be able to attend the Reading Parties. All personal information will be kept confidential. Please check out Pajama Program's website or email Najamah at najamah@pajamaprogram.org to learn more about volunteer opportunities. Thank you for your interest! http://pajamaprogram.org/
10016.title: Make a Child Smile through Reading at our NYC Reading Center!

10016.description: English in Action (EiA) and Andrew Romay New Immigrant Center (ARNIC), programs of the English-Speaking Union of the United States, match non-native speakers with American volunteers for one-to-one conversation practice. EiA and ARNIC are always looking for friendly new tutors. As an EiA/ARNIC Volunteer you will make a difference in your community, meet new people, share your culture and experiences, and learn about other cultures. Volunteers need no formal training, just an interest in other languages and cultures and the willingness to befriend a newcomer. Time commitment: minimum 2 hours per week. Volunteer leadership positions available. English in Action may mean the beginning of a lifelong interest in a particular area of the world, or even a deeper understanding of one's own culture.
10016.title: English Conversation Tutors needed!
10016.org: The English-Speaking Union of the United States

10016.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
10016.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate New York City NY

10016.description: Do you have a curiosity about global affairs? Lead a U.S. foreign policy discussion group today! For over 55 years, the Foreign Policy Association's Great Decisions program has brought together people and communities to encourage individuals to engage in the world around them and to think critically about the global issues facing policymakers. Each year, FPA produces the Great Decisions briefing book, examining eight U.S. foreign policy and global affairs topics. All across the U.S., discussion groups meet to consider and discuss these topics, constituting the largest civil-education network in the country. Discussion group leaders organize and lead these meetings in their communities. Become a group leader now!
10016.title: Lead a global affairs discussion group today!!

10016.title: Want to Volunteer in NYC? We Can Help You Find the Perfect Volunteer Job!

10016.description: MAKE A DIFFERENCE! VOLUNTEER! Want to Volunteer? Need help getting started? Come in for a free and personal one-on-one interview to help find the right match for you! The Volunteer Referral Center has opportunities at over 300 non-profit agencies in New York City, ranging from social services organizations, advocacy work, and children's agencies to theater groups and museums. VRC has been serving the NYC community for 28 years and is a great place to learn about a wide range of volunteer needs. Call 212-889-4805 for an interview or sign up online at http://volunteer-referral.com/ready-to-volunteer-in-nyc-lets-go/. (Note: Interviews are free of charge and by appointment only.)
10016.title: Volunteer Referral Service

11236.description: WeThrive is an entrepreneurial mentoring program that pairs college students with middle school students at local schools nearby. Youth participants will create ventures of their own and earn real revenues. Currently, we are looking for college students in the Brooklyn area who are passionate about driving social change to mentor youth at a local middle school. If interested, please click on this link to fill out our interest form https://wethrive.typeform.com/to/N9XYE1. We will be in touch shortly! You can also send an email to tally@teamwethrive.org
11236.title: Are you a college student? Do you love driving social impact?  Become a mentor to local youth!

10014.description: The National Parks Conservation Association's (NPCA) Northeast office is seeking volunteers to join the NPCA staff in tabling in Christopher Park to increase awareness regarding Stonewall National Monument. This summer, volunteers will be tabling near the Stonewall Inn in Christopher Park to answer questions and provide more information to the public about the recently designated Stonewall National Monument in Greenwich Village, the first National Park Service (NPS) site dedicated to LGBT history and the site of the 1969 uprisings that sparked the modern LGBT civil rights movement. Through the end of August, we plan to reach hundreds of visitors at tables located around Stonewall from 3-6pm on weekdays and 12-6pm on weekends. Engage with the public and help us celebrate the upcoming one-year anniversary of Stonewall's National Monument designation! Responsibilities: Talk to passers-by and share the story of Stonewall Discuss the recent designation of the Stonewall National Monument, and provide answers to basic questions Get feedback from visitors about their ideas for the future of Stonewall National Monument Maintain sign-up list for people interested in getting on the park's mailing list Direct the public to a website where they can learn more Set up and break down tabling materials Requirements: Be friendly and outgoing, ready to engage the public Interest in LGBT rights Available for 2 or 3 hour shifts Enjoy being outside Ability to lift table and chairs
10014.title: Stonewall National Monument Volunteers

10014.description: JOIN HUDSON RIVER PARK’S HRPGreenTeam Gain meaningful experience working with like-minded individuals looking to beautify and maintain Hudson River Park’s picturesque waterside landscape! This volunteer program is an exciting opportunity for community members to nurture their inner green thumb alongside their neighbors while improving public green space. Members of the HRPGreenTeam will work with our seasoned horticulture staff and participate in landscape enhancement activities including planting, weeding, pruning, mulching, trimming of ornamental grasses, addition of soil amendments, cleaning of vegetation beds, and other general gardening tasks. When: One Saturday of every month from March-October; 10AM-1PM March 25th April 15th May6th June 3rd June 17th July 15th July 29th August 12th August 26th September 9th October 21st November 18th What we provide: Safety and horticulture training, tools and equipment, Hudson River Park Volunteer T-Shirt, water, snacks, FUN! Can’t commit to all of our events? No problem! RSVP to any or all of the Green Team volunteer days. Locations and activities will vary each month, and volunteers will get to experience the Park from a whole new perspective throughout the seasons. Space is limited, so RSVP today to volunteer@fohrp.org or call for more information (347-515-2242)
10014.title: HRP GreenTeam at Hudson River Park!

10014.description: Kirschenbaum Productions is an Emmy award-winning boutique production company. We are storytellers whose work focuses on people, and have been featured widely in the media. We have just released a feature documentary called LOOK AT US NOW, MOTHER! The mission of this film is to help others who are suffering due to childhood abuse. We are seeking a smart, ambitious, responsible volunteer who is eager to learn and join our highly creative team. This person will work directly under a producer who is a thought leader/speaker while we continue independent distribution and build our movement which is focused on healing and forgiveness between mothers and daughters. They will be exposed to several areas of outreach and audience engagement including strategy and planning. An ideal candidate has excellent organizational and verbal and written skills, and detail oriented. Must be able to work in a fast paced environment. Responsibilities include research, outreach, and helping to plan community events. Should be able to work effectively remotely and on site. Must have own laptop, mac preferred. Responsibilities include: Assisting in relationship building with partner organizations Learning and helping to book and manage events/event calendar Connect with the community via social media Assisting in managing administrative work and details Assisting in handling deliverables for screenings and distribution If you are interested, please email your resume, cover letter, and 2 references. There is opportunity for growth leading to a paid position. Although we indicated this volunteer opportunity is virtual we are happy to have the person work on location also.
10014.title: Assist Producer/Thought leader on Forgiveness Documentary and Movement

10014.description: Participants of the Compost Ambassador Program are the public face of our Compost Drop-off sites located throughout Hudson River Park. Compost Ambassadors help to educate the public and raise awareness of our 2017 compost initiatives, providing helpful information about how Park patrons can get involved and further benefit their local community.
10014.title: Compost Ambassador

10014.description: This opportunity is available daily from 9:10 PM-9:40 PM! Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a nonprofit food rescue organization dedicated to reducing food waste and feeding the hungry. We are currently looking for Lead Rescuers to join our leadership team. A Lead Rescuer is a passionate and dedicated volunteer who commits to leading one event, once per week, the same evert every week. Training is provided. Help rescue healthy roasted vegetables and protein that would have been thrown away and bring it to a nearby homeless shelter to feet those who need it the most! This opportunity is available in both Midtown East and the Village. Heavyweight: the average amount of food is a total of 60 1bs
10014.title: Weekly Volunteer Needed for 9:10PM-9:40PM Food Rescue Events!

10014.description: Hudson River Park’s Neighborhood Gardener Volunteers are instrumental to the Park community, contributing vital support, time, and efforts to maintain our 4-mile footprint. Neighborhood Gardener Volunteers work alongside trained horticulture staff on weekdays to cultivate their green thumbs through fun tasks such as planting, pruning, weeding, mulching and more while learning about the flora and fauna of the West Side’s \"backyard.\" With the Hudson River and the impressive cityscape as a backdrop, volunteers gain an immersive experience into the Park’s history, goals, and beautification and preservation efforts. Opportunities are available weekday mornings (9:00-12:00) from April through November, and regular orientations and trainings are held to provide a comprehensive overview of our organization, build skills and techniques, and train new volunteers to the program. No experience is necessary- everyone from beginners to garden enthusiasts are welcome!
10014.title: Volunteer Neighborhood Gardener

10014.description: No Walkathon is currently scheduled and we seek someone with skill and interest to do substantial leadership work in organizing one. IMPORTANT: For most activities, we require at least a year of experience - and several years for some activities. Except for those with high level, professional skills, we ask most volunteers to average at least 15 hours a week. Some exceptions to these guidelines are possible. You can speak with us about this before you come in. If possible, please include your resume.
10014.title: The End Poverty Walkathon

11568.description: We are looking for a caring, compassionate and dedicated volunteer to spend time with someone living in one of group homes. We are looking for someone who enjoys arts and crafts, puzzles, card games and is interested in getting to know one of the wonderful people whom we serve. The commitment would be once a week for an hour or two in the evening (after 5pm) to give this deserving individual something to look forward to every week. Applicants would have to complete an orientation training, be screened for tuberculosis and have a full criminal background check completed. Help us to continue our mission of improving the lives of the people whom we serve.
11568.title: Get To Know Someone Special

08840.description: Growing nonprofit needs volunteers to help develop and assist Executive Director with various duties. Help includes soliciting donations, distributing materials to local businesses, devleloping community partnerships, help with events, etc.
08840.title: Development Assistant

08844.description: Our cancer charity need an experienced, super creative, graphic artist to design flyers and t-shirts for our up coming events.
08844.title: Graphic Artist

08844.description: The signature fundraising event of Community Options, Cupid's Chase, is an annual 5K run on Valentine's Day weekend in more than 35 locations across the country. While its purpose is serious - raising funds to better the lives of individuals with disabilities through employment and housing supports - the race itself is fun and whimsical. Registrants identify themselves as either looking for love (Available) or already in love (Unavailable.) Some runners get really into Cupid character - we've seen many a pink tutu on the course. Our volunteer committee is crucial to the success of the race - without volunteers, we simply would not have the ability to hold this great event. Whether you have an hour a week to spare or lots of time on your hands, have some background in either race (or walk) planning or participation, we need YOU! Please help us improve the day to day lives of the individuals we serve and have some fun, too. Looking for people with strengths in the following areas: event logistics, publicity, sponsorship solicitation, refreshment acquisition, entertainment, fundraising, volunteer management.
08844.title: 5K Race Committee - Central NJ

08844.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
08844.title: Companion Hospice Volunteers - Hillsborough Twp

08844.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe, comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers.
08844.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice - Hillsborough

08844.description: Ascend Hospice Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients ; mind, body and soul.
08844.title: Hospice Musicians - Hillsborough Twp

08844.description: We need a smart savy individual with administrative and clerical skills that can send out information from lists. Write letters and respond to general questions. Know how to use Word and Excel.
08844.title: Administrative Assistant

11202.description: Do you enjoy photography? Intern at the Toy Museum and have fun assisting in photographing our collection, our shows and fun stuff for our social media campaign. Flexible schedule and casual atmosphere. Great for two people who enjoy working together. Use our equipment and learn a lot about old toys, while having fun.
11202.title: Photography Intern

11202.description: Hands on opportunity for interns to create banners, posters, signs etc. Work as a team with our creative group. Flexible hours, casual atmosphere.
11202.title: Graphic Design Interns

11202.description: Video editor or AE to help edit webisodes. The webisodes are short, less than 10 minutes. Filming as well using our equipment. We use Adobe Premiere. Photographer interns to help photograph our collection.
11202.title: Video Editor and Photography Interns

11202.description: We are looking for summer interns & volunteers for the following areas: 1) Assist with our facebook page and other social media. 2) Writers 3) Project organizers 4) Advertising and promotion interns 5) Pre K -2nd grade education majors to assist with some lesson plans Great hands on opportunity. Friendly staff, casual environment.
11202.title: Summer Interns

11202.description: We are looking for young patrons for the Museum. Help plan events, meet new people and have lots of fun. This is a group for those 21 years old and older. Were you active in college and now working yet still interesting in planning and attending events? Looking for an exciting way to get back into some socializing and doing good at the same time. Considering joing our Young Patrons group. Interested applicants, please let us know.
11202.title: Young Patrons and Coordinators

10710.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
10710.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Showcase Cinema De Lux Ridge Hill in Yonkers, NY!

10278.description: Volunteer Opportunity for: Corporate Directors and Senior Management Consultants Position: Practice Leader, Advisory Board Practice to Small to Medium-size Enterprises in Manhattan, Brooklyn and The Bronx. Background: For over 50 years, SCORE Mentors have been providing counsel and assistance to thousands of entrepreneurs and small business owners across New York City. Some SCORE client firms have grown to the point that they need to add outside perspective and expertise to help them shape their business strategy and to keep them looking beyond managing their companies on a day to day basis to focus on the broader picture. SCORE NYC seeks to recruit an experienced corporate director or management consultant to create this practice. Responsibilities: With the ability to schedule this SCORE volunteer commitment around your available time, and working closely with SCORE NYC's senior leadership: Lead the effort to develop this Advisory Board practice; including identifying contacting, and persuading established businesses that they in fact would be well served by creating an Advisory Board Create ideal candidate profiles for members of the Advisory Board team; Build a roster of potential Advisory Board members from the current roster of SCORE Interview Mentors and qualified external recruits; Create practices and standards necessary to build a resource that will serve SCORE NYC's clients with distinction; Serve on one or multiple Advisory Boards in order to set a high level of service to SCORE's clients; Contribute to the strength and growth of SCORE New York through adding your management expertise to this totally volunteer organization. Ideal Candidate Profile: 30+ years as a business leader; Senior experience in general management, or on board(s) of directors, or in management consulting; An ability to quickly assess business opportunities and problems; Excellent listening skills and the ability to act as a responsible advisor; Ability to establish rapport with successful entrepreneurs and small business leaders. A real desire to help others succeed. Compensation: Volunteering at SCORE is one of the ways for you to give back to your community, connect with fellow business leaders, and pass on your knowledge and expertise to the next generation of entrepreneurs in your community. Enjoy the satisfaction of contributing to the success of others; Share great experience with other SCORE volunteers and make new friends; Provide leadership for the local business community; Participate in life-long learning, growing professionally and personally. To learn more about SCORE NYC, go to www.newyorkcity.scorenyc.org and If you’d like to discuss this opportunity to serve the New York business community: EMAIL: humanresources@scorenyc.org or CALL: Diane Drey, Score NYC Chapter Chair at 212-264-4507
10278.title: Volunteer - Advisory Board Member - for established businesses

10278.description: We are looking for an organized computer literate person who can assist in the prepartion and administration of the business workshops we put on annually for entrepreneurs. In addition to helping us you will have the opportunity to attend the workshops for free - so this is perfect opportunity for someone that is interested in going into business or having a business career. The workshops offerings cover 25 subject areas including marketing and sales, finance and accounting, leadership and management, and industry specific workshops. The Workshop Committee, which organizes these educational experiences needs qualified volunteer with event planning skills to participate in the team effort. AS EVENT COORDINATOR YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES ARE: Prepare the materials which will be distributed at the workshops Arrive at the workshop 45 minutes in advance to Meet and Greet the participants, check them in Make sure participants have paid the proper fee Collect and tally surveys on the workshop Prepare statistical information Introduce speakers (optional) REQUIREMENTS We seek individuals who can CONSISTENTLY volunteer four hours a week. Workshops are primarily given during the business day, although some are in the early evening.
10278.title: Volunteer - Event Planner - for Business Seminars

10278.description: We have an immediate opening for an administrative assistant to support our non-profit organization that mentors small businesses and start-ups. This is a key role because it is often the first point of contact for clients and volunteers visiting or calling our main offices. It also provides important support for the Membership and Workshop Committees. Responsibilities include - answering the telephone, - preparing promotional material, - responding to client inquiries, - assisting with workshop registrations - attending events and meeting and greeting prospective clients - assisting the mentors with a variety of administrative and computer tasks. We seek individuals who can consistently commit to at least one \"five hours per week\" at our downtown office. By joining our organization you will be making a significant contribution to New York City's small business community.
10278.title: Volunteer Administrative Assistant and Reception

10475.description: Youth Lacrosse Coaches needed to develop youth Lacrosse program located in the North Bronx. We will introduce the sport to this area by conducting a series of clinics. Upon developing interest we will develop teams based on age groups. Teach youth ages 8-13 the skills and fundamentals of Lacrosse. Playing and or Coaching experience preferred. Prepare youth to compete against teams throughout the Tri State area. Flexible scheduling is available. All volunteers subject to MANDATORY BACKGROUND CHECK.
10475.title: Youth Lacrosse Coaches
10475.org: North Bronx Youth Sports Association, Inc

10475.description: We are launching a campaign to help single parents that live in NYC shelters with there children. We need energetic persons to help us. If you are computer literate,or not you still can help. Said fundraiser is happening soon. So get on board .And lets change some lives.
10475.title: Lets do some long term good

10475.description: MJHS Hospice provides a specialized program of care and services for end-of-life patients. MJHS Hospice provides care for pediatric and adult patients in homes, nursing homes, assisted living communities, inpatient facilities and hospitals. MJHS Hospice Volunteer opportunities include: Providing support and companionship to patients and their families Participating in leisure activities such as reading, listening to music, playing games with patients Supporting or organizing group activities for patients Listening compassionately to patients and their families Providing office or clerical support for our hospice team Complementary therapies Requirements for all categories of volunteers: 18 years or older 15 hours of training (4 hours training for clerical/office volunteers) Background Check (no charge to applicant) Medical Clearance (no charge to applicant) 3-4 hours per week 1 year commitment Required skills for patient visits: discretion, patience, compassion and dedication Preferred clerical and office support skills include: receptionist skills, computer skills, organizational skills and filing For more information on how to become a MJHS Hospice Volunteer please call: Bronx: Tiara Moultrie, Coordinator of Volunteer Services; (347) 988-4043 or tmoultri@mjhs.org.
10475.title: Be Part of Someone's Legacy--Become a Hospice Volunteer in the Bronx!

10475.description: Youth Soccer Coaches needed to develop youth soccer program located in the North Bronx for the 2016 season. Teach youth ages 6-13 the skills and fundamentals of Soccer. Playing and or Coaching experience preferred. Those without experience willing to learn from the ground up are welcome. Prepare youth to compete against teams throughout the Tri State area. Flexible scheduling is available. All Coaches and Volunteers go through MANDATORY BACKGROUND CHECK.
10475.title: Soccer Coaches
10475.org: North Bronx Youth Sports Association, Inc

10475.description: Youth Cheerleading Coaches needed for Youth Cheerleading program located in the North. Teach youth ages 6-13 the skills of Cheerleading. Coach candidates should have experience and or knowledge of tumbling, gymnastics, acrobatics, dance, choreography, stepping, etc. Develop and prepare new youth cheerleaders for Cheer Competitions against teams for local, regional and national competition. Assist the Cheer Coordinator to develop program curriculum and training schedule. Flexible scheduling is available. All Coaches and Volunteers go through MANDATORY BACKGROUND CHECK.
10475.title: Cheerleading Coaches
10475.org: North Bronx Youth Sports Association, Inc

10475.description: Youth Football Coaches needed for Youth Football program located in the North Bronx for the 2016 season. Teach youth ages 6-13 the skills and fundamentals of Football. Teach all positions on the Football Field. Playing and or Coaching experience preferred. Those without experience willing to learn from the ground up are welcome. Prepare youth to compete against teams throughout the Tri State area. Develop youth to be competitive for loca, regional and national tournaments. Flexible scheduling is available. Practices start now. Commitment, dedication, learning training techniques and above level communication with youth and people of varied backgrounds is required. All Coaches and Volunteers go through MANDATORY BACKGROUND CHECK.
10475.title: Football Coaches
10475.org: North Bronx Youth Sports Association, Inc

10475.description: The North Bronx Youth Sports Association, Inc. was founded in 2004 to provide recreational opportunities to at risk youth in the North Bronx. We are a sports based youth development program. We provide training and competition in Football, Soccer and Cheerleading for ages 5-14 as well as academic monitoring. We are seeking Board Members that can assist this grass roots based community program achieve its goal of taking the steps to reach a higher level of service through strategic planning, fundraising, management and capital building.
10475.title: Seeking Board Members
10475.org: North Bronx Youth Sports Association, Inc

10475.description: Purpose Volunteers are needed to help in the office at JASA’s Co-Op City NORC (Naturally Occurring Retirement Community). Responsibilities Assist with computer data entry Assist with filing & copying Create event flyers and calendars Additional volunteer duties as assigned Skills Handle confidential files securely Familiarity with Microsoft Publisher, Word and Excel Ability to work independently and as part of a team Good organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks Strong communication skills Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
10475.title: Clerical Assistant - JASA Co-op City NORC

10475.description: Purpose We're looking for a computer-savvy volunteer to help with data entry, tracking, and statistics for Dreiser Senior Center. Responsibilities Perform data entry into computer system that monitors senior participation Accurately track services provided to clients Provide clerical support, including light typing Perform other duties as requested Skills Excellent command of English: written, spoken and comprehension Must be computer literate, including ability to learn and use program-specific software Experience with data entry Attention to detail and excellent organizational skills Must observe high degree of confidentiality Can work well independently Fast learner Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
10475.title: Data Clerk Volunteer - Dreiser Senior Center

11520.description: The Book Fairies is a growing nonprofit that is seeking motivated board members who are interested in making an impact on illiteracy across metropolitan New York. Please email the answers to the questions listed below: 1. Why are you interested in committing your time and energy to The Book Fairies? 2. What do you think are the characteristics of a great board member? 3. Board members bring experience, wisdom, strategic thinking, and their connections. Can you tell us about yours? We look forward to hearing back from you!
11520.title: Seeking Board Members for The Book Fairies

11520.description: These small book clubs of 6-8 people offer adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities the opportunity to read for pleasure. Guided by a pair of trained volunteer facilitators, Next Chapter Book Clubs will meet once a week for an hour at select libraries across Long Island.
11520.title: Next Chapter Book Club Facilitator

11520.description: In addition to our one-on-one tutoring program, our brand new Small Group Instruction classes (SGI) are a great opportunity to have a positive impact with multiple students. To participate as a tutor in SGI, you must be a certified teacher and take the SGI Tutor Training Workshop.
11520.title: Small Group Instructor (Certified Teachers Only)

11520.description: Teach literacy skills to adults reading below a 6th grade level and/or English to new English language learners. Opportunity welcomes creativity and initiative! Volunteers work closely with student's identified goals, which can range from obtaining a job, studying for citizenship, or even reading a bedtime story to a grandchild. No previous experience necessary. You will meet at a library of your choice. Some of our high need areas are New Hyde Park, Westbury, Hicksville, Uniondale, and Freeport. If we don't have a student in your area, you may have to travel to a surrounding library.
11520.title: Adult Literacy Tutor

11520.description: Help Sort Books Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays 10am-3pm Do you love books? Are you looking for a fun, relaxed and flexible volunteer position? Then, The Book Fairies is the perfect fit! Books keep tumbling into the warehouse and we need dedicated sorters to help fly through the books. We are searching for volunteers to help us on a consistent weekly basis. It would be one day a week or more, your choosing, with flexible hours. We are open Tuesdays through Thursdays from 10am-3pm (stay for the day or choose a few hours). The task is easy, you can sit or stand, no heavy lifting is required as we can bring the books to you. The task involves sorting through the books we receive from school book drives. We check each book for wear and tear and place them into categories from preschool through adult. The best part? You can take home any books you want as payment! Join us for a day and see if it's right for you. We would love to have you!
11520.title: Weekly Book Sorting Position

11561.description: MJHS Hospice provides a specialized program of care and services for end-of-life patients. MJHS Hospice provides care for pediatric and adult patients in homes, nursing homes, assisted living communities, inpatient facilities and hospitals. MJHS Hospice Volunteer opportunities include: Providing support and companionship to patients and their families Participating in leisure activities such as reading, listening to music, playing games with patients Supporting or organizing group activities for patients Listening compassionately to patients and their families Providing office or clerical support for our hospice team Complementary therapies Requirements for all categories of volunteers: 18 years or older 15 hours of training (4 hours training for clerical/office volunteers) Background Check (no charge to applicant) Medical Clearance (no charge to applicant) 3-4 hours per week 1 year commitment Required skills for patient visits: discretion, patience, compassion and dedication Preferred clerical and office support skills include: receptionist skills, computer skills, organizational skills and filing For more information on how to become a MJHS Hospice Volunteer please call: Queens and Nassau: Mical White-Huffstead, Volunteer Coordinator; 718-490-1900 or MHUFFSTE@MJHS.ORG
11561.title: Be Part of Someone's Legacy--Become a Hospice Volunteer in Nassau County!

10570.description: This is an opportunity to join the Board of Directors of Girl Scouts Heart of the Hudson in Pleasantivlle NY which is dedicated to supporting the mission of Girl Scouts- to build girls of courage, confidence and character. The Board consists of 12-15 directors of diverse backgrounds, expertise and experience. Potential candidates should be willing to spend time preparing for and attending monthly board meetings, in person, in Pleasantville NY. Directors are also asked to serve on at least one Committee and to make an annual personally substantial financial contribution to GSHH.
10570.title: Help build girls of courage, confidence, and character, who make the world a better place.
10570.org: GIRL SCOUTS HEART OF THE HUDSON INC

10573.description: Children who grow up with books from an early age have improved success in school. Open Door participates in Reach Out and Read a national literacy program designed to take place at medical offices across the country. Our team of reading volunteers read books aloud to preschool children and help them select a book to take home. Book Delivery: we need volunteers to take books from our book storage in Ossining to our 4 other health centers located in Port Chester, Sleepy Hollow, Mt. Kisco and Brewster each week. Volunteers can select one or more sites to deliver books to Commit to delivering the books once each week to the chosen location Organize the book cart or book shelf and store additional books where directed Book pick up and drop offs would be your choice of day(s) Monday - Friday, between 9:30am - 5:00pm It would be okay to pick the books up on one day and deliver the books on another day. Advise volunteer coordinator when book storage in Ossining is low on a particular type of books. Notes: This is a good individual position and would also be a great volunteer position for two friends to take on! You need to be in good physical condition. The book storage is in the basement, so would not be great for someone with many allergies. Volunteer would need to use their own vehicle. Application Requirements: Complete an on-line Volunteer Application All volunteers 18 years and older will have a background check performed by Open Door Medical requirements: Provide documentation of a physical exam and PPD Test (TB) not older than 12 months Provide an immunization record or documentation of blood work for titer levels Provide documentation of the seasonal flu vaccine Sign a Hepatitis B form Have two reference forms completed and submitted directly to Open Door Complete an on-line volunteer orientation. Complete an on-line safety post-test and a volunteer orientation post-test. Sign a Volunteer Service Agreement and Pledge of Confidentiality. Please contact Alicia Ward, Open Door Volunteer Coordinator with any questions: award@odfmc.org / 914-502-1468 Open Door and the young patients we serve can really use your help!
10573.title: Children's Book Delivery
10573.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

10573.description: Reading volunteers are needed! Help become the positive change we need. Statics prove that children read to at an early age are more successful in school. You can help change a child's world by becoming a reading volunteer for Open Door's Reach Out and Read Program. Volunteers read aloud with one or more children, model reading techniques for parents and have a conversation about the importance of reading with their children. Our Reach Out and Read Coordinators will train you about working with our families, what books are best by age and more to help you feel ready to make a difference. Wonderful flexible volunteer opportunity for everyone who loves to read and work with children. We are building our team of daytime volunteers especially and can use your help. If you are recently retired or at home and looking for a little something to do, give us a call. Many colleges have approved Reach Out and Read for required course hours. We also use after school support as well, so all of you high school students who need community service hours and are reliable, give our rewarding program a try. Locations: Port Chester, Ossining, Sleepy Hollow and Mt. Kisco, NY Days/Hours: all business hours Shift: a shift is 1 hour or longer if desired Not sure? Come for a Reach Out and Read trial to see if our environment is a good fit for you. Then all volunteers complete a volunteer application and volunteer Orientation. Open Door Family Medical Centers is a non-profit community-based health organization. We are buliding strong, healthy communities. Join our team! Contact: Alicia Ward, Volunteer Coordinator at award@odfmc.org or call 914-502-1468.
10573.title: You Can Change a Child's World, One Story at a Time
10573.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

11249.description: Autoimmune Registry Inc. is seeking an Executive Director to build the organization, raise funds, establish relationships with disease-specific patient groups, and, most important, improve the lives of people with any autoimmune disease. Intelligence and initiative are key, but the position will require strong communication skills (written and verbal), organizational skills, and enough experience to demonstrate these abilities. You will work directly with the founder and current President. You must be able to meet regularly in New York City (we will be getting shared office space). The position is going to be full time eventually, but it could be a part-time position initially.
11249.title: Executive Director for Autoimmune Registry

11249.description: We are seeking board members with a personal connection to someone suffering from one of the 140 autoimmune diseases that we track in our Autoimmune Registry. Prior board experience required. We are just getting started and need someone who can provide insights into board development.
11249.title: Board Members

11249.description: Help your community to stop food waste and fight hunger by bringing excess food to homeless shelters. You will be taking bags of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. This is a great opportunity to gain community service experience while helping others at the same time!!!! Please sign up for events directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
11249.title: Volunteers Needed For Weekly Food Rescue Events (Great Way To Give Back To The Community)

07405.description: Mary Ann is a quiet and gentle woman in her 30’s who lives in our sheltered apartments in Butler, NJ. These apartments provide support for people who cannot manage on their own but are capable of a level of independence. Mary Ann would enjoy someone to share her hobbies with. She cannot drive so would love a friend to go to an occasional movie, bowling or other activity in the community. She would benefit from a good friend that will help her to develop her confidence.
07405.title: Do you like scrap-booking and crafts?

07405.description: Sue Anne is a lovely woman who lives in our sheltered apartments in Butler. She is wishing for a volunteer that likes to browse in the dollar store or have coffee at the diner. She very much enjoys going to church and sending thoughtful cards to friends. She needs assistance with reading and writing but loves to remember people on their birthday. She is a very positive and upbeat person and appreciative of the little things.
07405.title: Do you like to browse the dollar store and an occasional trip to a diner?

07405.description: Matt is a 35 year old man with a mild developmental disability. He lives in a supervised apartment in Butler, NJ and would benefit from a friendship with with a person that would help him feel that he matters to someone as a family member would. He loves to talk about current events and sports, likes to go out to community events of any kind and is friendly and upbeat. He works a few hours a week in Shop Rite but other than this he has limited outside activities since he needs assistance making his way in the world. A weekly phone call from a volunteer would even be enough to put a smile on his face!
07405.title: Friendship will go a long way!

07407.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe, comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers.
07407.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice - Elmwood Park

07407.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.
07407.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Elmwood Park

07407.description: Ascend Hospice Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients ; mind, body and soul.
07407.title: Music Therapy for Hospice - Elmwood Park

07407.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07407.title: Companion Hospice Volunteers - Elmwood Park

10080.description: This opportunity is available every Saturday & Sunday! Help get excess bagels donated from a really great food business! The final destination will be the NYC Rescue Mission at 90 Lafayette Street. Middleweight: the average amount of food is 15-20 pounds. Sign up directly on our calendar: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10080.title: Fight Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in FiDi 6PM-6:30PM

10080.description: This opportunity is available every Monday-Friday Help get excess bagels donated from a really great food business! The final destination will be the NYC Rescue Mission at 90 Lafayette Street. Middleweight: the average amount of food is 15-20 pounds. Sign up directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10080.title: Stop Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in FiDi 5PM-5:30PM

07401.description: Be a Hospice Volunteer! Hospice Volunteers are needed for supportive visits to patients, offering emotional support and companionship. Volunteers can read to patients, hold their hand, talk and pray with them, write letters, be a good listener, or various other supportive acts. We offer free Hospice training. Compassionate Care Hospice is recruiting volunteers to work with our hospice patients and their families in home settings, assisted living settings, and nursing facilities near you! (Passaic County, Bergen County, Essex County, Hudson County, Union County) Please Call Volunteer Coordinator Jessicalee Huggins 973-916-1400 or email Jessicalee.huggins@cchnet.net
07401.title: Be a hospice volunteer in Bergen County
