07661.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07661.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.

07662.description: We are in need of invididuals and/or groups to work on our Memory Book project! We are a hospice agency serving the terminally ill throughout New Jersey. Many of our patients have Alzheimer’s or Dementia, which are debilitating diseases of memory loss. Most of them have lost their short term memory and can no longer recognize their families, friends and surroundings; but their long term memory consisting of their childhood or years past can remain intact. Therefore, we create Memory Books, in which we categorize items such as food, holidays, sports, cars, flowers/gardens, people, people showing emotion such as hugs, etc. Volunteers create these books by finding and cutting out pictures or scenes from magazines, cards, calendars, etc. We sit with the patients and review these categories to see if any memory is stimulated and many times it is. We have had great results with this over the years as a tool for the mental stimulation for these patients. It takes a lot of time, hours and dedication to put these books together and a great deal of material is needed to complete them. This is truly a community project that touches and adds to the quality of life for our patients. Grace Healthcare Services is happy to provide all materials needed to make these books. The books can be made from the comfort of your own group setting! We will arrange for the Volunteer Coordinator to drop off and pick up supplies. We look forward to working with you!
07662.title: Volunteers needed to make Memory Books!

07662.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07662.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07662.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.
07662.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Rochelle Park

07662.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07662.title: Hospice Volunteer

07666.description: We are looking for volunteers with a green thumb! We provide affordable housing to seniors in need and would like to get a vegatable garden going for our seniors to enjoy!!
07666.title: Garden for Seniors

07666.description: Hi! Bright Side Manor is looking to host a jewelry showcase for it's residents - and need your help! Bright Side Manor is a non profit organization that provides affordable housing for seniors in need. We operate with a small staff and a very small activities budget, so I am looking to community to help put on a fun activity for the residents! I am hoping to find volunteers that are willing to bring in jewlery to showcase. Ideally it will be like a small fair with a couple of tables set up outside. If you have any you would like to donate that would also be nice (but not necessary). Please feel free to text me at 609-915-0497 or reply to this post. THANK YOU!!! Liz
07666.title: Jewelry Showcase!

07666.description: JFCS establishes a corps of trained Preparedness and Response volunteers prepared to mobilize at a moment`s notice. They help older adults and individuals with disabilities to prepare kits in advance of a disaster and deliver emergency supplies to, and conduct home checks on, \"at risk\" older adults and individuals with disabilities who may be without power and unable to leave their homes.
07666.title: Disaster Preparedness & Response Program
07666.org: Jewish Family & Children's Services of Northern New Jersey

07666.description: JFCS builds accomplished children with engaging programming in a safe environment. Club ED is our afterschool program for students from Kindergarten through 5 th grade. JFCS recruits volunteers for the programs operating in the Fort Lee and Fairview school districts. Volunteers provide one hour per week of homework assistance (Monday through Friday).
07666.title: Club ED - Homework Assistance Program
07666.org: Jewish Family & Children's Services of Northern New Jersey

07666.description: YOU can make a difference in someone’s life! YOU can brighten the day of a homebound, isolated Senior! YOU can have fun and get to know someone in your community! Friendly Visitor Volunteers enjoy one-on-one relationships, while alleviating loneliness and isolation with important human contact encouraging lonely elders to socialize. Volunteers are specifically trained to understand and appreciate underlying social needs and, in doing so, to provide a sense of dignity and worth for the clients that is so often lacking. For more information, e-mail ninaa@jfsbergen.org or call Nina Ashurov at 201-837-9090 ext. 238
07666.title: Friendly Visitor
07666.org: Jewish Family & Children's Services of Northern New Jersey

07666.description: YOU can make a difference in someone’s life! YOU can brighten the day of a homebound, isolated Elder! YOU can have fun and get to know someone in your community! The Adopt-a-Grandparent telephone reassurance program sponsored by Jewish Family and Children's Services (JFCS) of Bergen, Passaic Counties and North Hudson, pairs teens with frail, homebound elders in their community. Teens call their \"bubbies\" once a week to provide companionship and social interaction as well as helping orient the Elder to time and place and assuring their safety and well being. A JFCS staff member provides training for all volunteers. The training includes an overview of how to make the call, effective communication with the elderly and recordkeeping. TOUCH A LIFE - ADOPT AN ELDER! You may find you get more than you give! For more information, e-mail ninaa@jfsbergen.org or call Nina Ashurov at 201-837-9090 ext. 238
07666.title: Adopt-a-Grandparent
07666.org: Jewish Family & Children's Services of Northern New Jersey

07666.description: The Kosher Meals on Wheels (KMOW) program of Bergen and Passaic Counties, NJ, is looking for volunteers to deliver meals to our homebound and isolated seniors and people with disabilities. Each route takes no more than one hour to drive. If you're 17 years of age or older and have a valid driver's license you can join our dedicated team of volunteers. Meals are picked up in Teaneck, NJ, mornings, afternoons or evenings. If you can drive every other week or every week, we need you. Interested? Contact us at ninaa@jfsbergen.org or call 201-837-9090 ext. 238
07666.title: Kosher Meals on Wheels (KMOW) Driver
07666.org: Jewish Family & Children's Services of Northern New Jersey

07666.description: Assist clients and staff with recreation program activities including games, arts and crafts, woodworking activities, painting, jewelry making, and more.
07666.title: ACTIVITIES/RECREATION ASSISTANT

07666.description: Volunteer 4 hours per week to respond to emergency ambulance calls in the Township of Teaneck, NJ
07666.title: Emergency Medical Technician (EMT)

11230.description: The eldest trees often bear the sweetest fruit! Visit a senior in your area and learn from them and grow mentally and spiritually all while relieving the feeling of isolation by visiting a homebound senior in their home for one hour a week. We match you with one senior who you will visit for 1 hour per week up to 6 months or more should you wish to commit further than the 6 month requirement. For more information call 718-449-5000 ext. 2212 or email Libby with your contact information at L.feldman@jccgci.org. Learn more on our website at www.friendlyvisitingny.org and like our facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Friendly-Visiting-Program/332936972502
11230.title: We all have a best friend through each stage in life! Visit a Senior in Your area!
11230.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11230.description: You can volunteer and make a real difference in a homebound individuals life in so many different ways. W e are a dynamic and diverse group of volunteers or Friendly Visitors who visit homebound individual in their area each week. Every member of our team is willing and eager to share their time with someone who is older, wiser, and has had a lifetime of experience. Volunteer by visiting a senior at there home, escorting them to appointments and recreational outings!
11230.title: A visit for a smile!
11230.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

08818.description: Sunday Social is a fun and fantastic project fit for the whole family. The New Jersey Veteran's Home in Menlo Park is filled with history from which we can all learn and grow. You have an opportunity to be the shining light in someone’s day. Volunteers are needed to socialize senior friends by playing games, reading a book, trivia, and exercise or playing an instrument. The options are numerous and great for anyone. Musicians: Musicians should notify Jersey Cares upon registration for further instruction at info@jerseycares.org. Animals: All animals need to be certified Pet Therapists, please email your certification to info@jerseycares.org . Youth: Youth volunteers (17 years and under) must be accompanied by an adult and a Youth Waiver must be completed by the guardian through Jersey Cares prior to arrival. Please email your Youth Waiver to info@jerseycares.org . Everyone: Please do not enter the facility if you have a cold/virus, the residents are very susceptible to contagion. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
08818.title: Sunday Social in Menlo Park

08818.description: The Gift Shop Volunteer assists in providing a service for patients, visitors and hospital staff by offering for sale a variety of items which are appealing and often essential for the patient's comfort.
08818.title: Auxiliary Gift Shop Volunteer

08818.description: Information Desk volunteers are needed for nights (4pm-8:30pm), weekends (7:30am-8:30pm) and days (7:30am-3:30pm) to provide accurate information to visitors & patients, answer phone inquiries, deliver patient mail & flowers, problem solve patient & visitor inquiries. This is the spot to learn all about the hospital and what services it provides.
08818.title: Information Desk Volunteer

07068.description: This outdoor hands-on class teaches the safe, easy and effective way to learn to ride on two wheels. Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers will be given training on how to fit a helmet and how to make minor bike adjustments. As a volunteer at this event, we need your help with the following: o Assist instructors with bicycle preparation o Removing bike pedals o Lowering seats o Bike sizing o Tire inflation o Brake check o Provide assistance guiding children through the course o Ability to work and stand in the sun for 3-4 hours o Ability to bend o Ability to jog behind the children’s bikes if necessary
07068.title: Help Kids Learn to Ride a Bike

07066.description: Homeside Hospice is looking for volunteers to provide Music Therapy to our patients in assisted living and in nursing homes in Union County. If you are a Music Therapist, you can provide a loving experience for patients in lifes final journey. As a volunteer you will provide essential, quality of life services to patients. Your efforts will provide the sort of care and help that a loving friend provides and help insure that the Hospice promise is fulfilled. Music Therapy Students Welcome!
07066.title: Music Therapy Volunteers needed in Union County

07066.description: Deliver groceries and other material assistance to families of kids with cancer. We are in need of volunteers for the trip from Monmouth to Middlesex and Mercer counties. The deliveries are made once a month from the Central Regional Office located in Clark, NJ and delivered to surrounding towns in Union, Somerset, Hunterdon, Warren and Morris County areas. The food is bagged and ready to go. Each volunteer would have the same family and route each month. Training will be provided. Climbing stairs may be involved. A backround check is required - we can get you one for $18 from the State of NJ if you can't provide your own. Spanish-speaking volunteers are a plus!
07066.title: Deliver items to bring cheer and help to families of kids with cancer

07066.description: All four regions (Bergen county, Gloucester county, Monmouth county, and Union county) are seeking volunteers to help us launch some exciting new fundraisers! You will work either on your own or with a small team of other volunteers to coordinate these events under the guidance of the Regional Director. Golf, Gift Auctions, Boutiques, Comedy Nights...the opportunities are endless. Have a suggestion? We are interested! Even if you've never planned a fundraiser, If you've ever planned a wedding or other major party, this is an opportunity you can handle! It can even be accomplished using only your Facebook or email contacts!
07066.title: Fundraising Event Planner - All Regions NJ

07066.description: Homeside Hospice is looking for volunteers to provide companionship to patients in their home or nursing home in the Princeton and Mercerville Areas. As a companion you will provide a listening ear and a sharing spirit to enhance the patient's emotional and spiritual well-being. As a volunteer you will provide essential, quality of life services to patients. Your efforts will provide the sort of care and help that a loving friend provides and help insure that the Hospice promise is fulfilled. Some visits might include reading, watching TV, taking walks, playing music, talking about their life and their family, or shared silence.
07066.title: Volunteer companions needed for hospice patients in Union County

07066.description: Homeside Hospice is looking for volunteers to provide animal assisted activities in nursing homes in Bergen, Essex, Hudson, Mercer, Middlesex, Monmouth, Morris, Ocean, Passic, Somerset, and Union counties. If you have a certified therapy pet, you and your pet can provide a loving experience for patients often isolated from nature. As a volunteer you will provide essential, quality of life services to patients. Your efforts will provide the sort of care and help that a loving friend provides and help insure that the Hospice promise is fulfilled.
07066.title: Volunteers and their pets needed for hospice patients

07066.description: Homeside Hospice is looking for volunteers to provide companionship to patients in their home or nursing home in Middlesex, Union , Somerset, Monmouth, Hudson and counties. As a companion you will provide a listening ear and a sharing spirit to enhance the patient's emotional and spiritual well-being. As a volunteer you will provide essential, quality of life services to patients. Your efforts will provide the sort of care and help that a loving friend provides and help insure that the Hospice promise is fulfilled. Some visits might include reading, watching TV, taking walks, playing music, talking about their life and their family, or shared silence.
07066.title: Volunteer companions needed for hospice patients

07066.description: Answering telephones Assisting with coordinating fundraisers Assisting with clerical duties Plus Much More........ Please call and inquire about these opportunities!
07066.title: Office Help/Clerical - All Regions

07065.description: We are looking for a committed professional to Chair the Technology Committee of a newly forming Christian school that will serve students in grades 5 to 12 in New York and New Jersey. Church affiliation or membership is not required for this opportunity. The Technology Committee will be responsible for setting the vision for and managing the overall technology functions and programs for the schools. They will make recommendations for equipment, software, hardware, programs and services that the school will need in every area and will also work to develop technology/media programs for the students . The Chair will work with the Pastor to develop the agenda and materials for each meeting and will then convene a monthly conference call. Other work can be done virtually as determined by the Committee, but the Chair will have access to our office space in downtown Rahway if a meeting is needed. The Chair's primary goal is to lead the committee in managing tasks to complete the work that it identified in its committee description. Candidates with significant experience in information technology are strongly encouraged to apply. The Committee will also consider applicants currently in undergraduate studies. The committee is on hiatus in July and August and will reconvene in September. Interested candidates are asked to send a resume and cover letter to kingdomcityfellowship@gmail.com. We will NOT respond to inquiries that come without a resume/cover letter.
07065.title: Chair, Technology Committee- The 1City Academy

07065.description: Women (ages 18-over) who love the Lord and love to serve are invited to join the inaugural class of the SoulDeevas Christian Women's Service Group. You can learn more about us at www.souldeevas.com. The SoulDeevas was created to provide a vehicle for Christian women to establish wealth, perfect their work, impart wisdom and connect through worship and service. Part of the SoulDeevas' immediate body of work will include: Planning an annual calendar of service, development and worship events. Defining our social priorities and advocacy/political agenda Establishing a scholarship program for girls Developing and implementing a mentoring program for girls and a development program for women and more. The SoulDeevas will meet in an office in Downtown Rahway, once a month on a day/time that is most convenient for the group - with a preference towards Saturdays. While candidates must identify as Christian, if they are not currently connected with a local church, that is okay. A Facebook page (for fellowship) is helpful, but not required. You may also email souldeevas@gmail.com for more information.
07065.title: SoulDeevas Christian Women's Service Group

07065.description: We are recruiting for committed ladies and gentlemen (ages 18-over) to pledge Nu Sigma Theta and help us develop a thriving chapter in New Jersey. Current adult members live in Illinois, Michigan, New Jersey, New York, Nigeria, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, and Virginia. Nu Sigma Theta was formed for community service and social/professional networking. Here are some of the activities we've done: * Collected toiletry donations, packed bags and distributed them to the homeless * Conducted job readiness and life skill workshops for at-risk teens; served as mentors and employment coaches * Served on advisory boards; boards of directors; focus groups for community based organizations to address areas of concern * Raised funds and/or awareness for an array of charities / Raised funds for families and individuals undergoing crisis * Participated in peace walks, rallies and other advocacy efforts around an array of justice issues * Facilitated school supply, toy and coat drives * Developed opportunities for our members to showcase their own businesses, projects, events and causes. * Collaborated with other community based organizations on advocacy and social justice programs. * Send birthday cards to children who have experienced crisis. * Lobbied political leaders for change in our local and global communities. Some of the social activities we've done have included - * Unlimited basketball team * Bowling Group * Dance / Step Team * Tournament of Champions * Memorial Day Weekend Trips to Myrtle Beach * Robust social media groups that expose members to other members around the world. * Annual business/service trip to New Jersey * Annual resume/business plan review for members Annually, the organization convenes in New Jersey for its conference which includes a recognition ceremony, vendor promotion, entrepreneur's luncheon and dinner dance. On Memorial Day weekend 2018, the plan is to convene in North Carolina for our annual family vacation. The NJ Chapter can expect to meet once a month in Downtown Rahway, New Jersey and can also work virtually. In addition to our social and service efforts, after six months of membership, we also help our members develop strong resumes/cover letters, look for jobs (if unemployed) and we serve as references for them. For those who own their own businesses, we promote their businesses/events/organizations on our social media pages as much as we can. A working email address is a requirement as is a Facebook account (you may create a separate one just for this activity if you'd like). The Facebook account is critical as it allows you to participate in discussions and activities with members from all over the world. Our pledge process is very simple, it is basically an orientation that is done virtually (via Facebook) and there is no form of hazing observed. If you do not have Facebook and are not willing to create a page for this opportunity, then there is no way that you can help us at this time. Interested candidates can complete the inquiry form at http://souldeevas.wixsite.com/neos/adult-membership or respond here with your name, age and neighborhood of residence. We will then forward the membership application. There are no dues required for those who apply under this opportunity but the summer pledge class is the last class where we will offer volunteer service membership. Orientations begin on either June 26th or July 3rd. There are eight slots available.
07065.title: Nu Sigma Theta- Service/Social Organization (NJ Chapter)

07065.description: We are looking for people who have a heart for service to join our new, non-denominational Church plant in Rahway or New York City! Here's what you'll find: 1. A ministry that aspires to grow beyond its four walls and really serve the community! 2. A leader who really breaks down the Bible without beating you in the head with it! 3. An opportunity to connect in a ministry that is not about fashion or popularity, but about love and service! 4. A community where everyone is accepted, loved, respected, and pushed to do their best! Here's what we need: We haven't started yet, so we need people to help us build from the ground up. Whatever gift or desire that you have in ministry, we can use it! We are a come as you are ministry (so jeans are just as accepted as suits). We are JUST starting, so you have to be comfortable enough to walk into a place with just two or three people and know that God is there waiting with a Word AND an assignment for you! We start in July and you have the option of being with us on either a Wednesday evening or a Sunday morning (in New Jersey) or a Thursday evening (in New York)! The first step is to email us something about you and tell us where you'd like to serve (NJ or NY). We'll then invite you to our first service.
07065.title: Kingdom Citizens (Rahway or NYC)

07065.description: The SoulDeevas Organization is looking for a Head Coach for its inaugural Competitive Step Team. The Head Coach will be responsible for: Coaching the team on Saturdays (about three hours) throughout the school year Maintaining flexibility on performance days, as times will vary, including nighttime and weekends during competition season and special events Creating a stimulating learning environment that is organized, well managed and enriching. Instructing, demonstrating, and coaching team of high school steppers. Planning and delivering end-of-school-year step team performance. Supervising and training an Assistant Coach who will be responsible for leading practice in the event of the Head Coach's absence. The team will begin to practice in September the team will run through June. After six month's of dedicated service, the Head Coach will begin to receive a weekly stipend during training season. Interested candidates MUST have experience with Competitive Stepping! A very experienced high school student will also be considered for this role as a junior coach.
07065.title: Step Team Coach

07065.description: The SoulDeevas Organization is looking for a Head Coach for its inaugural Majorette Dance Team. The Head Coach will be responsible for: Coaching the team on Saturdays (hours TBD) throughout the school year Maintaining flexibility on performance days, as times will vary, including nighttime and weekends during parade season and special events Creating a stimulating learning environment that is organized, well managed and enriching. Instructing, demonstrating, and coaching team of high school majorettes. Planning and delivering end-of-school-year majorettes team performance. Supervising and training an Assistant Coach who will be responsible for leading practice in the event of the Head Coach's absence. The team will begin to practice in September and the team will run through June. After six months of dedicated service, the Head Coach will begin to receive a weekly stipend during training season. Interested candidates MUST have experience with Majorette Dance!
07065.title: Majorette Dance Head Coach

07065.description: We are looking for committed ladies, gentlemen and teens who do not have a church home to join us and become part of Beta Kappa, Kingdom City Fellowship's Chapter of Nu Sigma Theta. You can learn more about Nu Sigma Theta at http://souldeevas.wixsite.com/neos. The Beta Kappa Chapter does NOT pay dues because the church pays for them. The Beta Kappa chapter would meet weekly for Faith Building, community service projects and social activities/events at an office in the Downtown Rahway location. Beta Kappa is part of the Kingdom City Fellowship. We are formerly from New York City and just moved to Rahway, hoping to plant a new church here that is real, relevant and radical! Service is our most sincere form of worship and we are looking for men, women and teens who love God enough to serve His people. You can learn more about Kingdom City at www.kingdomcityfellowship.org. Again, we meet in an office environment, so casual clothing is more than appropriate. We will launch our ministry in July and would love for you to be part of it. Participants can participate either on Wednesday evenings (7pm-8:30pm) or Sundays (11am to 12:30pm). If you really want to participate, but none of these days work for you, please let us know. For more information, please email kingdomcityfellowship@gmail.com.
07065.title: Beta Kappa- Rahway Chapter

07065.description: A creative, patient and extraordinarily talented event planning professional is needed to plan the inaugural fundraising gala for the 1City Academy Christian Schools. 1City is a new school that will serve students in grades 5 to 12 in New York and New Jersey. We anticipate that the gala will happen in November, 2017 in New York City and will lean to the Event Planner's expertise as to the best venue/location for the event. The Event Planner will have the services of two corps of volunteers and a Board of Directors at his/her disposal and will work with the Board Chair to plan and implement the event. Most of the work can be done virtually until we get closer to the gala and the Event Planner can also elect to work from our office in downtown Rahway if he/she needs to hold meetings. Specific knowledge of event spaces in New York is required.
07065.title: Event Planner- The 1City Academy Christian Schools

07065.description: We are looking for two attorneys (licensed in either New York or New Jersey) to serve on the Facilities and Compliance Committees of a newly forming Christian school that will serve students in grades 5 to 12 in New York and New Jersey. Although the committees serves as a function of our Board of Directors, its members are not members of the Board. Church affiliation or membership is not required for this opportunity. The Compliance Committee is convened to ensure that the schools are adhering to all of the applicable regulations set by the Education Departments of New York and New Jersey and that the schools adopt policies that minimize risk to the schools. The Facilities Committee will be responsible for overseeing the initial search and purchase/rental of school facilities in New York and New Jersey and will also oversee appropriate major renovations and other facilities projects, making recommendations as appropriate. The Committees will be convened primarily via conference call and will otherwise work virtually unless a meeting is agreed upon by the members. The committee is on hiatus in July and August and will reconvene in September. The attorneys would generally be asked to review any policies that the committees develop and share their expertise around any other matters that are brought up for discussion in committee meetings. Interested candidates are asked to send a resume and cover letter to kingdomcityfellowship@gmail.com. We will NOT respond to inquiries that come without a resume/cover letter.
07065.title: Attorney- The 1City Academy Christian Schools

07065.description: We are looking for a committed professional to Chair the Marketing Committee of a newly forming Christian school that will serve students in grades 5 to 12 in New York and New Jersey. Church affiliation or membership is not required for this opportunity. The Marketing Committee will be responsible for setting the vision for and managing the overall marketing strategy for the schools. They will also oversee the public relations, branding, social media, press and community relations activities for the schools. The Committee will take on ensuring that the schools’ marketing practices (service announcements, brochures, and other marketing materials) are governed by applicable laws and regulations, and standards of acceptable marketing, such as those promulgated by the Association of Fundraising Professionals. The Chair will work with the Pastor to develop the agenda and materials for each meeting and will then convene a monthly conference call. Other work can be done virtually as determined by the Committee, but the Chair will have access to our office space in downtown Rahway if a meeting is needed. The Chair's primary goal is to lead the committee in managing tasks to complete the work that it identified in its committee description. Candidates with significant experience in marketing/development are strongly encouraged to apply. The Committee will also consider applicants currently in undergraduate studies. The committee is on hiatus in July and August and will reconvene in September. The chair will be responsible for setting the conference call date for September. Interested candidates are asked to send a resume and cover letter to kingdomcityfellowship@gmail.com. We will NOT respond to inquiries that come without a resume/cover letter.
07065.title: Chair, Marketing Committee- The 1City Academy

07065.description: We are looking for a committed professional to chair the Operations Committee of a newly forming Christian school that will serve students in grades 5 to 12 in New York and New Jersey. Church affiliation or membership is not required for this opportunity. The Operations Committee will be responsible for planning out the aspects of the school’s day-to-day operations and for developing policies and procedures to support those operations as appropriate. This includes, but is not limited to: enrollment/transfer/discharge processes; enrollment/attendance reporting; development of student policies/handbooks; establishment of calendar/activities; initial charting of supplies; lunch/transportation procedures; disciplinary processes, etc. The Chair will work with the Pastor to develop the agenda and materials for each meeting and will then convene a monthly conference call. Other work can be done virtually as determined by the Committee, but the Chair will have access to our office space in downtown Rahway if a meeting is needed. The Chair's primary goal is to lead the committee in managing tasks to complete the work that it identified in its committee description. Candidates with significant experience in school management, operations, and education, as well as other areas of human services are strongly encouraged to apply. The Committee will also consider applicants currently in undergraduate studies. The committee is on hiatus in July and August and will reconvene in September. The chair will be responsible for setting the conference call date for September. Interested candidates are asked to send a resume and cover letter to kingdomcityfellowship@gmail.com. We will NOT respond to inquiries that come without a resume/cover letter.
07065.title: Chair, Operations Committee- 1City Christian Academy

07065.description: We are looking for a committed professional to chair the Development Committee of a newly forming Christian school that will serve students in grades 5 to 12 in New York and New Jersey. Church affiliation or membership is not required for this opportunity. The Development Committee will work to maximize funding from individuals, foundations and corporations and to promote the name and programs of The 1City Academy Christian Schools. The Development Committee will also develop a fundraising plan, which will include annual activities for the Board/Committee Members, parents, students and the general community and will work closely with the Finance Committee to establish the annual budget. The Committee will also take the lead in implementing fundraising activities to support the initial and ongoing expenses of the schools. The Chair will work with the Pastor to develop the agenda and materials for each meeting and will then convene a monthly conference call. Other work can be done virtually as determined by the Committee, but the Chair will have access to our office space in downtown Rahway if a meeting is needed. The Chair's primary goal is to lead the committee in managing tasks to complete the work that it identified in its committee description. Candidates with significant experience in development, fundraising and events planning, as well as other areas of human services are strongly encouraged to apply. The Committee will also consider applicants currently in undergraduate studies. The committee is on hiatus in July and August and will reconvene in September. The chair will be responsible for setting the conference call date for September. Interested candidates are asked to send a resume and cover letter to kingdomcityfellowship@gmail.com. We will NOT respond to inquiries that come without a resume/cover letter.
07065.title: Chair, Development Committee- 1City Christian Academy

07065.description: We are looking for a committed professional to chair the Finance/Audit Committee of a newly forming Christian school that will serve students in grades 5 to 12 in New York and New Jersey. Church affiliation or membership is not required for this opportunity. The Finance Committee will be responsible for establishing and overseeing the initial budget and investments and for approving subsequent years’ budgets. The Committee will also be responsible for the initial search, vetting and oversight of the school’s Finance Director, and will also work to identify and work with an independent auditor. The Committee will also develop the first policies and procedures for its operation that comply with all applicable local, state, federal standards. The Chair will work with the Pastor to develop the agenda and materials for each meeting and will then convene a monthly conference call. Other work can be done virtually as determined by the Committee, but the Chair will have access to our office space in downtown Rahway if a meeting is needed. The Chair's primary goal is to lead the committee in managing tasks to complete the work that it identified in its committee description. Candidates with significant experience in finance, accounting, and business, as well as other areas of human services are strongly encouraged to apply. The Committee will also consider applicants currently in undergraduate studies. The committee is on hiatus in July and August and will reconvene in September. The chair will be responsible for setting the conference call date for September. Interested candidates are asked to send a resume and cover letter to kingdomcityfellowship@gmail.com. We will not respond to inquiries that come without a resume and cover letter.
07065.title: Chair, Finance Committee- 1City Christian Academy

07065.description: We are looking for a committed professional to chair the Human Resources Committee of a newly forming Christian school that will serve students in grades 5 to 12 in New York and New Jersey. Church affiliation or membership is not required for this opportunity. The Human Resources Committee will be responsible for overseeing the initial search, hire and evaluation of the schools’ first principals and senior level staff; the Committee, working along with other Committees, will set salaries for senior level staff and review requests for increase as appropriate; the Committee will also develop the first policies and procedures for all staff and will ensure that the school is abiding by all appropriate labor laws. The Chair will work with the Pastor to develop the agenda and materials for each meeting and will then convene a monthly conference call. Other work can be done virtually as determined by the Committee, but the Chair will have access to our office space in downtown Rahway if a meeting is needed. The Chair's primary goal is to lead the committee in managing tasks to complete the work that it identified in its committee description. Candidates with significant experience in human resources and staff supervision, as well as other areas of human services are strongly encouraged to apply. The Committee will also consider applicants currently in undergraduate studies. The committee is on hiatus in July and August and will reconvene in September. The chair will be responsible for setting the conference call date for September. Interested candidates are asked to send a resume and cover letter to kingdomcityfellowship@gmail.com. We will not respond to inquiries that come without a resume/cover letter.
07065.title: Chair, Human Resources Committee- 1City Christian Academy

07065.description: We are looking for a committed professional to chair the Compliance Committee of a newly forming Christian school that will serve students in grades 5 to 12 in New York and New Jersey. Church affiliation or membership is not required for this opportunity. The Compliance Committee will be responsible for evaluating the schools’ exposure to risk and developing and implementing strategies to minimize and/or eliminate that risk. As we are in the foundational stages of the schools’ development, the Committee will also be responsible for researching, vetting and working with insurance and legal vendors and will be responsible for developing the schools’ initial risk management policies and for ensuring the schools’ compliance with all applicable legal, licensing and reporting requirements. The Chair will work with the Pastor to develop the agenda and materials for each meeting and will then convene a monthly conference call. Other work can be done virtually as determined by the Committee, but the Chair will have access to our office space in downtown Rahway if a meeting is needed. The Chair's primary goal is to lead the committee in managing tasks to complete the work that it identified in its committee description. Candidates with significant experience in law, compliance, insurance or other areas of human services are strongly encouraged to apply. The Committee will also consider applicants currently in undergraduate studies. The committee is on hiatus in July and August and will reconvene in September. The chair will be responsible for setting the conference call date for September. Interested candidates are asked to send a resume and cover letter to kingdomcityfellowship@gmail.com. We will NOT respond to inquiries that come without a resume/cover letter.
07065.title: Chair, Compliance Committee- 1City Christian Academy

07065.description: A patient with a terminal illness could benefit from compassionate visits from a Spanish speaking visitor. Visits can be scheduled according to your availabilty and are usually 1-2 hours in length once a week. Become a part of the Kindred Hospice team; a very special group of compassionate people who dedicate their time to a truly noble cause. Free training is provided. Contact Elaine.Carlsen@gentiva.com or call 888-556-8880 today.
07065.title: Spanish Speaking Friendly Visitors

07065.description: Art therapy; the psychological use of art media and the creative process, facilitated by an art therapist, to help foster self expression, create coping skills, and strengthen sense of self. Using the artistic process to help people explore different challenges and things they’re facing in their life. assess the needs of the client by listening and providing guidance; work creatively with various client groups in a therapeutic setting, ensuring a safe and secure environment; enable clients to explore their artwork and the process they used to create it; assess and understand the feelings or temperament of others; constructively challenge the behaviour and attitude of your clients; attend meetings and case conferences to share ideas, expertise and good practice; keep up to date with administration tasks; maintain art therapy space and materials; receive support and discuss ideas in individual supervision; explore opportunities for work where it may not currently exist; present a case to other professionals on reasons for employing an art therapist; keep up to date with developments in the profession by attending seminars, lectures, and workshops.
07065.title: Art Teacher / Art Therapist

07065.description: Landscape or maintain grounds of property using hand or power tools or equipment. Workers typically perform a variety of tasks, which may include any combination of the following: sod laying, mowing, trimming, planting, watering, fertilizing, digging, raking, sprinkler installation, and installation of mortarless segmental concrete masonry wall units. Building garden beds, installation of fences and handicap access rails and trails.
07065.title: General Laborers to Build Garden for Handicapped Children

07065.description: Essential Functions: Prepares correspondence, memos, reports, minutes, documents, orders and statistical data such as charts, tables and graphs from written, typed, or verbal instructions. Sets-up and maintains office files, records, and indices using computer applications that include use of electronic mail, word processing, spreadsheets, and special data bases. Posts information to records where judgment must be exercised in the selection of data. Prepares special and periodic reports that involve compiling data from a number of sources. Maintains control files of matters in progress to monitor and expedite their completion. Coordinates time, place and participant arrangements for meetings; or maintains appointment calendars. Prepares newsletters, brochures and other printed materials using desktop publishing software. Organizes and prepares training materials and PowerPoint presentations for distribution to staff. Reviews a variety of forms and records for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with applicable statutes. Takes and prepares minutes of meetings. Sorts, screens, prioritizes, and routes incoming mail; gives information to the public or interdepartmental representatives in situations where judgment and interpretation of departmental policies and regulations are required. Orders supplies and maintains office supply inventories. Provides courteous, high quality service to members of the public by personally responding to requests for service or appropriate referral.
07065.title: Office Support

07065.description: Kindred Hospice is looking for compassionate volunteers in the Union County area that can provide those with life-limiting illnesses with friendly visits and caregiver relief. Volunteer work is flexible and based on your availability. Our patients and families are grateful for whatever time you can give. Free screening & training is provided. Please contact Elaine.Carlsen@gentiva.com or call 888-556-8880.
07065.title: Friendly Visitor Needed: Union County

07065.description: Veterans are needed to provide comradeship to fellow Veterans who have life-limiting illnesses. Kindred Hospice is committed to recognizing and honoring those who have served our county. Veteran Volunteers have the unique ability to relate and connect with Veteran patients and their families. You can be a part of a great program to honor and recognize Veterans in a very special way. Kindred Hospice provides services to patients wherever they call home throughout the Mercer, Middlesex, Monmouth, Morris, Ocean, Somerset, & Union Counties. Free training is provided. Contact Elaine.Carlsen@gentiva.com or call 888-556-8880 today.
07065.title: Vet-to-Vet Volunteer

07060.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.
07060.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Plainfield

07060.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07060.title: Companion Hospice Volunteers - Plainfield

07060.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe, comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers.
07060.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice - Plainfield

07060.description: Ascend Hospice Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients ; mind, body and soul.
07060.title: Hospice Musicians - Plainfield

07060.description: Volunteers needed as classroom assistants for an adult ESL class. What you'll do: Work with a certified ESL teacher Guide student activities Model pronunciation Engage students in conversation You'll get: New friends ESL classroom experience The satisfaction of helping immigrants learn English and become comfortable in their new community
07060.title: Volunteer to help adults learn English
07060.org: United Church of Christ - Congregational/Plainfeld English School

11233.description: We are looking for an energetic and passionate, creative Teen Group Specialist to facilitate our teen groups and teach young girls and youg boys on self-esteem, character and healthy relationships! Position: Tuesday's and Thursday's- in school building College Students, Teachers and Social Workers are welcome! Please email your resume to hrm@iraiseinc.org
11233.title: School Mentor Specialist

11233.description: The community and Brooklyn Public Library needs you. If you are a leader, having leadership experience, and can work with minimal supervision, becoming an executive on our Friends Group Board will be excellent for you. We will be the backbone of Saratoga Branch Library AND Spring Creek Library ; position will last at least 1 year. STATUS Executives will work sporadically; a lot of work will be from home or via virtual teams. You must come to mandatory meeting, at least 6 per year. Position Description : Board needed includes: vice president, treasurer and secretary. * This description is general and more specific duties will be discussed * Data entry, volunteer hours tracking * Website content management and editing * Event planning and management , possibly * Event promotion * Grant writing and organization , depending on position * Strong communication skills (verbal and written). * Strong attention to detail. * Able to listen and communicate effectively with community members of diverse backgrounds. * Dependable and punctual. * Self-directed and willing to take initiative. * Computer literate (familiar with Microsoft Office suite). * Currently seeking volunteers at least 16 years of age. Volunteer Benefits * Training and experience with managerial, back-end, and administrative procedures. * Opportunity to meet new people and help enhance Brooklyn neighborhoods. * Networking and community building opportunities. * Gain an awesome reference working with the Brooklyn Public Library and BkMSCC. Location: Saratoga Library, Home based, & At office in Ocean Hill, Possible Event Outings
11233.title: LIBRARY FIENDS GROUP EXECUTIVE BOARD - Saratoga Branch

11233.description: Are you an aspiring photographer who enjoys taking pictures? If so, we are looking for someone just like you! This is a great opportunity to do what you love while giving back to the community.
11233.title: Photographer

11234.description: Non -profit organization seeks to provide young children with exposure to the ARTS. Volunteers needed to give at leasts 30 minutes a week to impart their skills at the child development center.
11234.title: Use your artistic skills to impact the lives of young children.

11234.description: We are looking for young men and women, age 12 to 18 to join our Cadet Program. The program is partnered with the United States Air Force and its main goals are to promote leadership, good citizenship, aerospace education and staying free of drugs among today's youth. We are NOT a military program. Yes, we do instill discipline, integrity, and respect, but we do not bare arms or serve as a recruiting tool for the armed forces. The involvement of the USAF is limited. However, we do wear Air Force style uniforms, follow their customs and courtesies, drill and movements, attend events sponsored by the Air Force and promote their basic core values of Integrity, Service Before Self, and Excellence. We meet on 2nd, 3rd and 4th Saturdays of each month from 10:30am to 2:30pm.
11234.title: Cadets
11234.org: Civil Air Patrol - Floyd Bennett Composite Squadron

11234.description: We are seeking individuals to join our organization for the purpose of performing Search & Rescue and Disaster Relief. Civil Air Patrol is responsible for over 90% of all inland Search And Rescue in the United States as tasked by the US Air Force. We utilize air and ground teams as well as communications and mission base staff personnel to accomplish those missions. CAP is also tasked to provide Disaster Relief and were mobilized to assist in the wake of Hurricanes Katrina and Rita in 2005. Our airplane was the first non-military aircraft to take to the sky after 9/11 when we were tasked with photo reconnaisance of Ground Zero for FEMA and SEMO. If you are the type of person who wants a chance to save lives and make a difference in this world, We've Been Waiting for You! We meet every 2nd, 3rd and 4th Saturday of each month from 10:00am to 3:00pm. Majority of your training will be in the field and at mission bases and on various weekends. You will not have to attend every squadron meeting to be active in the program.
11234.title: Emergency Services
11234.org: Civil Air Patrol - Floyd Bennett Composite Squadron

11234.description: We are seeking members to join the Civil Air Patrol in the capacity of Cadet Program Officers. Our organization works with male and female cadets age 12 to 21 and focuses on developing them physically, mentally, and socially through a challenging leadership program. Military drill, customs and courtesies, summer programs, knowledge bowls, aerospace education, search and rescue, disaster relief and moral leadership are just a few of the programs our cadets participate in throughout their careers. Become a mentor to these overachievers! Become someone who's made a difference in a young man/woman's life. No experience in military or education is necessary. We train!
11234.title: Cadet Program Officers
11234.org: Civil Air Patrol - Floyd Bennett Composite Squadron

11235.description: Purpose The ability to understand English is an important skill at any age. It’s never too late to learn! Facilitate a class that allows seniors to practice speaking, reading and writing English. Responsibilities Lead a weekly class in ESL (English as a Second Language) Create lessons suitable for people with varying knowledge of English Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills Experience teaching ESL Experience working with seniors is helpful, but not required Good organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks Strong communication skills Patience Knowledge of Spanish is helpful, but not required Comfort leading a group of varying levels Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week during business hours Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11235.title: ESL Instructor - JASA Manhattan Beach Senior Center

11235.description: Visit a homebound senior in the area of COney Island and Brighton Beach. You can volunteer and make a real difference in a homebound individuals life in so many different ways. We are a dynamic and diverse group of volunteers or Friendly Visitors who visit homebound individual in their area each week. Every member of our team is willing and eager to share their time with someone who is older, wiser, and has had a lifetime of experience. Our visitors come from all ages and stages of life, which allows the matching process to be flexible and accommodating to both homebound individuals and friendly visitors preferences.
11235.title: Senior Visiting in Coney Island/Brighton Beach
11235.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11235.description: Looking for volutneers who are able to commmit to the program to visit lovely seniors in the Coney Island-Brighton Beach area. Our seniors come from all walks of life and crave social contact since they are homeboud.
11235.title: Senior Visits in Coney Island
11235.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11235.description: What a way to kick off your new year’s resolutions by volunteering to visit a homebound senior in your area. These seniors desperately need the human contact and socialization and WE need YOU to help us do that! Trust me on this....volunteering with seniors is a life-changing experience - even for the volunteer! Your energy, enthusiasm, time, and skills truly have the power to change how these seniors live day to day- and at the same time you’re likely to find that the experience is changing you too. You’ll be giving much of yourself, but you’ll receive much in return!
11235.title: Senior Socialization-Give a senior a reason to smile!
11235.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

Responsibilities * Answer and direct phone calls * Assist with filing & copying * Assist with registration * Additional volunteer duties as assigned Skills * Handle confidential files securely * Ability to work independently and as part of a team * Good organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks * Strong communication skills Other * Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week, weekday afternoons * Ongoing opportunity * Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.

11235.description: Purpose Regular exercise is an essential part of a healthy lifestyle. Lead a weekly exercise class for seniors to help keep them in top shape. 11701.description: PAC - Office Assistant (14 hours per week) Mon -Fri - 9:30am-1:30pm About the position: We are seeking dedicated self-starters to work with the CEO of Parent Action Community Inc.(PAC) in Amityville NY. We offer a welcoming work environment and the ability to learn and grow in a supportive atmosphere. As the office Assistant, you will be a part of having an impact on the Amityville and surrounding community with a non-profit organization. About Parent Action Community: Parent Action Community (PAC) was established in 2005 by parents concerned with the behavior and condition of today's youth. We are a fully-accredited 501(c) (3) charity equipping young adults for the responsibility of leadership. PAC’s goals are to Equip, Empower, and Educate \"At-Risk\" Youth And Young Adults between the ages of 13 and 24. We develop their Knowledge, Personal Skills, and Motivation to Reduce Adolescent Pregnancies, High School Dropout Rates, Sexually Transmitted Diseases, including HIV/AIDS, Substance Abuse, Juvenile Delinquencies, and Reduction In Crimes through a Comprehensive, Community-Wide Collaborative Effort to Improve Academic Achievement in order to be Career and College-prepared. Our Volunteers have a unique opportunity to gain valuable campaigning and nonprofit experience, cultivate your interests in social equality, strengthen your understanding of a fast-paced campaign organization, and gain critical organization skills and experience. PAC’s reputation of providing services to the Amityville and surrounding community has grown over the last 10 years. We are looking to expand the organization and programs in the future. The role of Office assistant is to support the organization by overseeing the office during High School Diploma program, the distribution center and the tutoring programs. The Office Assistant will be responsible for the following: Preparing weekly reports on the activities in the PAC center during their volunteer hours. Ensure that all visitors sign in and complete a PAC \"in-need\" form. Prepare a weekly report on visitors. Prepare a weekly report on items that PAC was unable to supply. Preparing weekly reports on volunteer hours. Track number of program recipients. Provide a weekly report on attendance Prepare a monthly report for the CEO Review all Outgoing correspondences Qualifications: * Demonstrated commitment to Youth and Community projects; * Excellent written and verbal communication skills; * Good organizational skills, attention to detail, professional demeanor and the ability to juggle several tasks while meeting deadlines; * Experience or interest in non-profits an advantage;
11701.title: Volunteer Office Assistant

No experience is required. This position offers the opportunity to teach all levels of ESL, and provide administrative support to our office management. Main duties: * Teaching Weekly English lessons to youth and adults of other Language (All levels) and developing lesson plans and assessing learning progress of program participants * Evaluate and report progress in English proficiency of ESL participants * Tutoring High School Equivalency Program participants with their English homework for Advanced ESL Participants * Supporting office staff with ESL-related tasks, eg: translating for participants, English documents and website to other languages. * Assist with community outreach activities as needed Preferred: ESL Certified Instructor but not required Website: www.pac4success.org

11701.description: Parent Action Community Inc. Volunteer Board Members REPORTS TO: Board President/Founder Qualifications & Skills: Knowledge and skills in one or more areas of board governance: policy, legal, financial management, program development, information technology, marketing, education, counseling volunteer management, grant writing, fundraising and/or human resources. Good communication and writing skills. Length of term: Board of Directors are elected by the membership at the Annual general meeting. Board of Directors serve for a two-year term. Board of Directors may be re-elected for two additional terms. Meetings and Time Commitment: The board of directors meets September through June on the second Thursday of the month, from 6pm to 8pm. Committees in the board meet an average of four times per year, pending their respective work agenda. Board members are asked to attend no less than two special events or meetings per year, as they are determined. Board members are required to donate a minimum of 10 hours per month (as necessary) to the agency. This includes meetings, events and workshops. Expectations of board members: To establish the organization's mission, vision, and direction. To ensure the financial health of the organization. To ensure the organization has sufficient and appropriate human resources. Secure adequate funding. Maintain & update long-range strategic plan. Represent the organization to the public, private and business sectors. Attend and participate in meetings on a regular basis, and special events as well. Be aware and abstain from any conflict of interest. Participate on a standing committee of the board, and serve on ad-hoc committees as necessary. Be alert to community concerns that can be addressed by PAC mission, objectives, and programs. Help communicate and promote PAC mission and programs to the community. Donate significant fiscal contribution to the agency, either through personal means, by hosting an event, or by soliciting contributions from other sources (i.e., friends, businesses, community organizations, foundations, corporations, banks, etc.) If interested, please submit your resume to Johanna DeJesus, Organizational Development Consultant via pac4success@outlook.com. As soon as your resume is reviewed by PAC board, you will receive a board membership application for further consideration. Thank you! PAC’s website: www.pac4success.org
11701.title: Volunteer Board Member

Mission: To Equip, Empower, and Educate \"At-Risk\" Youth And Young Adults between the ages of 13 and 24. We develop their Knowledge, Personal Skills, and Motivation to Reduce Adolescent Pregnancies, High School Dropout Rates, Sexually Transmitted Diseases, including HIV/AIDS, Substance Abuse, Juvenile Delinquencies, and Reduction In Crimes through a Comprehensive, Community-Wide Collaborative Effort to Improve Academic Achievement in order to be Career and College-prepared. To learn more about us, visit: www.pac4success.org or email info@pac4success.org Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Parent-Action-Community-Inc/162667877128402

11218.description: GallopNYC uses therapeutic horsemanship to help riders walk, talk, connect, focus, behave and learn, inspiring each one to live life as fully, productively and independently as possible. 07201.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. 07201.description: Are you interested in helping a child have a voice? In becoming a CASA volunteer you will become the voice for a child in a court proceeding, which often overlooks the wants, needs and desires of the child. Every year more than half a million abused and neglected children are in need of safe, permanent, nurturing homes. Too many spend years moving from one temporary home to another. They are more likely than other children to face homelessness, unemployment, even prison as adults. That's why Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA) for children are important. CASA was created to make sure the abuse and neglect these children originally suffered at home doesn't continue as abuse and neglect at the hands of the system. As trained advocates, CASA volunteers are appointed by judges to be a voice for these children in court. The result is that a child is placed into a safe, loving home where he/she can thrive. CASA of Union County is currently recruiting for our Spring 2017 class of volunteer advocates. These volunteers will receive intensive training to equip them with the knowledge and skills necessary to navigate their way through the court and child welfare systems. They will learn how to advocate for the best interest of children and make sure that the children receive the services and assistance necessary to ensure that they move as quickly as possible toward safe and permanent homes. Please note: No legal or social service experience is required, but you must be 21 years of age. The CASA training is approximately thirty hours, and the volunteer is required to make an eighteen month commitment. By law, volunteers must have a full criminal background check and fingerprint check, as well as a screening interview before beginning training. We are especially in need of bilingual - particularly Spanish-speaking - volunteers. Information about upcoming info sessions and the training schedule are available on our website: www.casaofunioncounty.org. If you would like more information about how to join our Fall class of volunteer advocates (or a future class) please contact Courtney Green at cgreen@casaofunioncounty.org.

Each week we will introduce a new topic that will help you make a connection and develop a conversation. Conversations and Connections! We are seeking native English speaking volunteers to spend 90 minutes with a non-native English speaking student. We request only female volunteers apply for this opportunity. VOLUNTEER TIPS TO SUCCESS: As a conversation partner, your main role is to facilitate conversation practice. You are not expected to function as an ESL teacher. Your aim will be to give your student ample speaking practice. Help your student build confidence in expressing their thoughts. A flowing communication of ideas is more important than accurate English usage. Consider these tips to become an effective conversation partner. · Speak at a natural pace · Elaborate on topics · Minimize error correction · Include everyone · Monitor native language use · Have fun!

07206.description: NJPC is seeking a paralegal or pro bono attorney, and/or student of law to volunteer (Either in our office or virtual) to help us in reforming the Juvenile Justice System by ending the process of waiving youth 15-17 years of age to the adult prison system, ending solitary confinement for youth, ending the process of transering youth adjudicated delinquent to the adult system without due process and reducing racial and ethnic disparities in NJ's juvenile justice system. NJPC has recently published a data brief - The Incarceration of Children & Youth in New Jersey’s Adult Prison System: New Jersey Youth Justice Initiative - of 472 children and youth, ages 14 to 17, who were waived, sentenced and incarcerated in New Jersey’s adult prison system between 2007 - 2015. NJPC is also interested in having the volunteer help prepare litigations in reference to the brief. The Brief was published nationally and showed:  Gross racial and ethnic disparities: approximately 90% are youth of color; 72% are African American males.  Justice by geography: Rates of incarceration in the adult prison system vary significantly across counties in New Jersey, suggesting that justice depends on where one lives, not on the facts of a given case.  Youth are regularly deprived of due process: Approximately 30% of the 472 youth waived to adult court during the study period spent more than 2 years incarcerated, between their arrest date and their sentencing date, violating their right to a speedy trial.  Youth are regularly put in solitary confinement - especially youth with mental health disorders: Although solitary confinement is known to be psychologically damaging, especially to children, 53% of these youth spent a total of approximately 15,359 days (42 years) in solitary confinement between 2010 and 2015; 5 percent spend over a year there, and about 4 percent spent 2 years or more in solitary. Nearly 70 percent of those placed in solitary had a mental health disorder, with nearly 37% having two or more diagnoses.  Youth suffer abuse while in adult prison: once incarcerated in an adult prison, one in four youth surveyed reported physical abuse; 5% reported sexual abuse. NJPC has also published the first family guide to Navigating the Juvenile Justic: System in New Jersey: A Family GUide which was published nationally.
07206.title: NJPC Youth Justice Initiative: Legal Expertise Needed To Help Reform the Juvenile Justice System

07206.description: NJPC is currently seeking a volunteer for the NJ Youth Justice Initiative which seeks to end the (1) practice of solitary confinement for juveniles (2) practice of trying, sentencing and incarcerating youth, as young as 14, in the adult prison system in the state of New Jersey (3) practice of sending juveniles who turn age 18 in a juvenile facility to the adult prison system without due process and (4) inability for children and youth with special emotional and behavioral challenges to receive appropriate educational supports under federal IDEA law which should be provided to those children who are part of the special education system and IEP process. Volunteer would be responsible for speaking to parents of children currently incarcerated in the adult prison system to collect further data on their children's demographics, system involvement, education, etc; correspond with incarcerated youth; attend monthly task force meetings; coordinate and attend legislative meetings; review correspondence with children currently incarcerated; correspond/speak with parents of children incarcerated; work with advisory committee to develop press releases, case studies and brochures, and research federal IDEA law for those who were involved in the special education system prior to incarceration.
