07207.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07207.title: Companion Hospice Volunteers - Elizabeth

07207.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe, comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers.
07207.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice - Elizabeth

07207.description: Ascend Hospice Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients ; mind, body and soul.
07207.title: Hospice Musicians - Elizabeth

07207.description: This is your opportunity to help non-native English speaking citizens practice conversational English. Each week we will introduce a new topic that will help you make a connection and develop a conversation. Conversations and Connections! We are seeking native English speaking volunteers to spend 90 minutes with a non-native English speaking student. VOLUNTEER TIPS TO SUCCESS: As a conversation partner, your main role is to facilitate conversation practice. You are not expected to function as an ESL teacher. Your aim will be to give your student ample speaking practice. Help your student build confidence in expressing their thoughts. A flowing communication of ideas is more important than accurate English usage. Consider these tips to become an effective conversation partner. Speak at a natural pace Elaborate on topics Minimize error correction Include everyone Monitor native language use Have fun! The agency requests only female volunteers to help teach the women participating in the course. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07207.title: Conversations and Connections in Elizabeth

07207.description: The Patient Navigator serves as a contact person to those who have been recently diagnosed with cancer and is currently receiving treatment at a local hospital. The Patient Navigator is trained on how to guide the person through their cancer journey. The Patient Navigator ensures that the person’s needs are met through their initial contact, and provides additional support and information regarding community resources, programs, and services, basic cancer information. The Patient Navigator does not address the medical needs of the patient, rather they serve as a resource to guide them to the proper referral source. No medical advice is given to the patient and/or their caregiver.
07207.title: Patient Navigator

07207.description: Would you like to help ease a family members worry? Why not become an Operating Room Liaison in our new Ambulatory Surgery Center? You will be the person to relay information to family members regarding their loved ones who are undergoing a procedure at Trinitas Regional Medical Center. You will provide compassionate support, reading materials, coffee or tea. Requirements are limited to those who are compassionate.
07207.title: OR Liaison

07207.description: Hospitalization can be overwhelming. That's why we've created this new Volunteer Opportunity. Your responsibilities will include; visiting patients, orienting patients to their surroundings, troubleshooting minor issues, lending a supportive ear. Make a difference for our patients. Be a hero.
07207.title: Volunteer Patient Advocate

07207.description: Do you love to read? Would you like to make a difference in a child's life? Trinitas Hospital participates in the national literacy program - REACH OUT AND READ. The goal of the program is to promote literacy among children between the ages of 6 months and five years. Please, offer to make a difference in a child's life - offer to volunteer to host a story hour at our Pediatric Clinic. YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE.
07207.title: Readers Needed!

07207.description: Are you kind and compassionate? Do you have a great outlook on life? If so, we need you. Volunteers are needed to provide companionship to out-patients as they receive treatment in our brand new, state-of-the-art Cancer Center. You will lend an ear, offer refreshments and give patients hope for a positive outcome! Contact us today!
07207.title: Loving Volunteers Needed for Cancer Survivors

07207.description: The Supervised Visitation Program was established by legislation to provide a forum for children and non-custodial parents to develop or re-establish ongoing familial relationships in a safe environment. The program affords the non-custodial parent the opportunity to spend time with his/her child(ren) in a neutral setting without interference from the custodial parent or other interested parties. The program provides children the opportunity to establish a normal, healthy relationship with the non-custodial parent. Specially trained volunteers and student interns oversee the visits to observe interaction between the child(ren) and parent/guardian and to maintain a safe environment. Each volunteer is assigned a case that runs once a week for 12 week periods. Visits are held usually on a Thursday evenings at the Union County Courthouse Annex or on Saturday Mornings at a community site.
07207.title: Supervised Visitation Program

07207.description: The Juvenile Conference Committees (JCCs) serve under the authority of the Family Division of Superior Court. A JCC is a six to nine member citizen volunteer panel appointed by the Family Division Judge. In a confidential setting, JCC panels hear and decide matters involving alleged juvenile offenders. The juvenile, parent(s) and or guardian(s) and complainant are invited to discuss the offense and related matters with the Committee. The JCC considers the facts, and makes recommendations to the judge for a resolution that would aid in the juvenile's rehabilitation. The program is designed to divert juveniles charged with first or second degree minor offenses to their local JCC, which acts as a community-based arm of the Family Court. Charges that may be heard by the JCC include, but are not limited to: shoplifting, simple assault, attempted theft or theft, criminal mischief, criminal trespass, receiving stolen property and disorderly persons offenses. Program volunteers are required to complete mandatory program-specific training. Volunteers must live in the town in which they serve. High School Students are also sought for this program. We will be placing 1 high school student per town on each committee.
07207.title: Juvenile Conference Committee

07207.description: Child Placement Review (CPR) is a legislatively mandated judicial volunteer program in the Family Division. Boards are comprised of court-appointed citizen volunteers who monitor the cases of all children who are placed outside their homes by the Division of Youth and Family Services. Review Board members monitor the timeliness of case movement, examine case plans, and conduct in-person interviews of involved parties in order to provide judges with recommendations to assist in the critical decision-making process. (Boards are mandated to assess each case from the point of view of the best interest of the child.) The Board's recommendations embrace issues such as how the case is managed and how quickly the child achieves permanency. Review Board members are required to complete mandatory program-specific training.
07207.title: Child Placement Review Board

07205.description: Marketplace in Hillside is a project dedicated to battling hunger and poverty in our community. The Community FoodBank of New Jersey provides a meaningful volunteer experience in a positive, safe environment that is perfect for individuals, families, and groups of almost any size. Each year the FoodBank relies on more than 25,000 volunteers. Volunteer today and make a measurable difference in the lives of many by, helping sort and organize the food pantry, and package the items for distribution to needy families. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07205.title: Marketplace in Hillside

11021.description: The Village of Great Neck Plaza is seeking volunteers to assist on its Senior Span Program, which provides projects and programs for our senior citizens. We are looking for volunteers to \"Call a Friend,\" making contact with one of our shut in seniors for companionship and friendship. Other similar tasks need volunteers, such as helping a senior with an arts & craft project, reading poetry to seniors, assiting in errands, etc. There are also seminars held regularly at Village Hall. Each seminar is on a separate topic focusing on health, nutrition, aging issues, managing finances, and general senior education. Candidates must have professional expertise in an area and be comfortable with public speaking. For further information, please contact Mayor's Assistant, at (516) 482-4500, or mayorsassistant@greatneckplaza.net.
11021.title: Senior Span Volunteers

11023.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
11023.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Great Neck NY

06820.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE PLEASE NOTE: THIS OPPORTUNITY IS NOT AVAILABLE IN RHODE ISLAND. Volunteers must be able to commit to weekday, daytime hours as your schedule allows. A full blood drive volunteer shift is 5-6 hours. Provide excellent and enthusiastic customer service to enhance the blood donor experience. Engage with blood donors to make the donation experience fulfilling and set the stage for a long-term commitment to regular blood donations. Understand the American Red Cross core mission, vision and values, and represent these values through the delivery of excellent customer service. OPEN TIME DAYS Flexible; preferred commitment: 1 shift/month;approximately 5hrs/shift; daytime, weekday availability required. ｠Shifts are available in the morning and afternoon hours and sometimes extend into early evening hours. ｠ REQUIRED TRAINING ｷ｠｠｠｠｠｠｠｠ Orientation to American Red Cross ｷ｠｠｠｠｠｠｠｠ Donor Ambassador training
06820.title: Donor Ambassador at Blood Drives: BIO: Blood Drive Donor Ambassador
06820.org: American Red Cross - Connecticut and Rhode Island Region

06820.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE This is two local level mutually supporting leadership positions: Local Level Representative or Deputy Representative. These positions are responsible for supporting coordination between the Red Cross and VA Health Care Facilities in the local area. OPEN TIME DAYS Established by the local Red Cross unit REQUIRED TRAINING • Orientation to the American Red Cross • VAVS Orientation at the local VA • Specific job related training provided by the VAVS Program Manager • VAVS related on the job training provided by the local Red Cross
06820.title: Contribute to the quality of life for those who have served our nation by volunteering at your local
06820.org: American Red Cross - Connecticut and Rhode Island Region

06820.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE *THIS POSITION IS LOCATED OUT OF OUR BRIDGEPORT OFFICE* Under the leadership of the Coordinator of Disaster Volunteers, supports the on-boarding, development, training and support of territory disaster volunteers. OPEN TIME DAYS Flexible 5-10 hours a week REQUIRED TRAINING Required DSO Recommended Disaster Frontline Supervisor/Simulation
06820.title: Help support volunteers in various disaster roles to make them more successful and engaged in their
06820.org: American Red Cross - Connecticut and Rhode Island Region

06820.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE Locally coordinate all aspects of Home Fire Preparedness Campaign program planning and implementation. Assist with coordinating activities in advance and on the day of an event. Its goal is to reduce the rate of deaths and injuries due to home fires by 25 percent over 5 years. Its strategy includes participating in a community coalition that targets neighborhoods at-risk for home fires; installs and tests smoke alarms; and provides fire safety and disaster preparedness education/planning. OPEN TIME DAYS 8 hours per week (may increase near a scheduled event.) REQUIRED TRAINING • American Red Cross Volunteer Orientation • Disaster Services: An Overview (optional) • Home Fire Preparedness Campaign Guidance and Training: Safety for Home Visits, Fire Safety and｠ Disaster Education, and other required training.
06820.title: Save Lives by Helping Manage the Home Fire Campaign in your Community! : Home Fire Campaign - Local
06820.org: American Red Cross - Connecticut and Rhode Island Region

06820.description: An Hour a Week is Good for the Soul and that's all it takes to spread some good cheer. One hour of reading for this legally blind lady will make this lady's day special. If you are available between 10 and noon on Monday, Tuesday or Thursday, or Saturday/Sunday before 2 p.m., this is the spot for you. Requirements to be a good volunter: a desire to help others; a pleasant demeanor; a good reading/speaking voice; average reading skills; organizational or planning abilities; a good driving record; a clear criminal history; two references access to a car with proof of insurance;
06820.title: An Hour a Week is Good for the Soul
06820.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

06820.description: P2P Darien has a team of \"van volunteers\" who expertly visit various organizations and stores to pick up and deliver donated merchandise. We are seeking people to join this great group of P2P ambassadors! Volunteers are needed Monday through Friday mornings from 9-12. Must be able to lift at least 50lbs! Our team meets up at P2P then heads out with an organized 'to-do' list. You'll visit local schools, stores, and community organizations. Make a difference - help us get valuable resources to those in need. No special driver's license required.
06820.title: Help us run errands -Join our Van Crew team!

06820.description: P2P Darien has a team of dedicated and savvy volunteers who visit the CT Food Bank in Stamford and Fairfield weekly to shop and supply our Food Pantry. Get ready to sort through an assortment of wonderful food (perishable and non-perishable) to find what we need to serve our clients. It takes about 2 hours to complete the shop and return to P2P in Darien where our team unloads and sorts. Volunteers are needed weekday mornings.
06820.title: Shop Weekly at the Connecticut Food Bank!

06820.description: Help your neighbors in need! Person-to-Person's reception volunteers work as a team of 4 from 9 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. or 12:30 - 4 p.m. on weekdays. P2P requires a weekly commitment to volunteer in Reception in order to best serve our clients. Reception volunteers will greet clients, donors and guests. Volunteers also assist social service agencies with requests and appointments. Exceptional customer service skills and computer literacy, a must! Ability to speak Spanish or Creole, a plus!
06820.title: Service with a Smile - Receptionist

06820.description: Person-to-Person is looking for high school age volunteers to join our Youth Group! High school students are welcome to join us weekly on Thursdays from 4 - 6 p.m. and Saturday mornings from 9 a.m. - 12 p.m. during the school year. Students may volunteer for all or part of the time. Students from many different local high schools make up our Youth Group. Volunteers will have the opportunity to assist in the clothing center, sort food in the pantry, make appointments for clients, and interact with donors. If you are interested, please contact Janet King at janetking@p2pHelps.org.
06820.title: High School Student Volunteer Opportunity!

06820.description: Provide companionship and support for Darien seniors who would like more socialization. Willingness to visit with senior and share activities such as: reading aloud, playing games, cards, watching television together, doing puzzles or simply having a conversation. Must have own transportation.
06820.title: Friendly Visitor

06820.description: Provide seniors who need help with small tasks in their home. Perform small chores around the house such as: changing a light bulb or battery, watering plants. Must have own transportation.
06820.title: Friendly Helper

06820.description: Help drive Darien seniors to appointments during hours and/or locations not covered by At Home In Darien service. Help seniors safely to and from the car. Clean and valid driver's license and personal vehicle needed as well as auto insurance with a minimum coverage of $500,000.
06820.title: Friendly Driver

06820.description: Help homebound seniors with grocery shopping. Volunteer will go to the senior's home according to agreed upon date and time, picks up grocery list and money. Volunteer will do shopping, return with groceries, receipt and any change and help put groceries away.
06820.title: Friendly Shopper

06820.description: Person-to-Person’s Food Pantry supplies families in need with emergency food. Our families are referred by over 20 social service agencies in the community or by one of our six social workers. Volunteers stock the shelves and pack food orders according to shopping lists, based on the Food Pyramid. Volunteers are also involved in organizing food drives at local schools, churches and synagogues and sorting the food received in bulk after delivery. Volunteers coordinate the delivery of bread, meat and produce from local suppliers. Volunteer hours vary, but are flexible.
06820.title: Food Pantry Volunteer

06820.description: Person-to-Person’s Clothing Center provides donated clothing and small household goods to clients. Six clients visit the clothing center every half hour to shop. Volunteers greet donors and clients, receive donations and give receipts to donors. Volunteers sort and hang clothing and maintain the organization and cleanliness of the Clothing Center. Volunteer hours vary, but are flexible.
06820.title: Clothing Center Volunteer

07924.description: Make new friends and do your part to help make NJ a better place for people and wildlife! Help lead nature hikes, enter critical database info, assist with mailings or grounds maintenance, welcome visitors to our festival booth, or help with our website... your special skill is just what we need to help us achieve our mission. The map shows our Bernardsville HQ but we need your help all over NJ at our statewide offices and nature centers! Please visit the volunteer page of our website and apply today at: http://www.njaudubon.org/SectionAboutNJAS/VolunteerOpportunities.aspx
07924.title: Help Keep NJ Green with NJ Audubon       Year-Round Opportunities!

07924.description: St. Hubert's Animal welfare center has cats available for adpotion in the Bernardsville Petvalu who need daily care and socialization. This is provided by the volunteers who sign up for weekly reocurring shifts to care for these animals. Volunteers must be 18 years or older and available for 2 hours a week.
07924.title: Cat Volunteers in Bernardsville

07922.description: The Volunteer Leadership Intern program is an ideal opportunity for high school or college age students. You'll receive leadership training and mentoring experience while working in a science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) summer enrichment program. Interns are introduced to intellectual property and entrepreneurial concepts, receive 40 service learning hours and a letter of recognition from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office for completing the program. What is Camp Invention? Glad you asked! Camp Invention is where imaginations get their rocket fuel! This summer’s all-new curriculum allows children in kindergarten through 6th grade to experience real-world problem solving and creative thinking as they transform a distant exoplanet, take risks as future entrepreneurs, blast rockets and rubber chickens, and wire a circuit to create their own Spy Gadget Alarm Box! Local educators lead a week of hands-on STEM activities that will launch any child's imagination. Want to find a location near you? Visit http://www.invent.org/inspire/leadership-intern-program-10th-12th-college/
07922.title: Camp Invention Leadership Intern

07922.description: Volunteer today and join an amazing group of seniors for a fun filled afternoon. Activities include assisting approximately 20 seniors who have limited mobility: Play games Transporting seniors from their residence to the game room Socializing and cleaning up after the project On special occasions an entertainer may override games and volunteers will be asked to socialize with the residents to ensure their spirits are lifted. When you arrive you will be led to the 3rd floor dining area but first register at jerseycares.org to recieve the address details and the name of the contact information for the volunteer leader. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07922.title: Games Galore  and More in Berkeley Heights

07928.description: A visitor is needed to provide companionship to a patient with a life-limiting illness. Visits may be scheduled according to your availabilty and would be 1-2 hours in length. We are grateful for any time you can give. Become an important part the Kindred Hospice team which is a group of skilled, compassionate people who dedicate their time to a truly noble cause. Free training is provided. For more information contact Elaine.Carlsen@gentiva.com or call 888-556-8880 today.
07928.title: Chatham area: Friendly Visitor Needed

07928.description: Work with staff from Great Swamp Outdoor Education Center or Pyramid Mountain on programs and events, leading hikes or operating the visitors centers.
07928.title: Outdoor Education

10532.description: Our Westchester campus has three programs: Hawthorne Cedar Knolls Treatment Center, The Jerome M. Goldsmith Center for Adolescent Treatment (RTF) & The Sally & Anthony Mann Center (RTF). Each program provides residential mental health treatment for adolescents and young adults, ages 12-22. We are looking for volunteers with licensed pet therapy animals to visit our campus to spend some quality time with our teen residents. Spending time with animals is an incredibly therapeutic activity for our residents, and rain or shine, it is always a great way to make them smile.
10532.title: Pet Therapist - Westchester (Hawthorne)
10532.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10532.description: Our Westchester campus has three programs: Hawthorne Cedar Knolls Treatment Center, The Jerome M. Goldsmith Center for Adolescent Treatment (RTF) & The Sally & Anthony Mann Center (RTF). Each program provides residential treatment for adolescents and young adults, ages 12-22. Adolescents participate in intensive milieu therapy, individual, family, and group psychotherapy, pharmacotherapy, special education and vocational training, all in an open setting. As a GED Tutor, you will help our teens one-to-one or in a small group setting to assist them in passing the GED exam. Volunteers needed on Mondays from 5-6pm.
10532.title: GED Tutor- Westchester
10532.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10532.description: Our Westchester campus has three programs: Hawthorne Cedar Knolls Treatment Center, The Jerome M. Goldsmith Center for Adolescent Treatment (RTF) & The Sally & Anthony Mann Center (RTF). Each program provides residential treatment for adolescents and young adults, ages 12-22. Adolescents participate in intensive milieu therapy, individual, family, and group psychotherapy, pharmacotherapy, special education and vocational training, all in an open setting. Do you do what you love? Do you have hobbies and passions that can translate into skills for our teens? As a Team Activity Leader, you will be able to turn a hobby or passion into a unique and rewarding volunteer opportunity. We are looking for volunteers (individual or group) that are interested in working with teens and teaching them that a passion such as music, cosmetology, dance, arts visual or performing arts, or cooking. These are valuable skills for our teen clients to develop, and you may even help one of our clients discover a new lifelong passion of their own.
10532.title: Activity Specialist - Westchester
10532.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10532.description: Our Westchester campus has three programs: Hawthorne Cedar Knolls Treatment Center, The Jerome M. Goldsmith Center for Adolescent Treatment & The Sally & Anthony Mann Center. Each program provides residential treatment for adolescents and young adults, ages 12-22. Adolescents participate in intensive milieu therapy, individual, family, and group psychotherapy, pharmacotherapy, special education and vocational training, all in an open setting. We are looking for volunteers to collaborate with us and run a donation drive for the adolescent and adult residents of our Westchester campus programs. They are always very grateful for new clothing, bedding and toiletries, as well as batteries, electronic devices, gift cards, ports/theater event tickets or museum passes. We will collaborate with you to create a timeline, goal, and techniques on how to reach out for donations. This is a one-time group opportunity that is great for families or community groups; schedule is dependent on the agreed-upon length of the donation drive. The donations will go towards our three Westchester campus programs, but the donation drive can occur anywhere in the five boroughs or Westchester.
10532.title: Run a Donation Drive- Westchester
10532.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10532.description: The Jewish Board's Westchester campus has three programs: Hawthorne Cedar Knolls Treatment Center, The Jerome M. Goldsmith Center for Adolescent Treatment & The Sally & Anthony Mann Center. Each program provides residential treatment for adolescents and young adults ages 12-22. Adolescents participate in intensive milieu therapy, individual, family, and group psychotherapy, pharmacotherapy, special education and vocational training, all in an open setting. As a Holiday Party or Special Event host, you could invite your family, friends or coworkers to help throw a fun pizza party, game night or holiday party at our Westchester Campus. Or, perhaps you have a favorite movie you would like to watch with our students and facilitate a meaningful discussion group (about storyline, conflicts, characters, etc.). The possibilities are endless, and we will collaborate with you to assist with planning your event. This is a one-time group opportunity that is great for families, groups of friends, or community organizations.
10532.title: Host a Holiday Party or Special Event- Westchester
10532.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10536.description: Year-round volunteer opportunities include: Delivering tours of the historic house to the public Greeting visitors in our Carriage Barn Education & Visitor Center Assisting visitors with purchases in our Gift Shop Assisting with programs for school children Completing historic research Working with historic collections and archives
10536.title: Bring History to Life at the John Jay Historic Homestead
10536.org: John Jay Historic Homestead State Historic Site

10536.description: Requiring a commitment of approximately 3 hours per month, Stepping Stones seeks volunteer docents to lead guests through the guided tour of the National Historic Landmark's house and grounds. A successful applicant will be trained and provided with supporting literature. Docents are asked to consider a commitment of 2 years, as it takes a while to get fully comfortable with touring and the subject matter. Need not be in recovery, but sensitivity to the issue is a must.
10536.title: Tour Guide/Docent
10536.org: Stepping Stones - The Historic Home of Bill and Lois Wilson

07726.description: **NEW - ORIENTATION IS IN PRINCETON, NJ ON JULY 16th! APPLY NOW TO RESERVE A SEAT AT THE ORIENTATION!** ACCEPTING ONLY 10 MORE STUDENTS FOR NEW 2017 CLASS REGISTER BEFORE JUNE 30th, 2017 The Advanced Clinical Triage Squad (ACTS) consists of talented students in New Jersey who are prepared with the knowledge to quickly act in traumatic medical emergencies. The ACT squad accepts candidates year-round on an ongoing basis. EMRs. Who We Are. What We Do. Emergency Medical Responders (EMRs) are elite trained and certified personnel equipped with basic life support skills, event medicine experience, and trauma skills with a mastery in triage. Any current high school student is welcome to apply for free ACTS training, however, the application process is very selective. All candidates undergo a rigorous medical boot camp, the exact curriculum can be viewed at apply.actsquad.org After successful completion of the free ASHI training program, the standardized written exam (Part 1), and the psychomotor assessment (Part 2), the applicant will be certified as an official recognized Emergency Medical Responder with the Advanced Clinical Triage Squad. To learn more about the Advanced Clinical Triage Squad , visit actsquad.org Please submit to us your full name, currently enrolled high school, date of birth, phone number, email, and your reason for volunteering with us. REQUIREMENTS: Must be a current high school student. Must possess Basic Life Support (BLS) or CPR at the Professional Rescuer Level Certification by either the AHA, ASHI, or NSC. Regular CPR certification is not accepted. As a volunteer applicant, you are eligible to receive a discount of $40 off BLS certification if you choose to receive it from us (regular price: $85). We are an Authorized American Safety & Health Institute (ASHI) Training Provider. Please specify that when inquiring with us, or book a class with four or more at courses.wearehames.com
07726.title: Emergency Medical Responder (Free Training & Certification!)
07726.org: High School Association of Medical Engineers & Scientists, Inc.

07726.description: The High School Association of Medical Engineers & Scientists, Inc. (HAMES) Monmouth County Chapter will be conducting a psycho-anthropological study using naturalistic observation to test how humans interact with one another. Further information will be given once you submit your inquiry. HAMES House of Neurology Fellow Researchers will be conducting the experiment in June of 2017, however will begin screening potential participants in mid/late-May. Free screenings will be made per appointment, while the actual experiment will take place over the course of June. Fellow Researchers will work with your schedule. ONLY 20-25 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE SELECTED Volunteer Criteria: All Genders Ages 15-19 Years Old Currently Enrolled In or Graduated from High School (Parental Consent Required if Under 18) In Current Good Physical and Mental Health No prior history of clinically diagnosed psychological or neurological illnesses Please include your full name, date of birth, phone number, email address, zip code, and reason for your interest in volunteering. A Fellow Researcher will contact you soon if you qualify. All volunteers will be granted $50 credit towards any ASHI certification course (visit courses.wearehames.com for more information) and a certificate of community service hours upon full participation. Your participation will assist high school scientists in developing a better understanding of human thought processes, whilst supporting novel scientific theories and it's future advancements. To learn more about HAMES, visit WeAreHAMES.com **DISCLAIMER** This experiment is solely a non-invasive clinical study and NOT a clinical trial. No interventions will be performed. Your submission is only an inquiry and not an official application
07726.title: NJ TEEN HEALTHY TEST SUBJECTS FOR ANTHROPOLOGICAL CASE STUDY NEEDED
07726.org: High School Association of Medical Engineers & Scientists, Inc.

07726.description: ACCEPTING ONLY 10 STUDENTS FOR NEW 2017 CLASS REGISTER BEFORE JUNE 30th, 2017 The Advanced Clinical Triage Squad (ACTS) consists of talented students in New Jersey who are prepared with the knowledge to quickly act in traumatic medical emergencies. The ACT squad accepts candidates year-round on an ongoing basis. EMRs. Who We Are. What We Do. Emergency Medical Responders (EMRs) are elite trained and certified personnel equipped with basic life support skills, event medicine experience, and trauma skills with a mastery in triage. Any current high school student is welcome to apply for free ACTS training, however, the application process is very selective. All candidates undergo a rigorous medical boot camp, the exact curriculum can be viewed at apply.actsquad.org After successful completion of the free ASHI training program, the standardized written exam (Part 1), and the psychomotor assessment (Part 2), the applicant will be certified as an official recognized Emergency Medical Responder with the Advanced Clinical Triage Squad. To learn more about the Advanced Clinical Triage Squad, visit actsquad.org Please submit to us your full name, currently enrolled high school, date of birth, phone number, email, and your reason for volunteering with us. REQUIREMENTS: Must be a current high school student. Must possess Basic Life Support (BLS) or CPR at the Professional Rescuer Level Certification by either the AHA, ASHI, or NSC. Regular CPR certification is not accepted. As a volunteer applicant, you are eligible to receive a discount of $40 off BLS certification if you choose to receive it from us (regular price: $85). We are an Authorized American Safety & Health Institute (ASHI) Training Provider. Please specify that when inquiring with us, or book a class with four or more at courses.wearehames.com
07726.title: A.C.T.S. Event Medical Volunteer (Free Training!)
07726.org: High School Association of Medical Engineers & Scientists, Inc.

07726.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Grace Healthcare Services welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexology, music, imagery and touch therapies such as Reiki, massage, therapeutic touch and healing hands. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide certified/trained pets who visit with patients. These animals provide loving memories for some and give unconditional love helping our patients feel connected to a larger world. Administrative Volunteers provide help to the staff in our Edison office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, huggable dolls/bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Junior Volunteers consist of groups such as girl/boy scouts or young people who wish to honor our patients by making holiday cards, posters, wall hangings and memory books. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families and friends of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. Hospice training classes are required for Companionship and Complementary Volunteers. They are free of charge and offered on an ongoing basis. Grace Healthcare Services serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, contact our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Gracehcs.com!
07726.title: Become a Hospice Volunteer

11803.description: We are currently looking for a caring and dedicated volunteer to provide one on one companionship to a resident of our Intensive Care Facility in Plainview. This is an elderly female looking for someone to read with her, do word searches or puzzles together, do her nails and most importantly sit, talk and listen. Consistent attendance and a positive attitude will be the key ingredients to making this opportunity successful. Applicants will be required to attend a one hour orientation, be screened for tuberculosis and have a full criminal background check completed. Applicants will meet first with the volunteer coordinator and then later with members of this persons support team as a part of the prescreening process. Help us give someone we care about something to look forward to every week.
11803.title: Become a Friend

11803.description: AHRC Nassau is a non-profit agency which serves the developmentally and intellectually disabled. AHRC Nassau has existed for nearly 70 years and is a leader in the care and service of this population. Currently we are looking for volunteers to assist with our community based day habilitation program. We have 33 \"hubsites\" located throughout Nassau County and are looking for volunteers who would be available sometime Monday through Friday starting from 8am to 3pm. Day Habilitation Volunteers assist our program by engaging the people that we serve in meaningful activities. These activities could include arts & crafts, computer skills, reading groups, photography clubs, cooking lessons, yoga or light aerobics, music, pet therapy or any other passion that a volunteer may want to share with the people at one of our hubsites. The minimum age to volunteer at one of our hubsites is 16 years old and all volunteers are required to complete an application and meet with the volunteer coordinator for training and orientation. OPWDD (the Office of People with Developmental Disabilities) requires that all day habilitation volunteers be screened for tuberculosis and receive a full criminal background check. The cost for the screening and background check are covered by AHRC Nassau.
11803.title: Assist Day Habilitation Services

11803.description: Provide companionship to a homebound senior living in the Plainview-Old Bethpage community. Volunteers should be able to commit to a weekly hour-long visit for at least six months. Our Friendly Visiting Program gives our clients a chance to connect with a listener, and provides volunteers with a meaningful way to give back to their communities. Our social worker will match each volunteer and senior based on mutual interests. In most cases, long lasting and mutually rewarding relationships develop. Interview, training, references and background check are required.
11803.title: Friendly Visiting

11803.description: . Volunteer drivers are men and women willing to share their time and vehicle to help meet the transportation needs of seniors. Transport a senior living in the Plainview-Old Bethpage area to local medical appointments, food shopping or local errands. Qualifications include: a valid driver’s license, proof of insurance, a good driving record, and must be age 21 or over. All trips are within the local community. Interview, training, references and background check are required.
11803.title: Volunteer Drivers for Seniors

11801.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
11801.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Broadway Multiplex in Hicksville, NY!

11801.description: Searching for volunteers to organize and help plan a fundraising BBQ at Eisenhower park. If you can help with the planning, invites and ticket sales we would love to have you. Contact me, the CEO who needs your help!! We are searching for someone who is passionate about helping breast cancer patients through fundraising efforts to help continue our mission. Survivors, previvors, and families are all invited!!
11801.title: Breast cancer comfort foundation

11801.description: Can your dog become a C.A.T.T.? We are looking for beloved pets, retirees from breeding or competition, released service dogs, registered therapy dogs and/or rescues. We welcome Puppies (beginning at 12 weeks) to Adults! Qualify your dog for our innovative canine-assisted activities program where children and adults come to interact with our certified dogs. You and your dog will engage with our participants (with and without special needs) who come to DogAbility Center by appointment. Our certified canine teams are taught to manage a small obstacle course, ride in a wagon, play tug games, run relay races, play \"find the ball\" and other assorted tricks, as well as assist in \"fear of dogs\" sessions. Very young puppies are introduced gradually in our supervised Puppy Pals activity. To become certified, all teams must pass an initial evaluation and then attend training sessions where our DogAbility Certified Training Staff will offer personal assistance. See website for fees ~ Fully insured
11801.title: WANTED - Great Dogs and Handlers

11801.description: Are you a professional who wants to give back? A retiree or stay-at-home parent looking to keep your skills fresh? A college student hoping to build your resume? DogAbility Center is looking for skilled volunteers and individuals with just the right expertise to join our team. We are looking for interested individuals with initiative to help steer the direction of our organization with your time and talents. Your skills will help form our team and will ensure that our organization remains effective and carries forward our mission of bettering the lives and well-being of children and adults of all abilities in our community. We are seeking volunteers for the following reasons: To increase awareness and understanding of our organization through the work that our volunteers do. To give our volunteer staff additional manpower to do more work and get as much done as possible within the confines of our budget. To act together to achieve a shared purpose.
11801.title: Volunteers Needed for Canine-Assisted Therapeutic Program for Kids & Adults of All Abilities

11801.description: We are looking for special families to open their hearts and homes and join our family of puppy raisers. Four-month-old Bosley is a puppy with a special mission. One day, he will provide enhanced independence and mobility to a person with disabilities - whether they're blind or visually impaired, or have a disability other than blindness. But Bosley isn't growing up at the Guide Dog Foundation for the Blind. Each year, the Guide Dog Foundation breeds about 300 exceptional puppies, and it's vital that Bosley and other pups like him spend the first year of their lives with surrounded by the love and security of volunteer foster families called puppy walkers. Puppy walkers help Foundation puppies grow up to be confident dogs. What's involved in raising a Guide Dog Foundation puppy? Bosley went to live with his puppy walkers when he was about nine weeks old. He's learning basic obedience and social skills while being exposed to many different situations. People who raise Guide Dog Foundation puppies say it is the most rewarding thing they've ever done. Puppy raisers come from everywhere - stay-at-home moms or dads, teachers, college students, retirees, people with flexible work environments - and are crucial members of the Guide Dog Foundation family. By opening their hearts and homes to a puppy, a puppy raiser plays a crucial role in helping a person with disabilities live an independent life. Every puppy walker family works with a Guide Dog Foundation puppy adviser, who is available to answer questions and offer guidance and support. When he is about 14 months old, Bosley will return to the Guide Dog Foundation's Smithtown campus to begin his training as a guide or service dog. Puppy raisers will admit it's tough to say good-bye, but when they see the pup they raised take its place at the side of someone with disabilities, the ache they feel turns pride. There are puppies waiting now to join your loving home for a chance to start their careers. For more info, call or e-mail the Guide Dog Foundation's Puppy Department at 866-282-8046 or puppies@guidedog.org. Or visit www.GuideDog.org and click on the Puppy Program link. For over 60 years, the Guide Dog Foundation for the Blind has provided guide and service dogs and training free of charge to people with disabilities who seek the enhanced mobility, independence, and companionship only an assistance dog can provide.
11801.title: Must Love Dogs in Nassau County! Seeking volunteers to raise puppies!!

11804.description: We need costumed volunteers to work as tour guides in our living history museum to interpret life as it was in a nineteenth century farming community on Long Island. You might find yourself cooking on an open hearth, working in the general store, serving root beer in the village tavern or making candles or brooms. We are also looking for volunteers with some previous experience to demonstrate crafts like blacksmithing, candlemaking, broommaking, pottery, shoemaking, tinsmithing,quilting , contra dancing, etc. Training will be provided .
11804.title: costumed interpreters or docents

11201.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3) non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 4-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. The GoodS is a segment-based talk show starring Godni Amir & Sarah Coursey. We discuss the arts, culture, health, sustainability, and more! Responsibilities: Combine elements of color and texture to provide a visual understanding of the director’s view, characters associated, age, social status, etc. Will be helping with children and understanding if there is a play, what costume needs to be worn. Must learn about the personalities of the characters and when the production will be set in time. Suggest relationships between characters.
11201.title: Costume Designer for TV Show

11201.description: Job Description: Overseeing entire operations of the Fundraising Department. Continuing to keep the mission of the organization alive and fully support every aspect of the organization/company. Ability to manage a staff of 1-20 depending upon positions available. Continuing job description of Fundraising Coordinator, overseeing entire operations for Fundraising Department, including but not limiting to managing volunteers/interns, Fundraising Coordinator, etc. Responsibilities: - Manage, provide guidance to, and ensure accountability of AFB fundraising staff. - Ensure that the fundraising staff has clear and achievable objectives. - The resources and institutional support needed to carry out responsibilities; and positive and effective relationships with internal and external donors/sponsors and with counterparts in AFB - Develop a sound, achievable, comprehensive fundraising strategy to meet the goals for unrestricted and private restricted fundraising set by the President. Lead and coordinate the fundraising staff team to implement the plan efficiently and effectively. - Ensure that the fundraising strategy of AFB is adequately diversified and includes tactics in specific areas such as major donors, web based giving, foundations, corporate support, etc. - Collaborate with staff across the organization in order to ensure consistency in representing AFB to potential donors and other audiences. - Must continue support of AFB Mission and its goals. - Extending role of Fundraising Coordinator. - Must provide oversight of entire Fundraising Department, including but not limited to, interns/volunteers in any position, Fundraising Coordinator, Fundraising Budget Manager, Fundraising Material Specialist, etc. - Will Coordinate to expand and diversify AFB’s donor base, working closely with other volunteers/interns to secure proper funding. - Submitting Weekly, Monthly, Yearly goals and how the goals will be executed for the Fundraising Department. Competencies: - 2-4 year degree in Finance, Financial Accounting, Financial Management, Business Management, or 3-5 years experience in related field. - Proven record of continued/extensive team leadership skills. Ability to manage 1-20 employees. - Being able to work independently and also be a self motivated person. - Excellent Verbal and Written skills is required.
11201.title: VP of Marketing

11201.description: A Free Bird (AFB) is a 501(c)3), nonprofit art therapy organization dedicated to helping young people with cancer explore the artist within, by inspiring, teaching and celebrating them as artists. Founded in 2011, our organization remains 100% volunteer. Please take a moment to visit our website, www.afreebird.org to gain a better understanding of who we are and what we do. AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases the world over. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others. We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Director of Development to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. The successful candidate must have an authentic passion for our mission, excellent management skills, demonstrated success as an engaging fundraiser and a highly articulate communicator, skilled at making a compelling case for support both on paper and in person. Ideally, here’s what we would like in our Director of Development: An established leader with at least 10-15 years of senior development experience with demonstrable achievements, both financial and operational Proven ability to build, manage, mentor, motivate, and hold accountable to high standards, a diverse volunteer team, located in remote locations A commitment to excellence and success in increasing the effectiveness of development staff through established objectives and methods Expertise in strategic and operational resource development planning (both short and long-term); demonstrated success in executing broad fundraising strategies Proven ability to personally develop strategies, cultivate, solicit and steward major and institutional donors at the six and seven-figure levels; the ability to inspire high-net worth individuals and major foundations to financial leadership Strong written and verbal communication skills, including grants writing, with an emphasis on the ability to persuade Creative and innovative, with entrepreneurial and strategic inclinations A Bachelor’s degree; advanced degree preferred Commitment to working 20-hours per week (minimum of 10) Commitment to volunteering a minimum of one year with AFB How to apply: please send your CV along a brief cover letter stating the reason for your interest, your ability to commit your time, and what you hope to receive in return. AFB does not discriminate on the basis of gender, age, race, ethnicity, national origin, creed, sexual orientation, disability, or any other status protected by law.

11201.description: A Free Bird is a 501 (c) 3 non profit organization dedicated to inspiring and nourishing children with cancer through the therapeutic form of the arts. A Free Bird helps children ages 4-18 achieve their DREAM and inspires them to continue with their passion for the arts! We are currently seeking an Experienced HR Associate for Nonprofits, someone who is experienced with HR related work and has a minimum of 4 months on their schedule to be available. Someone who has worked in the non profit world perferred but not required. This is a time when someone who is taking a leave from one job and wants to do something in their spare time, or has the experience and is not able to receive a job for right now. Anyone who is willing to be part of this position will work 10-15 hours per week and will be in charge of minimum 30 volunteers for events, daily tasks/assignments, and hiring new volunteers and interns. The organization is growing and we are excited to bring on new and incredible talent that can really help us get to the next level. If you are someone who is available to 10-15 hours per week Tues-Thurs has a passion to help children with cancer, knows the Human Resources Field, is computer savvy, is patient, and gets along with people, then WE WANT YOU! Come help us fight cancer through the arts and empowering every child to become FREE from their disease! Please apply with a RESUME to HR@afreebird.org
11201.title: VP of HR

11201.description: The Care Management program is seeking Data Entry Specialists who are able to perform extensive data entry into 3 different electronic health records and a variety of Microsoft Excel spreadsheets in order to accurately track and manage the care coordination services provided to our clients. We seek volunteers who: - Are computer literate and knowledgeable of recent Microsoft Excel updates. - Have experience with data entry. - Are able to treat Protected Health Information confidentially & with good judgment. - Are willing to be trained to utilize electronic health records. This opportunity is available on Mondays-Fridays from 9am-5pm. Time commitment and hours are flexible within the hours of operation.

Performing - Plan and coordinate various aspects of radio, television, stage, or motion picture production, such as selecting script, coordinating writing, directing and editing, and arranging financing. Perform pre-production tasks including casting personnel, budgeting, scheduling, charting. Edit, rewrite, and employ arranging techniques to enhance emotional impact of the artist’s deliverable. Assess an artist's strengths and weaknesses, and employ strategies to accentuate the positive and minimize the negative. Meet with industry leaders to advance the production of artist events. Required Experience/Skills Concrete examples of project management Exposure to at least one of the Five Core Arts that RoyalCPop specializes in. Either professional or academic experience relevant to media and communications Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications Basic understanding of financial analysis Ability to review, edit and critique project proposals Ideal Candidate: · Advanced communication skills with both individuals and organizations · Desire to continue a profession in production and/or publishing · Existing connections · Event planning · Experience in the media, communications and/or entertainment industry · User experience expertise

This person will be the assistant to the Presdient and Administration Coordinator and will be assisting with documentation, computer work, and the ability to communicate effectively. Please inquire with your resume and we will get back to you as soon as possible.
11201.title: Volunteer Administration Development Assistant

11201.description: A Free Bird (AFB) is a 501(c)3), nonprofit art therapy organization dedicated to helping young people with cancer explore the artist within, by inspiring, teaching and celebrating them as artists. Founded in 2011, our organization remains 100% volunteer. Please take a moment to visit our website, www.afreebird.org to gain a better understanding of who we are and what we do. AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases the world over. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others. We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Director of Development to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. The successful candidate must have an authentic passion for our mission, excellent management skills, demonstrated success as an engaging fundraiser and a highly articulate communicator, skilled at making a compelling case for support both on paper and in person. Ideally, here’s what we would like in our Director of Development: An established leader with at least 10-15 years of senior development experience with demonstrable achievements, both financial and operational Proven ability to build, manage, mentor, motivate, and hold accountable to high standards, a diverse volunteer team, located in remote locations A commitment to excellence and success in increasing the effectiveness of development staff through established objectives and methods Expertise in strategic and operational resource development planning (both short and long-term); demonstrated success in executing broad fundraising strategies Proven ability to personally develop strategies, cultivate, solicit and steward major and institutional donors at the six and seven-figure levels; the ability to inspire high-net worth individuals and major foundations to financial leadership Strong written and verbal communication skills, including grants writing, with an emphasis on the ability to persuade Creative and innovative, with entrepreneurial and strategic inclinations A Bachelor’s degree; advanced degree preferred Commitment to working 20-hours per week (minimum of 10) Commitment to volunteering a minimum of one year with AFB How to apply : please send your CV along a brief cover letter stating the reason for your interest, your ability to commit your time, and what you hope to receive in return. AFB does not discriminate on the basis of gender, age, race, ethnicity, national origin, creed, sexual orientation, disability, or any other status protected by law.
11201.title: Director of Development

11201.description: Help your community stop food waste and fight hunger by bringing excess food to homeless shelters. You will be walking with trays of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. Please note you must sign up for an account, and after you confirm your account via email, you must go back to our website www.rescuinglftovercuisine.org to sign up for the event! We're also looking for Emergency Rescuer volunteers that let us know when they would be available to volunteer. And we send the opportunities as they come up, based on their preferred location, time, and days!
11201.title: End Food Waste and Feed the Hungry in DUMBO at 1PM!

11201.description: The City Tutors (CT) is looking for tutors to provide in-class academic support in reading and writing for the Division of Continuing Education at the New York City College of Technology (City Tech) for the Fall 2017 semester. Embedded Tutoring will run in the evening from 6-9PM. Tutors are asked to commit 2-3 hours of their time a week. Tutoring Days are yet to be determined. This is a great opportunity for: Working professionals who wish to support their community students who are majoring (or have in the course area to enhance their knowledge and experience and who wish to enhance their content knowledge and/or grow their professional experience As an embedded tutor, you would collaborate with an instructor to improve students’ performance while being supported and guide by an experienced academic support professional. You would identify and support students who are struggling, participate during the lecture to augment the class topic discussions, and provide feedback to students so that they may improve their fundamental understanding of the material. You might also design assignments, identify/track students who are struggling and create differentiated instruction as the need arises. You will be supported throughout this process by the City Tutors staff. All tutors are also expected to complete a four session comprehensive, professional training regimen. 6 hours of live training, plus another hour and a half for orientation. This is a commitment of 7.5 hours of in person training, and 4 hours of supplemental training for a total of 11.5 hours of training over the course of the Fall semester. Training days will be determined based on your schedule and that of the Tutor Training Coordinators. CT's tutoring program has been successful in helping students gain access to support that they otherwise would not have received, given their limited time spent on campus. Having a tutor in the class early in the semester will allow us to employ strategies to reduce withdrawals and student failure rates. Your work with us would help the students’ overall subject area performance, and help us improve this educational support model, reaching more students and departments with comprehensive academic support. Learn more about the Division of Continuing Education here: http://www.citytech.cuny.edu/ce/ To apply, you must: Have received an A- or A in the introduction to the subject course you are applying to tutor Have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have completed a degree program Submit monthly reports, keep a log sheet of any tutoring appointments done outside of class, and regularly communicate with the tutor training coordinator.
11201.title: Evening In-class Writing Tutor needed for City Tech Division of Continuing Education in Fall 2017

11201.description: A core rescuer commits to leading 10 food rescue events a week. They always lead the same events every week. Core Rescuers are required to do all of the events every week. If they miss one event, they must make up their event hour that week, or a future date, but the event must be made up. The core rescuer position is also a 4 month commitment. Throughout the four month commitment, we will supply you with an unlimited metro card for each month to complete your events. There is also a $500 stipend at the end of the program. As a core rescuer, you will also be leading groups of volunteers during events, and actively engaging them. Core rescuers educate our volunteers on the issues of food waste and hunger, while leading them from the restaurant, to a nearby homeless shelter, where we drop off the food donations. Training is provided.
11201.title: Food Rescue volunteer in Brooklyn 2:30PM-5:30PM! (10 Hours per week)

11201.description: JustFix.nyc, a Brooklyn-based nonprofit, is seeking volunteers to help staff our innovative tenant rights help clinic. They will also work 1-on-1 with tenants to help them understand their housing rights and help navigate the legal process using technology. Volunteers will help tenants use our mobile app to document conflicts with landlords and repair issues. Individuals interested in innovation, technology, and direct assistance for low-income New Yorkers should apply. We are looking for people who can commit to an average of 4 hours of weekly volunteering. No technology or housing justice experience required. Please contact Alicia Nieves at alicia@justfix.nyc with any questions or inquiries. More information at www.justfix.nyc. Deadline March 15, 2017.
11201.title: Help New Yorkers achieve housing justice! Become a coach for tenants in need!

11201.description: Overview: The Guardianship Project’s new volunteer program aims to assist our case managers in providing more frequent, friendly interaction with our clients. Volunteers not replace our current case managers visit Social interaction among the elderly and disabled greatly improves not only their quality of life, but their physical and mental health. Volunteers will offer clients with yet another friendly face from The Guardianship Project. This position helps extend the resources of The Guardianship Project to better assist our clients. Title: Friendly Visitor Work location: Variable (dependent on client location) Purpose of the position: The friendly visitor will serve as a companion to clients of The Guardianship Project. Volunteers will engage clients in activities like reading a book, talking, or just being a friendly face. Volunteers will be matched to clients on a 1:1 basis, and will visit weekly. Volunteers will visit clients weekly - for at least 30 minutes each time. Visits will take place in the residence where the client resides. Responsibilities and duties: Complete initial orientation/training and attend quarterly meetings of volunteers (quarterly sessions are optional unless otherwise noted) Establish a friendly relationship with an adult with multiple disabilities Engage clients in activities pertaining to their interests Offer companionship and friendship Visit clients weekly and provide friendly social interaction Notify the volunteer coordinator in a timely manner of any concerns about clients or absences from visits Provide ongoing communication to the Volunteer Coordinator Qualifications: Good listening skills; friendliness, patience and tact Must be dependable and punctual Ability to work cooperatively with a wide variety of individuals, including people with significant physical and mental impairments and varying socio-economic backgrounds Ability to hold information in confidence Strong desire to help people and to further the goals of the monitoring project Willingness to provide own transportation to make visits Experience with developmental disabilities and/or mental illness is not required Background check required Volunteer feedback: Feedback is essential for maintaining the success of our program. After each client visit volunteers are expected to fill out and return to the Volunteer Coordinator, via email, our feedback form. Age requirement: Volunteers must be at least 18 years of age. Commitment expected: A commitment of at least 6 months is expected. Contribute 2-4 hours per month; flexible schedule depending on clients’ schedules. Training: Volunteers must attend an initial Guardianship Project orientation and training session Ongoing support is tailored to each volunteers’ needs Ongoing trainings are held every 12 weeks, and are optional for attendance Training and supervision provided by Rebecca Dealy, Volunteer Coordinator
11201.title: The Guardianship Project Volunteer Program

11201.description: The Latinas On the Verge of Excellence - L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program would like to invite university female students to serve as mentors in our 2016 L.O.V.E. Mentoring Programs. The L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program aims to enhance academic performance and high school graduation rates among young Latinas by providing them with the support of positive role models. Mentoring sessions concentrate on developing study skills, enabling college access, and facilitating self-empowerment activities. This year we will be offering the exciting opportunity to mentor a student from public high schools throughout New York. Mentors will meet with mentees on schools' campuses weekly. A semester commitment (February - June) is required of mentors who wish to participate in these school-based programs.
11201.title: L.O.V.E. Volunteer Mentor

11201.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3)non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 4-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. We have launched a magazine to promote, communicate, and support our organization's mission. Our premiere issue launched 9/23/13 and we are actively developing our next edition and last years issues was 02/06/2015 We are seeking a talented editor with excellent time-management, team leadership and project management skills to perform a variety of editorial tasks, such as writing, editing, and copyediting, as well as supervising staff and keeping the magazine on schedule. Recent graduates or graduate students who held editor-positions with their school newspapers, school yearbooks, or other school periodicals are strongly encouraged to apply. Non-Traditional/Continuing Education students strongly encouraged to apply. This is only for a week, please add your resume
11201.title: Volunteer Magazine Editor ASAP for a Non profit for children with Cancer!

11201.description: Help out an elderly neighbor by keeping them company on appointments! Heights and Hills is a 44 year old non-profit organization that promotes successful aging in the community. We provide free case management services and referrals to frail and homebound residents over the age of sixty and their loved ones in nineteen Brooklyn neighborhoods. Our goal is to ensure that all community members, regardless of age, can continue to be vital, vibrant, and visible members of the communities they have helped to build. We need your help! Many of the people we work with are looking for comapions to help them travel to and from important medical and other kinds of appointments. Senior Companion Volunteers help out on an as needed basis by meeting our clietns at their homes and providing company and a steadying arm as they travel to and from appoinments. Volunteers accompany them by car service, Access-A-Ride, taxi and even bus and subway. Volunteer assignments usually last between 3 and 5 hours. Become a Senior Companion Volunteer today!!
11201.title: Senior Companion Volunteer

Responsibilities: Provide strategic consultation for AFB marketing and branding across print and digital media and collaborating with marketing department to develop a plan to maximize AFB awareness through marketing campaigns. Overall Responsibilities: -Identify and report on marketing targets and goals. -Meeting with marketing department weekly to discuss and provide feedback on past, current, and future marketing materials and campaigns, such as next steps and/or improvements. -Evaluate the success rate of marketing campaigns. -Analyze marketing situations and pass judgement on most optimal course of action and working with Marketing Materials Specialists to allocate marketing materials and resources. -Create briefing documents and build relationships, remain in contact, and negotiate with external parties. -Research and identify new market demands and growing trends and report them to marketing department. -Must support and maintain mission goal and statement of organization. Competencies: -Has/working towards a degree in Marketing, Business, Psychology, PR and related fields. -Excellent organizational and time management skills. -Excellent verbal and written communication skills. -Ability to think critically. -Knowledgeable about different forms of print and digital media and comfortable with conducting research. -Must be able to work and coordinate with others.
