Must be able to manage the Grants Team, Lead and assist them with any questions they may have. Overall Responsibilities: -Research and identify grant opportunities and apply to potential sources of funding. -Oversee application process to ensure all requirements have been met. -Develop a procedure and methodology to consistently and efficiently apply for grants. -Creating and updating a list of grant funders. -Scheduling meetings, workshops, seminars and/or activities for interested parties. -Communicate and collaborate with interested parties to secure funds for the purpose of improving programs and services. -Ensure process of receiving and using grants follow both funder and organization guidelines. -Manage budget periodically to optimize allocation of funds. -Must support and maintain mission goal and statement of organization. Competencies: -Background in PR, communications, and related fields. -Being professional, personable, and persuasive in order to achieve desired results. -Proficiency in math and ability to review technical information. -Excellent communication, organizational and writing skills. -Must be a team player and be able to supervise and guide others.
11201.title: Grant Writer

11201.description: Love Yourself Project is looking a grant writer and some administration duties/social media, and volunteer coordinator and ambassadors. The Love Yourself Project is a 501(c)(3) non-profit arts and education organization providing community programs which promote self-awareness, self-acceptance, self-esteem and skill building. It is our belief that with a strong relationship to the self, every individual can contribute to a future with loving regard for all living beings and the environment. Beginning Nov 19, 2010, the Love Yourself team took to the streets and subways of New York City greeting people with messages of kindness and love, distributing over 500 \"Love Yourself\" stickers and hand-folded hearts, and encouraged people to engage in a conversation about self-love. Since then, similar events have been held in Pakistan, Paris, Luxembourg, West Africa, Florida, Netherlands, Massachusetts, Australia, Iceland, England and Stockholm. We currently have distributed over 750,000 stickers. In 2011, the Project began working with children at The Earth School in NYC. Team members helped youngsters (ages 5-12) make origami hearts and facilitated discussions about what it means to 'love yourself’. The origami hearts were featured in the \"1,000 Hearts\"Exhibition. To create the \"1,000 Hearts\"exhibition, the team collected 1,000 hand-folded origami hearts from people all around the world. Participants shared something they love about themselves and folded the paper into a heart shape. The hearts and messages were presented both visually and aurally. Messages from the hearts are continuously being posted via Twitter. We just celebrated our 5th year anniversary at BAM FISHER 2015 with 5,000 hearts of self love messages. Help us continue our campaign for 2020 with 10,000 Hearts. The Love Yourself Project has hosted: The Festival of New Ideas with The New Museum in NYC. Untapped Love (lower Manhattan business to find out how they give back to the community.) 2010-12, educational events with Rush Arts Educational Program, NYC, Slyfest - The Good Neighborhood Project, Hannah Senesh School, Carol Gardens Brooklyn , Safe Horizon Organization, NYC, Taap at Fashion Industry High School NY, Nest School East Village, 2012-13, Flow12- Randall’s Island Park, Governors Island- Figment , feeding the homeless, Teen Pregnancy Prevention Program Grand Street Settlement NYC, Interim House, Providence RI., 2014 Barnes and Noble, Coalition for Hispanic Family Health Fair, Brooklyn Museum, Academy of Young Writes East NY, Children’s Workshop School NYC, Women’s Wellness Day and Jackie Robinson / Central Park East Middle School. Isaac Center, Flushing Queens Library, Funny Faces at Brooklyn Promenade & Coney Island Brooklyn and VIBE Theater Brooklyn. Queens Art Intervention, Heath Gallery Harlem NY, The LGBT Center NY NY, 2015 Brooklyn Academy of Music 5,000 Hearts, BGSQD NY NY, Volunteers for the Arts, NY NY Sesame Sprouts, Queens NY, City Chemist, Trader Joe’s Brooklyn NY, Fabio Scalia Gallery, Brooklyn NY, St. Joseph’s High School Brooklyn NY, Medgar Evers college Prep. H.S. Brooklyn NY 2016 City Museum of New York, Jubilee Senior Center, FigmentNYC, LGBTQ Brooklyn, Poly Prep middle school, Brooklyn, Brownsville Creation Center, Union Arts Center With the help of others and our commitment to changing the way we think about ourselves, we invite you to create an event in your country, neighborhood and schools. We look forward to hearing from you. Thank you for your time and consideration.
11201.title: Are You A Grant Writer? Enjoy the Arts? Want to Help Us? Join the Love Yourself Project!

11201.description: *** Volunteers needed June 3 & 4 on Governors Island ** The Love Yourself Project (LYP) is a non-profit organization committed to utilizing the arts to celebrate and empower communities around the world, to spread a message of unconditional self-love, both domestically and internationally. We are currently seeking part-time and full-time dedicated volunteers to assist us in donor development, marketing, public relations, arts education and fundraising. We seek self-motivated, positive individuals with strong computer knowledge and effective communication talents to join our organizational culture and team-oriented environment. We offer volunteers the opportunity for hands-on experience within a start-up non-profit organization, where significant personal and professional growth and development is possible. LYP Volunteers are responsible, but not limited to the following: Provide program support for all LYP Programs by working alongside staff, teaching artists, classroom teachers and students. Research and develop educational and art-based materials to correspond with the LYP mission. Develop and promote the mission, vision and values of The Love Yourself Project. Develop themes, procure supplies and execute ideas related to the Love Yourself Project. Keep adequate supplies, brochures and other materials. Serve as the point of contact for the LYP team. LYP Volunteers are unique in every way! We are like minded and hold each other accountable for being their best. A good sense of humor, a strong back bone, curious, make things happen and respect for all living things. If you're interested in participating in the Love Yourself Project, please contact Michael Mut at michael@loveyourselfproject.org Thank you for your interest in the Love Yourself Project, we look forward to meeting you!
11201.title: Love Yourself Project (LYP) Volunteers

11201.description: Since 1971, Heights and Hills has helped Brooklyn's older adults age successfully in their communities with independence, dignity and grace. Our Friendly Visiting program matches volunteers of all ages with home-bound and/or socially isolated seniors for weekly companionship - volunteers and clients go on walks, run errands, cook together, play cards, craft, talk about music, art, sports, politics or whatever else they find they have in common! Whenever possible Friendly Visitor volunteers are matched with seniors in their own neighborhood. Getting started is easy: fill out a short application and come into our office in downtown Brooklyn to speak with someone from the Volunteer Program. We look forward to hearing from you!

11203.description: The role of a Patient Support volunteer is to work as part of the patient care team as directed by Nursing. The Patient Support volunteer provides a warm and welcoming atmosphere for patients, families and visitors. The Department of Volunteer Services gives general orientation including Safety, Infection Control, Patients' Rights, HIPAA and other important information. Nursing staff provides orientation to patient care and on-the-job instruction. While on duty, the Patient Support volunteer is required to wear a volunteer vest provided by the Department of Volunteer Services. Duties: Makes continuous patient rounds on assigned units. Welcomes patients following their admission and assists in obtaining supplies (i.e. blankets, pillows, phone and TV hook up). Visit with patients and their families, offering conversation and emotional support. Dispenses water to patients and assist with meals, with supervising nurse's guidance and approval. Provides information regarding visiting hours, food service and Chaplaincy services. Distributes amenities, as requested and appropriate, including daily newspapers, magazines, books, games, etc. Reads with patients upon request. Walks with patients, with supervising nurse's guidance and approval. Assists patient to make phone calls. Communicates concerns to Patient Representative, Nurse Manager and other staff, as appropriate. Works cooperatively with all employees on unit to ensure patients are cared for courteously and promptly. Such responsibilities may include assisting staff from time to time with non-medical tasks. Maintains established departmental policies and procedures, objectives, quality improvement program, safety, and infection control standards. Promotes adherence to Patients' Bill of Rights. Assimilates core values - compassion, respect, ethics, excellence and dedication - throughout all processes. Communicates effectively and efficiently with patient, family, staff and other members of the health care team. Maintains confidentiality. Reports to duty as scheduled and on time. Adheres to Kingsbrook Jewish Medical Center dress code for volunteers.
11203.title: Patient Support Volunteer

11203.description: Volunteers provide general office assistance at the direction of departmental staff. Duties may include answering phones, light typing, labeling, filing and running errands.
11203.title: Clerical Support Volunteer

10128.description: We are hosting SUPERHERO DAY NYC and we are looking for the most imporatnt part -SUPEHEROES! We are looking to spread the message of hope to children with medical and special needs and their famileis! We want to bring the SUPERHEROES to our special little superheroes-children facing a difficult diagnosis. We would love to have SPIDERMAN, IRON MAN, CAPTAIN AMERICA, SUPERMAN, HULK, BATMAN, WONDERWOMAN, etc! Contact us if you are ready to get in costume to have a great time with the kids!

11205.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3)non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 4-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. You will be working with the child under our Fight Free Program which pairs a tutor and a child together from the child’s art form that they choose. It is a 12-week program consisting of One Hour per week continuously checking in with the Programs Director as well as updating the Child Life Specialist and Psychologist about what you have been teaching the child. You will work closely with the Programs Director to create a 12-week plan for the child. We are seeking a talented Piano Tutor to work with a child affected by cancer. To find out more information and how you can assist one of our children please email your resume and availability to: internships@afreebird.org
11205.title: Piano Tutor for Child Fighting Cancer

11207.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org/support/volunteer/adult-literacy-volunteer-tutor .
11207.title: Volunteer Tutor Information Session
11207.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11207.description: The community and Brooklyn Public Library needs you. If you are a leader, having leadership experience, and can work with minimal supervision, becoming an executive on our Friends Group Board will be excellent for you. We will be the backbone of Saratoga Branch Library AND Spring Creek Library ; position will last at least 1 year. STATUS Executives will work sporadically; a lot of work will be from home or via virtual teams. You must come to mandatory meeting, at least 6 per year. Position Description : Board needed includes: vice president, treasurer and secretary. * This description is general and more specific duties will be discussed * Data entry, volunteer hours tracking * Website content management and editing * Event planning and management , possibly * Event promotion * Grant writing and organization , depending on position * Strong communication skills (verbal and written). * Strong attention to detail. * Able to listen and communicate effectively with community members of diverse backgrounds. * Dependable and punctual. * Self-directed and willing to take initiative. * Computer literate (familiar with Microsoft Office suite). * Currently seeking volunteers at least 16 years of age. Volunteer Benefits * Training and experience with managerial, back-end, and administrative procedures. * Opportunity to meet new people and help enhance Brooklyn neighborhoods. * Networking and community building opportunities. * Gain an awesome reference working with the Brooklyn Public Library and BkMSCC. Location: Spring Creek Branch, Home based, & At office in Ocean Hill, Possible Event Outings
11207.title: LIBRARY FIENDS GROUP EXECUTIVE BOARD - Spring Creek

11206.description: Volunteer to make a difference in children's lives using the sport of TENNIS! REGISTER HERE: www.kingscountytennisleague.org/volunteer Kings County Tennis League (KCTL) is looking for enthusiastic and dedicated volunteers to teach tennis to kids in underserved Bedfod-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn communities. Tennis skills are helpful, but not required. KCTL's free summer season classes will operate on Saturdays from 1:00 PM to 3:00 PM, June 3 through September 23, at five different public housing developments in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn. Volunteers must commit to a minimum of two classes per month. To qualify, all volunteers are required to participate in a pre-season training session on April 22, 23, or 29. Training will provide anyone who has a positive attitude with the right tools to use tennis as a means for inspiration. Volunteers will receive a KCTL team jersey, free racquet stringing, and invitations to volunteer social events as a thank you for their time and hard work. Founded in 2010, KCTL is a 501c3 nonprofit organization that uses tennis year-round as an instrument for youth development and community building in public housing developments in Brooklyn. By bringing tennis directly to kids where they live, KCTL seeks to build a future in which all children in Brooklyn have regular access to a healthy activity that stimulates their personal growth and exposes them to new concepts, cultures, people, and possibilities.
11206.title: Coach, Motivate & Inspire Kids through Tennis

11206.description: Ridgewood Bushwick Senior Citizens Council is seeking Fun and innovative volunteers who are interested in spending one hour, one day a week with a homebound senior citizen. We have a large population of Polish speaking clients who need a volunteer. Our senior citizens are unable to go out into the community and are looking for a companion to laugh with, talk to, watch television with, paint or draw with and enjoy their time with! We ask that our volunteers commit to a minimum of 6 months with our seniors! This is a mutually rewarding friendship, where you're able to learn about the seniors in your neighborhoods, their art styles, interests and the changes that have occurred to the community over the years! We serve a diverse group of elderly and seek people of all backgrounds and ages (18 and up) to join us in helping them feel more connected to their communities. This Friendly Visiting Program is funded by The NYC Department for the Aging.
11206.title: Polish and English speaking volunteers needed for Senior Citizens!
11206.org: RIDGEWOOD BUSHWICK SENIOR CITIZENS COUNCIL INC

11206.description: El programa de visitas en un nuevo servicio que estamos empezando en el Programa de manejo de caso. Buscamos voluntarios que sean amables, paciente y quieran trabajar con las personas mayores. Estamos pidiendo que los voluntarios puedan visitar a las persona mayores al menos una vez a la semana durante una hora. Tambien estamos pidiendo que los voluntarios se comprometan a ser parte de este programa por un periodo mínimo de al menos 6 meses. Todos los voluntarios deben llenar una solicitud la cual yo se la haré llegar a usted. Tambien tenemos que hacer un \" criminal background check\" ya que como usted sabrá hay muchas personas mayores que han sido expuestas a situaciones difíciles con personas que tal vez las hayan tratado mal.
11206.title: Buscando voluntarios para pasar tiempo con los ancianos!
11206.org: RIDGEWOOD BUSHWICK SENIOR CITIZENS COUNCIL INC

11206.description: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a nonprofit organization that rescues leftover food, from local food businesses, from being thrown away and takes it to nearby homeless shelter, where the food is distributed to those in need. We need weekly volunteers in the Williamsburg area of Brooklyn, to pick up the leftover food, from nearby restaurants or food businesses! Please let us know if you would be interedted and we can send you more information on how to get invlved!
11206.title: Help Stop Food waste in Brooklyn!

11206.description: Opportunity Share your talents with JASA seniors! JASA is looking for volunteers to lead groups of seniors in organized activities at Bushwick/Hylan NORC (Naturally Occurring Retirement Community). Activities may include singing or music groups, political or current event discussions, crossword or puzzle groups, arts and crafts projects, fitness classes or anything else that will bring the people of the center together in an active and social way. Skills * Experience with seniors * Experience/background in class topic required * Relevant exercise certification required Other * Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week * Ongoing opportunity * Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11206.title: Activity Leader - JASA Bushwick/Hylan NORC

11206.description: Purpose The ability to understand English is an important skill at any age. It’s never too late to learn! Facilitate a class that allows seniors to practice speaking, reading and writing English. Responsibilities Lead a weekly class in ESL (English as a Second Language) Create lessons suitable for people with varying knowledge of English Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills Experience teaching ESL Experience working with seniors is helpful, but not required Good organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks Strong communication skills Patience Knowledge of Spanish is helpful, but not required Comfort leading a group of varying levels Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week during business hours Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11206.title: ESL Instructor - JASA Williamsburg Senior Center

11209.description: The social services intern is responsible for assisting clients with non-immigration social services paperwork including public benefits applications, signing up children for school, and Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP)/ food stamps applications. This is an excellent opportunity for those interested in Social Work or those currently enrolled in social work programs. The ideal candidate will be able to compassionately and efficiently handle cases while strengthening and supporting the community. Fluent English and working Arabic is preferred for this position, and a strong desire to empower and support the Arab-American community is preferred. The Social Services intern is expected to commit at least 10-15 hours/week of work with the Association; hours and days are somewhat flexible. Responsibilities: Assist with completing social service and SNAP forms and applications Interpreting, translating for clients Provide individual case management related to SNAP and social services Make copies of, and file application forms for clients Maintain confidential client database and case work files for individual clients Requirements: Experience working with immigrant populations Some experience with customer service, completing social services paperwork College Student or Graduate, above 18 Able to work consistent weekly hours Ability to commit at least a 3 month cycle Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite
11209.title: Social Services Intern
11209.org: Arab American Association of New York

11209.description: The Arab Women Activists and Leaders (AWAL) Intern will be a part of the Advocacy and Civic Engagement (ACE) team. The AWAL Intern will focus on assisting the Lead Organizer in providing advocacy tools to immigrant Arab/or Muslim women. The AWAL Intern is expected to commit to at least 12 hours per week for 6 months Primary Duties: Working with the Lead Organizer and Trainer to facilitate AWAL classes Assistance with AWAL curriculum Referral and communication with women enrolled in the program Assist with social media management for events pertaining to AWAL Assist in identifying and inviting guest speakers to AWAL classes Requirements: Experience working with diverse and immigrant communities A strong and genuine desire to advocate for social justice Strong knowledge of spoken Arabic, written Arabic is a plus Proficient with Microsoft Office and Google Apps Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skils Open to constructive feedback within the organization Female identified bodies preferred The women’s advocacy assistant is expected to commit to coming in on Monday and Tuesday 9:30 am - 12:30 pm. Hours and days are somewhat flexible.
11209.title: Arab Women Activists & Leaders (AWAL) Intern
11209.org: Arab American Association of New York

11209.description: The AAANY is looking for enthusiastic volunteers to tutor clients that have their Naturalization Test in the near future. Tutors will help prepare clients for their Naturalization Test by teaching them American history and by helping to improve their reading and writing. The Volunteer Citizenship Instructor must have a desire to work with immigrant communities and assist clients in learning civics and understanding the various components of the naturalization exam. Instructors will mentor and guide students through the most difficult challenges of learning the reading, writing, and verbal portions of the exam. In this role, volunteer instructors will be able to create lesson plans, study groups, conversation lessons, and practice exams for our students. Furthermore, volunteer teachers will gain an understanding of the workings of a nonprofit organization, tutoring programs, and they will have the opportunity to familiarize themselves with the Arab American and immigrant community of Bay Ridge. This is an excellent opportunity for all individuals that want to gain experience in education and for those that want to help immigrants become American citizens! Responsibilities: Provide weekly hour-long tutorial sessions for clients on the speaking, civics, reading, and writing portions of the naturalization exam Take attendance of the students who are present for each citizenship tutoring session Conduct mock interview and practice exams with students Log and share planning with coordinator and other volunteers, including entering hand-written notes on planning document Measure students' performance and progress during tutoring sessions Provide timely survey feedback to Association staff regarding both volunteer and student satisfaction and performance Requirements: Basic knowledge and interest in American history and politics is helpful, but not required; Basic understanding of the naturalization process (training will be provided); Sensitivity to cultural differences Knowledge of Arabic, Spanish, or French is preferred but not required A strong and genuine desire to help a diverse immigrant community Professional, interpersonal skills as well as attention to details *Must be available during our open hours: Monday-Friday 10am-5pm.
11209.title: Citizenship Tutor
11209.org: Arab American Association of New York

11208.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
11208.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Linden Blvd Multiplex in Brooklyn, NY!

11208.description: Our youth and community center is searching for individuals who are open to working under a Village concept. We currently provide services to the community members in East New York, Bushwick, and Canarsie and other parts of Brooklyn with hopes and plans to expand to other boroughs. Administratively we are in need of someone who will be able to manage intake assessments from walk in applicants and neighbors within the community. We have 3 different services we offer to the community and would like to have someone to make and receive phone calls regarding non profit, publishing, and real estate. As a coalition of Non-Profits we will be providing workshops and classes to the community. We are looking for volunteers who will be able to assist with administrative tasks like attendance monitoring and taking. Filing paperwork and making phone calls. Running small groups and facilitating outreach programs when necessary.
11208.title: Administrative Assistant

11208.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning. The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11208.title: Become a reading partner now- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 108 Sal Abbracciamento, NYC)

10121.description: This opportunity is available every Sunday-Friday from 9 PM-9:30 PM! Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a nonprofit food rescue organization dedicated to reducing food waste and feeding the hungry. We are currently looking for Lead Rescuers to join our leadership team. A Lead Rescuer is a passionate and dedicated volunteer who commits to leading one event, once per week. Training is provided. Help rescue leftover food that would otherwise have been thrown away and bring it to those who need it the most! You will pick up food donations from multiple vendors in a popular Midtown food court and deliver it on-foot to a nearby homeless shelter. Mediumweight: the average amount of food is a total of 30 lbs.
10121.title: Weekly Volunteer Needed for 9PM-9:30PM Food Rescue Events!

10121.description: This opportunity is available every Saturday and Sunday! Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a nonprofit food rescue organization dedicated to reducing food waste and getting food to those in need. We are currently looking to bring on Lead Rescuers to our leadership team. A lead rescuer is a passionate and dedicated volunteer who commits to leading one event, once per week. Training is provided. Help rescue bread, pastries, and other delicious food that would otherwise have been thrown out and help feed the hungry of NYC! You will pick up leftover food from two food vendors in a popular Midtown food court and deliver it to a nearby homeless shelter. This event lasts just 20 minutes, and will end at Antonio Olivieri Drop-In Center. Mediumweight: the average amount of food is a total of 30 lbs.
10121.title: Weekly Volunteer Needed for Weekend Midtown Food Rescue Events 9PM-9:30PM!

08816.description: Position Summary: The Disability Allies (DA) is dedicated to providing a social and learning environment for young adults and children with disabilities. The Teaching Assistant is a part time volunteer position that involves a commitment of a few hours a week. The Teaching Assistant will work with the teacher to promote interactive and structured learning for students with disabilities. Responsibilities: The Teaching Assistant will work with the teacher to promote interactive and structured learning for students with disabilities. The Teaching Assistant will assist the Teacher with the following tasks: Reinforce lessons presented by teachers by reviewing material with students one-on-one or in small groups Enforce school and class rules to help teach students proper behavior Help teachers with recordkeeping, such as tracking attendance and calculating grades Help students with social disorders improve their communication skills Qualifications & Competencies: Excellent public speaking and presentation skills Must be able to meet deadlines and adjust to changing priorities Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing Ability to connect with others and develop relationships Committed to the mission of serving young adults with disabilities Ability to perform several tasks concurrently Strong time management and organizational skills Ability to maintain detailed records and confidential information The Disability Allies (DA) is dedicated to providing a social and learning environment for young adults and children with disabilities. Students are paired up with mentors who help them learn in fun and structured environment. Our mentors help them with their social skills, help develop a core academic curriculum and reinforce learning strategies that were taught in school. Disability Allies Anti-Discrimination statement: Disability Allies shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, gender identification or expression, or military status in any of its activities of operations. These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers, and selection of vendors and provision of services.
08816.title: Teachers Assistant

08816.description: Position Summary: The Disability Allies (DA) is dedicated to providing social opportunities to connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. The Volunteer Social Worker is a part time volunteer position that involves a commitment of a few hours a week. He or she must be willing to join us at our monthly committee meetings at the Milltown Public Library at 10am on the Second Saturday of the Month. The Volunteer Social Worker will help participants at our events improve their social skills and interaction with other people. He or she will also obtain feedback from our participants and help resolve any conflicts. Responsibilities: Provide guidance, motivation, emotional support, and role modeling to our participants. Resolve conflict between our participants. Ensure that each participant is engaged in all the activities at our events. Encourage participants to interact with each other. Develop strategies to improve the social skills of our participants. Develop lasting relationships with our participants. Follow-up with participants and encourage them to attend our events attend our events. Obtain feedback from our participants about our events. Help pair up participants and mentors biased on their interests and disabilities. Essential functions/working conditions: Ability to work in a team setting Strong social and interpersonal skills Comfortable with mentoring individuals with disabilities Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing Ability to connect with others and develop relationships Committed to the mission of serving young adults and children with disabilities Ability to perform several tasks concurrently Strong time management and organizational skills About the Disability Allies: The purpose of the Disability Allies is to plan team building activities that connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. At our events we pair each individual up with a mentor. The job of the mentor is to help the participants with their social skills and insure that everyone interacts with each other. Our events are open to any young adult that has a disability, knows someone with a disability or is supportive of people with disabilities. Please visit www.disabilityallies.com to learn more. Disability Allies Anti-Discrimination statement: Disability Allies shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, gender identification or expression, or military status in any of its activities of operations. 08816.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
08816.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Musician, Pet Therapy, Reiki - East Brunswick

The Volunteer Website/ Database Developer is a part time position. You must be willing to join us at our monthly committee meetings at the East Brunswick Public Library at 10am on the Second Saturday of the Month. As a developer you will work with technology team to deliver the new Disability Allies web site, develop, test, troubleshoot and enhance website features based on requests from the users and committee chairs/teams. You will Migrate content from old site to new site and provide assistance to create content while the site features are under construction. Technical requirements: At least 1 year of hands-on experience with CMS such as Joomla, Drupal or WordPress. The site is being developed using Joomla so experience with that is preferred. Familiar with web development using PHP, HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Familiar with databases and SQL Understands the 3-tier web design architecture Understanding of AWS hosting (bonus) Other Requirements Should be able to dedicate at least 4-6 hours a week on assigned tasks. Good communication skills and have a proactive attitude. Should be able to attend weekly 1-hour Skype/Google hangout calls on weekends and meet in-person once a month on a weekend Should be able to estimate time and effort on assigned tasks and provide weekly status updates. Able to work in a dynamic environment. Generates content for the Disability Allies website 2. Ensure articles follow our content policies. 3. Utilize Photoshop and any other software tools necessary to ensure the highest quality content. 4. Utilize our technology to upload and optimize the articles for review by the editors. 5. Be an awesome, positive force for our company culture. Be a self-starter, looking to improve our great company every day. Qualifications & Competencies: A bachelor's degree in English, Communications or related field is strongly preferred. Related digital content writing experience strongly preferred. Must have the ability to write in a way that connects with our readers and drives them to share our content with friends and family. About the Disability Allies: The purpose of the Disability Allies is to plan team building activities that connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. At our events we pair each individual up with a mentor. The job of the mentor is to help the participants with their social skills and insure that everyone interacts with each other. Our events are open to any young adult that has a disability, knows someone with a disability or is supportive of people with disabilities. Please visit www.disabilityallies.com to learn more. Disability Allies Anti-Discrimination statement: Disability Allies shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, gender identification or expression, or military status in any of its activities of operations. These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers, and selection of vendors and provision of services.
08816.title: Content Writer

Community Organize is a part time position. The Community Organizer reports to the Director and is responsible for DA outreach and recruitment. Responsibilities: The Community Organizer’s primary responsibilities are to build strategic relationships, conduct a variety of outreach activities, and recruit volunteers and members. Create and implement our outreach plan Develop and strengthen relationships between the Disability Allies and the community Develop partnerships with universities, social groups and community organizations, in particular those that provide social opportunities to young adults with disabilities Recruit and place Disability Allies volunteers within our committees Qualifications & Competencies: Excellent public speaking and presentation skills Must be able to meet deadlines and adjust to changing priorities Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing Ability to connect with others and develop relationships Committed to the mission of serving young adults with disabilities Ability to perform several tasks concurrently Strong time management and organizational skills Ability to maintain detailed records and confidential information About the Disability Allies: The purpose of the Disability Allies is to plan team building activities that connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. 08816.description: Marketing Coordinator reports to the director and is responsible for to implementing a comprehensive and effective coordinated marketing effort for the Disability Allies Oversee our marketing, advertising and social media initiative Develop and create visually appealing marketing materials Refine and enhance brand identities As a part of the DA senior leadership team, determine strategy and key goals; develop a comprehensive and integrated plan/direction for marketing and outreach for our programs Develop and implement campaigns to promote brand recognition and to significantly increase enrollment in the Disability Allies program
08816.title: Marketing Coordinator

08816.description: The Professional Mentor is responsible for helping participants improve their social skills. Provide guidance, motivation, emotional support, and role modeling to our participants Ensure that each participant is engaged in all the activities at our events Encourage participants to interact with each other Develop strategies to improve the social skills of our participant
08816.title: Proffessional Mentor

08816.description: The Event Manager’s primary responsibilities are to manage our event registration, reach out to our members about our events and oversee the planning and organization of our events Reach out to our members via phone and text messaging to remind them about our monthly events Address any concerns or questions members have pertaining to our events Ensure that individuals register online and check-in at our monthly events Maintain records of individuals attending our monthly events Update our database with emails and phone numbers of individuals that attend our events Oversee and support Disability Allies volunteers and the event planning committees
08816.title: Event Planner

08816.description: The Development Associate/ Grant Writer will develop and expand the relationships between the organization and its donors and conduct fundraisers on a monthly basis. He or she may any of the following tasks. Seek out new and follow-up with potential and existing donors Obtain non-monetary donations from businesses such as supplies and/or gift cards Develop and implement a system to acknowledge and reward donors Assist our grant writer in researching and locating available grants Prepare, submit, and manage grant proposals to foundation and corporate sources. Maintain accurate and up-to-date donor contact and biographical information Conduct monthly fundraisers and spearhead our crowd funding campaign
08816.title: Grant Writer

08816.description: Marketplace in East Brunswick is a great opportunity for volunteers to impact the lives of families in the community. The Crisis Room at Aldersgate UMC provides food allotments that include perishable and non-perishable items, to numerous families every month. Jersey Cares volunteers are needed to assist with: Food Sorting Food Distribution Greeting guests in a heartfelt manner Organization of the food pantry Cleanliness Sort and fold clothing for distribution Sign up today and encourage family and friends to register with you! NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
08816.title: Marketplace in East Brunswick

08816.description: Can you provide a temporary home for a cat, litter of kittens or a dog? Do you have a little extra love to share with an abandoned animal? We are always looking for new foster homes so that we can rescue more animals or to give the cats that we have at the North Brunswick PetSmart a break and experience a \"real\" home. The Karma Cat + Zen Dog Rescue Society will arrange and pay for medical and food needs.
08816.title: Cat, Kitten or Dog Foster Home
08816.org: Karma Cat + Zen Dog Rescue Society

08816.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08816.title: Mentor Youth

08817.description: Voluntees are needed to visit group homes for adults with developmental disabilities to play games, lead socialization activities, share an interest or skill with the group like arts and crafts, music , mild exercise etc.
08817.title: Friendly  Visitor

08817.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New Jersey citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
08817.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Edison NJ

11368.description: Help Adults Learn MS Word and MS Publisher. Must speak spanish and english...
11368.title: Bilingual MS Word MS Publisher Instructor

11368.description: Dominico-American Society of Queens seeks a Newsletter Editor/Writer who is enthusiastic and self-motivated. This person will Design and produce digital and print newsletter We prefer someone who is bilingual and familiar with Queens County. The position reports to our Executive Director, who primarily works in our Corona office. Hours are flexible and can include Saturday mornings.
11368.title: Bilingual Newsletter Editor

11368.description: Teach adults how to create and use social media sites such as Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. \"Computer Basics,\" \"How to use a USB,\" to \"Internet Safety\" How to search and evaluate information online and how to use sites like Hulu, YouTube, and Google Earth.
11368.title: Bilingual Social Media Trainer

11368.description: Help adult to learn basic computer skills. Must be English and Spanish speaker.
11368.title: Bilingual Computer Instructor

11368.description: Greet visitors and callers, handle their inquiries, and direct them to the appropriate persons according to their needs. Take messages, or transfer calls to appropriate individuals.
11368.title: Bilingual Secretary-Assistant

11368.description: Looking for someone to volunteer their time to up keep our website using FileManager.
11368.title: Website Administrator

11368.description: We are looking for a person who has knowledge of writing proposals for nonprofit organizations. The person needs to have min experience. Thru proposals is how we get funds to provide services to our members. Services include ESL courses, Computer courses, Citizenship courses, and tutoring for the children in our After School program. These programs are very important for our community and by obtaining more funds we can expand our programs and provide more services.
11368.title: Proposal Writing Volunteer

11368.description: Provide individual and small group tutoring to our After-School students. Assist students in improving academic achievement by meeting with them on a regular basis to clarify learning problems and work on study skills. Other assistance includes: reviewing class material, discussing text, formulating ideas for papers, or working on solutions to solve problems. The tutor should be able to motivate the students and the parents to guarantee the progress of their academic experience. Plan field trips as well as lead computer-based classes for the children.
11368.title: Bilingual After School Tutor

11368.description: We are looking for a person/s who will like to volunteer their time to teach English as a second language at a Basic, intermediate, or Advance level to adults. Our target population is mainly Hispanic Immigrants in the communities that we serve which are Corona, Elmhurst, East Elmhurst, and Jackson Heights in Queens, New York.
11368.title: Bilingual ESL Teacher for Level 1,2,3 and 4

11367.description: We have a lovely senior who is looking for a friend who can help her learn computer, play some cards or board games and just chat. although she speaks English, she would love to converse in her native Spanish tongue. If this opportunity interests you and you can get to Flushing, please call Suzanne Windland at SNAP at 718 454-2100,ext 123
11367.title: Amiga for a senior!

11364.description: We have a lovely, active senior who would like a volunteer she can socialize with, talk to, grabe a bit to eat with, and learn computer from. Speaks English but would love to converse in her native tongue. Just an hour a week is all we ask. If this opportunity interests you or you would like more information, please call Suzanne Windland at 718 454-2100
11364.title: Cantonese Mandarin speaking volunteer needed - Friendly Visiting

11364.description: Summer Volunteer / Intern wanted for a drug education program based in Bayside, Queens. We need a summer volunteer / intern who can: 1) schedule events 2) be responsible for monitoring the schedule of our events, ensuring that everything is organized, etc. 3) Handle and maintain our database 4) prepare and send out newsletters 5) make deliveries of educational materials 6) man and set up booths at community fairs and events We are looking for someone who is reliable, organized, friendly and professional. If you are interested, please send your resume.
11364.title: Intern / Volunteer Wanted
11364.org: Foundation for a Drug Free World - NY Chapter

11364.description: Summer Volunteer / Intern wanted for a drug education program based in Bayside, Queens. We need a summer volunteer / intern who can: 1) schedule events 2) be responsible for monitoring the schedule of our events, ensuring that everything is organized, etc. 3) Handle and maintain our database 4) prepare and send out newsletters 5) make deliveries of educational materials 6) man and set up booths at community fairs and events We are looking for someone who is reliable, organized, friendly and professional. If you are interested, please send your resume.
11364.title: Event Management Volunteers
11364.org: Foundation for a Drug Free World - NY Chapter

11364.description: We are looking for a volunteer / intern, with potentiality of turning into long term job position, who will be an Executive Assistant and Administrator for the NY Chapter of Foundation for a Drug Free World. We do nearly daily events in the Greater NY area as well as oversee other chapters in other states in the US as well as in Latin America. We need assistance with following up on all of our chapters, ensuring they are sending in reports, answering emails, sending projects to volunteers, overseeing volunteers, sending thank you cards, storing documents neatly on computer, etc. We are looking for someone who is very organized who can help us to better organize and run our group, and who is good at following directions.
11364.title: Administrator / Secretary Position
11364.org: Foundation for a Drug Free World - NY Chapter

11364.description: This lovely outgoing senior would love a volunteer who can bring their small dog to visit. She has always had a dog, but with her disabilities, finds it to hard to care for one on her own. If this opportunity interests you, please call Suzanne Windland at SNAP at 718 454-2100, ext 136 for more information. Weekday afternoons or weekends.
11364.title: Partner with your pup!  Senior would love to receive some puppy love

11364.description: We are looking for a volunteer who can video all of our events. We provide free drug education events to NYC schools and after-school programs. We'd like to document all of our work through video and need a volunteer who can video our events. We are flexible and will accept the dates that you have available. Must have video camera and a video chip that we can reuse for the events.
11364.title: Videographer Wanted
11364.org: Foundation for a Drug Free World - NY Chapter

11364.description: The Foundation for a Drug Free World Northeast Chapter (www.foundationforadrugfreeworldnewyorkchapter.org) is looking for a graphic designer/artist who can create a blog for our website and come up with other creative ideas that we can put on the web to promote our program in NY and New Jersey. We are open to your ideas and need your help to take all of our photographs and events and utilize them to promote our message.
11364.title: Graphic Artist & Website Content Volunteer Position
11364.org: Foundation for a Drug Free World - NY Chapter

11364.description: A Drug Education international organization has a NY Chapter in Bayside, Queens. We put on free drug education to schools, after-school organizations and community organizations in Queens, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Harlem and the Bronx. The events are about 45 minutes - 1 hour long. We mainly show our organization's video, but there is also about a 15 minute lecture portion of the presentation/event. We put on two events per day in these areas of New York as a drug education community service program to schools and after-school programs. We are posting this as we have an opportunity for an intern to put on these events for our organization in the above areas. You will get experience: 1) setting up events, 2) presenting events, 3) getting follow up feedback for our organization. We are looking for part time and full time interns who can put on two events per day. You must be willing to take public transportation to events, unless you have a car. Travel expenses will be paid for by our organization as part of internship. You must be honest, responsible, competent. You must be a good representation of our organization when you are visiting these schools and after-school sites. If you are interested, please contact us for an interview. Location: Bayside,Queens Compensation: Internship. Travel expenses reimbursed. This is at a non-profit organization. This is an internship job
11364.title: Drug Education Events & Presentations: Internship/Volunteer Opportunity
11364.org: Foundation for a Drug Free World - NY Chapter

11365.description: Help us take care of the animals in our hospital. Stock and clean our Vet Mobile trucks. Sterilize surgical instruments. Sign up clients and prepare medications. Paid job available if you do a good job.
11365.title: Veterinary Hospital & Adoption Center

As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Together we can protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions.
