Please join our weekly Introductory Conference Call. The next one is on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. It is a live call, about an hour long, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. Please register for the call at this link so that we can follow up with you: https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/ We look forward to working with you!
11365.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Queens NY

11365.description: You can make a difference! Come join our team and provide haircuts for people living with an advanced illness within your Queens community. Volunteers will receive a 5 hour training program regarding the basics of Hospice care. To apply online go to our website at hospicecarenetwork.org or you may call 516-224-6421 for more information. Hospice Care Network is a certified not-for-profit hospice organization. Our staff and volunteers provide compassionate end-of-life care to over 500 patients daily in Queens, Nassau and Suffolk.
11365.title: Give a haircut...become a Hospice Volunteer!

11365.description: Hospice Care Network seeks compassionate individuals to provide companionship, respite, run errands, and provide support to people living with an advanced illness. Volunteers will be required to complete a 16 hour training program, be willing to travel within 30 minutes of their home and be able to dedicate 2-4 hours of service on a weekly basis. Interested candidates may apply directly by visiting our website, www.hospicecarenetwork.org , selecting the Volunteer tab and completing an online application. To request an application by mail or email, please call 516-832-7100 and ask to speak with a Volunteer Coordinator.
11365.title: Community Patient Support Volunteer

11362.description: Pride of Judea is a licensed community-based mental health clinic located in Eastern Queens. It provides services to children, adolescents, and adults who are struggling with a wide range of emotional and social problems. As a Team Activity Leader, you will be able to turn a hobby or passion into a unique and rewarding volunteer opportunity. We are looking for volunteers (individual or group) that are interested in working with older adults and teaching them a passion such as music, dance, arts visual or performing arts, or cooking- whatever your favorite pastime may be. You will also have an opportunity to assist staff, engage with Club Pride Members, and provide support for already existing group activities.
11362.title: Activity Specialist - Queens
11362.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

07724.description: \"The willingness of America’s veterans to sacrifice for our country has earned them our lasting gratitude.\" - Jeff Miller If you are a Veteran we could use your help! Compassus Hospice is looking for Veteran volunteers to spend time with fellow veterans at the end of their lives. Veteran volunteers have the unique ability to relate to patients with military service and understand their needs. The camaraderie created between veterans has proven to be supportive for all involved. Join our Veteran to Veteran volunteer program! What can volunteers do? Make friendly visits in facilities near you Provide caregiver relief and respite Complementary Therapy such as Reiki, Massage, and Pet Therapy Read Listen Share a special talent like music or crafts Administrative support What do we provide? Free training at your convenience Free health evaluation and TB test Ongoing educational opportunities Flexible scheduling and patient assignments close to you
07724.title: Military Veterans Needed as Hospice Volunteers

07724.description: Body: \"Reading gives us somewhere to go when we have to stay where we are.\" - Mason Cooley If you enjoy reading, share your love of literature with hospice patients! Some patients have limited eyesight or mobility and cannot enjoy a book the way they once could. Help them escape into the world of Jane Austen or maybe help them enjoy a biography about John F. Kennedy! Contact us for more information. Be the bright spot in someone’s day! What do we provide? Free training at your convenience Free health evaluation and TB test Ongoing educational opportunities Flexible scheduling and patient assignments close to you
07724.title: Love to read? Become a hospice volunteer!

07724.description: \"The difference between friends and pets is that, friends we allow into our company, pets we allow into our solitude.\" - Robert Brault Animals have an overwhelmingly positive affect on so many hospice patients. So many of our Compassus patients have owned pets in the past and miss being around animals; With that being said, please consider sharing your pet’s unconditional love with fellow animal lovers! Your pet will need to be a certified therapy animal. Request more information today! What do we provide? Information on how to get your pet certified for visits. Free training at a location near year and a time based on your convenience Free health evaluation and TB test Ongoing educational opportunities Social activities and events Flexible scheduling and patient assignments in your area
07724.title: Pet Therapy: Share your pet’s unconditional love with hospice patients!

07724.description: MSW students will gain valuable experience while providing terminally ill patients and their families with psychological and social support under the guidance of a VITAS MSW field instructor and team manager. Students will serve as members of VITAS interdisciplinary patient care teams while assisting patients and families in accessing community resources and governmental benefits and assessing patient and family needs and potential crisis situations. Students also will help patients and families identify grief issues and provide bereavement services. VITAS MSW student interns must be enrolled in a Master of Social Work program at an accredited college or university. All MSW student interns must attend new-employee orientation, which includes shadowing VITAS care providers, during the first month of the internship. For more information about VITAS visit VITAS.com.
07724.title: MSW Interns Needed to Provide Comfort and Support to Hospice Patients and Families
07724.org: VITAS Healthcare of New Jersey Shore

07724.description: Hospice volunteers visiting nursing home patients lessen the burden on family members who may be too far away to play an active role in their loved one’s life. With hospice training, you will find that your skill sets are sharpened and new ones emerge. Hospice volunteers are trained in communication skills, family dynamics and how to make a positive difference for patients and their caregivers. After you complete the required orientation, VITAS-trained volunteers are prepared to visit nursing homes and assisted living facilities to provide relief care for caregivers, offer companionship and pampering to the patient, sit vigil, provide love with Paw Pals visits and help in other meaningful ways.
07724.title: Offer Companionship and Pampering to Hospice Facility Patients
07724.org: VITAS Healthcare of New Jersey Shore

07724.description: VITAS Healthcare(r) is looking for kind and caring people to help terminally ill patients and their families - just by being there at the end of life. 11th-Hour (Vigil) Volunteers should be comfortable around death and dying and be familiar with the dying process. Most importantly, 11th-Hour Volunteers must be able to meet the unique needs of the patient and family by offering a calming presence. We are especially looking for volunteers who would be available at short notice to provide 2-4 hours shifts. VITAS Volunteer patient care orientation and the 11 th Hour Training is provided free of charge to help you learn the skills required to be an outstanding hospice volunteer. Time and dates are ongoing and flexible. For more information about VITAS visit VITAS.com.
07724.title: Be a Calming Presence at the End of Life
07724.org: VITAS Healthcare of New Jersey Shore

07724.description: My name is Katie and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a Non-Profit Organization looking for willing host families in your area. We wanted to reach out with this opportunity to host an international exchange student in your local community. Every year thousands of host families across the United States welcome International Exchange Students, AnB Education is grateful to be working with hundreds of host families across the country. An exchange student not only attends school, but becomes immersed in our world. Host families welcome a new sons, daughters, sisters and brothers from across the world. To us Host Families, you, are an essential part of helping create a better world! Through the personal relationships, language and cultural immersion we can help teach tomorrow’s leaders today. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are supported with a generous monthly reimbursement. Also, if you recommend a family to host, and A student is placed with the family we will send you a thank you of $200. Our International students need . . . -A caring and friendly host family who is willing to provide quiet space for studying, access to TV and internet, and access to laundry facilities. -A private bedroom (not in the basement please) and a shared or private bathroom in a safe and clean environment. -Breakfast and dinner meals with host family during the week. (The student would buy their lunch at school) and 3 meals during the weekend. (Most international students like to share meals with their American hosts every day. They benefit from speaking English in relaxed, natural situations outside of their English courses. ) http://www.anbeducation.com/host-family-application.html
07724.title: Host Families Needed; Tinton Falls, NJ

07724.description: My name is Michelle and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a Non-Profit Organization looking for willing host families in your area. We wanted to reach out with this opportunity to host an international exchange student in your local community. Every year thousands of host families across the United States welcome International Exchange Students, AnB Education is grateful to be working with hundreds of host families across the country. An exchange student not only attends school, but becomes immersed in our world. Host families welcome a new sons, daughters, sisters and brothers from across the world. To us Host Families, you, are an essential part of helping create a better world! Through the personal relationships, language and cultural immersion we can help teach tomorrow’s leaders today. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are supported with a generous monthly reimbursement. http://www.anbeducation.com/
07724.title: Host Families Needed!

07724.description: CASA for Children is a non-profit charitable organization which works through professionally trained and supervised volunteers to promote the welfare of foster children in Monmouth County, New Jersey who have been removed from their homes because of extreme parental abuse, neglect or abandonment. CASA serves as a child's \"Voice in Court\", working to insure that needed services and assistance are provided while helping to move the child toward a safe and permanent home. Volunteers will be screened (fingerprinted and interviewed) before beginning an intesive training program. After volunteers complete training, they will be assigned either one child or a set of siblings. They will review DCP&P documents and interview the child(ren),relatives, teachers and others who may have impact on the child's life. Volunteers will then write reports which are submitted to the family court judge. They will also be asked to attend court hearings. Each volunteer is requested to make a minimum one year commitment to their child(ren).
07724.title: Advocate for a Child in Foster Care!

07724.description: CASA for Children of Monmouth County's looking for community leaders from around Monmouth County for their Executive and Associate Boards. EXECUTIVE BOARD MEMBERS come from various social and professional backgrounds and help use their expertise to benefit the program. They help to determine policies, procedures and regulations for the conduct of the agency; to raise funds to finance the organization and its programs; and to monitor organizational performance. ASSOCIATE BOARD MEMBERS comprised of young leaders primarily aged between 21-40 who help support and promote the critical issues and efforts of CASA for Children in a variety of ways, including: Serving as an advocate for quality and equitable public education; Raising visibility for the organization; Connecting resources (both financial and in-kind) to the organization; Organizing a variety of fund-raising projects that focus on the vital work of CASA; Making current and future Monmouth County leaders aware of CASA and our programs If interested please contact the office or go to our website to download and fill out a board application.
07724.title: Board of Trustees - CASA

07724.description: Homeside Hospice is looking for volunteers to provide companionship to hospice patients in their home environment in Monmouth County. As a companion you will provide a listening ear and a sharing spirit to enhance the patient's emotional and spiritual well-being. As a volunteer you will provide essential, quality of life services to patients. Your efforts will provide the sort of care and help that a loving friend provides and help insure that the Hospice promise is fulfilled. Some visits might include reading, watching TV, taking walks, playing music, talking about their life and their family, or shared silence.
07724.title: Volunteer companions needed for hospice patients in Monmouth County

07724.description: VITAS Healthcare(r) is looking for people who love to sew who are able to share their skills with hospice patients and families. A Memory Bear, sewn by a volunteer with compassion and love, is a forever friend who can ease a hurting heart after the death of a VITAS hospice patient. Sewn from a favorite pair of jeans, a pullover top, dress, bathrobe or nightgown, a Memory Bear may recall the closeness of a loved one, bring a smile to someone in distress, or offer a sense of security to a child who feels alone after the loss of a parent or sibling. This is a great opportunity for you to give back to the community. By taking time out of your busy work week you can make the biggest difference in another’s life. For more information about VITAS visit VITAS.com.
07724.title: Stitch a Memory Bear. Create a Forever Friend.
07724.org: VITAS Healthcare of New Jersey Shore

07724.description: All it takes is compassion and a little time to become a volunteer feeding assistant, helping hospice patients during meal times in nursing homes. Volunteer feeding assistants provide the gifts of sustenance and companionship to hospice patients, who often need more time and assistance to finish their meals. Volunteers are trained in how to make any meal more enjoyable for patients, by being patient and providing a listening ear. Tasks can include accompanying residents to and from the dining room, preparing residents for a meal, serving the meal, providing encouragement and conversation, cutting food so residents can feed themselves, assisting with beverages, in some cases, feeding residents, recording food and beverage intake. The time commitment from the volunteer can be as little as one hour, yet the reward is instant gratification. All VITAS Healthcare volunteers are trained in communication skills, family dynamics, the dying experience and ways to positively affect the patient and his or her family. Times and dates are ongoing and flexible, and volunteer orientation is provided free of charge. For more information about VITAS visit VITAS.com.
07724.title: Feed a Hospice Resident, Feed Your Soul
07724.org: VITAS Healthcare of New Jersey Shore

11360.description: Dancing Dreams, a nonprofit dance program for physically challenged children, is seeking an assistant volunteer photographer to work alongside our current professional photographer, Hiroko Shono-Cheng (hirokophotography.com). This position is ideal for candidates interested and experienced in photography and multi-media production. Responsibilities include: -photographing dancers and helpers at classes -editing photos -shooting videos -assisting in multi-media production -entering data **All photos taken are solely for Dancing Dreams's use.** More information on Dancing Dreams can be found on dancingdreams.org.
11360.title: Assistant Volunteer Photographer

11361.description: About Are you interested in a field that works closely with individuals who have intellectual and developmental disabilities? Would you like to share your interests with someone who enjoys it just as much as you? Partners Health Plan, a not for profit health plan that supports the lives of individuals with developmental and intellectual disabilities, is looking for volunteers for The PAL Program. The PAL Program discovers a member’s passion, interests, and matches up the individual with a person or place in the community sharing a similar passion or interest. We discover what you enjoy and how it could potentially match with a member of PHP. Member Information 28 year old female who would like someone to take the subways with and travel to museums, art classes, libraries, and science centers. She has a mild form of autism, and is very interested in art, science, and furthering her education. How does it work? Meet with individual preferably once a week or depending on schedule flexibility Meet at home and travel to and from Bayside area with individual First outing will always be accompanied by Community Resource Coordinator Provide your own transportation to meet the individual at the destination Report to community resource coordinator with updates on the progress of outings Form natural friendship with individual based on similar interests Benefits Receive an optional professional reference upon completion of program Join an incredible community of passionate staff and volunteers Hours: Approximately one a week depending on the activity and volunteer schedule Suggested Commitment: 6 months - 1 year PHP provides equal opportunity for all volunteers.
11361.title: Art & Science Enthusiast

11361.description: Do you have a friendly, well-mannered dog or pet you want to share with others? Do you have a passion for supporting people receiving services at YAI? We are seeking volunteers to train their pets to facilitate Animal-Assisted Activities in our Queens day programs. After completing training with The Good Dog Foundation or other approved training organization, volunteers and their pets will visit our Queens day programs to assist individuals and groups in skill-building activities to further entry into the community. With the support of program staff, you and your pet will help participants build employment readiness, interpersonal skills, and improve general well-being. Are you interested but wondering whether your pet is suitable? Do you have a cat, rabbit, or other pet and wonder if they can be therapy animals? Contact Judith Harbour to discuss further. Scholarships to train are available on a case-by-case basis. Established teams are welcome to apply as well! Volunteers will need to commit to a regular schedule of visits.
11361.title: Volunteers needed for Animal-Assisted Therapy Program

10185.description: The Arts @ Henson-Parks, Inc. is currently looking for individuals well-grounded in digital photography and videography to instruct kids ages 7-18y, grades 3-12, in the basics of digital photography and editing as part of our program called \"The Pupil Project\". Weekly instruction will include educational and recreational projects that tie-in to an end-of-program showcase. Volunteering is ongoing, conducted in multi-week sessions, throughout Queens, Brooklyn, the Bronx and Manhattan. It entails a commitment of 1 days per week, 2 hours per day afterschool between the hours of 3-6pm during the school year starting Fall 2016. Equipment and instructional tools are provided. Own/public transporation required. #ThePupilProject #RedCameraCrew #pARTicipate For more information on the program visit our website: http://www.theartsathensonparks.com/programs/ .
10185.title: Photographers & Videographers -  Instruction to NYC Students after school

10543.description: Be a good neighbor in Larchmont- Mamaroneck! At Home on the Sound is a non-profit community-based organization serving older adults who live in Larchmont and Mamaroneck NY. Drivers are needed to take seniors who no longer drive themselves on short errands, to appointments, or shopping. Drive as your calendar allows. You will never be locked into a schedule: we contact you when a ride is requested. You let us know whether or not you are available. You will make a world of difference to an older neighbor who needs a lift!
10543.title: Volunteer Drivers needed for Senior Citizens

10543.description: Why not volunteer with your pet? At The New Jewish Home, Sarah Neuman, we welcome you to become a volunteer with your dog or cat. Pet visit volunteers make regular visits with the elders in our nursing home and make many new friends here along the way. Pet visits bring smiles and happiness to so many of those here at Sarah Neuman! For more details and requirements please contact the Volunteer Office at (914)864-5140 or email SRNVolunteers@Jewishhome.org
10543.title: Friendly pet visits!  Volunteer with your dog or cat!
10543.org: The New Jewish Home, Sarah Neuman

10549.description: Drivers to help older adults, aged 60+, and vision impaired adults who cannot drive to their medical appointments only. Background check, references and clean driving record required.
10549.title: - COPY - Driver Volunteer

10549.description: Meeting quarterly, Advisory Councils in Northeast Westchester and the Sound Shore identify transportation needs and concerns among older and disabled adults, as well as strategies for filling gaps. As the program expands up the Hudson River into Peekskill, an additional Council will be convened to consider the special needs of the River Towns and the North West.
10549.title: WestFair Rides Advisory Council Members

10549.description: Meeting quarterly, the Board provides fiscal, planning and administrative oversight to ensure fulfillment of the WFR mission and long term sustainability of the program. Seeking legal, planning, financial services backgrounds, as well as Latino and other minority perspectives. Spanish a plus.
10549.title: Board of Directors

10549.description: Someone with camera equipment, able to tape interviews and/or help with videos and video content. Travel, people person to help create videos for the promote branding of WestFair Rides and to help attract volunteers to the organization.
10549.title: Videographer Volunteer

10549.description: Promote WestFair Rides at caregiver, health and volunteer fairs. Manage inventory of items needed for distribution, e.g. flyers and other handouts.
10549.title: Ambassador Volunteers

10549.description: Discover venues for various events, as well as sources for gifts and health fair giveaway items for volunteer recognition, expos and, health fairs.
10549.title: Research Volunteer

10549.description: Reporting to the Volunteer Coordinator, assists in overseeing volunteers in one quadrant of Westchester County. A take-charge person to assist in team building, expansion and growth of West Fair Rides. Sets up meetings/meet-ups, inspires team building.
10549.title: Professional Team Leader Volunteer

10549.description: Drivers to help older adults, aged 60+, and vision impaired adults who cannot drive to their medical appointments only. Background check, references and clean driving record required.
10549.title: Driver Volunteer

10549.description: Assist with all aspects of planning events for WFR and the volunteers. Works closely with Volunteer Coordinator and Engagement Coordinator. Creative person to assist with ideas, research, event theme, design invitations, solicitation letters and telephone work.
10549.title: Event Planner Assistant Volunteer

10549.description: Do you have a curiosity about global affairs? Lead a U.S. foreign policy discussion group today! For over 55 years, the Foreign Policy Association's Great Decisions program has brought together people and communities to encourage individuals to engage in the world around them and to think critically about the global issues facing policymakers. Each year, FPA produces the Great Decisions briefing book, examining eight U.S. foreign policy and global affairs topics. All across the U.S., discussion groups meet to consider and discuss these topics, constituting the largest civil-education network in the country. Discussion group leaders organize and lead these meetings in their communities. Become a group leader now!
10549.title: Lead a global affairs discussion in the Mt. Kisco area today!!

10989.description: The Mental Health Association of Rockland County, Inc is continuing our successful mentoring program called Promising Pathways for the 2016 - 2017 school year which will help elementary and middle school students reconnect with school through encouragement and support of caring mentors. Mentors must be 19 years or older and have a desire to help change a child's life for the better. Please call 845-267-2172 x324 for more information. Please RSVP for one of our information sessions (July 19, August 2 or August 16 @ 6-7pm). Please feel free to bring a friend who might also be interested in mentoring.
10989.title: Promising Pathways, a mentoring program for elementary and middle school youth
10989.org: Mental Health Association of Rockland County

07430.description: Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist in therapeutic horse-back riding lessons as lead walkers for our Summer Semester! Lead walkers are responsible for handling the horse during lessons and only those with previous horse experience will be assigned as Lead Walkers. Lessons run Monday through Thursday. Our Summer Semester begins on July 10th and runs through to August 24th. Available afternoon shifts (2:45 Pm to 6:00 PM or any time in between): Thursday, July 20th Monday, July 24th Thursday, July 27th Monday, July 31st Thursday, August 10th Monday, August 14th Thursday, August 17th Monday, August 21st Thursday, August 24 th UPCOMING TRANING CLASSES: Wednesday, July 5 th, 3:00 to 4:30 PM Thursday, July 6 th, 10:00 to 11:30 AM Sunday, July 9 th, 10:00 to 11:30 AM Volunteer Handbook, application and schedule will be emailed to you and application needs to be returned to our office prior to registering for a volunteer training class. Pony Power Therapies gives special needs and at-risk children and adults a unique opportunity to ride, care for and interact with horses. Our riding and non-riding activities enhance individuals' physical, social and emotional well-being in a safe, nurturing farm environment. Please visit www.ponypowernj.org for more information on Pony Power Therapies. Interested individuals can email volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call our office at 201-934-1001.
07430.title: Horse Handlers for Therapeutic Horseback Riding - Afternoons!

07430.description: Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist in therapeutic horse-back riding lessons as lead walkers for our Summer Semester! Lead walkers are responsible for handling the horse during lessons and only those with previous horse experience will be assigned as Lead Walkers. Lessons run Monday through Thursday. Our Summer Semester begins on July 10th and runs through to August 24th. Available morning shifts (8:30 AM to 10:30 AM): Monday, July 10th Tuesday, July 11th Wednesday, July 12th Thursday, July 13th Tuesday, July 18th Wednesday, July 19th Thursday, July 20th Thursday, August 17th UPCOMING TRANING CLASSES: Wednesday, July 5 th, 3:00 to 4:30 PM Thursday, July 6 th, 10:00 to 11:30 AM Sunday, July 9 th, 10:00 to 11:30 AM Volunteer Handbook, application and schedule will be emailed to you and application needs to be returned to our office prior to registering for a volunteer training class. Pony Power Therapies gives special needs and at-risk children and adults a unique opportunity to ride, care for and interact with horses. Our riding and non-riding activities enhance individuals' physical, social and emotional well-being in a safe, nurturing farm environment. Please visit www.ponypowernj.org for more information on Pony Power Therapies. Interested individuals can email volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call our office at 201-934-1001.
07430.title: Horse Handlers for Therapeutic Horseback Riding - Mornings!

07430.description: Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist in therapeutic horse-back riding lessons as side walkers for our Summer Semester! Under the supervision of a certified riding instructor, the side walker walks next to the horse to provide support to the rider as needed. Lessons run Monday through Thursday. Our Summer Semester begins on July 10th and runs through to August 24th. Available afternoon shifts (2:45 Pm to 6:00 PM or anytime in between): Thursday, July 20th Monday, July 24th Thursday, July 27th Thursday, August 10th Monday, August 14th Thursday, August 17th Monday, August 21st Thursday, August 24 th UPCOMING TRANING CLASSES: Wednesday, July 5 th, 3:00 to 4:30 PM Thursday, July 6 th, 10:00 to 11:30 AM Sunday, July 9 th, 10:00 to 11:30 AM Volunteer Handbook, application and schedule will be emailed to you and application needs to be returned to our office prior to registering for a volunteer training class. Pony Power Therapies gives special needs and at-risk children and adults a unique opportunity to ride, care for and interact with horses. Our riding and non-riding activities enhance individuals' physical, social and emotional well-being in a safe, nurturing farm environment. Please visit www.ponypowernj.org for more information on Pony Power Therapies. Interested individuals can email volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call our office at 201-934-1001.
07430.title: Afternoon Volunteers for Therapeutic Horseback Riding - Side Walker!

07430.description: Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist in therapeutic horse-back riding lessons as side walkers for our Summer Semester! Under the supervision of a certified riding instructor, the side walker walks next to the horse to provide support to the rider as needed. Lessons run Monday through Thursday. Our Summer Semester begins on July 10th and runs through to August 24th. Available morning shifts (8:30 AM to 10:30 AM): Monday, July 10th Wednesday, July 12th Thursday, August 17th UPCOMING TRANING CLASSES: Wednesday, July 5 th, 3:00 to 4:30 PM Thursday, July 6 th, 10:00 to 11:30 AM Sunday, July 9 th, 10:00 to 11:30 AM Volunteer Handbook, application and schedule will be emailed to you and application needs to be returned to our office prior to registering for a volunteer training class. Pony Power Therapies gives special needs and at-risk children and adults a unique opportunity to ride, care for and interact with horses. Our riding and non-riding activities enhance individuals' physical, social and emotional well-being in a safe, nurturing farm environment. Please visit www.ponypowernj.org for more information on Pony Power Therapies. Interested individuals can email volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call our office at 201-934-1001.
07430.title: Morning Volunteers for Therapeutic Horseback Riding - Side Walkers!

07430.description: Pony Power Therapies is looking to recruit volunteers to help with the set up and maintenance of a garden located on our newly acquired property. The garden will be used for educational lessons with our participants focusing on health and nutrition. Orientation is required and the project is expected to start sometime near the end of June/beginning of July. Hours are somewhat flexible and would be either early mornings (before 9 AM) or early afternoon (between 12 and 2 PM)
07430.title: Garden Volunteers at Pony Power Therapies

07432.description: Deliver groceries and other material assistance to families of kids with cancer. We are in need of volunteers for the delivery of food and items to families in Bergen County area. The deliveries are made once a month from the Northern Regional Office located in Clark, NJ. The food is bagged and ready to go. Each volunteer would have the same family and route each month. Training will be provided. Climbing stairs may be involved. A backround check is required - we can get you one for $18 from the State of NJ if you can't provide your own. Spanish-speaking volunteers are a plus!
07432.title: Deliver items to bring comfort and cheer to help families of kids with cancer

07432.description: Deliver groceries and other material assistance to families of kids with cancer. We are in need of volunteers for the delivery of food and items to families in Bergen County area. The deliveries are made once a month from the Northern Regional Office located in Midland Park, NJ. The food is bagged and ready to go. Each volunteer would have the same family and route each month. Training will be provided. Climbing stairs may be involved. A backround check is required - we can get you one for $18 from the State of NJ if you can't provide your own. Spanish-speaking volunteers are a plus!
07432.title: Deliver items to bring comfort and cheer to help families of kids with cancer

11554.description: Make a REAL DIFFERENCE by assisting an Individual with a Disability in a weekly Exercise and/or Socialization Program! We provide Group Fitness Training and Socialization Programs to Individuals with ALL types of Abilities. Locations in Nassau and Suffolk Counties. Clean and friendly environment. Great for Students, Seniors or anyone wanting to simply GIVE BACK. Flexible hours and days available. THANK YOU!
11554.title: Assist an Individual with a Disability in a weekly Exercise and/or Socialization Program.

11510.description: This opportunity is to run a cheer leading program associated with the local youth football organization. This would allow for creating your own practice schedule, recruiting cheerleaders, deciding on uniforms and pricing to participate.
11510.title: Youth Cheer leading Coach/Organizer

11510.description: The Program is in need of knowledgeable baseball/softball coaches to help develop the children of Baldwins skills and assist coaches who do not have as much understanding of the game. Along with coaches volunteers are needed to obtain sponsors and help setup and run carnival events during the year. Currently we are putting batting cages in Baldwin park and any volunteer who can help lay cement and place poles would be greatly appreciated
11510.title: Baldwin Little League Volunteers

11510.description: The Clerical Assistant will assist with phone coverage, filing, data entry and other clerical duties.
11510.title: Clerical Assistant- Outpatient Physical Therapy

11510.description: The Clerical Assistant will assist with clerical duties such as filing, faxing, copying, telephone coverage and data entry.
11510.title: Clerical Assistant- CWI

07866.description: We are looking for volunteers 55 and over. Do you or someone you know suffer from a chronic condition and/or are a caregiver of someone who suffers from a chronic condition and you want to learn and pass the word onto others in your community? Become a trained Peer Leader. You will be taught how to teach others who suffer from chronic conditions to better manage their conditions with educations and setting realistic short-term and long-term goals. This is a results based program out of Stanford University. If this sounds like something you would be interested in doing please call 973-784-4900 ext. 208. ALL TRAINING AND MATERIALS ARE PROVIDED FOR FREE. Many of our peer leaders have taken the program as a participant and became leaders. You do not have to participate in the workshops to become a leader. Just call and we can get you trained.
07866.title: Take Control of Your Health Leaders
07866.org: Skylands RSVP & Volunteer Resource Center sponsored by NORWESCAP

07866.description: Do you or someone you know live with the fear of falling? Many older adults experience concerns about falling and restrict their activities. A Matter of Balance is a volunteer facilitated, award-winning program designed to manage falls and increase activity levels. Become a trained leader and teach others how to manage their concerns about falling! Volunteer coaches assist participants in learning how to set realistic goals to increase activity, change their environment to reduce fall risk factors, and perform simple exercises to increase strength and balance. If this is of interest to you please call 973-784-4900 ext. 203. This program is provided free to you and any participants. You will be trained for FREE and will be provided with all the necessary materials. This class is specifically designed to benefit older adults who are still managing their day to day activities in thier homes.
07866.title: Help Ease the Fear of Injury from Falls
07866.org: Skylands RSVP & Volunteer Resource Center sponsored by NORWESCAP

07866.description: Seniors, 55 . There are many home bound residents in Morris, Sussex, and Warren Counties in need of someone to take at least 1 hour per week to visit with them or call them to chat, check in, and be a friendly voice on the phone. Skylands RSVP is looking for volunteers who would enjoy spending time with a resident or making friendly phone calls on a weekly basis. In just one hour a week you can make a world of difference in someone's life.
07866.title: Make New Friends
07866.org: Skylands RSVP & Volunteer Resource Center sponsored by NORWESCAP

07866.description: Peers leaders (50+) are needed for a 24-week exercise and education program for older women and men who are at risk of developing or have osteoporosis, training and materials are provided. For additional information & registration, please call Cheryl at 973-784-4900 ext. 203 or Nancy at 973-784-4900 ext. 208.
07866.title: Lead Exercise Classes to Prevent Osteoporosis
07866.org: Skylands RSVP & Volunteer Resource Center sponsored by NORWESCAP

07866.description: Provide FREE, objective & confidential help to NJ Medicare beneficiaries who have problems with, or questions about Medicare, Medigap, Medicare Choice HMOs, and Long-Term Care insurance.
07866.title: Help Others Make Sense of Medicare
07866.org: Skylands RSVP & Volunteer Resource Center sponsored by NORWESCAP

07866.description: We are looking for volunteers 55 and over to go grocery shopping for those who are homebound. This is a volunteer position that is as easy as 1,2,3... 1) Pick up the client's grocery list, coupons, and money. 2) Do their shopping. 3) Put away their groceries. Three steps can make a big difference in someone's life.
07866.title: Grocery Shopper
07866.org: Skylands RSVP & Volunteer Resource Center sponsored by NORWESCAP

07020.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at Edgwater Multiplex. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
07020.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Edgewater Multiplex in Edgewater, NJ!

11740.description: The volunteer service would include helping to greet patients and overall waiting room patient observation/communication. The operating hours are Mon/Wed and Friday 7:30a to 6p, Tuesday and Thursday 7:30a to 8p and Saturday 8am to 1p.
11740.title: Radiology Greeter

11743.description: Do you want to educate, motivate and have a blast all while volunteering to promote healthy living and well-being? There is an opportunity waiting for your encouraging voice and energetic personality. You would get the chance to offer your services of Yoga, Tai chi, Pilate's, Floor Exercise Routines, Nutrition Information or Aromatherapy for those living with mental illness or substance abuse issues. This is a great opportunity to teach those who suffer from substance abuse, other coping mechanisms and ways to reduce stress naturally. It is also a great way to build experience in your field.
11743.title: Health and Wellness Professional Volunteer

11743.description: We are looking for dedicated volunteers with excellent customer service skills to perform follow up phone calls for our patients after they leave the hospital. In this role, you would work closely with the health care team and connect with people at a vulnerable time in their life to ensure that their discharge needs are being addressed. We are seeking compassionate, well spoken individuals who love people, are at least 20 years of age and able to donate 3-4 hours weekly.
11743.title: Patient Outreach Volunteer

11743.description: Family Service League (FSL), a Long Island Based non-profit human service organization, is seeking volunteers to train as advocates for our Long Island Seniors living in nursing homes, adult homes and family-type homes throughout Suffolk County. FSL offers initial training classes, ongoing supervision and continuing education for all volunteer candidates. Volunteer ombudspersons will visit an assigned long term care home once a week to help seniors and their families understand and exercise their rights to quality care and better quality of life To find out more about Family Service League Ombudsperson volunteer opportunities contact: Nancy Kritzer Berlin, CTRS Volunteer Coordinator, LTC Ombudsman Program 631-470-6756 or nkritzerberlin@fsl-li.org
11743.title: Ombudsman
11743.org: Family Service League of Suffolk County

11743.description: Join our Team. Unique opportunity for those interested in healthcare or hospitality! Huntington Hospital is seeking volunteers who are customer service oriented and able to quickly connect with our patients’ families. In this role, you will orient patients’ families in our surgical waiting room and give them an overview of the process during their stay. Individuals must possess the following: Ability to volunteer a minimum of one 4-hour shift per week - (4-8 pm, M-F) Compassionate communication skills Ensure that any questions or concerns are addressed Work with our Perioperative Surgical Team to alleviate visitor’s anxiety while waiting for their loved ones If interested or for additional information, please contact Gina Torchon at gtorchon@northwell.edu or 631-351-2081
11743.title: Perioperative Ambassador

11743.description: Role: Mother/Baby Ambassador Must be at least 18 years of age and interested in a healthcare profession, with a particular interest in the Mother/Baby area. In this exciting role you will enhance the experience of our new families by: *providing comfort items *welcoming and helping orient them to the unit *interfacing with health care professionals to enhance communication *answering call bells This role requires a commitment of 4 hours 3pm-7pm a minimum of once a week We will provide you with customer service training and orientation to the role.
11743.title: Mother/Baby Ambassador - Maternity

11743.description: Do you have Good Computer Skills? Are you capable of Multi-Tasking? Do you enjoy I nteracting With People? Are you Well-Organized? Do you have a Pleasing Telephone Personality? You will be keeping student records, answering the phone, and interacting with students as well as our volunteers, who are a great group of people. Our office is open weekdays only, Monday through Friday, morning and afternoon from 9:30 AM to 2:30 PM. Most of our office staff volunteer one morning or afternoon a week, though you can choose to spend more time with us if you wish. If you are a match for our small but busy office, we would love to hear from you. You can find out more about us on our website at www. seniornetLI.org or on Facebook at www.Facebook.com/SeniorNetLI.
11743.title: Like People?  Our SeniorNet Office Needs You
11743.org: SeniorNet Computer Learning Center at FSL-LI

11743.description: Our state-of-the art Computer Lab needs you if you have a technical background or just love to tinker, fix things and learn new skills. We are looking for help in: Maintaining and updating lab computers. Troubleshooting computers, printers and networks. Keeping other volunteers up to date on any hardware or software changes. Presenting lab reports at meetings. If you are enthusastic, outgoing, and would enjoy keeping our Computer Lab operating smoothly, SeniorNet is the place for you. Our Computer Lab is open weekdays only. Learn more about us on our website at www.seniornetLI.org or on Facebook.com/SeniorNetL.I.
11743.title: Are You Handy With Computers?  Our Computer Lab Needs You!
11743.org: SeniorNet Computer Learning Center at FSL-LI

11743.description: Meals on Wheels is a volunteer, non-profit organization in need of drivers. You'll be paired with another volunteer to deliver meals to shut-ins in the Huntington area one day a week. Meals are delivered Monday through Friday at lunch time. By giving about two hours per week on a regular basis, you'll help improve your neighbors' quality of life.
11743.title: Drivers Needed for Meals on Wheels, Huntington NY
11743.org: Meals on Wheels of Huntington NY

11743.description: Our Award-Winning Don Weidman SeniorNet Computer Center offers computer classes for adults over 50. These classes are taught by an instructor with the assistance of several coaches. Courses range from basic to advanced computer skills, as well as one-session classes on the use of popular gadgets such as the iPhone, iPad, etc.. Classes are held weekdays only, Monday through Friday, mornings and afternoons. Instructors need a good knowledge of computer programs and the ability to communicate well with students. You must be patient - a sense of humor is a plus. Classes should be fun. Coaches assist the instructor and work one-on-one with students who are having difficulty and need support. You should have a basic knowledge of the course material being taught. Again, patience and a sense of humor help. Experience the tremendous satisfaction of seeing the seniors in your class learn to use the knowledge you've shared with them to enhance their lives. If you are interested in teaching or coaching, you can learn more about us on our website at www.seniornetLI.org or on Facebook at www.Facebook.com/SeniorNetLI.
11743.title: Know About Computers?  Help Seniors Learn.
11743.org: SeniorNet Computer Learning Center at FSL-LI

11743.description: Deliver flowers, discharge patients, escort visitors to various departments, etc. Retirees, stay-at-home moms, and college students are welcome.
11743.title: Wing Volunteers

11743.description: The volunteer Ambassador role in the ED is to add a personal dimension of concern and compassion to patients and their families to improve the quality of care and to assist the staff as needed in the delivery of care. The volunteer, by letting patients and their families know that someone is concerned about their emotional and physical needs and is there to assist in finding solutions to their problems, can have a significant impact on the individuals perception of the ED and hospital experience. The volunteer, through communication and the use of problem solving techniques can change what might otherwise be perceived as an impersonal environment, to one of compassion and concern. Minimum 4 volunteer hours a week. Hours: 12N-4 pm; 4-8 pm; or 7-11 pm This program provides a tremendous opportunity for experience in the emergency medicine setting!
11743.title: Emergency Department Volunteer Ambassador

11743.description: Must be dependable and committed. Seeking volunteers to assist with meals, provide refreshments, visit with patients, etc. and be a welcoming asset to the environment. Hours are from 8 am to 12 Noon or 9 am to 1 pm - Monday to Friday.
11743.title: Nursing Unit Volunteers Needed

11743.description: Supervison of teens age 14-18 needed. Juniors run errands for Nursing units, mail room, discharging patients, etc. Hours are 4P-6:30P Wednesdays.
11743.title: Supervisor of Junior Volunteers

11746.description: Food Not Bombs Mission Statement:Food Not Bombs recovers and shares free vegan or vegetarian food with the public without restriction in over 1,000 cities around the world to protest war, poverty and the destruction of the environment. Each group is independent and invites everyone to participate in making decisions for their local chapter using the consensus process. Food Not Bombs is dedicated to taking nonviolent direct action to change society so no one is forced to stand in line to eat at a soup kitchen expressing a commitment to the fact that food is a right and not a privilege. With over a billion people going hungry each day how can we spend another dollar on war? Hello Neighbor,I'm a volunteer with Long Island Food Not Bombs (http://www.LIFNB.com).We have Free Food Shares (Free Food, Clothing, Books, Baby Items, Household Items, Art, etc.) throughout Long Island and Brooklyn. Depends what donations we get from stores, churches, neighbors and volunteers. Usually there are fruits, vegetables, milk, dairy, bread, cakes, pies, canned and dry goods, pet food, etc. We also have clothes, household & baby items, books, art, etc. depending what is brought to the Food Shares that day.Ask for Volunteer Jon or Rose if you have something to share. Say hello for me. Thank you, Volunteer Dennis A new release video: We start at 13:55: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fixP0UR_G_UCraigslist Post:Free \"Long Island Food Not Bombs\" Food SharesEvery Sunday at 2 PM, West Columbia Street & Station Plaza, Hempstead, NY 11550Every Tuesday at 7 PM, East 6th Street & Fairground Avenue, Huntington NY 11746Every Thursday at 7 PM, Horseblock Road & Woodycrest Drive, Farmingville, NY 11738Every Saturday at 12 PM, noon, 1556 Straight Path, Wyandanch, NY 11798Every Saturday at 3 PM, Lafayette Ave & Marcy Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11216All outdoors. Rain or Shine. No umbrellas or strollers by tables.Come Share With Your Community.Free Food, Clothing, Books, Baby Items, Household Items, Art, etc.Whatever is brought by our Volunteers, You (if you can) and Your Neighbors in Your Community.A Community is its Neighbors, not the towns they are in.Get there a few minutes before start time. Help us unload our Volunteers vehicles and set up tables.Bring empty bags, food, clothing, household items, baby items, books, etc to \"Share with Your Community\".See Volunteers if you do bring items to Share, or you want to volunteer to hand food and items out. Say hello for me, Dennis. Nothing to bring? Then bring yourselves.We'll help you get food and items you need. You don't need to bring any type of papers or ID to our Food Shares.Everyone is welcome to get Free Food, Clothing, Household Items, Baby Items, Books, Art, etc. Depends what is brought by our volunteers and other neighbors to share.We average 12,000 pounds of food and merchandise each Food Share.Just please be polite with your neighbors when we Share.We will not tolerate any type of racial slurs or bigotry.Please thank and help our Volunteers by taking recyclable cardboard (boxes to take home your food and items). Put out on your recycle day for pick up.More info go to our website: http://www.LIFNB.comStart Sharing:1) Pass this on to family, friends and neighbors in your community. 2) Copy flyers at LIFNB.com or this Craigslist post. Hand them out. Schools, Libraries, Senior Centers, Churches, Stores, etc.3) Maybe you are an owner, manager or employee of a store, supermarket, distributor, wholesaler, farm, or manufacturer. Do you have soon to be expired food, drinks and/or merchandise you will be throwing out?Help us help you save money. Less carting fees. Great Community Relations.Call the Hotline (631) 223-4370 - 10 AM - 2 PM.4) Next time you are in a store where you shop. Ask the owner or manager if they would like to donate soon to be expired food, drinks and/or merchandise they will be throwing out shortly. We'll pick up and they save money on carting fees and help the community. Give our Hotline Number (631) 223-4370 - 10 AM - 2 PM.5) Share on Facebook:\"Friend\" - Li FNB\"Like\" - Long Island Food Not Bombs6) Become one of our volunteers. Come and join us.No Food Shares in your area, volunteers will help you start one.We are not affiliated with any religion, church or political party. Community churches do donate food and items to our Food Shares.\"Long Island Food Not Bombs\" is the largest \"Food Not Bombs\" in the World. We are 4,000 Volunteers feeding 5,000 Long Islanders every week. 3 million pounds of food in 2014. Food that would have been thrown out. We do all this with no government funding, all volunteers. Volunteer to help us obtain funding. We are always in need of Plastic Folding Tables for our Food Shares. Donate when you can at: http://www.LIFNB.comThank you, Volunteer Dennis (48 yrs protesting war) peace
11746.title: Huntington Food Share - LIFNB

11747.description: Volunteers find working with us rewarding. Our work helps people bring more genuine love into their life and relationships and reduces stress while increasing their wellbeing. Join us as we forged ahead and lead a scientific Revolution. Love, science has now revealed, is a fundamental need for human health, both physically and emotionally. Volunteer find many of the concepts making a difference in their own lives. 2 of our groundbreaking projects are - 1. Love2Care - www.Love2Caretrial.com - Danbbury Hospital, CT - is a wellness clinical trial program for healthcare professionals like doctors, nurses, residents and hospital staff that integrates the latest medical science of stress management and wellness with psychology. 2. THE FIRST INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM TOWARD A UNIFIED SCIENCE OF LOVE - www.Love-Decoded.com - held June 26th, 2016 in NY - brought together esteemed scholars from around the world to work on defining love in the most useful way for people to be able to give it and get it. Second symposium is scheduled for 2018. Other programs - Saving A Marriage - Saves A Family Social Emotional Curriculum for K-12 Grades The Liberated Parent - a new book based on Deutsch's Theory of Love
11747.title: Grant writer, experienced

11747.description: Hospice Care Network provides modified massage therapy free of charge to patients and families at The Mary Ann Tully Hospice Inn, our 18 bed inpatient facility for those with a life limiting illness. All Volunteer Massage Therapists in our program are licensed by New York State. Our massage program offers individualized orientation and ongoing mentorship to enable volunteers to acclimate effectively and confidently into the hospice environment. We are looking for volunteers to be available 2-4 times each month for two hour shifts. For more information on the program, you may go to our website at www.hospicecarenetwork.org and click on the Volunteer tab and apply directly online. For more questions please call 516-224-6416 or email sthorne@hospicecarenetwork.org.
11747.title: Licensed Massage Therapist

11429.description: Divine Truth Ministry is at a cross-road as an organization that with specialized volunteers, we could substantially increase our impact on individuals and families struggling in New York City. The main areas that we could utilize volunteers are assisting with our community outreach and food preparation. We are in need of volunteers to assist in updating our website, blog, and social media. Our staff, board, and volunteers are currently doing everything possible to make our programs as strong as we possibly can. However, this has not left time for us to build a presence online that demonstrates the level of impact that we are making in the community. We believe this is not only important to inform potential clients but equally important for our organization to be seen as a dynamic agent of change by potential funders and services partners in the community.
11429.title: On A Mission To Change The World!

11420.description: Each year, Making Strides Against Breast Cancer kicks-off its season by hosting a morning event for our Team Leaders to learn about Strides, hear inspiring speakers, receive their Team Leader Kit, and more. This year, our kickoff is held at its new location: Resorts World Casino NYC Event Space. In attendance will be sponsors, volunteers, fundraisers, team leaders, and community members new to the event. We need volunteers to help us on the day of the event. Roles include, but are not limited to: *Greeters *Check-In *Ushers *Table Captains *Merch *Clean-up (All roles) If you are able to support our kickoff, please respond so we can reach out to you and confirm details. For more informaiton, email QueensNYStrides@cancer.org. Thank you for your volunteerism!
11420.title: Kickoff Event Volunteer

11423.description: The Daughters of Isis Foundation is looking for a dynamic professional to assist with development. The volunteer/intern will have strong organizational, writing and problem solving skills. Must be detailed oriented and an effective communicator with strong computer skills (Microsoft work, excel, Internet research nd PowerPoint) Individual must be flexible, team player with a willingness to take on new and varied tasks to achieve organization's mission. Duties and Responsibilities: Developing and maintaining individual donor program. Creating and maintaing donor database, acknowledging and reporting on gifts and donations received. Attending trainings on grat guidelines and deadlines. Assisting in the writing, editing and distribution of grant request and proposals. Managing fund raising related correspondence. Conducting prospectus research on individuals, organizations, corporations and foundations. Developing styrategies for approaching foundations and corporations. Maintaining files and doing reports oof foundations and corporations approached and grant requirements. Assisting in organizing and implementing fund raising events. Assisting with financial reporting of all gifts and donations.
11423.title: Fund Developer

11423.description: Looking for volunteers and interns 18 and older, (High School students, High School Graduates, College students and or graduates), to assist with our Rites of Passage Program, community outreach, fund raisers/events, web site design and development and other services as needed. Volunteers/interns must be professional and willing to travel. Be willing to work with a diverse background of clients. Able to develop willing groups for young women on areas such as self-esteem/self-development, All volunteers/interns must complete background check.
11423.title: Volunteers & Interns

11427.description: We have a lovely senior who would like a friendly visitor. Her interests include photography and theater. If you can get to the St. Johns University area on weekday afternoons and have an hour to spend lessening a seniors social isolation, please contact Suzanne Windland at 718 454-2100, ext 123 or reply to this ad. Thank you!
11427.title: Friendly Visitor with an interest in photography

11427.description: We have a lovely senior client who used to play piano and would love someone to come spend time with her and play her piano for her. (This mught even get her playing again) If this opportunity interests you and you can get to Queens village area on the weekend, please call Suzanne at 718 454-2100, ext 123 or reply to this ad. Thanks for reading!
11427.title: Can you be music to this Senior's ears?

11427.description: Do you like working with seniors? Do you have an interest in helping others? This group is geared toward helping memebers through difficult time in thier lives though problem solving and conversation. Please contact if you are interested in leading a discussion group. This opportunity is help for one hour at 10 or 11am Monday Morning.
11427.title: Beyond the Barriers Discussion Group Leader

07650.description: We are running free after schools for children underprivileged in order to give chances for them to get self esteem and confidence in learning. Most of our kids are immigrants who are struggling to settle down in new circumstances. you can teach our children so that they can share what they learn from you with others. Any kind of talent that makes our children and audience happy is greatly appreciated. We have one free after school in Palisades Park and the other in Bergenfield, New Jersey. We will resume 3rd one in Northern Virginia.
07650.title: Talent Sharing

07650.description: We are running free after schools for children underprivileged in order to give chances for them to get self esteem and confidence in learning. Most of our kids are immigrants who are struggling to settle down in new circumstances. you can teach our children so that they can share what they learn from you with others. Any kind of talent that makes our children and audience happy is greatly appreciated. We have one free after school in Palisades Park and the other in Bergenfield, New Jersey. We will resume 3rd one in Northern Virginia. Classes are from 4:00 PM to 6:10 PM on Monday to Thursday.
07650.title: ESL TEFL TESOL tutoring, Art work for kids

07650.description: We are running free after schools for children underprivileged in order to give chances for them to get self esteem and confidence in learning. Most of our kids are immigrants who are struggling to settle down in new circumstances. You can teach our children so that they can share what they learned from you with others in future. Any kind of talent that makes our children happy is greatly appreciated. We have one free after school in Palisades Park and the other in Bergenfield, New Jersey. We will resume 3rd one in Northern Virginia. Classes are from 4:00 to 6:10 PM from Monday to Thursday.
07650.title: Homework Tutoring

07649.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07649.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07649.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07649.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07649.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.
07649.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Oradell

For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! 07649.title: Hospice Volunteer

07871.description: Are you a good listener? Do you enjoy meeting people? Are you able to provide a comforting touch? Do you enjoy making an immediate difference in someone's life? If you answered \"Yes\" to any of these questions, then this volunteer opportunity is for you! We are a hospice program that provides services throughout Sussex County. ***Free training is provided*** How Can Volunteers Help? A trained volunteer can provide the following: - Relief for the Family - so they can run errands, companionship when family cannot be there, and Respite Care - Primary Caregiver - by sitting with the patient, making phone calls, support for the patient and family - Emotional Support - active listening to the patient and family, holding the patient's hand when he/she is scared, by just being there when they need to talk - Patient and Family Assistance - running errands, helping with light housework, preparing a light meal Volunteers can also come into the office and do office work: - Admission Packets - they put together the admission packets, make copies for the packets - Filing - do some light filing of patient's paperwork for their files
07871.title: Hospice Volunteers Needed for Sussex County, NJ

07656.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07656.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice
