10002.description: MJHS Hospice provides a specialized program of care and services for end-of-life patients. MJHS Hospice provides care for pediatric and adult patients in homes, nursing homes, assisted living communities, inpatient facilities and hospitals. MJHS Hospice Volunteer opportunities include: Providing support and companionship to patients and their families Participating in leisure activities such as reading, listening to music, playing games with patients Supporting or organizing group activities for patients Listening compassionately to patients and their families Providing office or clerical support for our hospice team Complementary therapies Requirements for all categories of volunteers: 18 years or older 15 hours of training (4 hours training for clerical/office volunteers) Background Check (no charge to applicant) Medical Clearance (no charge to applicant) 3-4 hours per week 1 year commitment Required skills for patient visits: discretion, patience, compassion and dedication Preferred clerical and office support skills include: receptionist skills, computer skills, organizational skills and filing For more information on how to become a MJHS Hospice Volunteer please call: Ivi Wakneen, Coordinator of Volunteer Services; (212)-649-5264 or iwakneen@mjhs.org
10002.title: Be Part of Someone's Legacy--Become a Hospice Volunteer in Manhattan!

10002.description: Putting together heart inspiring videos of 1 min and 3 mins long for a Free Environmental Summer Camp out of South Bronx and Lower east Side. Video clips and images have been gathered from various hand-held devices, ready for editing. Helpful Description of our Free Environmental Summer Camp from the South Bronx: The campers and their families will gain hard skills learned from adaptive rock climbing, hiking, and camping. They will also gain valuable skills such as communication, discernment, critical thinking and foresight to help them thrive in the challenging environment of the South Bronx. Our program helps the campers to take this shared sacred state in the outdoors back to NYC to empower our urban communities. We also run a 6 week long Summer Camp in the Lower East Side in the Children's Magical Garden.
10002.title: Creating heart inspiring videos of 1-3 mins long for Free Environmental Summer Camp

10002.description: ABOUT THE MATERIALS CENTER: The Materials Center at Manny Cantor Center is a community resource that houses a large collection of \"found\" materials, gathered and donated by New York City residents and businesses. These materials are objects from our everyday lives that are often discarded, but could be repurposed or transformed into something new, encouraging creativity, problem solving, and action. We believe that these materials can enhance and enrich children’s learning, creative expression, and symbolic development. The Materials Center is made possible through a partnership with Teaching Beyond the Square. ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY: You'll be helping to organize and sort materials! Responsibilities will include weighing-in donations, sifting through donated materials, sorting them into the areas/shelves/containers, prepping materials, and straightening up the areas to look more beautiful. This opportunity requires no prior knowledge. We will share with you what you need to get started. It is a great way to relax too. We have half hour and hour shifts to sign-up for (you can choose as many or as little as you want), but even if you can only stop by for 15 minutes you can make a difference! This is also a fun opportunity for families to do together.
10002.title: Sorting in our Materials Center (Mondays)!

10002.description: Help serve lunch to older adults on the Lower East Side to ensure they have a hot, healthy meal to eat! Each day about 150 seniors attend lunch at the Weinberg Center for Balanced living and our volunteer lunch servers are an integral part in ensuring it all goes smoothly. Doing everything from setting tables, plating food and delivering the meals to each table, it is always a fun and meaningful experience for all. The Weinberg Center for Balanced Living at Manny Cantor Center serves a diverse population of 60+ adults with everything from nutritious kosher meals, health and wellness programs, case workers, dance, art, language and fitness classes and a wide array of social events. Currently there are 4,000 members and growing to take advantage of this diverse array of mostly free programming. Key Responsibilities: Set tables with numbers, cutlery, napkins, condiments and water prior to meals Ensure cleanliness of tables and room both before, during and after meals Serve meals to seniors once they are seated Collect tickets from seniors in exchange for their meal Qualifications Needed: This is a customer service position, so best for people that are friendly and personable Strong verbal communications skills Professional demeanor Some experience in food service is a plus Some experience interacting with seniors is a plus Time Commitment: Shifts available M-F 11:00am-1:00pm Training/Support/Supervisor: Program Supervisor: Food Handler Training: You will receive hands on training during your first shift and in subsequent shifts, if necessary Support: Program Supervisor available to answer questions and provide instructions when needed Benefits: Gain knowledge of working in a Community Center and with older adults, while giving back to your community Volunteer meet-ups, which will include learning opportunities, social and networking events and more Tracking of your volunteer hours for your company, school or affiliated group Discounted membership to Manny Cantor Center Fitness Center (must volunteer 12 hours per month to be eligible) Next Steps: Fill out our application: http://mannycantor.org/volunteer/application/ For more information visit: http://mannycantor.org/volunteer/
10002.title: Serve Lunch to Older Adults on LES!

10002.description: Purpose of Role: Assist in the preparation of meals and efficiency of the MCC kitchen as it prepares meals for our Older Adult and Early Childhood programs. As a kitchen volunteer, you will play an integral role in the preparation of hundreds of meals on a daily basis. Location: Manny Cantor Center, 197 E. Broadway, New York, NY 10002 Key Responsibilities: Chop, peel and prepare food for cooking Ensure cleanliness of all dishes, cutlery, equipment, etc. Qualifications Needed: Basic kitchen skills is required Some experience volunteering or working in a kitchen is a plus Some experience in food service is a plus Understand and practice good hygiene Time Commitment: Shifts available M-F, 7am-2:30pm Minimum 2 hour shift, once/week Training/Support/Supervisor: Program Supervisor: Executive Chef Training: You will receive hands on training during your first two shifts Assessment: You and your supervisor will discuss the best role for you following your training shifts Support: Ongoing two-way feedback from program supervisor and volunteer manager, additional trainings and professional development opportunities may be available. Benefits: Gain knowledge of working in a fast-paced kitchen and valuable experience in food service Volunteer meet-ups, which will include learning opportunities, social and networking events and more Tracking of your volunteer hours for your company, school or affiliated group Discounted membership to Manny Cantor Center Fitness Center (12 volunteer hours a month to be eligible) Requirements: Fill out volunteer application Phone screening with Volunteer staff In-person interview with Kitchen program staff
10002.title: Prepare Meals for Children & Older Adults in the Lower East Side!

10002.description: Youth Ambassador Program is funded by the U.S. Department of State's Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs and administered by Global Potential. YAP program builds relationships and creates networks among Haitian youth leaders, training youth in the concepts and practices of Social Entrepreneurship; introducing youth to leaders in nonprofit and change-making organizations in the US; and learning about US families, culture, geography, and socio-economic realities YAP consists of three phases: Phase 1, YAP Fellows participate in monthly workshops. These workshops are based on a 4-module curriculum of community service, leadership development, civic education and participatory democracy; Phase 2, YAP Fellows participate in a 3-week immersive experience in the U.S., visiting New York City, Washington D.C.; Phase 3, YAP Leaders are given both individual and group support and coaching for 7 months to develop projects that will impact their local communities, based on their passions and abilities. Global Potential (GP) empowers youth and communities to energize each other through education, international service work and cultural exchange. GP is an 18-month transformative after-school + summer program that works with 500 youth a year. The GP program includes 16.5 months of workshops locally New York and 1.5 months of international cultural exchange in the Dominican Republic, Haiti, and Nicaragua. The Youth Ambassador Program Associate is responsible for assisting the Program Coordinator with all YAP program related tasks that is logistics, coordination and operations of YAP. Duties and Responsibilities: Ensure that all files and data are organized properly Input information of YAP participants into the database (salesforce & Google Drive) Manage the Youth Ambassador Program Facebook pages and Google Drive Make phone calls when needed to YAP partners and participants Support in the recruitment of YAP Participants Participate in the Monthly conference calls with the International Executive Councils Translate Documents from English to Haitian Creole and vice versa. Take notes and minutes during Conference calls, partner meetings, Youth monthly workshop Follow up with tasks assigned to the YAP Youth Update Youth, Staff and Partner Contact Information Follow up with YAP participants Help identifying new partners and communities Update the YAP Timeline and summarize weekly meeting notes Maintain support, confidentiality, and professionalism necessary to create a safe atmosphere of sharing, understanding, tolerance and mutual support. Qualifications: Currently in High School; Seniors Prefered; Must be able to commit for a minimum of 6 months, flexible schedule; Must be able to speak and write Haitian Creole or French; Proficiency in using social media platforms including Facebook, Google Hangout, Twitter and Instagram Be familiar with Google Spreadsheets, Google Doc, Google Hangout, and Salesforce (or be willing to receive basic training for use of these systems); Detailed oriented, responsible, organized, sociable with excellent communication skills; Strong listening and communication skills; Practical problem-solving skills and ability to suggest options and alternatives; and Sensitivity to persons of different educational, economic, cultural or ethnic backgrounds.
10002.title: Youth Ambassador Program Associate NYC

10002.description: Youth Ambassador Program is funded by the U.S. Department of State's Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs, youth division; administered by Global Potential. YAP program builds relationships and creates networks among Haitian youth leaders, training youth in the concepts and practices of Social Entrepreneurship; introducing youth to leaders in nonprofit and change-making organizations in the US; and learning about US families, culture, geography, and socio-economic realities YAP consists of three phases: Phase 1, YAP Fellows participate in monthly workshops. These workshops are based on a 4-module curriculum of community service, leadership development, civic education and participatory democracy; Phase 2, YAP Fellows participate in a 3-week immersive experience in the U.S., visiting New York City, Washington D.C.; Phase 3, YAP Leaders are given both individual and group support and coaching for 7 months to develop projects that will impact their local communities, based on their passions and abilities. Global Potential (GP) empowers youth and communities to energize each other through education, international service work and cultural exchange. GP is an 18-month transformative after-school + summer program that works with 500 youth a year. The GP program includes 16.5 months of workshops locally New York and 1.5 months of international cultural exchange in the Dominican Republic, Haiti, and Nicaragua. The Youth Ambassador Program Coordinator is responsible for assisting the Senior Program Coordinator with all program related tasks including logistics, coordination, and operations of YAP. Duties and Responsibilities: Candidate with High school diploma; college student preferred Adhere to the YAP operations timeline and summarize weekly meeting notes Ensure that all files and data are organized and inputted appropriately into Salesforce and Google Drive Translate Documents from English to Haitian Creole and vice versa. Support in the recruitment of YAP participants Coach YAP participants throughout the recruitment and program period Communicate with and mobilize international partners and participants via phone, Facebook, Hangout, email, etc Support in identifying new partners and communities in Haiti Facilitate participatory dialogue between GP/YAP partner communities and local leaders (international), partner NGOs, YAP youth, and the GP/YAP staff team to ensure empowerment of the community and equal and respectful power dynamic. Coordinate and attend bi-weekly meetings with colleagues based in Haiti Whenever possible, seek out Strategic Partnership and Cultivation opportunities with agencies serving youth and foundations/corporations/individuals granting funds to support YAP and GP’s work Ensure maintenance, organization, and cleanliness of Global Potential’s cloud-based office spaces, including but not limited to: Salesforce, Google Docs, Google Calendar, Gmail, Facebook Pages and Groups. Maintain support, confidentiality, and professionalism necessary to create a safe atmosphere of sharing, understanding, tolerance and mutual support and respect. Qualifications: Candidate with High school diploma; college student preferred Must be able to commit for a minimum of 6 months, 15 hours a week Must be able to speak and write Haitian Creole or French; Proficiency in using social media platforms including Facebook, Google Hangout, Twitter and Instagram Be familiar with Google Spreadsheets, Google Doc, Google Hangout, and Salesforce (or be willing to receive basic training for use of these systems) Experience with Salesforce is a plus Detailed oriented, responsible, organized, sociable with excellent communication skills Ability to communicate with teenagers openly and nonjudgmentally; Strong listening and communication skills; Ability to establish a relationship based on equal respect; Practical problem-solving skills and ability to suggest options and alternatives; and Sensitivity to persons of different educational, economic, cultural or ethnic backgrounds. Education Requirement Must be currently pursuing a degree in one of the following fields: Nonprofit Management, Psychology, Counseling, Sociology, or human services related fields of study, or have previous experience Must have completed Sophomore year in college
10002.title: Youth Ambassador Program Coordinator NYC

10002.description: Bike New York offers free bike education classes in all five boroughs from April to December, and they are all taught with help from our wonderful volunteers. In addition, volunteers have the opportunity to be a part of our various events including the largest charity ride in America, the TD Five Boro Bike Tour Presented by REI! Training only takes an hour, and the volunteer commitment is totally up to you. Learn how to teach someone to ride and you'll change someone's life!
10002.title: Want to teach someone how to ride a bike?

10002.description: This opportunity is available every Wednesday, & Sunday morning! We deliver food that would otherwise have been thrown away to homeless shelters to feed the homeless and food insecure in NYC. You can help: pick up the leftover food from a popular LES restaurant and deliver it on-foot to the nearby Bowery Mission! Volunteer for just 30 minutes per week and make a huge impact!
10002.title: Fight Food Waste and Feed the Hungry in Lower East Side 10AM-10:30AM!

10002.description: This opportunity is available every Sunday-Wednesday night! The food you pay so much for is perishable. But that does not mean it has be thrown out at the end of the day when it is unsold. Help us take this food that we would pay for to the hungry people who need it at The Bowery Mission, located at 227 Bowery. Heavyweight: the average amount of food is 50-80 lbs. Sign up directly on our website: Sunday 2/12/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16127 Monday 2/13/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16128 Tuesday 2/14/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16129 Wednesday 2/15/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16130 Sunday 2/19/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16131 Monday 2/20/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16132 Tuesday 2/21/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16133 Wednesday 2/22/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16134 Sunday 2/26/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16135 Monday 2/27/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16136 Tuesday 2/28/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16137 Wednesday 2/29/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16138
10002.title: Stop Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in Lower East Side 10:40PM-11:10PM!

10002.description: Help your community to stop food waste and fight hunger by bringing excess food to homeless shelters. You will be taking bags of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. This is a great opportunity to gain community service experience while helping others at the same time!!!! Please sign up for events directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10002.title: Stop Food Waste & Feed The Hungry!!

10003.description: Every Tuesday, starting in Mid-June and ending in Mid-November, a local CSA will have edible produce that it is looking to donate. RoHo Compost is looking for a volunteer to help us transport this produce to a local shelter or food bank. Someone with a car is preferred.
10003.title: Feed the Hungry by Rescuing Food!

10003.description: Mount Sinai Beth Israel, located in Manhattan’s Lower East Side- Gramercy Park- neighborhood, seeks volunteers with an interest in counseling, public health, social work, or pastoral care. In order to ensure that we provide high quality care, Mount Sinai Beth Israel has created a Chi Cart program for staff. Volunteers visit clinical and administrative floors in the hospital and provide a space for our employees to spiritually and physically recharge. Volunteers will be given resources to serve tea, snacks, and aromatherapy as a way to help staff take a break. Volunteers will have the opportunity to go behind the scenes of the hospital, participate in reporting data from each visit, and gain experience in conducting informal group counseling sessions. Volunteers must be comfortable with introducing themselves to the floor and encouraging staff members to take a short break with them. In addition to being warm and welcoming, volunteers should be comfortable with hospital systems and vernacular. Qualifications: Students: Mature, caring students. Ideal for students interested in pursuing social work or counseling. Must have completed 2 college level courses in a relevant field. Must be 18+. Community Members: Mature, caring, and compassionate people who would like to engage in supporting the well-being of professionals at a local hospital. Must have 1-2 years of experience working in a relevant setting.
10003.title: Chi Cart Program

10003.description: We are currently looking for Volunteer Office Assistants to work in the afternoon and/or the evening. Volunteer Office Assistants serve 4-6 hours per week for a prestigious downtown NYC community theater that produces 25-30 new plays and 3 free community events each year. Volunteer Office Assistants will answer phones, take reservations, file papers and occasionally assist Executive Director Crystal Field by writing letters or researching on the internet. Opportunities available specifically on weekdays in the Morning/Afternoons from 10am to 4pm, or in the evenings from 4pm to 10pm, or on weekends from 12pm to 8pm. Volunteers will receive FREE tickets to all TNC productions.
10003.title: Administrative Assistance

10003.description: Unmasked Theatre Company and Mental Health Advocacy is a NYC-based Nonprofit Our mission is to use the performing arts as a forum to stimulate social change with a focus on Mental Illness, it's issues, and the stigmas around it. We hope to build the company as we continue to: 1) give a voice to those who have been affected by Mental Illness through performance and discussion forums 2) spread awareness and understanding about the issues and controversies and challenges related to Mental Illness, 3) create outreach programs for those who have suffered in which they may find a voice and/or an avenue of healing through the creative and performing arts 4) ‪#‎stopthestigma‬ around mental illness and the discussion of mental illness and it’s issues by stimulating conversations from performance works on social media, and community events. We plan to build a great artistic and administrative team to work with to continue this mission and to create innovative artistic performance works as we grow in presence and prowess. Unmasked is currently looking for people who are truly invested in our cause and would like to help grow the mission and company as a whole. Although this is a volunteer position applicants will still be screened, and interviewed for: 1) investment in the cause (Mental Illness Advocacy & the Performing Arts) 2) qua lifications/skills We are seeking volunteers for the following positions: Attorneys (IP or Tax ) Website Developer Marketing Graphic Designer Social Media Content Manager Social Media Engagement Coordinator Social Media blogger Copywriter/Copy editor Community & School Outreach Coordinators Public Relations Specialist Treasurer (vote, on board) Secretary (vote, on board) Marketing Intern Grant Writers Fundraisers Network Coordinators (people interested in connecting unmasked with organizations affiliate with mental health and/or performing arts, and celebrity Advocates) General Board Members (networking, donors, patrons of the arts, or otherwise interested in the administrative side of the Company
10003.title: Seeking several positions for non-profit

10003.description: The Kids Creative Board of Directors is seeking new members! We are looking for a diverse group of individuals who are passionate about our mission of developing confident, community-minded youth through arts education programs in NYC. Everyone is invited to apply! Board members support and guide the organization and serve on a variety of fun committees, including Board Development, Fundraising, and Finance! Board members are responsible for: * Financial oversight * Ensuring adherence to governing regulations * Programmatic oversight and evaluation * Strategy and planning We are looking for new members from all sectors and backgrounds with a variety of skills that can help Kids Creative continue to develop confident youth. If you are passionate about children or the arts, we want to hear from you!
10003.title: Come join the Kids Creative Board of Directors!

10003.description: Help change the world! #HelpMeImagine a world that is safe and supportive of all people, regardless of their identity. Lend your time and talents to provide our young people that future. Volunteer Position: Front Desk Location: HMI Purpose: Hetrick-Martin Institute is looking for an individual who can volunteer to provide support at the front desk. Expectations/Responsibilities of the Position: Greet visitors, students, staff Have visitors sign in Answer phone Qualifications: Able to commit to one shifts: Monday, Wednesday, OR Friday: 9 - 12 pm Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday: 12 - 3:30 pm Please send apply online at www.hmi.org
10003.title: Front Desk Assistant

10003.description: Kaplan House is an urban residential facility for 25 older adolescent males, ages 17 to 21. The facility provides an extensive independent living skills program and therapeutic and support services. As a Math Tutor, you will have the opportunity to share your knowledge and make a difference with residents of Kaplan House by tutoring high school and/or college level math. You will work in either one-on-one or group tutoring sessions.
10003.title: Math Tutor - Manhattan
10003.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10003.description: We just received our tax exemption and will be holding our first fundraiser at Drama Book Shop on W. 40th St in Manhattan. We need inspiring public speakers who jive with our mission statement (www.BreakDiving.org) and who have a motivational or inspiring story to tell the audience. The best stories will probably be underdog stories, stories of great success (at whatever level), stories of perseverence, or something uniquely educational. Bottom line: if the audience leaves smarter, happier, more confident, or touched in some small way, that's the type of story we're looking for. While the position is voluntary, we will be using your name in publicity for the event, and also at the event too. So this could be a way to broaden the reach of your name, or brand, even in just a small way. If interested, please, don't hesitate to reach out! We'd love to hear from you.
10003.title: Seeking Public Speakers in NYC Area For Our Very First Fundraiser

10003.description: Volunteer Certified Long Term Care Ombudsmen are a vital link between residents of long term care facilities and the government resources able to investigate and resolve their problems. Ombudsmen are committed to advocating for these senior citizens and ensuring that residents' rights, unmet needs and complaints are handled and resolved effectively, while maintaining resident and complainant confidentiality. In this way, Ombudsmen protect and help improve the quality of life for the frailest of New York's senior population. Being an Ombudsman is an important responsibility that is taken on with great care and professionalism. In New York State, Ombudsmen are certified only after receiving extensive training. As Ombudsmen take on their duties in assigned facilities, they are supported by a network of fellow Ombudsmen, Coordinators, and the State Office. If you are interested in becoming an ombudsman please contact Mary Jane Wolper mwolper@cidny.org
10003.title: What is a Certified Long Term Care Ombudsman?
10003.org: CIDNY- Long Term Care Ombudsman Program

10003.description: The Kaplan Center for Community Services helps people who are struggling with a range of emotional and social problems. The Kaplan Center also provides psychiatric and social services to Jewish emigres from the former Soviet Union and elsewhere, and counseling services for senior citizens and their families. As a Client Companion for the Kaplan Center, you will assist one of the clients using their mental health services. This client lives independently in Boro Park, is in his mid to late 50s, and is looking for someone to accompany him to the grocery store as well as expose him to exercise, which can be as simple as going for a walk around the neighborhood. This opportunity is available Monday Friday in Boro Park. Volunteer is needed 1x/week in the afternoon for at least 6 months.
10003.title: Client Companion- Brooklyn (Boro Park)
10003.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10003.description: Samaritans of New York operates the city’s 24-hour suicide prevention hotline. Last year, we answered over 82,000 hotline calls. Samaritans is part of a well-established international network of 400 centers in 42 countries where over 20,000 volunteers provide crisis response and emotional support services to people who are in distress, depressed and suicidal. Samaritans is currently accepting applicants for the July Hotline Training Class. If you are interested in becoming a Samaritans volunteer, please contact us to attend one of the following orientations: Tuesday, June 27 Thursday, July 6 Wednesday, July 12 To receive a Volunteer Information packet, please email samaritansnycvol@aol.com with the following information: -your full name -phone number -residential street address Or: - Inquire through our website: http://samaritansnyc.org/volunteer-2/ - Call 212-673-3041 to receive a Volunteer Information Packet by mail We look forward to hearing from you! Volunteer requirements: Must be at least 21 Good English speaking + written skills Willing to work as part of a collaborative team Available to donate: 1 weekday morning, afternoon, evening or weekend shift a week 1 overnight shift a month No experience necessary!
10003.title: Public Health Hotline Seeks Peer Counselors

10003.description: Samaritans of New York operates the city’s 24-hour suicide prevention hotline. Last year, we answered over 82,000 hotline calls. Samaritans is part of a well-established international network of 400 centers in 42 countries where over 20,000 volunteers provide crisis response and emotional support services to people who are in distress, depressed and suicidal. Samaritans is currently accepting applicants for the July Hotline Training Class. If you are interested in becoming a Samaritans volunteer, please contact us to attend one of the following orientations: Tuesday, June 27 Thursday, July 6 Wednesday, July 12 To receive a Volunteer Information packet, please email samaritansnycvol@aol.com with the following information: -your full name -phone number -residential street address Or: - Inquire through our website: http://samaritansnyc.org/volunteer-2/ - Call 212-673-3041 to receive a Volunteer Information Packet by mail We look forward to hearing from you! Almost anyone who finds themselves facing some overwhelming obstacle or personal tragedy needs help getting through their moment of crisis. At Samaritans of NYC, our caring volunteers respond to people of all backgrounds: teenagers, the elderly, people dealing with chronic and terminal illnesses like cancer or AIDS; victims of violence, bullying and sexual abuse; the homeless, unemployed, veterans; those with sexual identity issues, who are trying to cope with stigma, who are hesitant to seek help. The work is challenging, the training intensive and the experience extremely rewarding! You must be focused, disciplined and keep the commitments you make. This is serious work; you’ll be joining a group of dedicated volunteers from NYC’s diverse communities who work together in a supportive environment in a convenient Village location. Volunteer requirements: Must be at least 21 Good English speaking + written skills Willing to work as part of a collaborative team Available to donate: 1 weekday morning, afternoon, evening or weekend shift a week 1 overnight shift a month No experience necessary!
10003.title: Peer Counselors Needed - Volunteer on Samaritans 24-Hour Crisis Hotline!

10003.description: Read about KittyKind at www.kittykind.org KittyKind is all-volunteer cat rescue and cat adoption group located in the Petco store on 17th Street and Broadway, in space that the Petco Corporation donates. KittyKind relies upon donations for all other expenses. It relies upon volunteers to care for the rescued cats. A Health-Maintenance volunteer helps to give nutritional supplements, eye cream, and veterinarian-prescribed medication to cats awaiting adoption at the KittyKind adoption center. Training and training materials will be given. The volunteer shift would be for a couple of hours, one day a week, throughout the year. After training, the day and the time are up to you. Preference is for a volunteer who has experience working with animals or who is a pre-vet, or a vet-tech student. However, all help is welcome. For Saturday or Sunday help, please be an \"early bird,\" able to start about 8 or 9, before the adoption center gets crowded. Must be over age 18. Active seniors very welcome! References preferred. To begin the application process, please do the following: Connect to kittykind.org Click on Volunteer Fill out an application, specifying Health Maintenance as your preference Then, someone will email you shortly after. Thanks.
10003.title: Health Care: Cats/Kittens

10003.description: We need a person(s) with a car to spend 1 hour (between 9:30 and 10:30am) on Saturdays to pick up donated food in the neighborhood from in-kind donors. We pick up from Au Bon Pain, Blimpies, Jon Vie Pasteries, Balducci's, D'Agostino's, etc. all in Soho and the Village.
10003.title: To pick up food with a car on Sat. mornings

10003.description: We feed 150 homeless and needy people every Saturday. Volunteers are invited to arrive about 9:00am until about 12:00pm to help in the preparation of food and soup by chopping vegatables, slicing bread, making sandwiches, arranging desserts, etc. No need to make a reservation - just show up and we'll put you to work although groups must be limited to 5 people please. A different group organized by NYCares serves the meals in the later afternoon. We are also in need of a person(s), with a car, to pick up food from in-kind donors in the neighborhood on Sat. mornings (ie. Sullivan Steet Bread, Knickeboker Restaurant, Chipolte, etc.) and bring the donated food to our Soup Kitchen so it can be prepared for serving. E-mail Dean directly if you can help in this endeavor.
10003.title: To help feed the needy

10166.description: We are expanding our board now that our tax-exempt nonprofit dance organization is growing. We are looking in for enthusiastic board members with a strong background in fundraising, grant writing, individual giving, corporate funding or sponsorships, and/or hosting fundraisers. We have meetings on an as-needed basis, about 4 to 6 times a year. Initial commitment is through the end of 2017 with hopefully at least a one-year renewal. Monthly time commitment will vary depending on what a board member can take on, averaging 10 hours or so a month. You'd be joining a high-energy diverse group of people with a can-do attitude and a great sense of humor and joy. Serving on the board means being part of the team that ensures the legal, administrative, financial, development, and public relations run smoothly so the organization can carry out its mission. Born Dancing's mission is to produce professional quality, original dance performances featuring differently abled performers, and to create dance education programs that provide Students With Disabilities and other High Need underserved communities with real-world performance and production experiences, apprenticeships to learn job and social skills, and internships in dance/theater production. Your service on the board would help make a powerful difference in the lives of children and teens with disabilities through dance and the related arts.
10166.title: Fundraiser to serve on Board of Directors of Nonprofit Dance Organization

10166.description: We are expanding our board now that our nonprofit dance organization is growing. We are looking for enthusiastic and commited board members with a strong background in marketing, social media, and branding. We have meetings on an as-needed basis, about 4 to 6 times a year. Initial commitment is through the end of 2017. Monthly time commitment will vary depening on what a board member can take on, averaging 10 hours or so a month. You'd be joining a high-energy diverse group of people with a can-do attitude and a great sense of humor and joy. Serving on the board means being part of the team that ensures the legal, administrative, financial, developent, and public relations run smoothly so the organization can carry out its mission. Born Dancing's mission is to produce professional quality, original dance performances featuring differently abled performers, and to create dance education programs that provide Students With Disabilities and other High Need underserved communities with real-world performance and production experiences, apprenticeships to learn job and social skills, and internships in dance/theater production. Your service on the board would help make a powerful difference in the lives of children and teens with disabilties through dance and the related arts.
10166.title: Marketing / Branding Expert to join Board of Non Profit Dance Organization

10166.description: Our tax exempt nonprofit dance organization is growing. We are looking for enthusistic and committed volunteers to help write our grant applications. We have meetings only on an as-needed basis and all work can be done from your home or office on your schedule. Time committment can be flexible based on how much you are willing or able to take on. Grant writers need to be detail-oriented strong writers who will meet deadlines and who will ensure that each application meets the (sometimes very) strict requirements of the funders. Born Dancing's mission is to produce professional quality, original dance performances featuring differently abled performers, and to create dance education programs that provide Students With Disabilities and other High Need underserved communities with real-world performance and production experiences, apprenticeships to learn job and social skills, and internships in dance/theater production.
10166.title: Grant Writer for growing nonprofit dance organization

10008.description: The Youth Voices Network gives voice to survivors of dating abuse with the goal of helping youth build safe and healthy relationships. A group made up of young survivors, the Youth Voices Network aims to let other young people know that they are not alone, raise awareness about warning signs of abuse, and direct survivors to helpful resources. Sharing their stories offers the survivors an opportunity to heal and transform their experiences of pain into a powerful tool for change. The Youth Voices Network welcomes new members. Our members are survivors of youth dating violence, who have experienced intimate partner violence or dating abuse as a teen or young adult. The Youth Voices Network raises awareness in a variety of ways, including the following: Sharing personal stories of survival - anonymously or not - with: Youth/peers Parents Teachers Government officials Journalists and other media professionals Strategizing to raise awareness of relationship abuse among youth through: Public events Awareness projects Outreach to youth and youth-focused community organizations Local and national media attention Proving a safe space and building relationships of support between members. To apply for this program, please complete the Youth Voices Network Application Form online at http://www.dayoneny.org/join-the-youth-voices-network/ For more information, please email us at youthvoicesnetwork@dayoneny.org.
10008.title: Stop Dating Abuse Now and Join the Youth Voices Network!

10009.description: We are no accepting applications for Civic Art Lab 2017. Please fill in this form no later than May 15th : http://bit.ly/2nIPDDH Civic Art Lab is a pop-up gallery and workshop space on the Lower East Side at Avenue C & 7th Street, hosted by GreenspaceNYC. For our third year, we return to the Lower East Side. Our 3 day lab themes include sustainability and design; creative re-use; mapping and neighborhood placemaking; urban agriculture; sustainable architecture; health & well-being; and environmental justice, to name a few. Please fill out the following form to apply. Call for submissions is open between April 1st and May 15th, 2017. For additional questions, please email laura@greenspacenyc.org and jeff@greenspacenyc.org.
10009.title: Civic Art Lab 2017 |  Call for workshops, talks, and pop-up exhibitions | LES

10009.description: This interactive workshop will educate participants in the fundamentals of resilient empowerment, and have them apply these principles to the conception of their own public design workshops. Operation Resilient Living & Innovation (ORLI+) will present attendees with a suite of community engagement strategies, designed to maximize collaboration with underserved populations and leverage local assets to grow a resilient society. This workshop is part of Civic Art Lab 2017, designed as a pop-up gallery and workshop space in the East Village at Avenue C & 7th Street. The lab will be hosted in partnership with Marc Norov and the Creations Gallery, a mixed-use community pop-up space, adjacent to a community-based bike repair shop. These workshops, talks, and exhibitions are designed by volunteer artists, designers, and teachers who lead investigations into diverse themes such as: creative re-use; urban agriculture; sustainable architecture; health & well-being, and environmental justice, to name a few. Civic Art Lab is hosted by GreenspaceNYC (www.greenspacenyc.org), a non-profit collaborative that develops and curates free educational programming, hands-on workshops, and public design projects that encourage dialogue, enliven public spaces, and promote the future of more equitable and sustainable cities.
10009.title: Volunteers, learn to design your own public design workshops! @ Civic Art Lab

10009.description: Invitation to volunteers and volunteer groups interested in sustainability, art, and design practices. RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/civic-art-lab-circular-economy-recycling-tickets-34952203983 This workshop is led by Agustina Besada (Sure We Can). Circular Economy is a movement that poses to re-think and re-design the traditional economic model into one where resources are repurposed, reused and recycled in closed loops. During the workshop, participants will learn about the Circular Economy principles, strategies and best practices, to then work in groups on specific cases to identify and brainstorm ideas to apply a Circular Economy approach. Civic Art Lab 2017 is the third iteration of the project, designed as a pop-up gallery and workshop space in the East Village at Avenue C & 7th Street. The lab will be hosted in partnership with Marc Norov and the Creations Gallery, a mixed-use community pop-up space, adjacent to a community-based bike repair shop. Our programming will continue to be low cost for full registrants and free for individual registrants. These workshops, talks, and exhibitions are designed by volunteer artists, designers, and teachers who lead investigations into diverse themes such as: creative re-use; urban agriculture; sustainable architecture; health & well-being, and environmental justice, to name a few. Civic Art Lab is hosted by GreenspaceNYC (www.greenspacenyc.org), a non-profit collaborative that develops and curates free educational programming, hands-on workshops, and public design projects that encourage dialogue, enliven public spaces, and promote the future of more equitable and sustainable cities. Get in touch: info@greenspacenyc.org Co-Directors / GREENSPACENYC + Civic Art Lab: Laura Scherling, Jeff Kasper Organizers: Dan Horn, Marcus Wilford Sponsors: Creations Gallery, Material for the Arts (NYC Office of Cultural Affairs), ORLI
10009.title: Join us for "Circular Economy & Recycling" at Civic Art Lab! July 9, 2017 at 3 pm

10009.description: Invitation to volunteers and volunteer groups interested in sustainability, art, and design practices. RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/civic-art-lab-community-resilience-build-a-workshop-tickets-34951971287 This workshop is led by Operation Resilient Living & Innovation (ORLI+, www.orliplus.org). This interactive workshop will educate participants in the fundamentals of resilient empowerment, and have them apply these principles to the conception of their own public design workshops. Operation Resilient Living & Innovation (ORLI+) will present attendees with a suite of community engagement strategies, designed to maximize collaboration with underserved populations and leverage local assets to grow a resilient society. To maximize the impact of this event, real-world scenarios will be incorporated, with the goal of presenting actionable outcomes for local at-risk communities. ORLI+ will conduct the following activities during the workshop: (1) ice-breaker to illustrate deficiencies of standard community design workshops, (2) presentation of model community workshop objectives and strategies, (3) presentation of case-study workshop scenarios by local/regional community leaders, (4) break-out case study analysis and workshop design by participants, and (5) presentation and discussion of proposed methodologies. This existing workshop model promotes the expansion of a typical conference program, drawing connections between local communities and professionals, and visiting experts. ORLI+ believes this enhanced and focused interaction can serve as a model for increasing the impact of architects and designers in their local communities (and vice-versa), leveraging the conference platform towards actionable, resilient community engagement and development. Civic Art Lab 2017 is the third iteration of the project, designed as a pop-up gallery and workshop space in the East Village at Avenue C & 7th Street. The lab will be hosted in partnership with Marc Norov and the Creations Gallery, a mixed-use community pop-up space, adjacent to a community-based bike repair shop. Our programming will continue to be low cost for full registrants and free for individual registrants. These workshops, talks, and exhibitions are designed by volunteer artists, designers, and teachers who lead investigations into diverse themes such as: creative re-use; urban agriculture; sustainable architecture; health & well-being, and environmental justice, to name a few. Civic Art Lab is hosted by GreenspaceNYC (www.greenspacenyc.org), a non-profit collaborative that develops and curates free educational programming, hands-on workshops, and public design projects that encourage dialogue, enliven public spaces, and promote the future of more equitable and sustainable cities. Get in touch: info@greenspacenyc.org Co-Directors / GREENSPACENYC + Civic Art Lab: Laura Scherling, Jeff Kasper Organizers: Dan Horn, Marcus Wilford Sponsors: Creations Gallery, Material for the Arts (NYC Office of Cultural Affairs), ORLI
10009.title: Join us for "Community Resilience: Build-A-Workshop" at Civic Art Lab! July 9th at 10:30 am

10009.description: 10 Volunteers are needed from July 5 through August 11 to help PS 15 students in their Summer After School and Friday Field Day Programs. Volunteers are asked to participate 2x per week throughout the month. The programs run Monday-Thursday 2:30-5:30pm and Friday 8:30am-3:30pm.
10009.title: Summer After School Program

10009.description: Volunteer with the LES Ecology Center's summer education programs! Help out with fishing clinics, open hours at the Environmental Learning Center, field trips, and more. Opportunties available on weekends, evenings, and weekdays. Fishing or environmental education experience is great but not necessary. Volunteers should be able to attend one of two training dates- either Sunday 5/21 4:30pm or Thursday 5/25 at 6pm.
10009.title: Summer Education Program Volunteers

10009.description: Go the extra mile with Back on My Feet NYC! Dedicated teams of volunteers run 2-4 miles with our members who are transitioning out of homelessness. We encourage runners of all speeds to become a part of our community! Team ABC runs/jogs/walks with Pride Site & The Bowery Mission every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 5:30-6:30AM. To find out more and sign up for an orientation, visit nyc.backonmyfeet.org/nyc-run-with-us
10009.title: Lower East Side Morning Runner

10009.description: S.O.S. Gamers is a not-for-profit 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to bridging the gap in technology and information for lower income residents living in New York City. We are currently seeking individuals to work with us as staff in our Youth Video Gaming League. The activities take place at the East 12th St School & Campos Plaza in the Lower East Side of Manhattan. The league provides an opportunity for youth to play video games in a safe, structured setting while acquiring valuable life skills such as teamwork, communication and sportsmanship. We are looking for volunteers for these roles: Activity Specialist/Coaches - Simply put, coaches aim to ensure that while the players are having a great time playing the game, they're also actively implementing the basic fundamentals of teamwork. In some cases, we're indeed role models for our youth, so this role requires knowledge and patience and great team building skills. Event Staff - Our larger scale events, such as gaming tournaments, require staff with particular skill sets to ensure that they run smoothly. These roles are: Event Coordinators, Sign-in Coordinators, Tournament Organizers, Station Managers, Game Casters/Commentary, Stream Managers, Photographers/Videographers We are also looking for individuals to assist with our Marketing (Online and In-Person) efforts as well as Graphic Designers. Scheduling for the COACH role is as follows: Monday - Day Program 4:30 - 6PM, Night Program 6 - 9 PM Tuesday - Day Program 4:30 - 6PM Thursday - Day Program 4:30 - 6PM Friday Day Program 1:15 - 6PM, Night Program 6 - 9 PM Sat - All ages 10AM - 6PM Volunteers need not be available all days, but will need to be available for an entire block of hours, i.e. Tuesday 4:30 - 6PM for the full 1.5 hours. All event staff roles will be scheduled during the Saturday - All Ages 10am - 6PM block of time. Marketing and Graphic Design are on an as needed basis around your schedule. Ideal candidate requirements include: A familiarity with current generation video gaming equipment, in particular, the Nintendo Wii U and Super Smash Bros. Wii U. A high comfort level with working around children and teens ages 13 Great social and organizational skills (facilitating small tournaments and other organized gaming activities) The ability to be flexible and adaptable as required Please send an email to SOS@SOSGamers.org AND ALewisHall@SOSGamers.org and include the role(s) you're interested in as well as a resume/job/education history. Regsitering with the our partner school through the Department of Education will be required. Thank you!
10009.title: You Game? Join our Youth Video Gaming League!

10009.description: CBSBB’s mentoring program enables young people to expand their horizons, their hopes and their dreams. It helps inspire them to improve academic performance and reduce risky behavior, which ultimately leads to stable health, strong personal relationships and gainful employment. You should know that research has proven that CBSBB’s integration of mentoring, family counseling and skill building ensures that our mentoring relationships are healthier and last longer than the national average. CBSBB’s target populations are children from first generation, low-income communities. Many of the families we work with are overwhelmed by multiple stressors. Poverty, a shortage of skills and a lack of exposure to opportunities are some of the issues our mentees face every day. These children are eager to expand their horizons and having a mentor can be the difference between their current reality and a successful future. You can be that difference! MENTOR ROLE: Maintain a one-to-one match relationship between yourself as the Big Sister/Brother (mentor) and your Little (mentee) while respecting the family system Serve as a positive role model and friend while helping your mentee to set and accomplish goals Build the match relationship by planning and participating in activities together PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS: Be at least 21 years of age Be interested in working with a young girl or boy between the ages of 10-18 Be willing to finance all match outings (outings need not be expensive) If child doesn’t travel alone, be responsible for picking up or dropping of your Little Sister/Brother TIME COMMITMENT: Mentors must meet fact-to-face with their mentees for 8 hours each month and go on outings with their mentee. Typically matches meet twice a month, for an average of 4 hours each, usually on weekends, for a minimum of one year Mentors are responsible for maintaining communication with their mentee in between outings by setting up a weekly call night to help build their match relationship Matches must attend at least one skill learning program workshop series per year TO APPLY: Visit www.cbsbb.org/volunteers or call us at 212 475-3291 x502.
10009.title: Change a Life.  Change Your Life.  Become a Mentor!

10009.description: Our Manhattan based organization is seeking a cohort of approximately 12 volunteers who would work with our homeless population on a scheduled rotating basis in teams of two or three workers weekly to assist us with intakes, assessments and referrals. Our hours of operation are every Saturday from 8 AM to 3:00PM and we are located at 137 East Second Street, (at Avenue A in Manhattan) at the Cardinal Spellman Center (lower level). 2nd Avenue stop on the F train. Our space is equipped with wireless Internet, computers and printers and a full supply of stationary for volunteers to assist our guests. All volunteers would have a tremendous amount of staff support. Please have the interested parties contact Joe Montano, Director at 347-534-7792 or through email at emailucss-ny@yahoo.com
10009.title: Volunteers needed to provide homeless with social services.

07438.description: A great way to volunteer is to share your interests with the people in our programs. What are you passionate about? Would you like to develop a knitting club? Chair yoga? A spiritual retreat? Hold a bingo game? Conduct Bible study? Bring your guitar and lead a sing-a-long? Maybe nutrition is your focus or aromatherapy. Gardening and horticultural therapy is always fun. There is no limit what amazing things a volunteer can do. Share your ideas and we can make it happen!
07438.title: And what do YOU like to do?

07438.description: Be a part of a club that helps men and women with developmental disabilites realize that they can give back to the community and make a difference! This club meets once a month on Wednesdays at 6:30 pm in Oak Ridge (Jefferson Township) NJ. The members decide on a cause they wish to support and devise a plan to get it done. This year they conducted a hugely succesful Mother's Day Gift Bag event which went to the young moms at Birth Haven in Newton, NJ, raised funds and collected food for the Jefferson Dog/Cat rescue organization and honored the Jefferson and Newton Police departments. It is an opportunity to help these men and women realize they are more than a charity themselves, but rather, have the right to give back and serve others as well.
07438.title: Fight for the Right" Club - Empowers people with developmental disabilities

08852.description: Volunteers needed to help at our food pantry to assist with distribution to the participant families in our program. Volunteers needed to handle fresh food provisions and more that come into the food pantry. Volunteer drivers needed to help pick up provisions in the local area from generous providers. Larger SUV or van required. We welcome hearing from you and look forward to speaking with you. Thank you for your interest in providing helping hands. Please contact us at 908-227-0684.
08852.title: Volunteers Needed

08852.description: Contact us for more information on working with hospice patients close to where you live. We provide FREE volunteer training for you along with free TB and Rubella/Rubeola testing. Your pet will need to be a certified pet therapy animal. You and your pet will bring joy and love to the lives of our patients and will receive so much love and joy in return!
08852.title: Share your pet's unconditional love with hospice patients!

08852.description: Pack meals for the Meals On Wheels Program and serve lunch to the seniors in the building. No cooking just dishing food from steam table. Hours one day week 8:30-12:30. Weekdays only.
08852.title: Kitchen Assistant

08852.description: Greet older adults coming to use gym in the senior center. Verify they are on approved list and have medical clearance to enter. Monitor seniors in gym. Shifts 8:30-12:30 and 12:30-3:00 at least one day per week. Weekdays only. High school students in July and August. Adults Sept-June.
08852.title: Gym Greeter

08852.description: Be the first point of contact for seniors entering the senior center. Check for membership. Help them scan in to our attendance computerized program. Answer simple questions. Direct members of the public to the offices. Shifts 8:30-12:00 and 12:00-3:00 weekdays only. No weekends Adults used Sept-June and High Shchool students in the summer
08852.title: Greeter

08850.description: We are a multi-service agency with opportunities for: -Hostessing senior socialization programs -Teaching seniors new skills -Training to be a Healthy Bones instructor to work with seniors to encourage healthy aging -Working as a Friendly Visitor brightening up a seniors' day -Running workshops for women in transition -Teaching computer classes in our Career Center -Training to be a fraud, waste and abuse volunteer for Senior Medicare Patrol -Delivering Kosher Meals on Wheels throughout Middlesex County -Helping in Food Pantries throughout Middlesex County -Researching and applying for grants -Working in our offices as administrative or clerical support
08850.title: RSVP (Retired and Senior Volunteer Program) for volunteers 55+
08850.org: Jewish Family Services of Middlesex County

08850.description: JFS is looking for current or retired multilingual ESL teachers to teach citizenship classes around Middlesex County to immigrants working toward citizenship. We are also in need of tutors for citizenship classes; test scorers; office administrative and clerical support; and grant writers to research and apply for grants.
08850.title: ESL Multilingual teachers needed to teach Citizenship classes
08850.org: Jewish Family Services of Middlesex County

08857.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.
08857.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Old Bridge

08857.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
08857.title: Companion Hospice Volunteers - Old Bridge

08857.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe, comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers.
08857.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice - Old Bridge

08857.description: Ascend Hospice Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients ; mind, body and soul.
08857.title: Hospice Musicians - Old Bridge

08857.description: General assistance to Envionmental Services department. Volunteer should like working with their hands. General cleaning, windows, sweeping, walking the grounds for trash pickup, helping maintenance staff with preventative maintenance issues.
08857.title: Maintenance Support Volunteer

08857.description: To provide patients the opportunity to interact with trained and certified dogs during their hospitalization to improve thieir emotional and social status.
08857.title: Pet Therapy (Old Bridge)

08857.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08857.title: Mentoring Youth

08854.description: Parker is a non-profit senior service organization, serving elders throughout the central Jersey area for over 100 years. Our campus Parker at River Road, is a Nursing Care Residence for elders in Piscataway with physical and cognitive needs. Attached is also Parker at Stonegate, an Assisted Living Residence, and Parker at the Pavilion. We are in search of pet volunteers to visit our loving residents at Parker at River Road, in Piscataway, NJ. Requirements: Animals:Dog/Cat Must be friendly Must have up to date vaccination records Must fill out volunteer application
08854.title: Pet Volunteers Needed at Piscataway Nursing Home!

08854.description: At Kindred Hospice, we strive to provide the best palliative therapies which ensure that people suffering from terminal illness are comfortable and at peace. Kindred Hospice is looking a Reiki Practitioner in hopes of relieving pain, bringing comfort, and creating a calm and peaceful environment to our patients. Reiki Practitioner Certification is required. Free screening and hospice training is provided. Contact Elaine.Carlsen@gentiva.com or call 888-556-8880 today.
08854.title: Reiki Specialist

08854.description: Music has been found to alleviate patients’ pain and anxiety and bring relaxation and happiness. You can give comfort and joy to a terminally ill hospice patient by sharing your musical talent. Professional musician and singers are welcome but it is not required. Kindred Hospice provides services to patients wherever they call home throughout the Mercer, Middlesex, Monmouth, Morris, Ocean, Somerset, & Union Counties. Free training is provided. Contact Elaine.Carlsen@gentiva.com or call 888-556-8880 today.
08854.title: Musicians Needed

08854.description: Kindred Hospice, an healthcare agency that provides compassionate care to those at end of life, is in need of teens, 16 and older, to help during the summer in our Piscataway office. Administrative Volunteers provide valuable office support including filing, faxing and doing computer work. Volunteer work is flexible and we are grateful for as much time as you can give even if for just a few hours a week. Work is done during office hours which is Mon - Fri, 9 am - 5 pm. No previous experience is needed; free training is provided. Certification of service hours will be provided upon request. Contact Elaine.Carlsen@gentiva.com or call 732-562-8800.
08854.title: Teen Summer Helpers

06906.description: Office support volunteers help our staff with basic tasks such as answering the phone, copying and assembling packets, helping with web research, and more. If you are a person who demonstrates the ability to communicate with people effectively, has absolute integrity and the use of good judgment to handle the professional and confidential nature of assignments, then Caring Hospice of Connecticut located in Stamford, Connecticut is the right fit for you. We are looking for individuals who are willing to commit to a consistent schedule a few hours per week or every other week. Individualized training is provided free of charge. In keeping with Medicare requirements, background and medical checks are part of the training process.
06906.title: Enjoy answering telephones? Become an office support volunteer!

06907.description: This lady who is blind and uses a guide dog is looking for a shopping buddy for occasional trips to the mall and for groceries. She is a an adult college student pursuing her Masters Degree in Special Education. Requirements to be a great volunteer include: a desire to help others; a pleasant demeanor; a good reading/speaking voice; average reading skills; organizational or planning abilities; a good driving record; a clear criminal history; two references access to a car with proof of insurance; a minimum of $50/100k liability and $5,000 of property damage coverage.
06907.title: Lady and Guide Dog Looking for a Shopping Buddy
06907.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

06905.description: Are you someone who can oversee a year-round operation? Are you someone who has planning and management experience? Have you participated in non-profit fundraising? Stamford Dollars for Scholars is an all-volunteer 501(C)(3) organization looking for an individual who believes in supportng local students pursuing education after high school; someone who can oversee the fundraising activities for our organization. Our sponsors come to us to manage their scholarships and select recipients from a pool of applicants each year. In addition, we provide our own scholarships funded through events we host throughout the year as well as general donations solicited from the community. The right individual should have a comfortable knowledge or experience in: Accounting and Finance Budgeting and Planning Non-profit fundraising strategies Working within a non-profit organization The Board believes this is a position that requires a commitment year-round, A board position will be considered for the right candidate.
06905.title: Director of Fundraising

06905.description: Stamford Dollars for Scholars is an all-volunteer nonprofit community organization whose mission is to provide scholarships to support local students in their pursuit of higher education. Since its inception in 2012, Stamford Dollars for Scholars awarded 107 scholarships to high school graduates, valued at $357,000. The Student Outreach Volunteer is an advocate for Stamford Dollars for Scholars, working as a team with the Student Outreach Coordinators to communicate with high school guidance counselors, provide scholarship application workshops to high school seniors, and to represent Stamford Dollars for Scholars at local events and college fairs. This position requires as-needed coordination by phone or in-person meetings; regularly, the Student Outreach Volunteer is expected to work independently. A minimum commitment of 4 hours per week between September and April is required. Qualifications Exceptional communication skills. Experience working with high school students or familiarity with scholarship or college application process. Demonstrated ability to work with computers. Self-directed, able to work autonomously, while understanding that collaboration will be essential. Must be able to schedule workshops during school hours. Must be available one to two evenings total to attend local college fairs. College or graduate students, entrepreneurs, retirees welcome.
06905.title: Student Outreach Volunteer

06905.description: Stamford Dollars for Scholars is an all-volunteer nonprofit community organization whose mission is to provide scholarships to support local students in their pursuit of higher education. Since its inception in 2012, Stamford Dollars for Scholars awarded 107 scholarships to high school graduates, valued at $357,000. The Social Media and Communications Specialist is an advocate for Stamford Dollars for Scholars, working with the Vice President of Student Affairs to create and curate visual and written content, update and monitor social media accounts on a regular basis, and to create reports for the Board of Directors. This position requires as-needed coordination by phone or in-person meetings; regularly, the Social Media and Communications Specialist is expected to work remotely and independently. A minimum commitment of 6 hours per week is required. Qualifications Experience managing a brand’s online presence as a community and/or social media manager or educational equivalent. Exceptional communication, writing and editing skills. Solid judgment as a brand’s primary social media ambassador; ability to exert discretion, professionalism, and maintain brand voice and values in all public forums at all times. Self-directed and the ability to work autonomously, while understanding that collaboration will be essential. An ability to think creatively about how to best represent the organization and its cause. Experience or education in digital marking or graphic design is preferred. College or graduate students pursuing a degree in digital media, digital marketing or communications welcome.
06905.title: Social Media and Communication Specialist

06905.description: Stamford Dollars for Scholars holds fundraising events each year. We currently have two major events on our calendar: a Gala held in May and a Golf Fundraiser, held in September. In addition, we have smaller events throughout the year, including two social media driven events: #GivingTuesday (December) and Fairfield County Giving Day (March). We are looking for an Event Director. This individual would be responsible for managing an event which would include: Developing a vision and image for the event Recruiting and forming an event committee Scheduling necessary committee meetings for planning and coordination Preparing a budget and revenue projection Leading the creative side Assuring success The individual should have good planning and project management skills, enjoy event planning sctivities and the ability to rally volunteers to the cause. Individuals should be self-starters and independent thinkers who will make decisions within the scope of the assigned task. You will report to the VP of Fundraising, who will have oversight and financial responsibility and who will report to the Board of Directors. Special interest in finding individuals who have interest or experience in: golf tournaments, gala fundraisers, online fundraising, fundraising for non-profits, fundraising for scholarships. This position can lead to an invitation to join our Board of Directors.
06905.title: Event Planner/Coordinator

06902.description: Our seniors love to \"check the garden\" everyday however no longer have the ability to do the work. We have a small patch of grass/dirt and also a raised wooden planter that need some TLC in the form of shovels and perhaps topsoil We will pay for the soil and plants but we're looking for someone to do the \"dirty\" work. ' If you love a garden, don't mind an audience, and enjoy mingling with the senior crowd, then you're the one for us. Please call. We are here 24/7 and are very flexible with dates, days or times. Thank you!!!!
06902.title: Anyone out there willing to make us a garden??

06902.description: We have a gentlemen veteran here at Brighton Gardens of Stamford who sits week after week waiting for other veterans to join him. He likes to hear stories and also tell his own story. If you can spare a half hour on Thursdays at 11, please let me know. It doesn't have to be every week, just something for him to look forward to. He's a very nice man, he insists on wearing his veteran hat and reads the sports page waiting to see if someone shows up. Call or email if you are interested. Thank you!
06902.title: Veterans Welcome here at Brighton Gardens Stamford

06902.description: Our amazing volunteer Book Lady has given away over 35,000 books since she started filling our 2 community carts with books 3 years ago. Her trusty helper for the last year has taken a paying job (heaven forbid!) and can no longer lend a hand. Are you free Monday mornings between 10 and 11:30 to help haul boxes a few feet, place books on the shelves, and have fun with a a couple dozen three year olds who visit the cart every week. Not only is it a dream volunteer job, but Book Lady Lorrie is about as wonderful as they come.
06902.title: Help our Book Lady

06902.description: We are looking for English speaking professionals who are interested in donating their time and expertise to offer a parenting education class at Saint Joseph Parenting Center (SJPC) in Stamford, CT. Our English program aims to empower parents in our community to help them become the best advocates for their children as well as active citizens in the community so we can stop the cycle of child abuse and neglect. We offer every instructor, orientation and a detailed curriculum to follow, as well as supporting materials for class. We would love your time if you have any of the following backgrounds: Teacher, pediatrician, nurse, dental hygienist, therapist, social worker, parent or family educator, community outrach, special educator, lawyer, banker. The English class is every Monday, 10am-12pm and Wednesday Evening 6pm-8pm. Opportunity offers plenty of flexibility; you can chose to commit as little as once or twice a year to teach a class.
06902.title: English Speaking Professionals to Teach a Parenting Education Class

06902.description: Americares Free Clinics is looking for a volunteer to help with medical data entry for 4 hours per week during regular working hours. Some experience with a medical database preferred but not required. Accuracy and reliability are important. Location is the Americares headquarters in Stamford. This position supports the ongoing mission of our Connecticut free clinics.
06902.title: Administrative Volunteer

06902.description: We have seniors looking to play Poker, Gin Rummy, and Texas Hold 'Em with somebody who can refresh and interact. If you'd like to spend some time playing cards, then Brighton Gardens is the right place! We are flexible and can generally accomodate days, dates, and times.
06902.title: Card Players - Brighton Gardens Seniors Want You!

06902.description: Are you available to offer administrative support an hour or two a week? I'm looking for a volunteer to help me with filing and file organizing. And if you know anything about converting documents to a useable online format (such as Google docs) you'd be my hero!
06902.title: Helping Dir. of Volunteers

06902.description: Family Centers’ Resident Services Program is seeking 2-4 volunteers to work one-on-one and in small groups with children in grades K-3 rd in a learning center setting. Volunteers will help children with their homework, provide assistance with the target lesson of the day, and help engage the children in the enrichment activity of the day by; talking to them, encouraging them, and modeling what is expected of the children. Other duties may include: setting up and cleaning up your workspace for homework and activities. Volunteers are needed: Monday and Wednesday between the hours of 4p.m.-5:30p.m. at the Lawn Hill and Oak Park community centers ( 32-34 Custer and 73 Dale Street in Stamford’s East Side). The minimum age to volunteer in this program is 18.
06902.title: East Side Learning Center Volunteer

06902.description: Literacy Volunteers at Family Centers is looking for volunteers to teach adults to read, write and speak the English language. Workshops teach a variety of techniques with emphasis on determining how the student learns best. Training includes practice and demonstration, lesson planning, and goal setting. Interested volunteers must be able to attend all sessions and previous teaching experience is not necessary. Please contact us for more information and join our dedicated group of dynamic tutors and make a difference in your community! Please check back for the next Literacy Volunteers Tutor Training, to be held late fall/early winter.
06902.title: Literacy Volunteers Tutors

06902.description: The Nurturing Families Network (NFN) is a statewide support program for first-time parents that provides a system of continuous care designed to promote positive parenting. The NFN program at Family Centers is offered to all new parents giving birth at Greenwich and Stamford hospitals. After completing their training, volunteers contact parents by phone and offer support, educational materials, group events and referral information to other community services. Information to parents may include topics such as newborn feeding, childcare, stress management, immunizations, and other critical information about the health and care of their new baby. Volunteers will be supervised by the program coordinator. Hours are flexible for this opportunity and volunteers may work out of our Stamford location (60 Palmer's Hill Road) or one of our Greenwich locations (40 Arch Street or 22 Bridge Street). In addition to the training a personal interview and background check is required. Spanish speaking volunteers are encouraged to apply.
06902.title: Nurturing Families Network Volunteer
