06902.description: A local young adult needs a mentor for community inclusion activities. He loves music and adapted computers, but due to blindness he cannot drive so he has a difficult time accessing social activities and work opportunities. If you are interested, you will attend community events, concerts, attend movies, go on a short walk, or explore work opportunities by helping him obtain applications and returning them for consideration. This is a great opportunity to spend some time in your community while helping another person. Requirements to be a great volunteer include: a desire to help others; a pleasant demeanor; a good reading/speaking voice; average reading skills; organizational or planning abilities; a good driving record; a clear criminal history; two references access to a car with proof of insurance; a minimum of $50/100k liability and $5,000 of property damage coverage.
06902.title: Mentor and Community Inclusion Buddy Needed for Local Fellow with Blindness
06902.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

06902.description: BILINGUAL (SPANISH-ENGLISH) ADMINISTRATIVE VOLUNTEER needed for Stamford Americares Free Clinic. Need conversational Spanish. We need Friday volunteers to help with returning patient calls and make appointments, and on Tuesdays we can use help in the afternoons during clinic sessions. We are flexible and will work with your schedule! Come join our team of caring professionals.
06902.title: BILINGUAL ADMINISTRATIVE HELP  needed for Stamford AmeriCares Free Clinic

06902.description: Stigma leaves me stuck and I need to make a new good friend who will read to me and visit with me at my group home. If you like discussing current events, reading and visiting this is a perfect match for you. I like to learn grammar and vocabulary or read about minerals, food and nutrition or related topics. I might repeat myself so I just need you to be patient with me while we get to know each other. Requirements to be a great volunteer include: a desire to help others; a pleasant demeanor; a good reading/speaking voice; average reading skills; organizational or planning abilities; a good driving record; a clear criminal history; two references access to a car with proof of insurance; a minimum of $50/100k liability and $5,000 of property damage coverage.
06902.title: Stigma Leaves Me Stuck - Will You Read to Me?
06902.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

06902.description: We are looking for Spanish speaking professionals who are interested in donating their time and expertise to lead a parenting education class at Saint Joseph Parenting Center (SJPC) in Stamford, CT. Our Spanish program aims to empower the Spanish speaking parents in our community to help them become the best advocates for theri children as well as active citizens in the community so we can stop the cycle of child abuse and neglect. We offer every instructor with orientation and a detailed curriculum, as well as supporting materials for each class. We would love your time if you have any of the following backgrounds: Teacher, nurse, pediatrician, dental hygienist, therapist, social worker, parent or family educator, community outreacher, special educator, lawyer or banker. Our class runs every Tuesday morning (10am-12pm) and Wednesday evening (6pm-8pm).
06902.title: Spanish Speaking Professionals to Teach Parenting Education Class

06902.description: Provide loving, nonjudgmental, and practical support to pregnant women in crisis. Perform free pregnancy tests. Reach out in friendship to help each girl or woman for as long as needed. Birthright's guiding principle: It is the right of every pregnant woman to give birth and the right of every child to be born. Birthright offers the alternative to abortion. Birthright is pro-life. Birthright is non-profit, interdenominational, and non-political. Help make a difference in a mother's life as she prepares for the birth of her baby.
06902.title: Friendship counselor to women with unplanned pregnancies.  Bilingual a plus

06902.description: SPANISH/ ENGLISH INTERPRETERS are needed for the AmeriCares clinic in Stamford CT. Clinic sessions are on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday afternoons from noon to 5:00. Volunteers can work a four hour shift. We are very flexible and will work with your schedule. Must be fluent in Spanish and English. Our interpreters translate the needs of our patients to our medical staff. Besides your language skills, your professional and compassionate presence is needed. Volunteers are asked to work one or two clinic sessions per month. Come join our team of committed and compassionate professionals. Please also see our website for more information. AmeriCaresFreeClinics.org PLEASE NOTE: Thursday clinic is especially in need of interpreters.
06902.title: SPANISH/ ENGLISH INTERPRETERS NEEDED for Stamford AmeriCares Free Clinic

06902.description: VOLUNTEER Medical Assistants or EMTs are needed for our very busy AmeriCares mobile clinic located in Stamford CT. If you are an experienced medical assistant or EMT, we can use your help. Our free clinic treats low income, uninsured residents of Stamford. The clinic sessions are: Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday afternoons from noon to 5:00. Volunteers can work a 4 hour shift that works with their schedule. Come join our team of committed and compassionate professionals! You can volunteer once a week or once a month. We are flexible and will work with your schedule. Please see our website for more information about our program, AmericaresFreeClinics.org or email Lorraine Larkin at llarkin@americares.org
06902.title: EMT or Medical Assistants needed at Stamford AmeriCares Free Clinic

06902.description: VOLUNTEER NURSES are needed for our busy AmeriCares free clinic located in Stamford CT. Our clinic has recently been relocated to a beautiful and spacious location at 401 Shippan Avenue. Our free clinic treats low income, uninsured residents of Stamford. Volunteers’ shifts are 12:30 to 4:30 pm on Tuesday, Wednesday or Thursdays. We are flexible and will work with your schedule. Come join our team of committed and compassionate professionals! You can volunteer once a week or once a month. It is up to you. Please see our website for more information about our program, AmericaresFreeClinics.org or email Lorraine Larkin at llarkin@americares.org
06902.title: Volunteer Nurses needed at Stamford americares free clinic

06902.description: Love to cook? Purchase and prepare a healthy, homecooked, delicious, and complete meal in your kitchen or the commercial kitchen in our school, and deliver it to 10 hungry teenage boys - once, once-a-month, or when it's convenient. Your help is budget relieving, and lets staff spend more one-on-one time with our group home boys who would be homeless except for Domus. To know more, write me and I'll provide additional details.
06902.title: Meal Preparation for our Group Home Boys

06902.description: Do you have a curiosity about global affairs? Lead a U.S. foreign policy discussion group today! For over 55 years, the Foreign Policy Association's Great Decisions program has brought together people and communities to encourage individuals to engage in the world around them and to think critically about the global issues facing policymakers. Each year, FPA produces the Great Decisions briefing book, examining eight U.S. foreign policy and global affairs topics. All across the U.S., discussion groups meet to consider and discuss these topics, constituting the largest civil-education network in the country. Discussion group leaders organize and lead these meetings in their communities. Become a group leader now!
06902.title: Lead a global affairs discussion in the Stamford area today!!

06902.description: Volunteer assignment length and hours Opportunity currently available to volunteer approximately 3-4 months, or longer. Ideally volunteer will be available a minimum of 15-20 hrs/week. Summary AmeriCares is a nonprofit international relief organization delivering medicines, medical supplies and aid to people in crisis around the world and across America. In a quarter of a century, we have delivered more than $9 billion of aid to 137 countries. Responsibilities Monitor, respond to and log Help Desk requests and communications Document, track and monitor a problem to ensure a timely resolution As requested, provide support to end users on a variety of issues related to first-level help desk technical support As needed, set-up
06902.title: Help Desk Volunteer

06902.description: About AmeriCares AmeriCares is a nonprofit international relief organization that delivers medicines, medical supplies and aid to people in crisis around the world and across America. In a quarter of a century, we have delivered more than $9 billion of aid to 137 countries. Volunteer assignment Our Communications Department is responsible for all of AmeriCares internal and external communications, PR, Marketing /Branding, e-Communications and Multi-Media initiatives. This includes, but is not limited to newsletters, annual appeal brochures, website content, e-newsletters, donor collateral, marketing collateral, videos, photography, press releases, speech writing, and op-ed pieces. We are currently seeking a volunteer who can support our Multi-media Manager with some of our multi-media work. Primarily this person would assist in the archiving and cataloging of AmeriCares digital photographs. In addition, when needed they may also assist in some editing tasks and assist in the creation of some presentations. Volunteer Hours This volunteer opportunity begins immediately and will last approximately 2-3 months. Ideally we would like someone who is available for a minimum of 8-10/hours per week.
06902.title: Multi-media Volunteer

06902.description: AmeriCares is a nonprofit international relief organization that delivers medicines, medical supplies and aid to people in crisis around the world and across America. In a quarter of a century, we have delivered more than $8 billion of aid to 137 countries. From time-to-time we will have opportunities available for experienced audit professionals to contribute to internal audit assignments on a project basis. Flexibility regarding hours, depending upon scope of assignment.
06902.title: Volunteer Internal Auditor

06902.description: Volunteer assignment length and hours Opportunity currently available to volunteer approximately 3-4 months or longer. Ideally, volunteer will be available for a minimum of 5-10hrs/week. Description AmeriCares is a nonprofit international relief organization that delivers medicines, medical supplies and aid to people in crisis around the world and across America. In a quarter of a century, we have delivered more than $8 billion of aid to 137 countries. AmeriCares Medical Assistance Program, US Partnerships delivers medicine and medical supplies to nonprofit medical centers across the United States to help them improve the quality of care that they provide to uninsured and underinsured patients. These medical centers are the welcoming and professional 'medical home' for women, men and children whose only alternative for primary health services is the local emergency room. As a result of AmeriCares Medical Assistance Program, more patients walk out of a safety net clinic not just with a diagnosis, but with the treatment they need. For patients with acute conditions, this means recovery from an illness and a timely return to work. For patients with chronic conditions, this means maintaining continuity in their medication regimen so that their diseases do not progress to advanced stages or trigger emergency episodes. In the last two years, AmeriCaresMedical Assistance Program for the United States has Supplied more than 150 individual clinics with 449 shipments of pharmaceuticals and supplies Valued at over $36 million. Responsibilities Your primary responsibility in this role is to provide back-up support to our full-time receptionist so that he/she can attend to responsibilities away from the phone and front desk when needed. You may also be called upon from time-to-time to cover for our receptionist when needed for vacation coverage or any unplanned absences. Assist in answering all incoming telephone calls and proper routing to appropriate staff Take and relay messages Provide information to callers Greet all visitors to AmeriCares and notify appropriate AmeriCares staff of their guests’ arrival. Answer questions and make guests feel welcome
06902.title: Volunteer Receptionist

06902.description: The AmeriCares Free Clinics located in Danbury, Bridgeport and Norwalk, CT need volunteer registered nurses to run the free clinic programs. Only registered nurses and nurse practitioners should apply.
06902.title: RegisteredNurse

06903.description: Media/News Writer Volunteer, If you enjoy writing, this is the volunteer job for you. We are looking for someone to create press releases about the Stamford History Center for distribution to various media outlets (onlinenews sites, radio, tv, magazines, etc.). You will interview people in the organization to gather information. Once your article is reviewed by our volunteer editors, it will be sent out. It is essential that our media volunteer stays up-to- date with our activities, so press releases go out in a timely fashion. The position can be expanded to include the creation of newsletters and flyers (working with our graphic designer). This is a job that can be done largely from your own laptop/desktop, and at your own convenience. REQUIREMENT: Please write a two or three paragraph \"Press Release\" on one of the following topics: 1] About our Tag Sale 2] The opening of the Hoyt-Barnum House or 3] A past Historical Center event You can get ideas by going to our web site: www.stamfordhistory.org Forward it to me and we will review and get back to you. Thanks again for your interest in joining the volunteer team! Tom Tom Porter Volunteer Coordinator Stamford History Center 1508 High Ridge Road Stamford, CT 06903 www.stamfordhistory.org 203-329-1183 Skills needed: organized, experienced writer; a self-starter who can use Word and navigate the internet.
06903.title: Media/News Writer Volunteer

06903.description: Museum Docent We are looking for volunteers who would like to introduce visitors to our 1699 historic house museum. You would be involved with greeting visitors with a smile and giving a brief explanation of the Center's offerings: a research library, photo archive, our current exhibit, and our historic house museum. People who wish to tour Hoyt-Barnum House first view an introductory film before starting the audio tour. You would be responsible for selling tickets and recording transactions, giving guests their audio pods and collecting them after the tours, opening and closing up the house museum, and monitoring visitors while they are in the house. Training is provided. Museum Docents should be friendly and personable. They should be physically able to manage stairs and brief walks on a regular basis. Docents should be at least 20 years old and able to work at least one four-hour day, 2 x /month. Shifts are from noon to 4 pm on Thursdays and Fridays. Two docents are needed on Saturday: one from 10:30 - 2:30 and one from noon to 4 pm. You are welcome to stay longer to meet our other volunteers and make use of our facility. Skills Customer Service Public Speaking General Education Problem Solving Communication Basic math/money skills
06903.title: Museum Docent

06901.description: We have been approved for Google's non-profit ad word program. We need help setting up ad words.
06901.title: Google ad word help!!

06901.description: Seeking volunteer transport drivers with reliable vehicles to help us move dogs along our transport route between these towns: Hagerstown MD, Mechanicsburg PA, Hamburg PA, Phillipsburg NJ, Haskell NJ (northern NJ), Stamford CT, E Hartford CT. Transports are on Saturdays and we move through these towns during afternoon/evening hours. MUST LOVE DOGS. Must be comfortable handling strange dogs that may or may not be stressed by transport. Attention to detail important. Not above cleaning up stinky messes to help our furry friends get to safety. Crates are required but not provided. On occasion we are able to get some crates donated. Please submit a driver application: http://form.jotform.us/form/50214993744156
06901.title: Saturday transport driver near Stamford CT

06901.description: Declare Your Dedication to a Better Stamford! Be a Reader to the Blind and help make Connecticut a better place to live. If you like to chat, read current news affairs, shop a little, walk a little and love life a lot, this is the chance you have been waiting for. Four new volunteer positions in Stamford and one in Norwalk will become open within the next few weeks. Here is a little overview of what's available: 1.. gent needs a well read, inquiring and patient mind to discuss science, space and all manner of interesting topics. There will be a bit of reading science magazines or other news of mutual agreement, even a few library materials would be welcome; 2...lady and her guide dog need a sighted guide buddy to walk the local area incuding paths to the beach, conference center and other areas. She would also like to go to the library, shopping or out for coffee and a little shopping; 3... two ladies who are both socially isolated and who want to get out to shop, attend local performances, speeches, conferences, presentations and outdoor concerts. Both would enjoy shopping for clothes, curios, and groceries. 4...gent in Norwalk and his service dog needs a socialization buddy, he has a very high intelligence level and no peers locally to share his knowledge, expertise or interests. Visits will largely be on site in a common area and then if mutually agreed, outings will be of interest. Get in on the Ground Floor of this great volunteer opportunity and do your part to make Connecticut a great place to live, work and socialize. Requirements to be a great volunteer include: a desire to help others; a pleasant demeanor; a good reading/speaking voice; average reading skills; organizational or planning abilities; a good driving record; a clear criminal history; two references access to a car with proof of insurance; a minimum of $50/100k liability and $5,000 of property damage coverage.
06901.title: Declare Your Dedication to a Better Stamford! Be a Reader and Buddy to the Blind
06901.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

06901.description: Volunteer Keep America Beautiful (KAB) seeks an enthusiastic, hard-working individual interested in furthering the nonprofit’s purpose of bringing people together to ensure that beauty is the lasting signature in our communities and our country. Working with its network of more than 620 community-based affiliates, KAB provides the educational tools, awareness platforms and resources to help end littering, improve recycling and beautify America’s communities. Through our actions and impact, we help create communities that are socially connected, environmentally healthy and economically sound. The volunteer will work for the Development Department and may have opportunity to interface with individuals in other departments. The volunteer will support the Development team and will work directly with all members of the department. Projects may include, but are not limited to: Donor profiles and fundraising - Researching corporate, foundation, and individual prospects; preparing briefs and presentations for meetings with corporate prospects and current sponsors; assisting staff with portfolio management Grant writing - Research and compilation of support documents for grant applications Donor communications/outreach - prepare materials for fundraising appeals; donor correspondence letters, calling donors Database management (SalesForce) eSpatial mapping and data analysis Operational and administrative support as needed (e.g., filing, scanning, or mailings) Possible assistance with event planning and/or events Skills: Strong writing and research skills required; working knowledge of MSOffice including Word, Excel, PowerPoint; detail-oriented and organized; focused and productive on tasks-at-hand. Some knowledge of fundraising software and experience with fundraising is desirable but not required. Perspective: Positive and respectful attitude; willing to take direction, but able to work independently; interest in learning as well as contributing to the greater goals of the department and organization. Reporting: This position reports to the Chief Development Officer. Location: This position is based at Keep America Beautiful’s national office - 1010 Washington Blvd., Stamford, Connecticut. Office is 5 blocks from the Stamford Train Station. Free shuttle provided AM & PM . Free on-site parking is available during working hours. Hours: We offer a flexible schedule for volunteers and will determine a mutually agreed upon schedule prior to the start date. Our office hours are Monday to Friday 9:00am - 5:00pm. If you are a college student and need course credit, it is possible to arrange, if applicable. Start Date: Immediately To apply: Please submit resume and cover letter to contact below. Contact: Berett Garbus, Development Coordinator Keep America Beautiful / 1010 Washington Blvd / Stamford, CT 06901 Phone: 203-659-3052 / bgarbus@kab.org
06901.title: Development Department Volunteer

06901.description: Point of Contact: Donna Miller, Executive Director Phone: (203) 327-9419 e-mail: donnam@ecpsc.org website: http://www.exchangeclubparentingskillscenter.com/ Come join a dynamic team of professionals committed to prevent child abuse in Southern CT. The Exchange Club focuses on crisis intervention in the effort to break the cycle of child abuse while preserving the family unit. Our mission is to stop or prevent the cycle of child abuse or neglect in families by modeling nurturing parenting practices. The Center is AAA accredited nationally by the National Exchange Club Foundation for highest achievement and best practices. Since its founding, The Exchange Club Parenting Skills Center has helped over 10,000 children and their families, and case studies show a greater than 85% success rate among families served\" Volunteer Outreach Coordinator: Job Description and Duties The Exchange Club Outreach Volunteer will promote public awareness of the prevention of child abuse through public education, media campaigns and fund raising. This position will also help to recruit new volunteers and expand our network of community partners. This leads to greater public understanding and interest in our organization which in turn, helps facilitate fund raising efforts while shaping the public’s thinking and policies around this issue. Duties include: Volunteer recruiting, training and education in collaboration with the Volunteer Coordinator Creation, development and implementation of community events in collaboration with the Event Coordinator Creation, development and implementation of community fundraisers Creation, development and implementation of media campaigns Being a liaison with community partners Work closely with the Volunteer Coordinator and other volunteer teammates to identify outreach opportunities and social networks that may be untapped Time Commitment Flexible, 8 or more hours a week Location of work may be partially on site at the Exchange Club Headquarters but will also require off site work within the greater Stamford and Fairfield County community Car will be necessary. Reimbursement is available for travel related to the position Skills: College Degree or Certification (Bachelors, Associates or Supervisory Certification) would be beneficial Leadership abilities and strategic thinking, ability to identify and prioritize high value opportunities Excellent written and oral communication skills Ability to present effective and compelling messages to individuals, groups and the public Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to work with a diverse variety of individuals All interested parties must fill out an application. Candidates must provide references and allow a background check to be performed by the agency. We look forward to hearing from you!
06901.title: Volunteer Outreach Coordinator
06901.org: EXCHANGE CLUB CENTER FOR THE PREV OF CHILD ABUSE OF SOUTHERN CT INC

06901.description: Point of Contact Donna Miller, Executive Director Phone: (203) 327-9419 e-mail: donnam@ecpsc.org Website: http://www.exchangeclubparentingskillscenter.com/ Come join a dynamic team of professionals committed to prevent child abuse in Southern CT. The Exchange Club focuses on crisis intervention in the effort to break the cycle of child abuse while preserving the family unit. Our mission is to stop or prevent the cycle of child abuse or neglect in families by modeling nurturing parenting practices. The Center is AAA accredited nationally by the National Exchange Club Foundation for highest achievement and best practices. Since its founding, The Exchange Club Parenting Skills Center has helped over 10,000 children and their families, and case studies show a greater than 85% success rate among families served\" Volunteer Event Planner: Job Description and Duties Special Events Volunteers perform a variety of tasks including planning and implementing events both in the Exchange Club Headquarters and in the community, such as holiday parties, ceremonies, annual receptions, family fun days, nature walks, food banks, clothing banks, health education events, healthy lifestyles event, job search coaching, etc. The Event Planner must have strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with internal staff, Board of Directors and community partners Ability to manage projects from start to finish for both one day events (mini events) and projects with longer timelines Continuously identify/create new strategic community events with civic and corporate partners Work closely with the Volunteer Coordinator and other volunteer teammates to identify outreach opportunities and partners that may agree to host a special event Time Commitment Flexible, 3 or more hours a week. May require more while planning and implementing projects and events Location of work may be partially on site at the Exchange Club Headquarters but may also require off site work within the greater Stamford and Fairfield County community Car would be helpful. Reimbursement is available for travel related to the position Skills: Possess good verbal and communication skills and have a passion for interacting with people Must be creative and flexible to pique the interest and meet the needs of the communities served Project planning and community outreach experience are a plus Good organizational skills and some computer proficiencies would be very helpful (Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Social Media) All interested parties must fill out an application. Candidates must provide references and allow a background check to be performed by the agency. We look forward to hearing from you!
06901.title: Volunteer Event Planner
06901.org: EXCHANGE CLUB CENTER FOR THE PREV OF CHILD ABUSE OF SOUTHERN CT INC

06901.description: Point of Contact Donna Miller, Executive Director Phone: (203) 327-9419 e-mail: donnam@ecpsc.org website: http://www.exchangeclubparentingskillscenter.com/ Come join a dynamic team of professionals committed to prevent child abuse in Southern CT. The Exchange Club focuses on crisis intervention in the effort to break the cycle of child abuse while preserving the family unit. Our mission is to stop or prevent the cycle of child abuse or neglect in families by modeling nurturing parenting practices. The Center is AAA accredited nationally by the National Exchange Club Foundation for highest achievement and best practices. Since its founding, The Exchange Club Parenting Skills Center has helped over 10,000 children and their families, and case studies show a greater than 85% success rate among families served\" Volunteer Office Assistant: Job Description and Duties Manage day to day administrative duties at the Exchange Club office such as greeting visitors and community constituents, answering the phone, filing and maintaining records, organize office systems, writing memos, etc. Support the Board of Directors, Center Director and Volunteer Coordinator with daily clerical functions Help coordinate administrative details with Director and the Board of Directors on fund raising activities, mailings, newsletters, community outreach events and other special projects Assist with pre and post event communications and donor thank you letters and other communications as needed Time Commitment Flexible, 8 or more hours a week Most of the work will be at the Exchange Club Headquarters. Some work may be done remotely Skills: Experience with secretarial or administrative duties, organizational skills and ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously Computer skills, some level of proficiency with Microsoft Word and PowerPoint, e-mail and internet searches Strong Communication and interpersonal skills Project management skills All interested parties must fill out an application. Candidates must provide references and allow a background check to be performed by the agency. We look forward to hearing from you!
06901.title: Volunteer Office Assistant
06901.org: EXCHANGE CLUB CENTER FOR THE PREV OF CHILD ABUSE OF SOUTHERN CT INC

06901.description: Point of Contact Donna Miller, Executive Director Phone: (203) 327-9419 e-mail: donnam@ecpsc.org http://www.exchangeclubparentingskillscenter.com/ Come join a dynamic team of professionals committed to prevent child abuse in Southern CT. The Exchange Club focuses on crisis intervention in the effort to break the cycle of child abuse while preserving the family unit. Our mission is to stop or prevent the cycle of child abuse or neglect in families by modeling nurturing parenting practices. The Center is AAA accredited nationally by the National Exchange Club Foundation for highest achievement and best practices. Since its founding, The Exchange Club Parenting Skills Center has helped over 10,000 children and their families, and case studies show a greater than 85% success rate among families served\" Volunteer Coordinator: Job Description and Duties The Exchange Club Volunteer Coordinator will manage all aspects of our Volunteer program including assessing the changing needs of our organization, creating positions, writing job descriptions, recruitment, placement and retention of volunteers. This position is perfect for someone who is creative and self-starting, capable of building our Volunteer program from scratch. Help develop a volunteer strategy for our organization that is successful and aligns with the vision of our organization Create appropriate volunteer positions and role descriptions that meet the needs of our clients and staff. Recruit, manage and train volunteers. Develop relationships with various external stakeholders to raise awareness of the Exchange Club and foster opportunities to recruit support (funding and/or expertise) from the community and corporate sectors Leverage Social Media to broaden the Exchange Club’s network Flexible - 16 or more hours a week Skills: College Degree or Certification (Bachelors, Associates or Supervisory Certification) would be beneficial Ability to lead and motivate a team of volunteers, work cohesively with management and staff including the Board of Directors Excellent communication skills, project management skills Some proficiency with computers and social media Creativity to build and shape a successful volunteer program All interested parties must fill out an application. Candidates must provide references and allow a background check to be performed by the agency. We look forward to hearing from you!
06901.title: Volunteer Coordinator
06901.org: EXCHANGE CLUB CENTER FOR THE PREV OF CHILD ABUSE OF SOUTHERN CT INC

06901.description: The SustainAbilityCT (iACT) project focuses on economic solutions that drive employment, education and housing. Recognizing that economic stability is the most important predictor of an individual’s ability to permanently exit an abusive relationship, DVCC created iACT to help victims achieve financial security through numerous resources, including financial education workshops, resume preparation, job search strategies, and connection to job training programs and affordable housing resources. The goal is that clients become financially savvy, self-confident and in control of every aspect of their lives. The SustainAbilityCT program of DVCC is looking for professionals who can assist our clients and staff in areas of: Debt planning; Mortgages; Automotive financing; Family Law;Consumer law; CPA; Financial Literacy; Tax laws and more. If you think you have a skill or competency that will help our clients we would love to talk to you.
06901.title: Skilled Professionals

06901.description: Stamford Academy, our alternative high school, has about 140 students. Most of the kids have been unsuccessful in their traditional high school. The staff is highly motivated and dedicated to providing the instruction, support, and attention needed to ensure the students successfully matriculate and graduate. If there ever was a program that lives the Domus vision, this is it! The principal is seeking a volunteer who says, \"What do you need?\" Examples of activities include: keeping the bulletin boards current, light data entry or other administrative functions, and general organizing. Once you're comfortable, there is also ample opportunity to get the know the students. If you love Domus, you'll love Stamford Academy.
06901.title: Weekday Helper

06901.description: In collaboration with the Connecticut Food Bank (Commodity Supplemental Food Program) and Charter Oak Communities, Family Centers is looking for volunteers to assist with the unloading and distribution of food boxes at four residential senior locations in Stamford. Volunteers are needed the second Thursday of the month from approximately 9:00-12:30. The delivery schedule will begin at 9:00am and unfold as follows: Stamford Manor (26 Main Street): 50 boxes, Post House (40 Clinton Avenue): 25 boxes, Quintard Manor (18 Quintard Terrace): 15 boxes and lastly Rippowam Manor (11 North Street): 30 boxes. Each stop will take about 30 minutes with the unloading and delivering into the building. Volunteers should be able to lift up to 25lbs. and must provide their own transportation from site to site.
06901.title: Food Delivery Volunteers

06901.description: Domestic Violence Crisis Center (DVCC) is committed to promoting the fundamental right of all individuals to be safe in their personal relationships. The EparanzaCT program is an arm of the DVCC that serves the Latino population in the Fairfield County area. We serve six towns in CT: Stamford, Norwalk, Darien, New Canaan, Westport & Wilton. There is an immediate need for volunteers who speak Spanish. We have opportunities in In-take (Health centers & ER), Hotline, Medical Advocacy Program, Sustainability program (ESL classes, computer instruction, financial planning, Tax help etc.) Please note training is required and DVCC will provide the training at no cost to you but we need a 3-6 month commitment towards the opportunity.
06901.title: Spanish speaking volunteers

06901.description: Similar to the book cart program in front of our Lockwood Avenue campus, we'd like to start a neighborhood give-away book cart in front of Stamford Academy, our high school on North Street. The books come from the community, your friends shelves, and local libraries. If you have 2 hours a week, a flexible schedule, your own transportation, love books, are community minded, and like a little physical activity, this is the volunteer opportunity for you!
06901.title: Become a Book Cart Champion

06901.description: Protect our environment and the special world in which we live. Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned Connecticut citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Together we can protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. Want to know more? Please join our weekly Introductory Conference Call. The next one is on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. It is a live call, about an hour long, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. Please register for the call at this link so that we can follow up with you: https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/ We look forward to working with you!
06901.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Stamford CT

06901.description: This Stamford lady needs a volunteer driver for local trips to area medical offices while she waits for training with her new guide dog. Volunteer in your community with this high impact but easy way to make a huge difference. Requirements to be a great volunteer include: a desire to help others; a pleasant demeanor; a good reading/speaking voice; average reading skills; organizational or planning abilities; a good driving record; a clear criminal history; two references access to a car with proof of insurance; a minimum of $50/100k liability and $5,000 of property damage coverage.
06901.title: Driver or Bus Companion Needed for Stamford Lady and Her Guide Dog
06901.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

06901.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
06901.title: Stamford Area>>>Advice Counselor

06901.description: By providing childcare at either of our sites in Norwalk or Stamford, you will help the mothers who receive DVCC's services to be able to participate fully in support groups and counseling sessions, or to attend doctors' appointments, job interviews or just have a few moments to themselves. You must be 16 years of age or older and a comittment of 2 hours a week would be most welcomed. Before becoming a Certified Volunteer and being able to have direct client contact, you will be required to take our state certified 20-hour Educational Seminar, This is given twice a year, Spring and Fall.
06901.title: Child welfare Volunteers

06901.description: DVCC's PeaceWorks programs brings awareness and education to the schools in the seven towns that we serve. In our K-5 grade programs focus on anger management and conflict resolution. Our healthy families programs are presented to middle school and high school children. Our healthy relationship workshops are presented in 8th grade and high school. We also do various workshops on the topic of domestic violence to civic groups, professionals, and faith based communities. Volunteers help educators with Puppets, story telling, model positive behavior and get classroom materials ready for presentations.
06901.title: Preventive Education- PeaceWorks Volunteer

06901.description: A hotline volunteer works directly with victims of domestic violence by providing information and safety planning assistance. Training is required and will be provided by DVCC. Position also requires a 20 hour educational seminar mandated by the Coalition Against Domestic Violence.
06901.title: Hotline Volunteer

06901.description: Office helpers are asked to commit to a four hour shift helping with copying, filing, answering hotline and business phones, computer work, greeting clients, and processing mailings.
06901.title: Office Helpers

10268.description: Sanctuary for Families is New York’s leading service provider and advocate for survivors of domestic violence, sex trafficking, and related forms of gender violence. Sanctuary works to end gender violence through three key areas: direct service; outreach, education and training; and systems-change advocacy. Sanctuary currently seeks Hungarian-speaking volunteers to complete written document translations. Sanctuary's volunteer-led Translation Project supports our agency staff by completing a range of written document translations, including legal documents and outreach materials. This opportunity is open to all with written fluency in Hungarian - translations are completed virtually via email. Qualifications: Written fluency in Hungarian Ability to complete translations via email within a set deadline Respect for confidentiality is a must How to Apply To apply, please complete our volunteer application form found on our website (www.sanctuaryforfamilies.org/support-us/volunteer)
10268.title: Hungarian Translator

10466.description: Provide counseling and supportive services to high school students. Provide career and college counseling and advising to high school students. Paid Volunteer Position
10466.title: School Social Worker

10466.description: The primary function of this position is to provide clinical oversight and service delivery of I'RAISE Geared for Success Program. This position is responsible for the Geared for Success program curriculum as well as the implementation of quality clinical services to the clientele within this program.
10466.title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker

11550.description: Not-for-profit agency is seeking a highly motivated, energetic and creative volunteer to work alongside the Program Manager in finding speakers and programs that would be of interest to guests coming to Long Island’s largest Soup Kitchen, the Mary Brennan INN (located in Hempstead). Past workshops have included topics such as yoga, medication, sports talk, art and financial budgeting. We are looking to offer a wide-variety of programs at different times of the day. The volunteer candidate must be friendly, professional, computer literate, organized and excellent communication skills.
11550.title: Enrichment Activities Coordinator

11550.description: Not-for-profit agency is seeking a highly skilled person to work in the administrative office, alongside our Grants Coordinator and Director of Development, in the area of grant research, documentation and reporting. Volunteer must be knowledgeable and great at writing and/or researching grants (grant funding from corporations, financial institutions, private and family foundations, as well as NY state contracts). We will train you on web research using the Foundation Center tools and our internal database program. If you have a general understanding of how grant funding works for non-profit agencies, we’d like to meet you. Please contact Dorian Stern, Director of Development, at dstern@the-inn.org to arrange an appointment to meet and discuss the opportunity.
11550.title: Grant Writer/Researcher

11550.description: Not-for-profit agency is seeking highly skilled fast paced, energetic volunteers that are pleasant, caring, and courteous to work in Long Island's largest Soup Kitchen, as a Volunteer Coordinator. Volunteer Coordinator will assist staff in ensuring that all volunteers are assigned to specific tasks and that each area of the soup kitchen is sufficiently covered. Volunteer Coordinators must be flexible in assisting wherever they are needed and must work with the Managers to maintain safe mealtime standards in accordance with the agency's policies and procedures. Volunteer Coordinators must follow directions and work well on a team, be punctual, dependable, friendly, respectful and a good communicator. They must also have the ability to respond to emergency situations while maintaining composure and demonstrating appropriate professionalism and restraint at all times. Volunteer Coordinators must have the physical stamina to stand for long periods of time. Volunteer Coordinators are needed for each day of the week, Mon-Fri, during the hours of 8:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m.
11550.title: Volunteer Coordinator

11550.description: The Center for Transformative Change (CTC) serves as a consultative referral center for guests of the Mary Brennan INN Soup Kitchen. The center is seeking a Receptionist to meet, greet and check-in guests who are requesting services; monitor incoming phone calls and file away guest folders. The ideal volunteer must be a people person, team player and friendly, professional, able to communicate well, multi-task, be organized, and be flexible in assisting wherever they are needed. We are looking for receptionists to fill the days and hours below: Monday through Thursday - 11:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.
11550.title: Receptionist - Center for Transformative Change

11550.description: Long Island's largest Soup Kitchen, the Mary Brennan INN, is seeking a Receptionist to meet and greet volunteers and donors; monitor incoming phone calls and accept and record donations. The ideal volunteer must be a people person, team player and friendly, professional, able to communicate well, multi-task, be organized, and be flexible in assisting wherever they are needed. We are looking for receptionists to fill the hours below: Tuesdays & Thursdays from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Mon, Wed & Fri from 2 p.m. to 5 p.m.
11550.title: Receptionist - Mary Brennan INN Soup Kitchen

11550.description: The INN is seeking volunteers for the Mary Brennan INN, Long Islands largest soup kitchen. Duties include, but are not limited to, preparing and serving a meal, sorting items, stacking shelves, organizing and cleaning. Volunteers must be friendly and flexible.
11550.title: Soup Kitchen Volunteer

11550.description: The INN is seeking volunteers with backgrounds in Social Work or Health & Human Services for its new Center for Transformative Change (CTC). The CTC is located adjacent to the existing Mary Brennan INN, the largest soup kitchen on Long Island, and is designed to serve as a consultative referral center for guests of the Mary Brennan INN. Guests will be referred for services and programs that meet their needs for issues such as housing, educational program, employment, health care, etc. Volunteers with Spanish language skills are also needed. The CTC is expected to open January 2016. Currently seeking volunteers on Tuesdays and Thursdays: 9:00-12:00PM / Wednesdays: 12:30-3:00PM
11550.title: New Program Opportunity

11550.description: The INN is a not-for-profit organization that addresses the needs of hungry and homeless Long Islanders. We are currently seeking volunteers who are willing to assist in our clothing boutique to (1) help sort through clothing donations and stock/re-stock the boutique; and (2) volunteers who are friendly and can assist guests in choosing clothing from the boutique. Various times available. Affluent in Spanish is not a requirement but a plus. For more information about The INN go to www.the-inn.org
11550.title: Clothing Boutique Volunteers

11550.description: The Mental Health Association of Nassau County’s Compeer program is expanding its program to serve youth. Compeer matches caring adult volunteers with youth ages 5-17 who are in the recovery process toward better Mental Health. Mentors spend an hour per week providing friendship, support and a positive role model through community-based activities enjoyable to both the Mentor and the youth. We are currently accepting applications for referrals and volunteers. If you are interested in volunteering or know a child that can benefit from the program please call Rhea Spina at 516-489-2322 x 1260.
11550.title: Compeer Youth Program - Making a Difference in a Child's Life
11550.org: Mental Health Association of Nassau County, Inc.

11550.description: Food Not Bombs Mission Statement:Food Not Bombs recovers and shares free vegan or vegetarian food with the public without restriction in over 1,000 cities around the world to protest war, poverty and the destruction of the environment. Each group is independent and invites everyone to participate in making decisions for their local chapter using the consensus process. Food Not Bombs is dedicated to taking nonviolent direct action to change society so no one is forced to stand in line to eat at a soup kitchen expressing a commitment to the fact that food is a right and not a privilege. With over a billion people going hungry each day how can we spend another dollar on war? Hello Neighbor,I'm a volunteer with Long Island Food Not Bombs (LIFNB.com).We have Free Food Shares (Free Food, Clothing, Books, Baby Items, Household Items, Art, etc.) throughout Long Island and Brooklyn. Depends what donations we get from stores, churches, neighbors and volunteers. Usually there are fruits, vegetables, milk, dairy, bread, cakes, pies, canned and dry goods, pet food, etc. We also have clothes, household & baby items, books, art, etc. depending what is brought to the Food Shares that day.Ask for Volunteer Jon or Rose if you have something to share. Say hello for me. Thank you, Volunteer Dennis A new release video: We start at 13:55: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fixP0UR_G_UCraigslist Post:Free \"Long Island Food Not Bombs\" Food SharesEvery Sunday at 2 PM, West Columbia Street & Station Plaza, Hempstead, NY 11550Every Tuesday at 7 PM, East 6th Street & Fairground Avenue, Huntington NY 11746Every Thursday at 7 PM, Horseblock Road & Woodycrest Drive, Farmingville, NY 11738Every Saturday at 12 PM, noon, 1556 Straight Path, Wyandanch, NY 11798Every Saturday at 3 PM, Lafayette Ave & Marcy Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11216All outdoors. Rain or Shine. No umbrellas or strollers by tables.Come Share With Your Community.Free Food, Clothing, Books, Baby Items, Household Items, Art, etc.Whatever is brought by our Volunteers, You (if you can) and Your Neighbors in Your Community.A Community is its Neighbors, not the towns they are in.Get there a few minutes before start time. Help us unload our Volunteers vehicles and set up tables.Bring empty bags, food, clothing, household items, baby items, books, etc to \"Share with Your Community\".See Volunteers if you do bring items to Share, or you want to volunteer to hand food and items out. Say hello for me, Dennis. Nothing to bring? Then bring yourselves.We'll help you get food and items you need. You don't need to bring any type of papers or ID to our Food Shares.Everyone is welcome to get Free Food, Clothing, Household Items, Baby Items, Books, Art, etc. Depends what is brought by our volunteers and other neighbors to share.We average 8,000 pounds of food and merchandise each Food Share.Just please be polite with your neighbors when we Share.We will not tolerate any type of racial slurs or bigotry.Please thank and help our Volunteers by taking recyclable cardboard (boxes to take home your food and items). Put out on your recycle day for pick up.More info go to our website: LIFNB.com Start Sharing:1) Pass this on to family, friends and neighbors in your community. 2) Copy flyers at LIFNB.com or this Craigslist post. Hand them out. Schools, Libraries, Senior Centers, Churches, Stores, etc.3) Maybe you are an owner, manager or employee of a store, supermarket, distributor, wholesaler, farm, or manufacturer. Do you have soon to be expired food, drinks and/or merchandise you will be throwing out?Help us help you save money. Less carting fees. Great Community Relations.Call the Hotline (631) 223-4370 - 10 AM - 2 PM.4) Next time you are in a store where you shop. Ask the owner or manager if they would like to donate soon to be expired food, drinks and/or merchandise they will be throwing out shortly. We'll pick up and they save money on carting fees and help the community. Give our Hotline Number (631) 223-4370 - 10 AM - 2 PM.5) Share on Facebook:\"Friend\" - Li FNB\"Like\" - Long Island Food Not Bombs6) Become one of our volunteers. Come and join us.No Food Shares in your area, volunteers will help you start one.We are not affiliated with any religion, church or political party. Community churches do donate food and items to our Food Shares.\"Long Island Food Not Bombs\" is the largest \"Food Not Bombs\" in the World.We do all this with no government funding, all volunteers. Volunteer to help us obtain funding.We are always in need of Plastic Folding Tables for our Food Shares. Donate when you can at: http://www.LIFNB.comThank you, Volunteer Dennis Peace
11550.title: Hempstead Food Share - LIFNB

11550.description: EAC Network In-Home Respite Services is a not-for-profit program helping older adults and their family caregivers in Nassau County. No minimum or maximum number of hours, we will work with your schedule and any travel limitations. We have many opportunities- 1)visiting with an older adult once a week for 2-6 hours 2)working to publicize the program, including working on flyers or contacting helpful parties 3) public speaking 4) staffing volunteer or health fair tables, attending events such as Memory Cafe's. If you choose to visit an older adult, you will enjoy purposeful activities such as walking, talking, chair exercises, listening to music. You will not provide personal care or household tasks. No driving required. You will relieve a family caregiver so they can go out for a weekly break of 2-6 hours. No experience necessary. We provide training.
11550.title: Non-Profit Program helping Older Adults in Nassau County

11550.description: Not-for-profit agency is seeking volunteers to join their Speakers Bureau. Volunteers will speak to community groups, schools, religious organizations and companies about issues of hunger and homelessness on Long Island, the services the agency provides and how others can get involved. All volunteers will receive the training and support required to successfully speak to the public on their behalf. Candidates must be comfortable with public speaking, have the ability to speak passionately and confidently to large and diverse audiences, be friendly, flexible, and able to work with the public tactfully, courteously and effectively. For further information please contact Cynthia Sucich, Director of Communications, at (516) 486-8506ext. 115.
11550.title: Speakers Bureau Volunteers

11550.description: Not-for-profit agency is seeking an office volunteer with Microsoft Office and Internet knowledge. Candidate should be friendly, dependable and able to work in a fast-paced environment. Duties include: data entry, internet research, follow-up phone calls, mail merges, and filing. Flexible schedule. For further information please contact Cynthia Sucich, Director of Communications, at (516) 486-8506 ext. 115.
11550.title: Office Volunteer

11550.description: This position requires a people person. *The ideal volunteer will assist staff and volunteers in the main dining area during the meal period. *Assisting Hispanic speaking guests in making their needs known. *The Bi-lingual volunteer will also address the guests during the pre-meal announcements. *This volunteer position also involves assisting the on grounds social worker in the area of translation with Hispanic speaking guests, when necessary. For more information about The INN go to www.the-inn.org
11550.title: Bi-Lingual Interpreter

11550.description: The Players is an improvisational theater troupe performs vignettes that show audiences what it's like to live with a psychiatric disability, how the illness itself, the lack of support services and public attitudes impact on individuals with mental illnesses and those around them. The cast remains in character and responds to questions after each performance while a skilled mental health facilitator moderates the discussion. The Players perform at no cost at different locations such as PTAs meetings, schools, religious groups and civic and community organizations.
11550.title: Mental Health Players
11550.org: Mental Health Association of Nassau County, Inc.

11550.description: Use the power of friendship to help people with mental illnesses live happier, more productive lives. Compeer volunteers spend about an hour a week with a new friend who is matched by gender, age, location and mutual interests. Orientation and supervision provided.
11550.title: Compeer - Making friends, changing lives
11550.org: Mental Health Association of Nassau County, Inc.

11553.description: Registered Nurses needed to assist Pharmacists in our Medication Room. Rotacare is a non-profit primary care health care clinic serving Long Island's most needy. Please leave the best phone number where you can be reached. Rotacare is open Mondays from 12:30-5:30, one Tuesday a month from 1:30-5:30 and two Thursdays a month from 3:30-6:30. Join over 120 dedicated volunteers as we provide quality healthcare to those with the most need and least access to medical care.
11553.title: Registered Nurse for Medication Room

11553.description: Computer Assistant (Computer Geek)needed to help us create identification badges for our patients. Must have intermediate computer knowledge and good interpersonal skills. Spanish speaking a plus. RotaCare is a nonprofit healthcare clinic devoted to help relieve the pain and suffering of individuals who have the most need and the least access to medical care. Through the efforts of physicians, nurses and support staff, Rotacare provides basic primary care to our patients. Please leave the best phone number where we can reach you. Become a RotaCare Volunteer today!!
11553.title: Computer Assistant

11553.description: Certified EKG Tech needed for nonprofit healthcare clinic for Long Island's neediest. We are open Monday afternoons, one Tuesday and two Thursday afternoons. Please leave the best phone number where we can reach you. We need your assistance!
11553.title: EKG Tech

11553.description: Social Worker needed a few times per month to support and assist our patients. We are a non-profit healthcare clinic run entirely by volunteers to provide care for individuals who do not have health insurance and are unable to pay for care. We are open every Monday and alternating Tuesdays and Thursdays. Please consider donating your time and talent to help support our mission of taking care of Long Island's most needy adults. Please leave the best phone number for us to reach you.
11553.title: Social Worker for Non-Profit Healthcare Clinic

11553.description: Are you a people person? We need greeters and front desk assistance in a non-profit healthcare clinic in Uniondale. We are open Mondays and every other Tuesday and Thursday. Greeters welcome our patients and escort them to the clinic. Front Desk volunteers assist by making appointments for the patients. Spanish language ability is helpful but not necessary. Please leave the best phone number where we can reach you. We look forward to hearing from you!
11553.title: Greeters and Front Desk Assistance Needed in Non-Profit Free Health Care Clinic

11553.description: Spanish interpreters needed for non-profit free health care clinic. We are open Mondays and alternating Tuesday's and Thursday's in Uniondale. Please leave the best phone number where we can reach you. We need your help!!
11553.title: Spanish Interpreters Needed for Non-Profit Health Care Clinic

11553.description: We need retired or active Registered Nurses for a free health center in Uniondale, N.Y. run entirely by volunteers to provide care for individuals who do not have health insurance and are unable to pay for care. Our Registered Nurses provide initial assessments for our patients and may also work in our Medication Room. Our hours are Mondays (12:30-5:30), the first and third Thursdays of the month (3:30-7:30) and the second and fourth Tuesdays of the month (1:30-5:30). Please leave the best phone number for us to reach you.

11553.description: Join RotaCare's all-volunteer staff and help provide free health care to people in need. The Prescription Program for Indigent Patients (PPIP) obtains free medication from pharmaceutical companies for our patients. The program is invaluable for RotaCare, but the application process is labor intensive. We need assistance completing the applications; tracking the applications and the shipments of medicine; contacting the drug manufacturers; and assuring the patients receive the correct medicine. Without this program RotaCare could not provide free medication for our patients and the patients would not get their vital medications because they could not afford them. Additional volunteers assisting in this department would help us ensure that our patients get the medicine they need. Since 1992, RotaCare has been providing free primary care to people who are uninsured and financially eligible. 11553.description: RotaCare is a free health center run by volunteers to provide health care to those who are without health insurance and are unable to afford care. Physicians are needed to provide primary care for our patients. RotaCare is not a Walk-in clinic. It operates as a doctor's office and doctors are responsible for the overall management of the patients, many of whom have chronic conditions such as diabetes and hypertension. Doctors also make referrals to specialists who have a relationship with RotaCare and have agreed to see our patients free of charge. A small time commitment can help individuals who would otherwise go without medical care, keeping them out of the hospital, at work and caring for their family. Since 1992, RotaCare has been providing free primary care to people who are uninsured and financially eligible. A rotating staff of about 100 volunteers includes doctors, nurse practitioners, pharmacists, nurses, and non-medical support staff. The health center is open every Monday, the first and third Thursday of the month and the second and fourth Tuesday of the month. Please leave the best phone number for us to reach you. Nurse practitioners are needed to provide primary care for our patients. RotaCare is not a walk-in clinic. It operates as a doctor's office and the NPs are responsible for the overall management of the patients, including prescribing medication which is provided to the patients at no cost. The NPs also make referrals to specialists who have a relationship with RotaCare if the necessary care cannot be provided on-site. Since 1992, RotaCare has been providing free primary care to people who are uninsured and financially eligible. Activities may include singing or music groups, political or current event discussions, crossword or puzzle groups, arts and crafts projects, fitness classes or anything else that will bring the people of the center together in an active and social way. Skills * Experience with seniors * Experience/background in class topic required * Relevant certification required for exercise classes Other * Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week * Ongoing opportunity * Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.

10462.description: About Are you interested in a field that works closely with individuals who have intellectual and developmental disabilities? Would you like to share your interests with someone who enjoys it just as much as you? Partners Health Plan, a not for profit health plan that supports the lives of individuals with developmental and intellectual disabilities, is looking for volunteers for The PAL Program. The PAL Program discovers a member’s passion, interests, and matches up the individual with a person or place in the community sharing a similar passion or interest. We discover what you enjoy and how it could potentially match with a member of PHP. Member Information 65 year old male who has a developmental disability, is high functioning, and would like to play pool with someone once a week. In his words, he would like a \"hip and cool\" guy to play pool with :) How does it work? Meet with individual once a week, or once bi-weekly depending on schedule flexibility First outing will always be accompanied by Community Resource Coordinator Provide your own transportation to meet the individual at the destination Report to community resource coordinator with updates on the progress of outings Form natural friendship with individual based on similar interests Benefits Receive an optional professional reference upon completion of program Join an incredible community of passionate staff and volunteers Hours: Approximately one a week depending on the activity and volunteer schedule Suggested Commitment: 6 months - 1 year PHP provides equal opportunity for all volunteers.
10462.title: Billiard & Pool Lover

10462.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!

We are looking for volunteers to reach out to some of our seniors and complete phone satisfaction surveys about the program. Responsibilities Make outreach calls seniors to conduct satisfaction surveys Enter results in computer program Additional clerical assistance as needed Skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Patient and enthusiastic Handle confidential files & information securely Experience working with seniors is helpful but not required Have a good general knowledge of computer operations including internet applications and Microsoft Office Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of once a week Ongoing opportunity for a few months Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies
10462.title: Phone Outreach Volunteer

10463.description: Image Impact International seeks a highly motivated Vice President of Development to join our all-volunteer team. This volunteer Board position works collaboratively to create, oversee, and implement a strategic approach to fundraising. This role provides leadership for fundraising initiatives and combines excellent communication and organizational skills with a passion for the organization’s mission. Image Impact International’s mission is to mentor first-generation college students to remain in college. Through our college to career bridge programs, we provide the leadership, communication, and professional skills needed for workplace success. VP Development Responsibilities include: Plan fund development activities Execute a realistic strategic action plan to increase revenues and ensure sustainability. Set realistic revenue projections and an expenditure budget for fundraising annually. Review policies and procedures for fund development and stewardship in coordination with the VP Governance. Organize fund development activities Identify and prioritize corporate, community and individual potential donors for Board of Directors outreach. Assist with effective internal and external communications to approach funders and donors. Oversee an automated donor database which respects the privacy and confidentiality of donor information. In coordination with the Treasurer, use automated donor reports to provide regular updates on fundraising progress. Build relationships Cultivate relationships with foundations, grantors, sponsors, and donors whose missions align with our own. Create relationships with stakeholders to advance the organization’s mission and fundraising goals. These communities include first-generation college students, career services, alumni, business leaders, and public and private colleges. Inspire, train, and motivate Board members and volunteers. Online Campaigns and Events Oversee the planning and execution of annual online campaigns and special fundraising events. Evaluate the effectiveness of fundraising activities and adjust strategies as necessary. Grants Coordinate with the Grants support team to prioritize grant opportunities and partnerships. Oversee the grants research and grant writing support team. Assist with the preparation and submittal of grant applications as needed. Volunteer Board Position Details Term: Two (2) Years Time Commitment: Minimum of 3-5 virtual hours per month, including some evenings. Attend monthly virtual Board weeknight meeting. Participate in periodic team meetings if located in the New York Metro Area. Please submit the following documents for consideration: Resume or CV Bio of 100-300 words Candidates may submit their materials electronically, via Word or as a PDF to president@imageimpact.org. ABOUT IMAGE IMPACT INTERNATIONAL: Image Impact International, Inc. (III) is a global Non-profit 501(c)(3) organization. Our mission is to mentor first-generation college students to remain in college. Through our college to career bridge programs, we provide the leadership, communication, and professional skills needed for workplace success.
10463.title: Vice President Development (New York Metro Area)

10460.description: The City Tutors (CT) is looking for volunteer tutors to provide academic support to Children’s Aid Society's Next Generation Center at the corner of Southern Blvd and East 172nd street in the Bronx. We are currently seeking tutors for math, science, reading, and social science to support students 18-24 years old as they prepare for the TASC, the new high school equivalency exam. You would work with a group of students for 2 hours per week between 9am to noon. (You can do this on one day.) This is a great opportunity for students who are majoring (or have already earned a degree) in the course area to enhance their knowledge and experience, and who would like to leverage their knowledge in the subject area to support others with their learning growth and development. As a tutor, you will collaborate with a local coordinator to improve students’ performance while being supported and guided by experienced academic support professionals. To apply, you must: 1. Have received an A- or A in the introduction to the subject course you are applying to tutor. 2. Have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have received a degree recently. 3. Be willing to complete 11.5 hours of College Reading and Learning Aligned (CRLA) training at City College of New York. All tutors are also expected to complete a four session comprehensive, professional training regimen. 6 hours of live training, plus another hour and a half for orientation. This is a commitment of 7.5 hours of in person training, and 4 hours of supplemental training for a total of 11.5 hours of training over the course of the Summer semester. We can accommodate your schedule for the live trainings. CT's tutoring program has been successful in helping students gain access to support that they otherwise would not have received, given their limited time spent on campus. Having tutors in these sessions early in the semester will allow us to employ strategies to reduce withdrawals and student failure rates. Your work with us would help the students’ overall subject area performance, and help us improve this educational support model, reaching more students and departments with comprehensive academic support. Learn more about Children’s Aid Society here: http://www.childrensaidsociety.org/
10460.title: Bronx Tutoring Opportunities at Childrens Aid Society

10507.description: Protect our environment and the special world in which we live. Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Together we can protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. Want to know more? Please join our weekly Introductory Conference Call. The next one is on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. It is a live call, about an hour long, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. Please register for the call at this link so that we can follow up with you: https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/ We look forward to working with you!
10507.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Westchester County NY

10507.description: Westchester Land Trust is seeking volunteers to help in our garden - weed, plant, dig, water and harvest at our Sugar Hill Farm Headquarters. We meet Tuesdays, 10am - 2pm on the following days: APRIL 11 & 25 MAY 9 & 23 JUNE 13 & 27 JULY 11 & 25 AUGUST 8 & 22 SEPTEMBER 12 & 26 OCTOBER 10 & 24 WLT is in its sixth year of partnership with Food Bank for Westchester, growing fresh produce on our Bedford Hill campus for their mobile food pantry. We are always in need of additional help to tend the farm. No experience necessary . If you would like to bring a group - we do need some advance notice, to make sure we have enough work & supervision to keep everyone busy and productive! Westchester Land Trust works together with public and private partners to preserve land in perpetuity, and to protect and enhance the natural resources in our communities. For more information visit: www.westchesterlandtrust.org

10507.title: Do something extraordinary – raise a future guide dog in Westchester County, NY!

07470.description: VITAS Volunteers give their time to terminally ill patients and their families in a hospital type setting. Volunteers are needed to visit with patients and families, serve patients at mealtime, read books out loud to patients or visiting children, write letters or play games with patients and/or families, offer spiritual support, provide friendly support with your certified pet, sing or play music for patients and their families, manage the patient care activity cart and help with administrative duties. The VITAS IPU is open 24 hours, 7 days a week. Volunteers generally help by providing support during a 2 to 4 hour shift. VITAS provides free volunteer orientation on how to work with people at the end of life. Assignments are made according to the volunteer’s work and family schedules.
