We are seeking someone who can make a video of our store for YouTube/Facebook. It does not have to be something fancy with special lighting and tripods - if your phone doesn't flip we'd be fine with you using that! Our hope is a video of the store will entice new customers to come visit.
07470.title: Videographer to Make YouTube Commercial
07470.org: Wayne PTO Browse N Shop Thrift Store

07470.description: The Browse N Shop is a community thrift store run by the Wayne PTO. All proceeds go towards scholarships from Wayne Hills and Wayne Valley students. We need help advertising our thrift store. We are a small store but have been around for 59 years. Thanks to volunteermatch we have a wonderful flyer and have found help with our facebook page. We are hoping someone with new ideas will help us reach out to our local community. Everything in the store is donated so we would like to attract new donators as well as new customers. Any ideas are welcome so please reach out to us even if you can't devote much time but have one great idea!
07470.title: Marketing Manager
07470.org: Wayne PTO Browse N Shop Thrift Store

07470.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07470.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07470.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07470.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07470.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07470.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07470.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.
07470.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Wayne

07470.description: Games Galore and More is a team of volunteers who assist the staff of a long-term care senior facility with fun activities while engaging residents in meaningful and friendly conversation, board and card games and reading to the residents. This is a wonderful opportunity to brighten the life of someone who may normally not have the opportunity to connect with others outside of their families and the organization's staff. This is the perfect project for individuals, families, friends and loved ones. Volunteer today and let the games begin! You are welcome to bring you own games or use the games at the facility. Also, calling all musicians who would like to perform informally for the residents. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07470.title: Games Galore in Wayne

07470.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07470.title: Hospice Volunteer

07470.description: Sebastien has just moved into a sheltered apartment and is feeling very proud and independent. He is 21 years old and full of energy and a love of fun. He is particularly fond of ice hockey both on TV and going to games. Music is another favorite and he has over 5000 songs on his ipod. Seby is in need of a young volunteer with similar interests and energywho will be a good role model of how to manage oneself out in the community.
07470.title: Sebastian LOVES ice hockey and ice cream.

07470.description: Calling all book lovers! Are you looking for the perfect opportunity to combine your love of literature with a way to give back? Read along with some seniors with Book Buddies in Wayne. It's a great opportunity to socialize with some lovely seniors and do good--all at once. The seniors in this wing of a long-term care facility have Alzheimer's disease, and reading aloud to them helps stimulate and socialize them. Sign up today! This project is BYOB--your own book, that is. The ideal book is short and visual. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07470.title: Book Buddies in Wayne

07470.description: We are in great need of male volunteers to serve this population and be positive adult role models to the boys in our program. Please consider giving just a few hours of your time each week to make a lifelong difference to a child. Court Appointed Special Advocates are volunteers who are appointed by the Family Court to advocate in the best interest of young adults and youth in foster care. CASA volunteers are trained to be a voice for children who are in the foster care system due to abuse or neglect. Unfortunately boys make up a larger percentage of the children in care and stay longer than girls. Passaic County CASA supervises and provides support for volunteers as we work towards the common goal of improving the lives of foster children. Currently, over 500 children are waiting for a volunteer to speak up for them and to ensure that they don't fall between the cracks of the system. Visit www.passaiccountycasa.org for more information
07470.title: Male Advocate for Boys in foster care
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

07470.description: Court Appointed Special Advocates are volunteers who advocate for the best interest of a child in foster care. CASA volunteers are trained to be a voice for children who are in the foster care system due to abuse or neglect. These children are caught in the tangle of the legal system and need someone to speak up for them. Volunteers visit their assigned child twice per month, review records, interview invovled parties and attend court hearings as well as write reports to submit to the Judge. Passaic County CASA supervises and provides support for volunteers as we work towards the common goal of improving the lives of foster children. Currently, over 500 children are waiting for a volunteer to speak up for them and to ensure that they don't fall between the cracks of the system.
07470.title: Child Advocate/Mentor
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

07470.description: Help adults with disabilities experience the works of the Great Masters by introducing them to a masterpiece and leading a related art project. This is a brand new program at our adult day program in Wayne. Volunteers are a part of the planning process and then will be asked to lead a lesson 1-3 times a month or provide one-on-one help to participants during the lesson. This program takes place on the second, third, and fourth Wednesday of every month 9:30am-11:30am. Volunteers are not required to attend every session.
07470.title: Art appreciation

07470.description: Substance abuse is growing and knows no boundaries. Our main purpose is to educate the community about the dangers and arm them with the tools needed to avoid making dangerous choices. From children to young adults and senior citizens; we have a different message for each group. Please help us to educate the community and reduce substance abuse in our lifetime. Support our organization while networking for your own group or using your skills to shine while helping us to fight Alcohol, Tobacco and other Drug abuse in Wayne. Support us with your specific talent or join in and we'll help you find a way to participate! Call 973-694-1800 x 3244 or write: alliance@waynetownship.com to join us. Please considering following us on FACEBOOK, too! Needs: We are currently searching for a Volunteer Coordinator to be an ambassador to our new volunteers and to help bring our message to the local Senior Citizen Groups. Office: filing, typing, direct mail assistance, photography, press releases, fundraising. Events: hand out flyers and help convey our message to the community. Event Photographer News Release: Print and video Internet promotion/social media Apply for funding and solicit sponsors Search out new grants and sponsors Seacrh out new educational programs and find funding
07470.title: Volunteer Ambassador, Public Relations Volunteer: Educate the Community-Wipe Out Substance Abuse
07470.org: Wayne Alliance for the Prevention of Substance Abuse

07470.description: If you enjoy doing these things, so does a 68 year old man who lives in a Supervised Apartment in Wayne. Sal also enjoys exercising and going to the gym in his complex. Some other activities Sal enjoys are board games, cards, old movies, old music and crafts. He would love to have a friend to go out with and to talk with so that he is not lonely. He lives with two other men and he has retired from a job he had for many, many years. Sal has a good sense of humor and enjoys a good laugh. He also loves to go to dances.
07470.title: Do you Like to Bowl, go to concerts, discuss politics?

07470.description: Passaic County CASA (Court Appointed Special Advocates) is seeking members for the Board of Trustees who has a sincere desire to help our kids, combined with the talent to do so! The ideal candidates will have a business, medical, legal or fundraising background. If you have the desire to actively become involved in a cause that will become one of the most worthwhile causes that you will associate yourself with throughout your life, please contact us. Board members must commit to attending meetings on the 4th Wednesday of the month.
07470.title: Board of Trustee Member
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

07470.description: Court Appointed Special Advocates are volunteers who are appointed by the Family Court to advocate in the best interest of a child in foster care. CASA volunteers are trained to be a voice for children who are in the foster care system due to abuse or neglect. These children are caught in the tangle of the legal system and need someone to speak up for them. Volunteers make recommendations for the benefit of the child in terms of placement and services. Passaic County CASA supervises and provides support for volunteers as we work towards the common goal of improving the lives of foster children. Currently, over 500 children are waiting for a volunteer to speak up for them and to ensure that they don't fall between the cracks of the system.
07470.title: Child Advocate for Children in Foster Care
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

07470.description: Who we are: Passaic County CASA (Court Appointed Special Advocates) provides advocacy for children in the Passaic County, NJ foster care system- currently over 500 children are waiting for a volunteer to speak up for them and to ensure that they don't fall between the cracks of the system. The Role: CASA volunteers are trained to advocate for children who are in the foster care system due to abuse or neglect. These children are caught in the tangle of the legal system and need someone to speak up for them. CASA volunteers are responsible for recommending the best interests of their assigned child in the court process and facilitating with professionals. Please join us!
07470.title: Court Appointed Special Advocate
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

08550.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
08550.title: Princeton Junction, NJ: Autism Volunteer

08550.description: Princeton HomeCare Hospice is looking for compassionate, caring individuals to share their time, talents and abilities with terminally ill patients and their families. Volunteers serve in a variety of areas, and in countless meaningful ways. Training, support and supervision is provided by a caring staff of dedicated and caring professionals. Come join us and make a difference in someone's life! Application, Interview, Training and free registration required.
08550.title: Hospice Volunteers

07450.description: Swim one on one with a chidl/adult with mental and/or physical challenges. Teach swim skills, socialization and recreation with class participants. Classes meet on mondays/wednesdays and fridays 4:30-5:15pm. You may pick one day a week or more and classes run all year. You do not have to commit to all year and can switch days each week if you need to.
07450.title: Special Swim Assistant

07505.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. This is a part-time 14-hours per week, unpaid telecommuting internship. The internship is 4-months and responsible for leading public and political outreach in the state and district assigned to. Key Responsibilities: - Must be available Mondays 4:30-6:00 PM PST for The Borgen Project’s national conference call. - Meet with members of Congress and/or Congressional staffers in your State and District. - Represent The Borgen Project at various business, political and community events. - Assist with fundraising. Create a personal fundraising campaign and meet targets. - Mobilize individuals to contact their members of Congress in support of key poverty-reduction legislation. - As needed, speak to groups, classes and organizations. - Write letters of support for key programs to political leaders, media and other groups. Qualifications: - Outstanding writing skills. - Self-starter who can produce great results with limited supervision. - Strong oral communication skills and ability to lead meetings and give speeches.
07505.title: Political Affairs Internship

07505.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. This is a 12-week, part-time, unpaid internship. The selected candidate will be able to work from home and set their own schedule, but must meet weekly deadlines. Articles submitted will appear on BORGEN Magazine or The Borgen Project Blog. Key Responsibilities: - Interview sources and research topics in-depth. - Write 2 well-researched articles per week. - Communicate with editors and supervisors. - Assist with fundraising. Create a personal fundraising campaign and meet targets. - Attend national conference call and/or training every Monday at 4 - 5:30 PM PST. Qualifications: Strong journalism writing skills. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines with very little supervision. Experience writing for newspapers is helpful, but not required.
07505.title: Journalism Internship

07505.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. This is a 12-week, part-time, unpaid internship. The selected candidate will be able to work from home and pick their own schedule, but must meet weekly deadlines. Articles submitted will appear on BORGEN Magazine or The Borgen Project Blog. Key Responsibilities: - Write 2 articles per week. - Research topics. - Assist with advocacy efforts. - Assist with fundraising. Create a personal fundraising campaign and meet targets. - Attend national conference call and/or training every Monday at 4 - 5:30 PM PST. Qualifications: Strong research and writing skills. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines with very little supervision. Experience writing SEO friendly content is helpful, but not required.
07505.title: Writer Internship

07505.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. The Borgen Project is hiring an HR Intern who will work remotely. This human resources role will focus on national recruitment and updating job postings. Key Responsibilities: - Update job postings (80% of internship). - Inform groups and classes of openings. - Take on various tasks as needed. - Everyone who is part of the organization assists the team with fundraising, 25-hours of this position is dedicated to creating and implementing a personal fundraising campaign. - Assist with advocacy efforts. Details: This is an unpaid internship, although college credit is available. The HR internship is 16-hours per week for 12-weeks. Must meet weekly deadlines and be available Monday evenings 5-6PM PST for meetings and national conference calls.
07505.title: HR Internship

07505.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. The Borgen Project is hiring a Public Relations/Marketing Intern who will work remotely. This public relations intern will be involved in a variety of aspects of marketing and communications. Key Responsibilities: - Create a branding campaign. - Conduct an informal focus group and gather feedback for market research. - Pitch story ideas to print, broadcast and digital media. - Create and implement a fundraising strategy. - Plan, market and present at an informational meeting. - Utilize social media and develop strategies for web-based messaging. - Assist with The Borgen Project's advocacy efforts. - Take on assignments as needed. Details: This is an unpaid internship, although college credit is available. The internship is 16-hours per week for 12-weeks. Must meet weekly deadlines and be available the first Monday evening of the month, at 5pm PST for meetings.
07505.title: Public Relations/Marketing Internship

07505.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. You don’t need to be a lobbyist to help influence foreign policy. As a Regional Director, you’ll serve as a Borgen Project Ambassador in your city - mobilizing your friends, family and colleagues to contact Congress in support of key poverty reduction legislation. This is an unpaid, volunteer position. Key Responsibilities: - Attend one (30-60 minute) national conference call per month: 5PM PDT 6PM MDT 7PM CDT 8PM EDT - Meet with local congressional leaders and lobby for legislation that improves living conditions for the world’s poor. - Mobilize people in your community to contact their congressional leaders to support poverty reduction legislation. - Manage and implement fundraising campaigns. - Build a network of people engaged in the cause. - Serve as The Borgen Project’s ambassador in your city. Qualifications: - Basic understanding of U.S. Politics and international development. - Highly organized with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks while managing their work time efficiently. - Strong team player that loves to bring new ideas to the table. - Ability to demonstrate frequent independent judgment with decisiveness. - Excellent overall communication skills: oral, written, presentation.
07505.title: Regional Director

07505.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. This is a great entry-level volunteer position for someone looking to be part of The Borgen Project. Advocates can operate from anywhere in the U.S. This is an unpaid, volunteer position. Key Responsibilities: - Attend one (30-60 minute) national conference call per month: 5PM PDT 6PM MDT 7PM CDT 8PM EDT - Serve as an ambassador for the world’s poor. Build awareness of the issues and ways people can help. - Manage and implement fundraising campaigns. - Represent The Borgen Project in your city - attend events and engage people in the cause. - Contact congressional leaders in support of key poverty-reduction programs. Qualifications: - Excellent overall communication skills: oral, written, presentation. - Ability to self-manage and prioritize assignments.
07505.title: Advocate

07505.description: Our food pantry gives food to 3,100 people every month. It takes tens of thousands of grocery bags to meet monthly demand and we are in constant need of bag donations. CUMAC is recruiting bag collection coordinators. As a bag collector,your job would be to: 1. Collect bags From your home pantry From neighbors Set up bins at school, work or in your religious home Ask your local grocery store (we can provide a letter of introduction!) With your boy scout or girl scout troop Post to social media and email your network asking them to bring bags to your home Anywhere else you can! 2. Manage quality control It’s a big help on your end if you toss any bags that are ripped, dirty or smaller than a grocery bag (ie: newspaper bags, baggies, 7-11 bags) 3. Set up a time to deliver the bags to CUMAC or arrange for a pick up (Sending our trucks out requires a lot of money, please understand that we can only afford to pick up very large collections that are within our usual route) CUMAC would be happy to write a letter of acknowledgement for your service, just ask!
07505.title: Grocery Bag Collection Coordinator

07505.description: In an overburdened social welfare system, abused and neglected children often slip through the cracks among hundreds of current cases. CASA volunteer mentors change that. Appointed by judges, CASA volunteers typically handle just one case at a time--and commit to staying on that case until the child is placed in a safe, permanent home. While others may come and go, CASA volunteers provide that one constant that children need in order to thrive. Are you ready to stand up for a child who needs you? Passaic County CASA supervises and provides support for volunteers as we work towards the common goal of improving the lives of foster children. Currently, over 500 children are waiting for a volunteer to speak up for them and to ensure that they don't fall between the cracks of the system.
07505.title: Mentor for Foster Child
07505.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

07505.description: We are looking for a few committed women to work together to serve 6 week programs of leadership and life skills building to small groups of girls. This program is based on achieving measurable outcomes for girls ages 5-17 - providing them with the necessary tools to make good choices, set goals and achieve self worth -so they can get through school with a positive experience, graduate and make plans for their futures. Training and support is on going. Programs are flexible and run on YOUR schedule. And girls are boldly empowered to make a difference in the world!
07505.title: Champions for Girls needed in Paterson
07505.org: Girl Scouts of Northern New Jersey

07506.description: Student Needs: Private Bedroom, 2 Meals on Weekdays, 3 Meals on Weekends. Anyone can apply. Generous Monthly Stipend Provided. Contact Katie at: 267-205-3682 or hosting@anbeducation.com *Please provide me with your phone number as a lot of emails do not go through with the request. Thank you! Most students come from China, Korea and Vietnam. They are all high school students looking to earn a quality education. Have friends or family who might want to host? Sent them our direction!
07506.title: Host An International Student!

07506.description: Healing the Children New Jersey, a non-profit organization located in Hawthorne, NJ that provides medical care and assistance to children in need around the world is seeking a volunteer board member with an accounting background to serve primary treasury functions such as financial reporting, cash flow management, payroll oversight, and coordination with outside auditors. Time required:an average of two hours per week.
07506.title: Volunteer Treasurer for Non-Profit

07506.description: Healing the Children New Jersey is a non profit organization located in Hawthorne, NJ. Healing the Children New Jersey is looking for volunteer host families to host children in their home while they are in New Jersey receiving donated medical from area doctors and hospitals. The family takes care of the child from the day of their arrival until they are medically cleared to return home to their family. Please contact HTCNJ to learn more on how you can make the difference in the life of a child in need.
07506.title: Become a Volunteer Host Family

07501.description: Eva’s Village invites teams of up to 12 volunteers to see firsthand what a difference we can make together! The Community Kitchen at Eva’s Village offers a nutritious meal to 300-400 individuals in need, 365 days a year. Volunteer teams have the opportunity to learn about the mission and programs of Eva’s Village; help to prepare and serve lunch for our Community Kitchen guests; and talk about their experience after the volunteer service is complete. Fund-A-Meals can be scheduled Monday-Friday. Groups are asked to arrive at 10:00am and the experience concludes by 2:00pm. Eva's is especially seeking corporate/organizational donors to \"Fund A Meal\". Contact Angela for details: angela.vance@evasvillage.org.
07501.title: Eva's Community Kitchen Server

07501.description: Partner with Eva's Workforce Development Program, whose goals are to empower, mentor and prepare clients with the knowledge, courage and tools necessary to successfully find a job. Work with Eva's clients so they can learn how to complete a job application, prepare a resume/reference page/thank you letter and do basic internet job searches. Train them on interviewing skills by working with volunteers and participating in bimonthly mock job fairs that focus on practicing interviewing. Clients who attend the Workforce Development program are in their first weeks of Orientation (4 weeks in total) at the Halfway House Addiction Treatment Program at Eva’s Village. They are adult men and women who vary in age, education and work skills. They are referred to Eva’s by various county Drug Court Systems, detox or other treatment facilities, or simply come on their own to get help. Although many of the clients have been in prison, none are violent offenders, including sexual abuse and/or crimes against persons or children.
07501.title: Workforce Development Volunteers

07501.description: Volunteers play an important role in the facilities' operation with meal preparation and service. As you are serving meals please interact with guests in conversation and clear their tables as needed. Volunteers will be deployed for the following tasks: Food Servers (2-3) Beverage Servers (1-2) Greeter (1-2) General Help (3) NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07501.title: Hunger Helpers in Paterson

07501.description: We are looking for volunteers 55 Plus to assist struggling first grade readers in a Paterson public school reading program. The volunteer will tutor the students twice a week to help them get to their reading grade level. The volunteer will meet on designated days to complete lessons provided by the coordinator. The volunteer must have a background check and fingerprinting, be fluent in English and have excellent reading skills. You must commit to two days a week (Mon/Wed or Tues/Thurs) from 3-5 pm. For additional information contact Stan at 973-784-4900, x202 or gabays@norwescap.org
07501.title: Become a Paterson Reader! Can you help tutor 1st Grade Readers!
07501.org: Skylands RSVP & Volunteer Resource Center sponsored by NORWESCAP

07501.description: St. Paul's Community Development Corporation (SPCDC) has partnered with the Paterson Public School District to facilitate the Full-Service Community School model which educates, nurtures and advocates comprehensive academic, social and health services for students, students' family members and community members that will result in improved educational outcomes for children. Through this partnership, St. Paul's Community Development Corporation (SPCDC) is committed to providing its students with the 21st century skills necessary to succeed in secondary and post-secondary education and to encourage positive attributes in order to achieve academic success in a safe and nurturing environment. We are seeking enthusiastic volunteers with all areas of skills, talents, and ideas to lead after-school clubs for grades K-5. Expertise is requested in the following areas for potential clubs: Arts & Crafts Fitness Newspaper & Culture Photography Books Dance & Music Science Drama Lego Creations Writing Math Tutoring Mentoring
07501.title: Full Service Community School Volunteer

07501.description: SPCDC requires the support of volunteers to help package 75-100 grocery bags per day for distribution to families in need. Individuals or groups are able to sign up for an available date or multiple dates (pending availability). This is a great way to engage with your community and help ensure that families have access to healthy and nutritious meals.
07501.title: Food Pantry Volunteer

07501.description: CUMAC is a busy nonprofit, running multiple programs dedicated to fighting hunger and poverty in our community. Whether feeding 3,000 people a month, providing for victims of disaster or collecting holiday toys, we love showing off the accomplishments of our many programs! We're looking for a volunteer to share their time and talent by photographing our work. Our photographer would have to have their own equipment and be willing to allow our agency to use pictures on our webpage and in promotional material. This is a very flexible project and affords complete creative license. In addition to the joy of helping a worthy cause document their work, this could be a great boost to any student resumes or a fun use of free time for amateur photography buffs. Feel free to check out our facebook page or website for more info about our work: www.facebook.com/cumacfeedspeople www.cumac.org
07501.title: Volunteer Photographer

07501.description: The St. Paul's Community Development Corporation -- Emergency Men's Shelter is in need of individuals or groups interested in PREPARING and SERVING meals to our homeless residents. Interested parties will schedule an available date, set the menu, prepare and serve the meal on the date in question. This is a wonderful activity for families or groups (including youth groups, Girl Scouts/Boy Scouts, sororities/fraternities, as well as other community and civic organizations). For available dates, please call 973-710-3900 ext 422 (9am - 4pm) OR ext. 421 (4pm - 10pm).
07501.title: Emergency Men's Shelter -- Dinner Preparer & Server

07501.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
07501.title: Paterson Area>>>Advice Counselor

07503.description: Licensed clinician needed to help with general issues.
07503.title: Licensed Clinician

07503.description: Volunteers needed to help with fundraising. PLEASE SUBMIT RESUME AND APPLICATION DIRECTLY TO Wafaa@wafaaorganization.org AND THEN PLEASE CALL AND EMAIL US AFTER SUBMITTING THE APPLICATION. 973-766-2406 or wafaa@wafaaorganization.org.
07503.title: Fundraising Help

07503.description: Volunteers needed to help with grant writing. PLEASE SUBMIT RESUME AND APPLICATION DIRECTLY TO Wafaa@wafaaorganization.org AND THEN PLEASE CALL AND EMAIL US AFTER SUBMITTING THE APPLICATION. 973-766-2406 or wafaa@wafaaorganization.org.
07503.title: Grant Writer

07509.description: CUMAC is the largest food distribution program in Passaic County, feeding over 2,600 low income individuals and families every month. Volunteers are needed to give vital assistance, sorting and bagging up fresh fruit and vegetables in CUMAC's warehouse. If the fresh produce is not available, volunteers will help sort canned goods. Volunteers should wear closed toed shoes and clothes they don't mind getting dirty. It is important to dress in layers as the warehouse doors are often open and it can get chilly. CUMAC has its own parking lot which volunteers are welcome to use. There is a tunnel entrance to the lot on your left just before the black train overpass. Please drive slowly as workers will be on the other side. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07509.title: Marketplace in Paterson

07508.description: looking for hosts! Anyone can apply. Generous Monthly Stipend Provided. Student Needs: Private Bedroom, 2 Meals on Weekdays, 3 Meals on Weekends. Contact Katie at: 267-205-3682 or hosting@anbeducation.com Most students come from China, Korea and Vietnam. They are all high school students looking to earn a quality education. Looking for anyone who can host from September-May. Have friends or family who might want to host? Sent them our direction!
07508.title: Host an International Student

07508.description: My name is Zachary Hill and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a non-profit educational organization that assists families with hosting international students. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are rewarded with a generous monthly stipend. A 1099 is availiable for tax purposes. Our International students need . . . -A private bedroom (not in the basement please) and a shared or private bathroom in a safe and clean environment. -Breakfast and dinner during the week. (The student would buy their lunch at school) and 3 meals during the weekend. (Most international students like to share meals with their American hosts every day. They benefit from speaking English in relaxed, natural situations outside of their English courses. ) http://www.anbeducation.com/
07508.title: Help Change the Life of an International Student, by Becoming a Host Family!

07508.description: \"We have absolutely loved having an exchange student. We have learned so much about another culture and have enjoyed introducing our student to American traditions. It has been a wonderful experience for our whole family!\" - Gayle My name is Katie and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a Non-Profit Organization looking for willing host families in your area. We wanted to reach out with this opportunity to host an international exchange student in your local community. Every year thousands of host families across the United States welcome International Exchange Students, AnB Education is grateful to be working with hundreds of host families across the country. An exchange student not only attends school, but becomes immersed in our world. Host families welcome a new sons, daughters, sisters and brothers from across the world. To us Host Families, you, are an essential part of helping create a better world! Through the personal relationships, language and cultural immersion we can help teach tomorrow’s leaders today. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are supported with a generous monthly reimbursement. Our International students need . . . -A caring and friendly host family who is willing to provide quiet space for studying, access to TV and internet, and access to laundry facilities. -A private bedroom (not in the basement please) and a shared or private bathroom in a safe and clean environment. -Breakfast and dinner meals with host family during the week. (The student would buy their lunch at school) and 3 meals during the weekend. (Most international students like to share meals with their American hosts every day. They benefit from speaking English in relaxed, natural situations outside of their English courses. ) http://www.anbeducation.com/become-a-host-family.html
07508.title: Do you have a spare room and a big heart?

07508.description: If you like to shop, Personal Shopping in Prospect Park is just the project for you! New Hope Community Ministries serves over 100 families a month through their mentoring and free grocery program. Volunteers are needed to interact with families by helping them sign in, \"shopping\" with them in the food pantry, and help monitor their grocery tab during the process. Join us by shopping with and getting to know a family and make a difference in their life! NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!

10954.description: Help Save Lives! Join the New York Blood Center Volunteer Team in the Hudson Valley area. Educate others about the importance of donating blood and enhance the donor experience at a blood drive. Greet and register donors, provide for donor safety by escorting and monitoring donors post donation. All volunteers are required to complete a volunteer application, a criminal background check and attend a 2 hour training/orientation session. Flexible assignments to choose from right in your own community.
10954.title: Ambassador Volunteer - Rockland Cnty

10954.description: Description of Volunteer duties: Volunteer Recreation Activities Assistants will serve in the following areas: -Socializing and interacting with older adults -Assist staff -Participate in structured groups; arts & crafts, music, cooking, exercise and cognitive programs -Assist in serving lunches & snacks -General office duties
10954.title: Adult Day Care Volunteer
10954.org: Meals on Wheels Programs and Services of Rockland

10954.description: Got an Hour? Homebound Meal Deliveries: One hour, once a week, deliver meals to Rockland’s homebound residents. Deliveries are made with your own vehicle any Monday-Friday, between the hours of 10 a.m. to 12 p.m.. You can also volunteer on a less frequent basis; you can become a substitute driver, holiday or snow driver. Individuals or families welcome. Children are encouraged to accompany adults.
10954.title: Got an Hour? Homebound Deliveries in Rockland County
10954.org: Meals on Wheels Programs and Services of Rockland

10954.description: Commissary Assistance: assist with meal preparation for all our programs in our commissary located in Nanuet. Volunteer opportunities exist Monday through Friday, 7:00a.m to 11:00a.m. Individuals or families are welcome. Must be over 12 years of age.
10954.title: Food Service Volunteer
10954.org: Meals on Wheels Programs and Services of Rockland

07112.description: We are currently seeking a club facilitator for the Girls Who Code Club at the Chancellor Avenue School in Newark, NJ and Summit, NJ . Girls Who Code Clubs is an after school/weekend program providing access to computer science education for 6th-12th grade girls nationwide. Why Volunteer? Expose girls to a comprehensive and unique CS education Empower young women in CS and help transform tech into a better, more inclusive industry Develop powerful leadership skills while positively impacting your community Interact with large tech companies and industry leaders through field trips and guest speakers Join a community of professionals and students who share your passion for gender parity Qualifications: Proficient in at least one backend programming language. Immediate knowledge of data structures and algorithms. Some experience working with youth preferred but not required. Ability to pass a background screening. Commitment to volunteer 2-3 hours a week. Apply at https://girlswhocode.com/volunteer/
07112.title: Girls Who Code Coach- Week day Evenings (4pm-6pm)

07112.description: Assist therapists with variety of non-therapeutic duties. Acts as an opportunity for volunteers to observe actual therapy treatment sessions. Excellent area for volunteers looking to explore potential career choice in therapy related fields. Responsibilities include organizing/straightening closets/shelves in treatment rooms. Clean/returns toys to proper locations. Assists therapists with set-up/clean-up of activities. Performs necessary office/clerical tasks including copying, filing and organizational tasks. Assists therapist with engaging patients in play activities.
07112.title: Therapy Gym Assistant

07114.description: We're looking for some dedicated volunteers with a van willing to donate some of their time to picking up leftover food in Newark, New Jersey. Help us reduce food waste, and get food to those in need. Time: 2:00 AM
07114.title: Stop Food Waste and Feed the Hungry in Newark, New Jersey (Volunteer with a Truck Needed)

07114.description: Travelers Aid Newark Liberty International Airport (EWR) is a nonprofit organization whose staff and volunteers work together to assist passengers from around the world. Travelers Aid EWR seeks to support airport passengers in a variety of capacities. In more complex cases, Travelers Aid staff is prepared to assist with social service referrals, resources and/or connecting individuals with support systems. Volunteers are the core resource of the Travelers Aid program. They lend their knowledge and experience to passengers by suggesting tourist information, giving maps/brochures and offering guidance on how to navigate the airport and the transit systems of New Jersey & New York. Travelers Aid volunteers receive a uniform, complimentary parking, food voucher and (in some cases) public transportation reimbursement. Available shifts are 11:00am to 4:00pm or 4:00pm to 9:00pm, 7 days a week. *At this time we look are looking for volunteers for both shifts on: Monday,Thursday, Friday and Sunday. For Wednesday And Saturday we are look for volunteers from 4 pm - 9 pm.
07114.title: Meet and help people from ALL OVER THE WORLD!
07114.org: Travelers Aid at Newark Liberty International Airport

07834.description: Do you have a curiosity about global affairs? Lead a U.S. foreign policy discussion group today! For over 55 years, the Foreign Policy Association's Great Decisions program has brought together people and communities to encourage individuals to engage in the world around them and to think critically about the global issues facing policymakers. Each year, FPA produces the Great Decisions briefing book, examining eight U.S. foreign policy and global affairs topics. All across the U.S., discussion groups meet to consider and discuss these topics, constituting the largest civil-education network in the country. Discussion group leaders organize and lead these meetings in their communities. Become a group leader now!
07834.title: Lead a global affairs discussion in the Denville area today!!

07059.description: Planning Provide ideas & goals for upcoming season (plantings, projects, plans, ideas for corporate volunteers and plans) Create a plan on how to accomplish goals for the year (corporations volunteers, budget money, projects) Compile a budget for upcoming year to present to Board of Trustees. Pull together an annual report including budget for last season to close out year. Budget & Reporting NOTE: Budgets from previous years are available to use as a template Contact potential volunteers. Manage volunteer activities for individuals and groups. Volunteers NOTE: Plans from previous years are available on how to organize corporate events Garden Management (includes area in front of Office) Put out decorations and signs in garden for new season (letters for ABC garden, fairy garden decorations, sings for fairy garden and ABC garden) Prepare beds with mulch, begin planting annuals Water areas where sprinklers have not been installed. Maintain overall Children’s Garden appearance and front of office. Includes weeding and deadheading. Management of perennials by ensuring the growth and spread is maintained. Fall cleanup. Remove annuals. Cut back perennials. Store signs and decorations in the shed.

07059.description: Enright Melanoma Foundation Board of Trustees Job Description Member of the Board of Trustees Mission The mission of the Enright Melanoma Foundation is to raise sun safety awareness and to help prevent melanoma through education and early intervention. For more information, please visit the nonprofit’s website at www.enrightmelanomafoundation.org . Position The Board will support the work of the Enright Melanoma Foundation (EMF) and provide mission-based leadership and strategic governance. While day-to-day operations are led by EMF’s executive director, the Board-Executive Director relationship is a partnership, and the appropriate involvement of the Board is both critical and expected. EMF is specifically looking for Board Members with experience in fundraising and/or marketing. Other Board Member responsibilities include: Leadership, governance and oversight: Serving as a trusted advisor to the Executive Director as she develops and implements the strategic direction of the organization Reviewing agenda and supporting materials prior to board and committee meetings Approving the annual budget, business decisions; being informed of, and meeting all, legal and fiduciary responsibilities Contributing to an annual performance evaluation of the CEO Assisting the Executive Director and Board Chair in identifying and recruiting other Board of Trustees members Partnering with the Executive Director and other board members to ensure that board resolutions are carried out Serving on committees and taking on special assignments Representing EMF to stakeholders; acting as an ambassador for the organization Fundraising: Board of Trustee members will consider the Enright Melanoma Foundation a philanthropic priority and make annual gifts that reflect that priority, so that EMF can credibly solicit contributions from foundations, organizations, and individuals, EMF expects to have 100 percent of Board Members make an annual contribution that is commensurate with their capacity. EMF also holds at least one fundraising event each year and requests support and participation from all Board Members. Board terms/participation Enright Board of Trustee members shall serve for a term of two (2) years, calendar years commencing on January 1 of the subsequent year or until resignation or removal by a majority vote of the Board of Trustees. A Trustee, upon the expiration of his/her term of office, may become eligible for re-election to the Board. Board meetings are held monthly on the 2nd Wednesday evening of the month from 6:30- 8:00pm. Meetings are usually held at an office location in Warren, NJ. Additional committee meetings will be held either in person or by conference call, when appropriate. Qualifications: This is an opportunity for an individual who is passionate about EMF’s mission. Members will have achieved leadership stature in healthcare, business, government, philanthropy, or the nonprofit sector. His/her accomplishments will allow him/her to seek out other well-qualified, high-performing individuals who may help the foundation better promote its mission through financial, intellectual or material support. Ideal Board of Trustees candidates will have the following qualifications: Professional experience with significant executive leadership accomplishments in healthcare, business, government, philanthropy, fundraising, marketing, or the nonprofit sector A commitment to and understanding of EMF’s beneficiaries, preferably based on experience Diplomatic skills and a natural affinity for cultivating relationships and persuading, convening, facilitating, and building consensus among diverse individuals Personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and a passion for improving the lives of EMF’s beneficiaries Service on the Enright Melanoma Foundation’s Board of Trustees is without remuneration. Please submit your Resume, along with a Cover Letter, explaining why you are interested in serving on the EMF Board of Trustees to: info@enrightmelanomafoundation.org
07059.title: Marketing & Fundraising Board Members

Volunteers are needed to help highly motivated, academically qualified, yet economically disadvantaged eighth grade students with their math and writing. The program’s goal is to develop future leaders through education. 07052.description: Reading Buddies, a program of the RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties at Jewish Family Service MetroWest, engages older adult volunteers in promoting childhood literacy in public schools. Volunteers age 55+ read to the same small group of students each week throughout the school year using a read-aloud format that supplements the school’s regular reading curriculum. Reading Buddies is a one of a kind program that uses volunteers to support children grades k-2 and educators in the classroom. This program is a one hour commitment once a week. All volunteers must submit to a background check. If you are interested in signing up to read to children or would like to know what schools we currently need volunteers in, please contact Rebecca Silverstein at rsilverstein@jfsmetrowest.org or 793-637-1761.

07052.description: Do you want to make a difference in the life of a terminally ill patient? Our patients are located all over NJ, in various facilities and in their homes. We are looking for caring people to offer companionship to our patients. There is no experience necessary, we will train you and be there to support you with everything you do for us! Volunteers are truly appreciated and valued! We will work around your availability and location preferences. Types of volunteers Administrative Volunteering- Assisting with office clerical duties such as phones, mailings, filing. Direct Patient Volunteers- Meeting with patients in the facilities or in their homes. Simply offer companionship by talking, listening, watching TV, reading or any other activity that may interest the patient. Do you have special talents you would like to share? Art? Music? Pet Therapy? I would love to discuss those with you also!!! To discuss opportunities further please email AJ Blair, Volunteer Coordinator at ablair@serenityhospicenj.com. I look forward to hearing from you!!!! Thank you for your consideration!!!!!

07055.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.

07054.description: Seeking a volunteer or student looking for experience to serve as a Class Aide within our community diabetes education classes. Our foundation offers interactive, educational classes (along with free healthy dinner) to the community, and an Aide is needed to help participants complete paperwork, help nurses get health screenings completed, help serve meals, and assist with general handouts. You will work directly with dietitians and the class moderator. This is a great opportunity to be involved directly with public health and community education, including gaining nutrition and nursing information that could be valuable for you. 11102.description: Volunteer Art Teacher June 15-30 th Hello, We are seeking a volunteer Art Teacher from June 15 th -30 th teaching older adults in a creative aging art program in Astoria. We offer Watercolors, Acrylic, beads and sketching classes and are open to other art forms. Our art teacher has won a residency in Greece and we do not have funds for a substitute. I am seeking an unpaid volunteer or person needing internship experience to work as an art instructor. Classes start at 9am and can end at 11:30 with an option to open the classroom from 12:30 to 3pm. Although classes are offered all weekdays we can work with your schedule. Say you are only available Thursday and we find someone who is available Monday and Friday etc. The art class is comprised of persons over the age of 60 many of whom have been working for 3 years and have learned professional techniques. The class is very dedicated to art and are amazing people. Please note the photo is from the first week of class 3 years ago and they are now much further along! The instructor will be provided with supplies and will be responsible for ensuring they are put away and that the room is locked when not in use. We provide no-cost, culturally competent social, educational, and informational programs. We are looking for an energetic and lively volunteer who will reach out to our newly arrived immigrant families and engage them in our programs and services. You will design a community outreach plan, attend community events and meetings, create and distribute informational and outreach materials, and promote the organization's activities. We are looking for someone with an outgoing personality and good communication skills,who is detail oriented, organized, able to work independently, and a team player. A flexible schedule and availability, longer term commitment, prior experience in outreach activities, and proficiency in other languages preferred. Please email your resume and availability to volunteer@cianainc.org

11102.org: Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, CIANA

11102.description: NEWS RELEASE - GOODGUIDES(tm) January 20, 2010 GOODWILL (r) TO HELP MENTOR TEENS Justice Department Grant to Fight Juvenile Delinquency Astoria, New York -- Goodwill Industries of Greater NY and Northern NJ is proud to launch a new program in Astoria, New York designed to assist youth in overcoming disadvantages and avoiding delinquency. The effort is part of a national mentoring program known as Goodwill(r) GoodGuides(tm) that helps teens finish school and transition into productive careers through the guidance of trusted adults. \"Goodwill has a long history of helping people find work,\" said Mrs. Karen Means , Senior Vice President of Youth Services \"A crucial part of that history is making sure that families are strong. Goodwill GoodGuides(tm) can help keep youth who are at-risk get on the right path, away from trouble and toward a better future. That's good for everyone involved.\" The Goodwill GoodGuides(tm) program in Astoria, New York is made possible through a two-year, $299,723 grant to Goodwill Industries of Greater NY and Northern NJ The donation is part of a $19.1 million award to Goodwill Industries International from the U.S. Department of Justice and dispersed to 56 independent Goodwill agencies around the country. The overall goal of the Goodwill GoodGuides(tm) program is to help youth build career plans and skills, and prepare for school completion, post-secondary training and productive work by providing structured and supportive relationships with trusted adult mentors. It targets youths between the ages of 12 and 17 who are at-risk for dropping out of school, facing legal troubles, or are at risk for delinquency due to issues such as abuse, disability, drug or alcohol dependence, or gang membership. \"With Goodwill GoodGuides(tm), we will be able to offer expanded mentoring services to the youth of our community,\" said Mrs. Karen Means, Senior Vice President of Youth Services, Goodwill Industries of Greater NY and Northern NJ . \"Goodwill will recruit, train and support volunteer mentors to engage youth in promoting their career development and life skills.\" The Goodwill GoodGuides(tm) program will launch on January 11 in Astoria, New York If you're interested in becoming a volunteer mentor or know of a youth who would benefit from this program, please call 718 777 6443 Contact: Mr. Anthony Whittaker, 718 777 6443 Goodwill Industries of Greater NY and Northern NJ 4 - 21 27 th Avenue Astoria, NY 11102 Click on the link below and visit the WONDERFUL world of Astoria GoodGuides Mentoring. http://www.wix.com/goodguidesmentoring/goodguides
11102.title: GoodGuides Mentoring Program Queens, New York
11102.org: Goodwill Industries of Greater NY & Northern NJ, Inc.

11101.description: Welcome to our ESL Practice Program at The English Language Center! The ESL Practice Program needs volunteers to assist our adult English language students with small group conversation practice or one-on-one writing tutoring. The aim of Conversation Groups is to further our students' speaking and listening skills. Many of our students live with family or friends and don't get to practice these skills outside of class. Writing Partners, on the other hand, help individual students with homework from their writing and grammar classes as well as help students improve their overall writing skills. Evening Conversation Groups: When: Wednesdays and Thursdays, July 19th - August 24th Time: 5:45PM to 6:45PM Place: LaGuardia Community College (TELC) Evening Writing Tutors: When: Monday - Thursday, July 17th - August 24th Time: 5:45PM to 6:45PM Place: LaGuardia Community College (TELC) Please contact Marek Pena at marpena@lagcc.cuny.edu for more information.

AIFB does not accept independent student interns, only one sponsored or approved by their university. 11101.description: There are more than 11,000 children in New York State whose mothers are imprisoned. The absence of their mother leaves them vulnerable, particularly the older children, who face increased risk of involvement with crime substance abuse and other anti-social behaviors. Without good care and attention, they become victims of the prison system. The core of Hour Children’s work is to reverse this outcome. Hour Friends in Deed mentoring program provides a child, between the ages of 4-17, with a caring adult who commits to building a healthy relationship with a young person. The mentor becomes someone that supports and guides the child with positive academic, career, and personal goals. We encourage mentors and mentees to find fun activities to do together. Both of you can pick to play sports, go to the movies, do arts & crafts, or any activity where you both will have FUN! Your positive influence will contribute to the growth and development of this child. We specifically need mentors for children who live in Staten Island. Each mentor, 18 years or older, commits to participate in the program for one year and to meet with his/her mentee for at least 4 hours per month. Become a mentor. Be part of the solution and make an impact on a child’s life!!!!
11101.title: Mentor a Child in Long Island City, Queens
11101.org: Hour Children

11101.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
11101.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Long Island NY
11101.org: Citizens' Climate Lobby

11101.description: Tax Preparation Volunteers , Urban Upbound, formerly known as ERDA. Urban Upbound provides residents of public housing neighborhoods and other moderate, low- and very-low income New Yorkers with the tools and resources needed to achieve self-sufficiency and economic mobility, and to break intergenerational cycles of poverty. The target area we serve includes the 30,000 residents of five public housing neighborhoods in Western Queens: Queensbridge (the largest public housing community in the nation), Ravenswood, Astoria, Woodside, and Pomonok. The neighborhoods where these communities are located include Long Island City, Woodside, Astoria, and Flushing. One of Urban Upbound's most successful initiatives is our Free Tax Preparation Campaign, where we help low-income filers access the tax credits for which they are eligible - saving working families hundreds of dollars in unnecessary tax preparation fees. Additionally, tax filers have the opportunity to: enroll in Urban Upbound's workforce development program to receive assistance finding work; sign up for one-on-one financial counseling; get pre-screened for food stamps, public assistance and low or no cost health insurance; and, open a bank account. We are currently recruiting volunteers to help make this year's tax prep season another success! As a volunteer you will have the unique opportunity to work in a dynamic, high impact, results oriented community based organization. Qualified candidates will utilize their accounting and financial skills while giving back to the community. All volunteer tax preparers are asked to successfully complete the IRS online Link & Learn course. Long Island City does free taxes all year round! Skills and Qualifications Ability to work with diverse populations Commitment to social and economic justice Excellent time-management and organizational skills Independent self-starter Strong teamwork abilities Bilingual (Spanish; Mandarin, Korean) a plus Facility with numbers and commitment to learning tax law and Tax Wise software
11101.title: Tax Preparation Volunteers
11101.org: Urban Upbound

Description of the position: You will be working directly with the President of the Afghanistan International Foundation for the Blind doing research, clerical work, accounting and treasury, building a database, supporting fund raising efforts, monitoring other volunteers in the absence of the president, and more. 4 hour per week commitment and volunteer time is flexible based on volunteer's availability. We welcome student interns for this position, especially in the field Social Sciences. Qualification and responsability: Volunteer must be proficient in basic computer skills Must be able to read, write, and communicate in a professional matter, Must be punctual Must have basic office management skills Must follow the rules and regulation of the office Required documentation: Current resume Email address, mailing address and phone number One page of professional biography in an essay format that will include their educational background, current position, their past work experience and their volunteer work in other organizations. 3 reference letters from individuals that are not family members, along with their email addresses, mailing addresses and phone numbers Face to face interviews are required
11101.title: Volunteer Assistant to President of the Foundation
11101.org: Afghanistan International Foundation for the Blind (AIFB)

11101.description: The Afghanistan International Foundation For The Blind (AIFB) formally known as \"Afghanistan Blind Women and Children Foundation (ABWC)\": Enhancing the lives of blind individuals in the country since August 28, 2009, AIFB has been recognized by NY State as a non-profit foundation. The mission of The Afghanistan Blind Women and Children Foundation is to empower Afghan blind women through healthcare and blind children through education and rehabilitation services in Afghanistan. The Afghanistan International Foundation For The Blind needs your time as a volunteer! Description: The AIFB Foundation is seeking DEDICATED board members to improve the quality of life for blind individuals in Afghanistan. As a board member, you will have the opportunity to have a major impact on the medical, educational welfare, rehabilitation, and community services to help over 400,000 blind indivduals in Afghanistan. Qualification and responsability: The primary work of the Board of Director is to make decision on behalf of the foundation and work as a team to make sure that decisions made by the board are executed legallyThey will be required to participate in Board meetings every 3 months, if an individual misses 3 board meetings without giving prior notice they will be removed from the board. Must be able to commit 6 months to 1 year Must cast the majority of board of director's vote in order to become a member Be able to answer any questions that arise from the board members Must be able to support the foundation in the amount of 300$ annually or encourage people to support the treasury of the organization Their responsibility as a board member will be to help us extend our contact network, recruiting or improving board of director functions, fundraise, and make accurate decisions that benefits the mission and vision of the organizations. Requirement Must have strong leadership skills Must be able to make decisions that benefit the welfare of the organization Be able to conduct and participate in fundraising events Individuals who are willing to become Board of Directors need to submit the following documentation: Current resume Email address, mailing address and phone number One page of professional biography in an essay format that will include their educational background, current position, their past work experience and their volunteer work in other organizations. 3 reference letters from individuals that are not family members, along with their email addresses, mailing addresses and phone numbers Face to face interviews required.
11101.title: Board Member Needed for Organization to Aid the Blind
11101.org: Afghanistan International Foundation for the Blind (AIFB)

11106.description: Do you have a friendly, well-mannered dog or pet you want to share with others? Do you have a passion for supporting people receiving services at YAI? We are seeking volunteers to train their pets to facilitate Animal-Assisted Activities in our Queens day programs. After completing training with The Good Dog Foundation or other approved training organization, volunteers and their pets will visit our Queens day programs to assist individuals and groups in skill-building activities to further entry into the community. With the support of program staff, you and your pet will help participants build employment readiness, interpersonal skills, and improve general well-being. Are you interested but wondering whether your pet is suitable? Do you have a cat, rabbit, or other pet and wonder if they can be therapy animals? Contact Judith Harbour to discuss further. Scholarships to train are available on a case-by-case basis. Already established teams are also welcome to apply! Volunteers will need to commit to a regular schedule of visits.
11106.title: Volunteers needed for Animal-Assisted Therapy Program

11106.description: Mentors will develop supportive relationships with three to four program participants. Meet with mentees on a regular basis to establish working relationships and to support mentees in educational goals. Assist mentees in solving school-related and other problems that interfere with mentee's success at school.
11106.title: Volunteer Mentor

11106.description: Volunteers will develop supportive relationships with three to four program participants (mentees);Meet with mentee on a gegular basis to establish a working relationship and to support mentee's goals; Assist mentee in solving school-related and other problems that interfare with mentee's success at school. If you share a passion for working with youth please click the link below and fill out an application: http://www.riissettlement.org/volunteer-your-time/sign-up-to-volunteer/ The mission of Jacob A. Riis Neighborhood Settlement is to build and strengthen underserved communities in Western Queens and to act as a catalyst for change.
11106.title: Volunteer Mentor

11106.description: Tutors will provide much needed assistance to youth through homework help and test prep at our Cornerstone program. The elementary and middle school youth hours will occur during our afterschool programming and the teen hours will occur during our evening program. Time of Volunteer Program: - for elementary and middle school level: 3:00-5:30pm - for high school level: 6:00-9:00pm Frequency of Volunteer Program: Monday-Thursday If your interested in volunteering with us, please click on the link below to fill out an application: http://www.riissettlement.org/volunteer-your-time/sign-up-to-volunteer/ The mission of Jacob A. Riis Neighborhood Settlement is to build and strengthen underserved communities in Western Queens and to act as a catalyst for change.
11106.title: Volunteer Tutor

11106.description: Our client choice, supermarket-style food pantry runs three distributions per week for two hours each. Our distribution hours are Mondays, 2:00 - 4:00; Tuesdays, 10:30 - 12:30; and Thursdays, 3:00 - 5:00. We seek volunteers for all three shifts, but especially Mondays and Thursdays! Your time commitment will involve arriving at least one hour prior to the start of distribution, and staying through the entire two hour shift. Responsibilities include stocking shelves, sorting and storing produce, helping clients shop, breaking down boxes, and routine clean up. We are also seeking a dedicated desk volunteer who is responsible for checking in clients when they arrive. This is energetic, fast-paced work with a lovely group of core volunteers from the community! We strive to provide food to those in need in the most welcoming, warm way possible. Bring your customer service skills! Bilingual abilities are definitely a plus as well. Please apply ONLY if you will be committing to volunteer with us at least once per week for at least one month. We are unable to train volunteers for a one-time shift.
11106.title: Help feed the hungry in Queens!
11106.org: Hour Children Community Outreach and Food Pantry

11104.description: The Senior Center provides around 200 meals a day to seniors. Volunteers will provide assistance in the senior center dining room and kitchen for lunch service, which includes food preparation, distribution and clean up. WHAT WILL I BE DOING? Under the direction of the kitchen supervisor you might be: Wrapping silverware Preparing components of the meals Serving meals Providing table service Assisting with clean up Washing dishes/pots and pans Wiping down tables Signing in Seniors YOUR QUALITIES: Commitment and Consistent Considerate and patient Available Mondays through Fridays 9am to 2pm Work well with staff, volunteers, and clients Ability to communicate effectively Sensitive to diverse cultures
11104.title: Help Serve Lunch to Seniors at Sunnyside!

11104.description: Helping seniors
