11104.title: Sunnyside Community Services - Administrative Assistant

11104.description: Studies show that having a pet can significantly improve a person's mental and physical health. Many seniors have pets, but need a little help caring for them. HELP A SENIOR KEEP THEIR PET!! I currently have a Spanish-speaking male senior in Astoria and he needs help taking care of and cleaning up from his cat! Could you help, even once a week for six months? Volunteers are needed to visit with the senior, and help them care for their pet. The volunteers might walk a dog, clean a litter box, pick up pet food or litter, take a pet to the vet and/or foster a pet if the senior becomes hospitalized. We are looking for volunteers to do some or all of these things. Friendly visiting is an easy, fun, rewarding way to become involved in your community. We only ask for one hour per week (or more if YOU chose)! Many seniors want to play cards or games and go for walks. This is a great way to make a difference in someone's life and their pets life! The Friendly Visitor Program is run by Sunnyside Community Services and covers areas of Western Queens including Astoria, Elmhurst, East Elmhurst, Jackson Heights, Corona, Forest Hills, Flushing, Maspeth, Middle Village, Long Island City, Ridgewood, Sunnyside, Woodside, Rego Park and more. Friendly Visitors are volunteers who visit home bound elderly for about an hour each week in their homes. Volunteers reduce feelings of isolation, and help improve seniors' mental and physical health. Seniors are able to stay in their homes and communities longer. Volunteers can dramatically improve the quality of a seniors' life. The Friendly Visitor Program is funded by grants from CityMeals-on-Wheels and Amie's Place Foundation and serves homebound seniors who receive meal deliveries. Clients receiving visitors are often unable to go outside on their own and depend on visitors for social interaction. Friendly Visitors receive training, support and feedback from the Friendly Visiting Coordinator. We will match you with someone who shares your interests and schedule and is located (ideally) within 30 minutes of your home or office.

11104.description: PURPOSE: Provide case assistance, information and referral for seniors. Help seniors acquire benefits and entitlements so they can remain in and continue their involvement in the community. RESPONSIBILITIES: Be the first face of the senior center’s service area, welcoming seniors, and encouraging their participation Conduct intakes to determine eligibility and assist seniors in accessing benefits and entitlements Work as a liaison in connecting seniors to other agency and community programs Assist with information and referral regarding services Maintain strict confidentiality for both client and personnel files Conduct ongoing support group sessions in English and Spanish Conduct follow up via telephone with senior center members Maintain detailed logs of services rendered Assist in other areas of the senior center as needed VOLUNTEER QUALITIES: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Analytical and able to make decisions with limited information Able to adjust to a fast pace environment Ability to work independently and in a team environment Self-motivated Availabile anytime between Monday - Friday 9am-5pm TECHNICAL & SKILLS REQUIREMENTS: Comfortable using a computer Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with staff, volunteers, and clients Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing Bilingual English/Spanish
11104.title: Help Seniors Get Access to Benefits!

11104.description: About: For many families, the Social Adult Day Program offers a welcome alternative to a nursing home. Seniors can remain living in their homes, and caregivers can make time for their careers, for other family members, or for themselves. As a volunteer, under the direction of program staff you will be assisting with seniors activities and meal times. The welcoming and home-like center includes a kitchen, a dining area, and activity room. Our highly qualified staff can assist with medication reminders, personal care, and grooming. A low staff-to-participant ratio enables us to offer each senior individualized assistance as needed. Activities include: Therapeutic music, art, and dance sessions Sensory activities Storytelling Gentle exercises Reminiscence groups Arts and crafts The program serves a hot, nutritious lunch each day. We also offer door-to-door transportation in a van that is accessible to people in wheelchairs and people with limited mobility. Requirements: Make at least a 3-month commitment Must have a medical clearance and an up-to-date (within 2 years) PPD test Choose you day/s, Mondays through Fridays; hours are set, 10am to 3pm Qualities: Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with staff, volunteers, and clients Ability to communicate effectively Sensitivity to diverse cultures Be caring, considerate, compassionate, patient
11104.title: Adult Day Services for Seniors Volunteer

11104.description: Good day and thanks for reading! Senior CHAT volunteers needed to call and talk with a senior once a week (or more if you choose)! If you don't have the time to visit someone, but would still like to connect and make a new friend, I'd love to hear from you! You would call on your own schedule, whatever works for you! Volunteers must initially meet with me at my office in Sunnyside Queens and commit to calling someone once per week for at least 6 months! The Friendly Visitor Program is run by Sunnyside Community Services and covers all areas of Queens including Astoria, Elmhurst, East Elmhurst, Jackson Heights, Corona, Forest Hills, Flushing, Maspeth, Middle Village, Long Island City, Ridgewood, Sunnyside, Woodside, Rego Park and more. Volunteers reduce feelings of isolation, and help improve seniors' mental and physical health. Seniors are able to stay in their homes and communities longer. Volunteers can dramatically improve the quality of a seniors' life. The Friendly Visitor Program is funded by grants from CityMeals-on-Wheels and serves homebound seniors who receive meal deliveries. Clients receiving visitors are often unable to go outside on their own and depend on visitors for social interaction. Friendly Visitors receive training, support and feedback from the Friendly Visiting Coordinator. We will match you with someone who shares your interests and schedule! If you are interested in volunteering, please contact Erin Neubauer-Keyes, Friendly Visitor Program Coordinator at Sunnyside Community Services, 43-31 39 Street, Sunnyside, NY 11104. 718-784-6173 x479 Please write \"CHAT VOLUNTEER\" in the subject line of your email. I get a LOT of spam! Thanks!

11104.description: I currently have 2 seniors with dogs in Forest Hills and these dogs need to be walked! Both seniors are smokers and that makes it more challenging to find volunteers to help their dogs! Could you walk one of these dogs, even once a week for six months? Could you help them once a week? Studies show that having a pet can significantly improve a person's mental and physical health. Many seniors have pets, but need a little help caring for them. HELP A SENIOR KEEP THEIR PET!! Volunteers are needed to visit with the senior, and help them care for their pet. The volunteers might walk a dog, clean a litter box, pick up pet food or litter, take a pet to the vet and/or foster a pet if the senior becomes hospitalized. We are looking for volunteers to do some or all of these things. Friendly visiting is an easy, fun, rewarding way to become involved in your community. We only ask for one hour per week (or more if YOU chose)! Many seniors want to play cards or games and go for walks. This is a great way to make a difference in someone's life and their pets life! The Friendly Visitor Program is run by Sunnyside Community Services and covers areas of Western Queens including Astoria, Elmhurst, East Elmhurst, Jackson Heights, Corona, Forest Hills, Flushing, Maspeth, Middle Village, Long Island City, Ridgewood, Sunnyside, Woodside, Rego Park and more. Friendly Visitors are volunteers who visit home bound elderly for about an hour each week in their homes. Volunteers reduce feelings of isolation, and help improve seniors' mental and physical health. Seniors are able to stay in their homes and communities longer. Volunteers can dramatically improve the quality of a seniors' life. The Friendly Visitor Program is funded by grants from CityMeals-on-Wheels and Amie's Place Foundation and serves homebound seniors who receive meal deliveries. Clients receiving visitors are often unable to go outside on their own and depend on visitors for social interaction. Friendly Visitors receive training, support and feedback from the Friendly Visiting Coordinator. We will match you with someone who shares your interests and schedule and is located (ideally) within 30 minutes of your home or office.
11104.title: DOG Lovers in Rego Park/ Forest Hills!!- Help a Senior Care for their Dog!

Friendly visiting is an easy, fun, rewarding way to become involved in your community. Other languages are also needed! 11105.description: Situated on a 260-acre campus in New Jersey, Collier High School offers a specialized educational opportunity for about 150 students. Students come to Collier having had difficulty adapting to public schools due to emotional or psychological difficulties such as depression, anxiety, or behavioral issues. Good Shepherd Volunteers fill many roles at this school. Options include, but are not limited to, teaching, tutoring, running sports/extracurricular groups, facilitating arts/theater/music events, youth counseling, curriculum development, administration assistance, and ropes course instruction. You are encouraged to use your unique gifts, talents, and passions to choose which way to best serve students while also allowing yourself to try new things and help in various settings.
11105.title: Full-time volunteer with Collier Youth High School

11105.description: Good Shepherd Volunteers is a one-year full-time volunteer program that serves women, children, and adolescents affected by poverty, violence and neglect. The upcoming volunteer year starts August 2017 and ends approximately July 2018. Our volunteers live in community with each other, have a small living stipend, and practice the 4 Tenets of GSV: social justice, community, spirituality, and simplicity. We need people who are compassionate, flexible, and are up for a challenge. The populations we are working with are usually in a traumatic moment in their lives. We have placements in group homes, working with youth in and coming out of foster homes, a domestic violence shelter, in school settings, and in public policy. We invite you to learn more about our program by visiting our website at www.gsvolunteers.org!
11105.title: Full-Time Volunteer Opportunities with Good Shepherd Volunteers

Students who major in marketing, public relations, media, broadcasting, creative writing, public speaking or community outreach could build a porfolio helping us promote the services our Center offers seniors. 07945.description: We are looking for a summer volunteer 2 x week volunteer shifts during the weeks of July 10- Aug 4. for tasks such as: · Trail Maintenance · Native Garden Maintenance · Invasive Species Removal · Outdoor Classroom Restoration · General Facilities Upkeep Beef up your resume and gain hands on knowledge and experience as an environemental steward.
07945.title: Stewardship Crew member

07945.description: There are many ways to volunteer at Schiff. Our monthly Volunteer Work Days make everyone a \"land steward for a day!\" Check our online calendar for dates and times. Schiff also welcomes corporate volunteer groups, scout troops, religious groups, schools, and other organizations who wish to donate time or earn community service hours. Please email us at info@schiffnaturepreserve.org to make appropriate arrangements. Listed below are just a few ways to volunteer at Schiff. We welcome your suggestions and ideas! Adults Publicity Fundraising & Special Events Caretakers for our Native Plant Garden Landscaping, Trail Maintenance Groups Corporate Work Days School Group Community Service Community Service Projects Landscaping, Trail Maintenance Teens Counselors for our Summer Nature Program for Kids Eagle Scout & Gold Award Projects Join our Stewardship Crew (\"Stew Crew\") The work of maintaining the trails, gardens, and facilities of the Schiff Nature Preserve is a year round project, but much work is needed over the summer. Under the leadership of the Stew Crew Leader, the Volunteer Stew Crew offers teens (16+) and young adults an opportunity to complete up to 50 hours of volunteer time while learning about land stewardship in a \"hands on\" fashion through the completion of projects such as: Trail Maintenance Native Garden Maintenance Invasive Species Removal Outdoor Classroom Restoration General Facilities Upkeep The Stew Crew Leader position is a paid position for an enthusiastic, invested, young person with an interest in the environment, sustainability, and animal and plant biology. During July and early August, in addition to supporting the Summer Nature Program director, the Stew Crew Leader gathers 5-10 volunteers, organizes work days, and completes a total of 50 hours of work commitment. Applicants are welcomed to send a letter of interest, a resume, and references to info@schiffnaturepreserve.org .
07945.title: General Volunteer Opportunities with Schiff

07945.description: Join our team of volunteers. Participate in our engaging and flexible volunteer program. Help play a key role in supporting terminally ill patients and their loved ones. You CAN decide which program you want to be a part of: Administrative Volunteers Basic Clerical Tasks, such as Filing and Data Entry Become familiarized with Homecare Homebase software Work on Special Projects when needed Companion Volunteers Contribute to our patients' quality of life Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Read to patients, share special talents, play games, watch TV, and much more Benefits Increase purpose and meaning in your life by positively impacting other lives Experience significant opportunities for personal growth and development Convenient FREE training that fits your schedule Internship Credit (if applicable) Develop interpersonal skills Build your resume Reference Letter after a period of commitment
07945.title: Hospice Volunteers in Mendham, NJ - No Experience Needed

07945.description: Join our team of volunteers. Participate in our engaging and flexible volunteer program. Help play a key role in supporting terminally ill patients and their loved ones. 06883.description: We are looking for teenagers who share our passion for addressing children's physical and emotional health issues. Through our Teen Council, you can be part of a group of teens who create initiatives that make a difference in improving the lives of children - from medical conditions, to bullying, to economic disparity. Each month, we focus on a particular children's issue - such as pediatric cancer, type 1 diabetes, autism, cystic fibrosis, and bullying. We also promote healthy living by providing nutrition lessons, cooking, and fitness activities for children. If you are interested in learning more, please contact us at info@kidsheartfelthealth.com.
06883.title: Teens with a Heart

07701.description: Are you a business owner? Are you a skilled tradesman/woman? A carpenter, plumber, electrician, HVAC, welder, chef, hairdresser, auto mechanics , computers and the list goes on and on. We are looking for folks to \"take a teen to work,\" to introduce them to different trades and get them thinking about their futures and the different vocational paths available to them. Sharing your expertise with them. If this is something that interests you, please contact us at your earliest convenience. We would like to begin this summer.
07701.title: Student Apprenticeship Volunteers Needed!

07701.description: Veterans Volunteers Needed! Grace Healthcare Services is a Community-based Hospice program that cares for Veterans at the end of life. Volunteers are an essential component of this care. WHY A NEED FOR VETERAN VOLUNTEERS? -Veteran Volunteers have the unique ability to relate and connect to patients who have served our country. -Veterans share a common bond and code of conduct. -The camaraderie that exists between Veterans has proven to be a great support for the Veterans we care for. As a member of the New Jersey Hospice and Palliative Care Organization, Grace Healthcare has made a unique commitment to all Veterans by participating in a partnership with the US Department of Veteran Affairs. This is known as the, \"We Honor Veterans\" initiative. The We Honor Veterans initiative recognizes that only a small percentage of Veterans are a part of the VA Healthcare system and therefore aren't always aware of benefits that they might be entitled to. As part of this venture, our goal is to raise awareness within the veteran community. Once a Veteran comes on service with us, our priority is to give them the recognition they deserve as well as help to insure that all benefits they may be entitled to are accessed. We believe that involves interaction with Veteran volunteers who have had similar life experiences. As a Grace Volunteer you will be given a choice of assignment depending on your desire to provide bedside visits, or office based assignments or to become part of our Veteran Speaker Committee. If you are interested or have questions please contact the Grace Healthcare Services Volunteer Department at 732-225-4100 and ask for Ms. Moynihan to inquire about the Veteran-to-Veteran Volunteer Program. We look forward to hearing from you!
07701.title: Veteran Volunteers Needed!

07701.description: As Monmouth County’s first soup kitchen and pantry, Lunch Break freely provides life's basic necessities - food, clothing and fellowship to the community. Their mission is to alleviate hunger and lead those they serve to self-sufficiency and healthier lifestyles. They serve everyone, with compassion and dignity. Volunteers are needed to serve a meal to community members in need. The volunteers should wear jeans and sneakers. Please refrain from wearing jewelry and bringing pocketbooks. Lunch Break requires that volunteers provide additional information in order to volunteer at this opportunity. Please follow the link and provide the information requested. Volunteers who do not fill out the information requested and click submit, will not be permitted to volunteer. Link Here NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07701.title: Hunger Helpers in Red Bank

07701.description: Maybe you're retired or maybe you're between jobs. If so, please consider driving our big, blue bus to transport our kids to and from Bible class, summer day camp, and other activities in three different locations in Monmouth County, NJ. The KIDS NEED YOU!!!!!! Contact us for all the information!
07701.title: WOULD YOU LIKE TO DRIVE A BIG BLUE BUS? HAVE YOUR C.D.L.?  Have we got an opportunity for you!!!

06880.description: CAG is seeking an individual to serve as a Board member who has background in strategic marketing, which ideally includes a blend of marketing planning and execution, with direct experience at an advertising agency or on the client side, with branding, advertising and communications experience. Advocacy experience is also highly regarded. CAG desires assistance to expand its reach, awareness and membership statewide - including further penetration into underserved communities. Also important will be cultivating and maintaining relationships with funders, members, collaborating organizations and legislators as well as the ability to work at a quick pace, flexibly and nimbly. Excellent written and verbal skills are a must. Responsibilities to include the following: Collaborating with the Executive Director and Board leadership to develop and execute a comprehensive marketing and communications plan employing strategies that will broaden programmatic reach and deepen impact, including hands-on experience with all appropriate aspects of social media Managing the ongoing promotion of major programs and developing and executing messaging for new initiatives Identifying and crafting stories that communicate the essence of the organization’s mission and successes Working with the technology-development team to identify a set of meaningful touchpoints with our targets - new member joining, annual pledging - and creating an array of appropriate communications to be automated and sent, in order to stay current and ensure maximum engagement and support from our stakeholders. Working with all CAG committees, specifically including Development and Programming, to assist with execution of their annual plans and to help further corporate engagement efforts Identifying significant media and public policy issues that can be leveraged to support CAG’s work, and creating and implementing plans to exploit them
06880.title: Connecticut Association for the Gifted - BOD Opening in Marketing/Advertising

06880.description: Why not use your love for being in the community and connecting with others, as a way to engage those who want to give back in a meaningful way? The Volunteer Lead recruits and coordinates volunteers within the community for multiple year round assignments to support Making Strides of Westport. The Volunteer Lead position is a Committee Chair role, with a 1-2 year commitment. Sub-committee positions also available. We will work with your schedule and availability. ---------------------------------------------------- The American Cancer Society Making Strides Against Breast Cancer walks raise awareness and funds to save lives from breast cancer. Our Making Strides of Westport event brings in more than 6000 participants annually and has raised more than $2M over the past 5 years! For more information, please visit www.makingstrideswalk.org/westportct
06880.title: Lead Volunteer Coordinator for Making Strides Against Breast Cancer Event
06880.org: American Cancer Society Making Strides Against Breast Cancer

06880.description: The Connecticut Association for the Gifted (CAG), founded in 1969, is the pre-eminent parent, teacher and school resource, and legislative advocate forConnecticut’s talented and high-ability students. CAG provides families with information, resources and programs to benefit their gifted and talented children; educators with high-quality professional development; and Boards of Education with the tools to support talented students. CAG is seeking an individual to serve as a Board member who has a hands-on background in public relations, including firsthand social media experience. The ideal candidate would possess a working knowledge of strategic marketing that includes a blend of media relations, marketing planning and advocacy. CAG desires assistance to expand its reach, awareness and membership statewide -- including further penetration into underserved communities. Also important will be cultivating and maintaining relationships with funders, legislators and collaborating organizations, as well as the ability to work at a quick pace, flexibly and nimbly. Must also possess excellent written and verbal skills. Responsibilities to include the following: Identifying and crafting stories that communicate the essence of an organization’s mission and successes Collaborating with the Executive Director and Board leadership to develop and execute a comprehensive communications plan employing strategies that will broaden programmatic reach and deepen impact Developing and refining \"core\" organizational messages to ensure consistency across all platforms Identifying significant media and public policy issues that can be leveraged to support CAG’s work, and creating and implementing plans to exploit them Managing messaging for ongoing promotion of major programs and developing messaging for new initiatives Along with ED and officers, representing organization at public events, conferences, workshops, networking groups and media events Developing and supporting relationships with CT media Working with all appropriate committees including Development and Partnership, to assist with corporate/small business/like-minded organization engagement efforts Serving as Executive Editor for the organization's website Along with Program Coordinator, overseeing organizational response to inquiries about CAG Coaching and supporting all staff and board members as spokespersons Previous experience on a non-profit board is helpful This is an unpaid (volunteer) position. To apply or for further information contact Lisa Garner at execdirector@ctgifted.org.
06880.title: Connecticut Association for the Gifted - Board of Directors Member Experienced in Public Relations

06880.description: The Westport Mentor Program is a school-based program where individuals from the community meet for 45 minutes per week, on school grounds, during the school year, to offer friendship, support-and a non-judgmental ear. Mentors are matched to students grade K-12. A mentor establishes a one-on-one relationship with the student by acting as a friend, guide and role model. The goal of the program is to build a child's self-esteem and develop positive relationships in school, at home, and in the community. If you are interested or would like more information, please contact Lauren Rosenkranz, Westport Mentor Program Coordinator, 203.341.1183 or lrosenkranz@westportct.gov
06880.title: Make a Difference in the life of a child...Be a Mentor

10040.description: Friendly Visiting is a program that pairs volunteers with homebound seniors to provided company and friendship. Upper Manhattan Partnership for Senior Independence provided friendly visiting services to senior that resides from North 110th street and West of Fifth Avenue to the Northern tip of Manhattan. One visit per week for a period of six months or more can make a difference in a senior’s life. Friendly Visiting Coordinator Elissette Reyes De Jesus 212-342-9694 646-228-1812 ereyesdejesus@isabella.org
10040.title: Friendly Visiting Program

10044.description: The Carter Burden Network is dedicated to supporting the efforts of older people to remain in their homes living independently, safely, and with dignity. Volunteers are an integral component of the Carter Burden Network's 40+ years of success. No matter your age, experience or schedule, CBN can accommodate your needs to ensure that you have a meaningful and effective volunteer experience. Carter Burden Network Roosevelt Island Senior Center is looking for a volunteer to host zumba and/or dance classes once a week for seniors. We are looking for someone fun, energetic and reliable. Qualifications: certified fitness instructor or dance teacher Schedule: Monday's or Thursday's Time: 9AM - 10AM or 9:30AM - 10:30AM. Schedule it flexible for morning hours. *Volunteer may choose to commit to hosting class two days a week, if they would like, but not mandatory. * Please only apply if you are willing to travel to/from Roosevelt Island
10044.title: Zumba/Dance Fitness Instructor

10044.description: Purpose The Local Organizing Committee (LOC) leads the fundraising efforts for the New York Walk+Run event, serves as a grassroots promotions team for the Walk+Run event, and acts as an ambassador of Be The Match to the local community. The New York Be The Match Walk+Run event is Saturday, September 30th. Location Volunteer in the New York area with the local LOC volunteers and the staff Development Manager. LOC Roles Roles vary depending upon current membership and vacancies and members' strengths and skill sets. The ideal LOC structure includes a Chair and members focused on sponsorships, entertainment, registration, team recruitment, in-kind donations, event promotions, and volunteer recruitment. Time Commitment The LOC is most active in the 5-6 months leading up to an event. LOC members can expect to spend around 15-20 hours a month on committee work, but this can vary by role and based on your own availability. LOC members are expected to attend meetings, conference calls, and local promotional events and to work with Be The Match staff with regards to their specific functional area during the planning period and event weekend. Qualifications This is a leadership position and a great opportunity for someone with experience and/or interest in fundraising and event planning. Must be at least 18 years of age Self-motivated Strong interest in non-profits Strong interpersonal and communication skills Ability to work with office tools such as Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook Must have a computer, or easy access to one Local business connections helpful Be The Match Walk+Run Overview Be The Match Walk+Run is a fundraising event that helps patients with blood cancers like leukemia find a marrow donor and receive a life-saving transplant. Every four minutes someone is diagnosed with a blood cancer. It can happen to anyone at any time. But so can a cure - a marrow transplant. The cure for blood cancer is in the hands of ordinary people. Most of us won’t have a marrow donor in our family and Be The Match matches volunteer marrow donors with patients who need them. The Be The Match Walk+Run (5K, 1K, and Tot Trot) raises funds to: add more volunteer potential marrow donors to the Be The Match Registry, giving more patients hope for a cure; help patients with uninsured treatment costs; and, support continued marrow transplant research.
10044.title: New York Be The Match Walk+Run Local Organizing Committee

11370.description: We are currently looking for an individual to work on our team as a WebSite Designer. Our 501 (c) 3 non-profit organization (www.alertnfp.org) Alert Inc is a non-for-profit organization which deals with the securing of our educational institutions to better safeguard the welfare of students, facility and staff of schools through numerous programs and network support. IT personnel needed to help with designing websites and maintaining and upgrading them-Depending on applicant opportunity may lead to full time paid position
11370.title: Website Developer

07608.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe, comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers.
07608.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice - Teterboro

07608.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.
07608.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Teterboro

07608.description: Ascend Hospice Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients ; mind, body and soul.
07608.title: Music Therapy for Hospice - Teterboro

11226.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org/support/volunteer/adult-literacy-volunteer-tutor .
11226.title: Volunteer Tutor Information Session
11226.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11226.description: We are looking for an organ player to play our new Allen Organ Theater II. Time is every Sunday at 11:30 AM - 1:30 PM.
11226.title: Organist Wanted

11226.description: Maa Sa Akhi Performing Arts Academy seeks a Development Assistant to provide administrative support for the Director in all aspects of Maa Sa Akhi development. This role requires solid people management expertise. The Development Assistant must be a flexible and engaging individual who can analyze and prioritize tasks and build trusting relationships for the effective achievement of results. This person will report to and get approval from the Director before implementing any new procedure or changing any policy. As a member of Maa Sa Akhi’s development team, the Development Assistant will work closely with the Director, as well as other Maa Sa Akhi staff, faculty, and Board members to assist in the administration, coordination and implementation of all development activities. The position may also include such tasks as greeting students, answering the phone, calling interested prospective students, typing letters, calling and emailing reminders for upcoming events, assisting with planning for trips and events. The ideal candidate will be interested in nonprofit arts administration and fundraising, and be passionate about the mission of Maa Sa Akhi Performing Arts Academy : to help each student realize their innate excellence through the performing arts toward success in their every endeavor.
11226.title: Development Assistant, Part Time
11226.org: Maa Sa Akhi Performing Arts Academy

11226.description: Be our community champion! Community Options seeks business people to help further its mission. Among the goals set for the Business Advisory Council, or COBAC: To assist Community Options staff in its fundraising endeavors, To assist Community Options staff in networking with the business community, To help individuals with disabilities integrate into their communities, To ensure utmost quality in Community Options services, To educate local business owners and the corporate sector about persons with disabilities and the role that the business community can play in their lives, To attain a societal understanding and acceptance of a person with a disability as a productive member of the community. As a member of COBAC in your community, you're our champion! Join us today. Learn more about COBAC here: http://www.comop.org/get-involved/cobac/
11226.title: Business Advisory Council Committee -BKN

11226.description: Sue Rock Originals Everyone is a support organization for survivors of domestic violence. We have a wonderful opportunity to fundraise with TEES throughout the summer. We need EXCELLENT Henna/Mendi Artist to use their creativity to design on our tees to help make our fundraising effort a success. Everyone loves T-Shirts but ONE OF A KIND Tees are even better.
11226.title: Mehndi Artists Needed to Create Fundraising Items!!

11226.description: Wishgranting volunteers work directly with wish children and their families to live out the mission of Make-A-Wish through granting wishes! You will work with a volunteer partner, and meet with your wish child and their family. You will then have the magical conversation about your wish kid’s wish! Volunteers work with each child to determine his or her heartfelt wish and complete the granting of the wish with Program staff. Following your initial interview with a wish child, you and your volunteer partner maintain communication with the family and Make-A-Wish staff about the status of the wish. This helps build excitement and anticipation for the wish experience until the day the wish comes true! Wish granters are required to be a minimum age of 21, interview the wish child at their home or in the hospital, work collaboratively, and have excellent communications skills. This role does not require a specific number of volunteer hours per week but requires each volunteer to see the experience through from start to finish. Interviews with wish children are scheduled at the convenience of the volunteers and wish families. The wish process, from start to finish, can take anywhere between six months to two and a half years to reach completion.
11226.title: Wishgranting Volunteers
11226.org: Make-A-Wish Metro New York and Western New York

11226.description: If you could go anywhere, meet anyone, be anything, or have anything you most wanted . . . what would it be? Become a Wishgranting Volunteer and help create moments of hope, strength, and joy for children in Metro New York. As a Wishgranting Volunteer, you will be paired up in teams of two to interview children with life-threatening illnesses to determine their heartfelt wish. You will assist in the granting of each wish with Make-A-Wish staff and your volunteer partner.
11226.title: Help make wishes come true!
11226.org: Make-A-Wish Metro New York and Western New York

07607.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07607.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07607.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07607.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/
07607.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Maywood

10024.description: Since 2001 DOROT’s prestigious Summer Teen Internship Program has been inspiring high school students to become leaders and give back to the community. Volunteer with a diverse group of socially-conscious high school students to help local seniors connect. The internship is designed to provide students with a minimum of 92 hours of community service. * Documentary Filmaking - Session I * Intergenerational Theater - Session II * Deliver meals and birthday cakes * Teach computer skills * Cook and dine with seniors * Plan intergenerational trips to local museums * 104 hours of community service Session 1: June 26 - July 20 (exceptions made for regents exams) Session 2: July 24 - August 17 Apply here: www.dorotusa.org/teenapp Watch a Day in the Life of a DOROT Teen Intern: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jeXyE2YSHCM ''It’s an incredibly fulfilling experience to reach out to the seniors in the community and help them with whatever they need assistance with. It's also an added benefit that, as teen interns, we can build relationships with other teens who love the same service work. -Maude, Summer Teen Intern The DOROT Summer Teen Internship Program is jointly funded by UJA-Federation of New York and the Jim Joseph Foundation. The Jewish Education Project serves as lead operator of the Initiative.
10024.title: Summer Teen Internship Program 2017

10024.description: Volunteer tutors needed for low income students for summer session from 7/5/17-8/18/17. You will be matched one-to-one for just two hours per week. Students range in age from 7-18. There are no weekend hours available.
10024.title: Help a Child!  Be a Summer Volunteer Tutor

10024.description: myFace is proud to host Races For Faces 2017! Please join us on Sunday, July 23, for a fun-filled family day in beautiful Riverside Park on the Upper West Side of Manhattan to raise money and awareness for craniofacial conditions. Meeting Point: The Warsaw Ghetto Memorial at 83rd Street Event Schedule: 7:00 AM - Volunteers Arrive and Check-In 9:00 AM - Registration Begins 10:00 AM - Opening Remarks 10:30 AM - Walk Commencement & Carnival Fun! 12:00 PM - Closing Ceremony & Awards We will have lots of fun for children of all ages including exciting games, family activities and raffle, arts and crafts, obstacle courses and lots of surprises! Every dollar donated goes towards helping patients with craniofacial differences and their families! To learn more, please visit www.racesforfaces.org
10024.title: Races for Faces 2017

10024.description: Goddard Riverside is seeking a Horticulturist volunteer to work with our Older Adult population to help beautify our Senior Center garden. Dates and time are flexible between Monday - Friday 9-5. Goddard Riverside serves some 17,000 people each year through 26 programs on the Upper West Side and throughout Manhattan. We work every day for a fair and just society where all people have the opportunity to make choices that lead to better lives for themselves and their families. If you are interested, please contact Brianne Kilpatrick at BKilpatrick@goddard.org
10024.title: Horticulturist Needed

10024.description: Goddard Riverside is seeking a qualified individual to help with answering a switch board and helping out with front desk work - stamping mail, distributing mail and filing. This volunteer position is located in our Senior Center at 88th and Columbus Avenue. We are looking for someone who can volunteer with us Monday-Friday 9-5. It is a plus if you speak Spanish or another language. Goddard Riverside serves some 17,000 people each year through 26 programs on the Upper West Side and throughout Manhattan. We work every day for a fair and just society where all people have the opportunity to make choices that lead to better lives for themselves and their families. Interested individuals should send resume with cover letter to Brianne Kilpatrick at BKilpatrick@goddard.org.
10024.title: Clerical Help Needed

10024.description: Volunteer as an EMT or non-medical provider with CPMU! http://www.cpmu.com/index.php/join-cpmu/
10024.title: Volunteer with the Central Park Medical Unit!

10024.description: From a teen who visited a DOROT Senior: I LOVED THIS VISIT SO MUCH!!! It was really heartwarming and gratifying to see how elated Angie was after she opened the gifts that were in the birthday package. It was so nice to see someone so happy by our visit and what we brought with us. I felt very at ease and it was great talking to her and seeing her reaction to the gifts. -Jessica, 10th grade Teens help alleviate loneliness and social isolation of DOROT's seniors through a variety of hands-on experiences in the community and onsite at DOROT. Teen Interns may: visit seniors in their home for companionship. teach seniors how to use a computer, iPad, iShuffle, and other types of technology. celebrate seniors’ birthdays. deliver meals to seniors. send birthday cards out to seniors. read to visually impaired seniors. shop and delivery groceries to seniors. play chess, cards, scrabble, and other games with seniors. assist with office work at DOROT. take part in a variety of other opportunities and experiences. Time Commitment: 1 day a week (Monday - Thursday) 2 hours a day (after school - no later than 4:00-6:00pm) 1 semester (minimum of 10 times at DOROT) Our Teen Internship has limited spots and is competitive, so teens must go through an application process. As a prospective intern, the first step is to fill out the interest form, then contact Shelley Levine at 917-441-5051 for a brief phone interview. We take great care to find teen interns who are committed, responsible, reliable, and enthusiastic about working with seniors. Eligibile teens are in 9th-12th grades.
10024.title: DOROT School Year TEEN Internship

10024.description: This opportunity is available every night! Excess bread can be combined with other ingredients to create meals to feed the hungry at a nearby food pantry rather than being thrown out. Help us walk with the food that would have been thrown away! We will get bags of bread and walk for this fifteen minute event, and will finish at the Rectory at the Holy Trinity Catholic Church at 213 W 82nd Street. Light Weight: the average total amount of food is 10 lbs. Sign up directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10024.title: Fight Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in Upper West Side 8:05PM-8:20PM

10024.description: Are you in-transition, new to being older, an empty nester, or retired? Looking for new experiences and new challenges at a new stage in life? Bring your knowledge, skills and patience that you’ve developed over the years to DOROT. You will also meet other volunteers that share similar interests. Knitting and Crocheting Afghans for Seniors Gather twice a month with other volunteers to knit or crochet Afghans that will be given to seniors at DOROT’s Homelessness Prevention and Aftercare Program. Wednesdays & Thursdays, 10:30 AM - 12:00 PM Thursday, October 20 Wednesday, November 2 Thursday, November 17 Wednesday, December 7 Thursday, December 22 2017 Wednesday, January 4 Thursday, January 19 Wednesday, February 1 Thursday, February 16 Wednesday, March 1 Thursday, March 16 Wednesday, April 5 Thursday, April 20 Wednesday, May 3 Thursday, May 18 Wednesday, June 7 Thursday, June 22 DOROT will provide some supplies, bringing your own is preferred. For more information and to register, please contact Rebecca Zinger, Coordinator of Adult Volunteer Services at rzinger@dorotusa.org or 917-441-5054.
10024.title: Knitting & Crocheting Afghans for Seniors- Upper West Side

10024.description: It’s an election year and it’s almost time to vote for our next President! The West Side Campaign Against Hunger will host a voter registration drive for the General Election beginning on Monday, August 1, 2016, through October 14, 2016. Help WSCAH customers register to vote by signing up for one of our voter registration trainings throughout June and July. You may choose from the following dates: Friday, July 15 at 2pm Friday, July 29 at 2pm If you’re outgoing and believe in the power of voting, this opportunity is for you! Bilingual in Spanish is helpful. Trained volunteers may choose to volunteer on any Monday and/or Wednesday between August 1 and October 14 for a 2 hour shift in the morning or afternoon. If you have any questions, please email Rashida Latef, Advocacy Coordinator, at rlatef@wscah.org or call 212-362-3662 ext 140.
10024.title: Be an advocate at the West Side Campaign Against Hunger!

10024.description: Help your community to stop food waste and fight hunger by bringing excess food to homeless shelters. You will be taking bags of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. This is a great opportunity to gain community service experience while helping others at the same time!!!! Please sign up for events directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10024.title: Stop Food Waste & Help Feed The Hungry!

10024.description: Help your community to stop food waste and fight hunger by bringing excess food to homeless shelters. You will be taking bags of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. This is a great opportunity to gain community service experience while helping others at the same time!!!! Please sign up for events directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10024.title: Weekly Volunteers Needed To Help Fight Food Waste & Feed The Hungry!!

10024.description: Bring the knowledge, skills and patience you've developed to make a significant impact on the lives of older members of our community. Our DOROT seniors will benefit from your time and expertise. You will meet other volunteers and make new friends that share similar interests and are as passionate about volunteering as you. Volunteer Opportunities Inlcude: Cooking for Homelessness Prevention Program: SCHEDULED FOR 6/15/17 Speaking Exchange Video Chat Services Groups Intergenerational Programs Vist our website for more information: http://www.dorotusa.org/site/PageServer?pagename=vol_older_adult#.VkEWgLeFNdg
10024.title: Retired? Volunteer with DOROT and assist seniors.

10024.description: Customer and community volunteers are an integral part of what we do. We depend on volunteers for food pantry services, which creates a community of individuals helping others. Without volunteers, we would be unable to provide food and counseling services for as many people as we do. The majority of our volunteers are customers who choose to five back by donating hours of their time. We also have volunteers from the community, neighboring schools, corporations, foundations and religious congregations. Volunteers help bring in deliveries, stock shelves, bag bread, pack rice and beans, break down boxes, assist customers with their shoping, work the checkout area, and much more.
10024.title: Be a West Side Campaign Against Hunger Volunteer!

10024.description: Escort a senior to a cultural event such as a concert, movie, theater or museum. Interview, training, references and background check is required.
10024.title: Escort a senior to a cultural event

10024.description: Teach basic computer skills and internet navigation to a senior in their home. Lessons are 1-4 sessions, depending on the senior’s needs, for approximately one hour. Interview, training, references and background check is required.
10024.title: Teach computer skills to  elderly in Manhattan

10024.description: Make a friend for a lifetime! Visit a compatible senior, one-on-one, for conversation, companionship and to share mutual interests. These weekly 1 hour visits occur within the home of a senior residing on the East Side or Upper West side of Manhattan. You will be matched by a professional social worker to establish a meaningful and rewarding relationship. Interview, training, references, background check and year-long commitment required.
10024.title: Become a Friendly Visitor with a local senior

10024.description: Are your customer service skills 'up to snuff'? At the West Side Campaign Against Hunger, volunteers who fulfill the role of check-out help in the pantry assisting customers with their shopping. Training will be provided. Knowledge of Spanish, Cantonese, French, Urdu, or Russian is very helpful, but not neccessary. Volunteer Hours: Monday: 7 am to 7 pm Tuesday: delivery day, 7 am to 11 am Wednesday, Thursday and Friday: 7 am to 4 pm
10024.title: Bilingual Volunteers Needed!

10024.description: Help frail seniors with grocery shopping, getting to medical appointments or just taking a walk in the park! Interview, training, references and background check is required.
10024.title: Help seniors with grocery shopping and errands in Manhattan

08890.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
08890.title: Middlesex Area>>>>>Advice Counselor

07601.description: BVMI provides free primary healthcare to low-income Bergen County residents who do not have health insurance. Our patients lack the means to pay for medical care; BVMI keeps our patients out of local Emergency Departments. Our patients come from many different backgrounds so we are looking for an interpreter to sit with our social worker one afternoon a week as she interacts with potential clients. If you are ready to give back to your community and speak Spanish, BVMI is the right place for you. For more information about BVMI, please visit www.bvmi,org.
07601.title: Interpreter - Spanish

07601.description: BVMI provides free primary healthcare to low-income Bergen County residents who do not have health insurance. Our patients lack the means to pay for medical care; BVMI keeps our patients out of local Emergency Departments. Healthcare professionals are at the heart of BVMI. A team of 65 volunteer physicians, nurses and other medical scribes provide medical care for BVMI’s patients. Our scribes specialize in charting physician-patient encounters during medical exams. If you are a student getting ready to attend medical school or presently in medical school and are looking for experience, BVMI is the right place for you. This volunteer position offers one-on-one collaboration with a physician and is unprecedented in terms of exposure to real medicine in practice. Our scribes learn about patient care on the job in real time. The center is open Monday - Friday, 9am - 5pm. Thursday we are open until 7pm and we are flexible in terms of how often and how much time you spend at BVMI Our patients come from many different backgrounds; please let us know if you are bilingual (Spanish, Korean, Chinese, etc). For more information about BVMI, please visit www.bvmi,org.
07601.title: Medical Scribe

07601.description: CASA Volunteers are appointed by family court judges to advocate for the best interest of an abused or neglected child during their time in the child welfare system. They are in essence, the voice of the child, in court. CASA Volunteers interview parents, doctors, educators, foster parents, therapists, and anyone else involved in the life of the child they are assigned. Their goal is to provide child-focused reports to the court, which will lead to a speedy, safe, and permanent placement for the child. This is why it is imperative for these volunteers to go through extensive training. All Volunteers are screened closely for objectivity, competence, and commitment. You can become a CASA volunteer if: You have never been convicted of a crime and can pass a criminal background check. You are not personally involved with DCP&P (the state child welfare agency). Your job (and your life) is flexible. You are at least 21 years old. You are willing to make a one-year commitment. You pass CASA’s screening process. Typically, a CASA volunteer will spend an average 10-20 hours per month working with their assigned case. Each case is different, so the amount of time required to get the job done varies significantly. We do require the volunteer to visit the child once every two weeks and be in court once every three months. CASA for Children of Bergen County asks that you make a one-year commitment. We prefer that a volunteer continue with their assigned case until it is permanently resolved which typically involves an 18 months - two year commitment. One of the primary benefits of the CASA program is that, unlike many caseworkers, most CASA volunteers remain a consistent figure during the course of case proceedings. This provides important continuity for children. Potential CASA volunteers must attend an Information Session, be interviewed and be accepted into training. CASA provides extensive training for our volunteers so that they are prepared to provide children with the support they desperately need. CASA volunteers undergo a thorough 36-hour training course. They learn about courtroom procedure, effective advocacy techniques for children, and specific topics ranging from child abuse to early childhood development and adolescent behavior. In addtion, trainees must attend 3 hours of court observation before being sworn-in by the presiding Family Court judge. Volunteers are required to attend 12 hours of continued training for each year of service. Our training course is offered several times a year and will prepare you for your volunteer experience. Information Sessions: May 17th 10am or 5:30pm Next Training: Flex Summer Training (half online & half in class) In Lcass dates 5:30pm-8:30pm: June 20th, 27th, July 11th, 18th, 25th and August 1st There are information session EVERY third Wednesday of the month! Please fill out our Registration form to come to our next informtaion seesion! https://bergencasa.org/volunteer-inquiry-form/
07601.title: Become a CASA volunteer
07601.org: CASA for Children of Bergen County

07601.description: Volunteers needed to represent BVMI at health fairs throughout Bergen County. We will train and provide information about BVMI for distribution.
07601.title: Health Fair Representative

07601.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07601.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07601.description: BVMI utilizes 110 clinical and lay volunteers to help provide care for patients and carry out administrative and fundraising tasks to keep BVMI running smoothly. We are seeking a volunteer coordinator who can help us manage these volunteers, including: Determine, with staff, agency needs which can be met by volunteers Recruit volunteers Respond to inquiries from prospective volunteers Interview prospective volunteers Oversee credentialing process for clinical volunteers Train and onboard new volunteers Schedule volunteers Assign tasks/projects to volunteers The coordinator will work with the administrative director.
07601.title: Volunteer Coordinator

07601.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07601.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07601.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07601.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07601.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.

07601.description: As part of our mission we deliver workshops to existing clients and the public on a variety of small business topics. The topics range from very tactical such as how to use specific accounting software to strategic planning for a business. We are seeking a few people to help grow our workshop program by helping us define and develop workshops to be delivered in the Northeast NJ area. The right candidate will understand how to define what topics are needed based on market research and past program performance. They will be able to seek out and establish relationships with presenters. They will evaluate the content and presenters and submit them for approval by the Workshop committee. The Workshop developer will review the client feedback to determine if the workshop should be repeated, the frequency and any changes required to make the program more effective. The actual execution of the workshops may be turned over to workshop administrators or retained as appropriate and desired. The work can largely be done remotely but occasional meetings at our office in Hackensack NJ will be required as will attendance at some number of workshops.
07601.title: SCORE Northeast NJ - Workshop Leader/Development

07601.description: BVMI is seeking individuals to conduct financial screening of new and existing patients to determine qualification according to established eligibility criteria. Screeners collect required financial records and other documents, and utilize a custom spreadsheet as well as BVMI's medical record software during the interview process. Interviews are done by appointment. There is a need for interviewers who speak English, Spanish and/or Korean.
07601.title: Patient Interviewer

07601.description: BVMI is looking for special volunteers to help interpret for patients and practitioners. Spanish speakers are in high demand, especially those with a medical background. Other languages, including Korean, are also needed.
07601.title: Interpreter

07601.description: BVMI is looking for volunteers to assist with administrative tasks that keep the healthcare center running! If you are good with the computer, like to make phone calls, love helping with special events or just like to stuff envelopes, we can put you to work. We have a special need for individuals who are bilingual Spanish.
07601.title: Office Volunteer

07601.description: BVMI is looking for volunteer doctors, nurses, nurse practitioners, physician assistants, dietitians, social workers and other healthcare professionals to treat patients. BVMI provides primary care, so PCPs and internists are always welcome, but specialists are also needed to either practice at BVMI or provide free service in their own practice. Volunteers who provide care to patients at BVMI receive free malpractice insurance. Must have valid license to practice in NJ.
07601.title: Clinical Volunteer

07601.description: The laboratory trained students for over 15yrs. Interested in training early stage student/yourg professional via volunteer program Mainly looking for biology-related trained post-college/Masters degree, PhDs and MDs. All volunteers/interns are supervised under my senior postdoctoral fellows (PhDs). This program is not paid position, so no salary or compensation of any kind involved. Program is for volunteers and non-paid internship. Some are under OPT- this is unpaid training. You are expected to be trained for scientific research and get cancer research experience. I do have set guidelines for this program. Must work minimum 5hrs/day, 4 days/wk (flexible) Must stay with the lab for minimum 1yr. Must publish papers as coauthors with us If wish to stay with the lab and funding is available, we will consider hiring (you must show high productivity via publication records) Will get some junior student supervision experience Most of my trainees get trained while they prepare for industry jobs, PhD program, medical school or MD residency. I do need to evaluate CV for qualification and interview them.
07601.title: Cancer Research Volunteers/ Non-Paid Internship, OPT and Training

The CHEER Programs needs to have a commitment of 2 hours per week. Individuals and parent/child teams are welcome.

Our immediate desire is to have six to eight members on the professional advisory committee that would meet one to two times per year and be available for consultation by telephone as needed. Educational and professional experience in the speciality areas listed is preferred.

11224.description: APPLY BY 4 p.m. EST ON MAY 1 for SUMMER APPLY BY 4 p.m. EST ON MAY 15 for FALL Education Volunteers engage and educate aquarium guests in a variety of ways. Whether they are connecting people to animals and nature at the park's touch pool, exploring conservation stories through interpretation at exhibits, or taking on active roles in conservation by assisting with campaigns- education volunteers are vital to the WCS mission to save wildlife and wild places worldwide. As an education volunteer, you will have the opportunity to meet individuals from around the world and join a family of fellow volunteers, staff, and wildlife experts who share a passion for our natural world. You can help in a variety of ways to staff exhibits, teach visitors about marine conservation, and assist at events and education programs. Education volunteer programs are open to: Working and Retired Adults Seniors College/Grad Students Teens who are at least 15 years of age or older WCS Now Interpreter: Level 1 Volunteer Engage guests by facilitating interactive, conservation-based activities at exhibits and other specific locations in the park, assist with campaign-related petitions and crafts. Level 1 Interpreters will use activities to engage visitors of all ages and may also facilitate animal interactions at Touch Pool as needed. What are some of the responsibilities? Help facilitate fun, interactive conservation based activities at exhibits Engage guests of all ages in lively, interpretive talks and conversations on wildlife and conservation Assist with WCS Campaigns through related petitions and crafts; engaging guests in conservation action Facilitate animal encounters at the aquarium's Touch Pool as needed Level 1 Interpreter Volunteers should: Have an Enthusiasm for working with children and their families Have Strong improvisation skills with a flair for the theatrical Have an Appreciation for hands-on, creative activities Be Outgoing and Approachable Be Eager to learn and try new things Be Comfortable with handling live invertebrates Have the Ability to be on your feet for 4-6 hours (depending on shift), in all types of weather. Be Committed to sharing the WCS mission and message WCS Now Interpreter: Level 2 Volunteer Engage guests by facilitating interactive, conservation-based activities at exhibits and other specific locations in the park, assist with campaign-related petitions and crafts. Level 2 Interpreters will use activities to engage visitors of all ages, perform narrations at exhibits where none currently exist (TBD) and will educate guests in the aquarium's Aquatheatre pre-show engagement. All WCS Now Interpreters (Levels 1 and 2) may also facilitate animal interactions at Touch Pool as needed. What are some of the responsibilities? All that is listed for Level 1 Interpreters and... Perform narrations at exhibits where none currently exist Educate guests in the aquarium's Aquatheatre pre-show engagement Facilitate animal encounters at the aquarium's Touch Pool as needed WCS Now Interpreter- Level 2 Education Volunteers should: All that is listed for Level 1 WCS Now Interpreters and... Have Strong public speaking skills & memorization skills Demonstrate Flexibility, ability to observe and respond to animal behavior Be Comfortable using a microphone Have the Ability to be on your feet for 4-6 hours (depending on shift), in all types of weather. Be Committed to sharing the WCS mission and message Commitment Attend all of the 5 to 7 day training (depending on season) Volunteers commit to serving a minimum 2-4 shifts per week or month (depending on season). Full day or ½ day shifts; both set and open schedules available. Flexible scheduling We have shifts available Sundays through Saturdays (7 days). Morning shifts and Afternoon shifts available. Volunteers self-select each month the days and shifts they wish to volunteer Please visit our website at: http://nyaquarium.com/volunteering/education-volunteers for more information on the program, deadline, training dates, and to print an application. High School Students must also print a teacher recommendation form.
11224.title: WCS Now Interpreter Volunteer
11224.org: New York Aquarium - Wildlife Conservation Society

Education Volunteers engage and educate aquarium guests in a variety of ways. Whether they are connecting people to animals and nature at the park's touch pool, exploring conservation stories through interpretation at exhibits, or taking on active roles in conservation by assisting with campaigns- education volunteers are vital to the WCS mission to save wildlife and wild places worldwide. As an education volunteer, you will have the opportunity to meet individuals from around the world and join a family of fellow volunteers, staff, and wildlife experts who share a passion for our natural world. Volunteer duties include greeting clients, answering the front desk phone, taking and distributing messages, taking referral information from clients over the phone, and general clerical duties as needed. Lifting heay boxes is a required skill for this opportunitty.

As this archiving is all physical paperwork, you must be able to lift heavy boxes full of charts in order to properly archive them.

11224.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

11224.description: Purpose JASA is seeking a volunteer to lead a group of seniors through a variety of dances, providing valuable physical exercise while having fun with a lively group. Responsibilities * Lead a group of seniors in a weekly dance class * Create routines suitable for varied skill levels and physical abilities * Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills * Exercise/dance certification * Experience leading seniors in exercise/dance * Knowledge of line and/or folk dance * Comfortable leading a group of varying skill levels Other * Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week * Ongoing opportunity, weekday availability only * Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11224.title: Dance Instructor - JASA Luna Park Senior Center

11224.description: Visit a homebound senior in your area! Not only will you make a difference in their lives but you will learn so much form them! Feelings of loneliness and isolation can lead to serious consequences for senior health. Understanding the causes and risk factors for senior isolation can help us prevent it. Nobody relishes the prospect of aging without a spouse or family member at their side, without friends to help them laugh at the ridiculous parts and support them through the difficult times. Yet that is just what many seniors face. Many of our aging loved ones are feeling alone but you can change that by committing yourself to visit them for one hour a week! Learn more by visiting us at www.friendlyvisitingny.org and register online or call us at 718-449-5000 ext. 2212.
11224.title: Friendly Visiting
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: You can volunteer and make a real difference in a homebound individuals life in so many different ways. We are a dynamic and diverse group of volunteers who visit homebound individual in their area each week. Every member of our team is willing and eager to share their time with someone who is older, wiser, and has had a lifetime of experience.
11224.title: Exercise your heart and visit a senior!
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: Volunteer with Habitat for Humanity in Brooklyn! Over three years ago, Superstorm Sandy flooded parts of coastal Brooklyn. Habitat for Humanity NYC's Critical Home Repair program has been helping families rebuild, but many Brooklyn homes are still in dire need of repair before their owners can return home. Our volunteers are at the heart of everything we do and we need YOU to help us continue making an impact throughout NYC! As a volunteer you will have the opportunity to: Make your own schedule - volunteer as little or as much as you would like Receive on-site training in construction - learn new skills or enhance the ones you already have Meet other volunteers committed to affordable housing Give back to your community in an amazing way Make a positive difference in the lives of others No construction experience is necessary -- just enthusiasm! _______________________________________________________________ How to Sign Up: Learn more before signing up by visiting our website (habitatnyc.org) OR create a profile on volunteerhub and sign up for a volunteer orientation (see instructions below). Please note: orientations are optional and are not required for Construction volunteers. If you are ready to start making a difference, follow the steps below to create your volunteerhub account: 1. Log on to habitatnyc.volunteerhub.com 2. Click the \"Register\" button to create a new profile Choose a username and password Leave the Join Code field blank and click \"Next\" Input your full name, contact information, date of birth, and emergency contact's information 3. Select \"Construction\" and click on the event that interests you 4. Click on the \"Sign Up\" button and follow the directions to register for the event 5. You will receive a confirmation email letting you know you successfully signed up for a volunteer day! Please email volunteer@habitatnyc.org with any questions We hope to see you soon!
11224.title: Build with Habitat for Humanity in Brooklyn!
11224.org: Habitat for Humanity New York City

11224.description: If you live in Brooklyn or travel to Brooklyn on a weekly basis and can commit to one hour a week for at least 6 months, this is the program to be part of! You won’t regret it! The majority of our seniors live alone without any regular visitors. Having outlived spouses, siblings, friends, and even their own children, they are often extremely isolated. Almost every one of our seniors don't interact with anyone - ever - except the person who we match to visit them. Our Friendly Visiting program provides much-needed companionship for these homebound elderly in Brooklyn... but we need you! Visit us at www.friendlyvisitingny.org and find out more or simply enter your info on our site to be contacted. We will meet with you and match you with the senior that is right for you!
11224.title: Change a senior's day with a visit!
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island
