11030.description: During our CP Nassau's Golf and Tennis Tournament. Volunteers are needed to assist both and the course and off. We need hole watchers at 4 of the pars, as well as starters, and raffle attendants. The morning shift is from 7:00am - 12:00pm. Durign this shift you will be offered a large breakfast and a lite lunch. The evening shift is from 12:00pm - 5:00pm, in which you can help yourself to lunch. If you decided to volunteer with us all day you are welcome to breakfast, lunch and a seat at the banquet that evening. It truly is a fun summer event for a great cause.
11030.title: Golf and Tennis Tournament
11030.org: Cerebral Palsy Association of Nassau County, Inc.

11030.description: North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset is looking for caring people to join our \"MealTime Mate Feeding Program.\" MealTime Mate volunteers are specially trained to provide assistance and companionship to those patients who need help with their meals. Breakfast, lunch and dinner shifts are available 7 days a week. At North Shore University Hospital we believe that people deserve exceptional care. That's why patient experience is a central focus and the driving force behind our volunteer services department. Join our cause, make a difference, and become a volunteer.
11030.title: MealTime Mate Feeder Volunteer

11030.description: Women's Comprehensive Health Center in Manhasset is looking for vibrant, energetic people to greet patients, provide directions and escort as needed. If you are willing to give us a few daytime, weekday hours, we need your compassion and !

Basic knowledge of Microsoft office suite

This includes everything from idea generation, planning, coordinating internal and external parties involved, working with vendors, mapping out spaces, assisting with special guests and more. * Work occasional weekend events. SOCIAL MEDIA * Develop ideas to widen our social media reach * Create posts for our social media channels such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and others. PROGRAMMING * Assist with tracking of insurance forms, hold harmless agreements and signed rules and regulations documents. Focus on outreach to local organizations to bring in new talent including arts organizations, college and universities, etc. Track performer roster and update lists as new performers are added. Track website and security book to ensure that both entities have the most up to date information with performers’ headshots.

Provide support for on-going development activities including prospect research, grant writing support, build sponsor program administration, and program marketing. Serve as ongoing point of contact for event participants before and after their event day. Develop social media marketing, recruitment, and event updates for events including Facebook updates, tweets, and blog posts. Provide event participants with necessary documentation in a timely manner, including waivers, directional maps, volunteer FAQs, and other necessary documents. G. Manage participant and donor data in software programs. Attend and participate in event related activities and meetings.

10023.description: Do you want to SEE beyond the declining level of dialogue in the world to what (actually) is real in everyday items of news? This free news sheet is being made available by the Global Center for Human Change at a time when confidence in the veracity of even the basic facts about our world has sunk to an all-time low. 'The REAL News' shows the principles upon which constructive dialogue and the fashioning of a new world built on those principles can take place. It does NOT reflect partisan bias or seek to make any point about current political positioning - it is forward thinking only, beyond the current fixed line of conflict and critique. Do you want to SEE what (actually) is real in everyday items of news at a time when we urgently need to see clearly? Each week, 'The REAL News Team’, together with Philosopher and Writer, Richard A. Bowell, take a news story from around the world and show what really is occurring in these times within the context of our evolution and the way to contribute consciously to a new world. Volunteers will become trained in these sessions in the way to SEE what (really) is real in the news, beyond the alarmist or sensationalist portrayal of news we have grown to think is normal. Applications will be accepted until noon on Saturday, 20 May. Successful applicants will be invited to our live training session in New York City on Thursday, May 25 (8pm). JOIN us today! Never before have we needed to be able to SEE our human situation on this planet within the context of our evolution as NOW! Click here for a sample of our weekly news sheet: http://mailchi.mp/globalcenterforhumanchange.org/seeing-what-is-real-news-issue-1-may-1-993549 The Global Center for Human Change is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization in the USA.
10023.title: Seeking 20 Volunteers To Join Our News Team And Help Deliver The REAL News!

10023.description: Hours and days are flexible and negotiable. Majority of the work can be done remotely but volunteer will occasionally need to meet in-person with Freedom Ladder team members in the New York area. Duties and Responsibilities Prepares work to be accomplished by gathering information and materials Plans concept by studying information and materials Illustrates concept by designing rough layout of art and copy regarding arrangement, size, type size and style, and related aesthetic concepts Obtains approval of concept by submitting rough layout for approval Prepares finished copy and art by operating typesetting, printing, and similar equipment; purchasing from vendors Prepares final layout by marking and pasting up finished copy and art Completes projects by coordinating with outside agencies, art services, printers, etc. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Works in collaboration with the E-commerce Manager, Website Manager, Videographer/ Multimedia Manager and other staff to develop and implement strategic initiatives related to Freedom Ladder’s on-line presence If you have 5+ years of experience in graphic design, please send us your resume and portfolio to freedomladder@outlook.com . Include \"Graphic Designer\" in the e-mail subject.
10023.title: Graphic Designer

10023.description: Freedom Ladder currently seeks experienced education leaders (retired teachers, school administrators, etc.) who possess extensive knowledge of the NYC education landscape. Workshop leaders will work collaboratively with the Education Director to identify schools to conduct Freedom Ladder workshop sessions.
10023.title: Workshop Leader

10023.description: Purpose Help to ensure seniors are receiving warm, nutritious meals in a timely, orderly manner by assisting with set-up, serving and clean-up for weekday lunches. Responsibilities * Set tables before lunch * Portion food and serve meal to seniors * Clean up tables * Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills * Ability to work independently and as part of a team * Friendly personality * Ability to stand on feet for extended periods of time * Ability to lift up to 5 pounds and push a cart Other * Interest in nutrition * Minimum commitment of one day a week, Fridays * Ongoing opportunity for several months * Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
10023.title: Lunch Service Volunteer - JASA Club 76 Senior Center

10602.description: Help provide free pet food to economically challenged elderly, disabled, and veterans who can no longer afford to feed their pets. Hudson Valley Pet Food Pantry urgently needs volunteers to assist at Saturday pet food drives at local pet food stores and supermarkets, and other activities such as pantry stocking and food distribution, varying dates and times. No experience necessary. More experienced volunteers will accompany you and familiarize you with the group's activities. Help keep pets out of shelters, and help financially vulnerable people keep their best friend. EMAIL: hvpetfoodpantry@aol.com
10602.title: Help Feed Hungry Pets

10603.description: Volunteers are needed for Compeer, an award-winning program of Westchester Jewish Community Services that matches trained volunteers with individuals in mental health treatment who are in need of companionship. Compeer was founded in 1973 in Rochester, NY, and now has programs throughout the U.S. and Australia. Compeer volunteers receive support and guidance from program staff, and are invited to social events with their Compeer friends throughout the year. Volunteers commit to four or more hours per month for at least a year. Typically, volunteers and their Compeer friends go on outings to restaurants, movies, parks, libraries, museums and more. Compeer gives volunteers the opportunity to make a significant difference in the lives of people who are often isolated and lonely. For more information, please contact Laura Stein, MSW, Compeer Coordinator, at (914) 761-0600 X 208 or Lstein@wjcs.com.
10603.title: Make a Friend, Change a Life
10603.org: Compeer of Westchester Jewish Community Services

06830.description: Looking for volunteers with graphic design and marketing background to help update our website, create/edit promotional material and marketing projects.
06830.title: Graphic Design/Marketing

06830.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE The coordinator serves in an on-call capacity and coordinates the Red Cross's response to fires and other emergencies; serving as the direct line of communication with the Emergency Communications Center (ECC) and DAT members in the field; dispatching the volunteers that are on shift for response and providing remote support, coordinating lodging and activating Client Assistance Cards (CAC); making notification to other Red Cross activities as needed. This position typically does not physically respond to the disasters, but there are occasionally exceptions OPEN TIME DAYS Coordinators are expected to cover a minimum of one 12 hour on-call shift per week. ｠The maximum a Coordinator can work consecutively is 24 hours. ｠There are both day and night shifts available. ｠Sunday through Saturday. ｠Day shifts are 7:00AM-7:00PM; Night shifts are 7:00PM - 7:00AM REQUIRED TRAINING -DCS an Overview -Other classes as needed
06830.title: Leadership: (RP) Disaster Action Team On Call Coordinator
06830.org: American Red Cross - Greater New York Region

06830.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE Mass Care Service Associates provide for the immediate emergency needs of those affected by disaster in affected areas.This occurs through the activities of Sheltering, Feeding, Bulk Distribution, and Safe and Well Linking. OPEN TIME DAYS Shifts vary depending on disaster.｠ Requires a strong on-going commitment. REQUIRED TRAINING Red Cross Orientation Disaster Services: An Overview Basic Food Safety (online, selfpaced) Shelter Fundamentals Mass Care Workshops Career path provided by department
06830.title: Dedicate your time to a world class Disaster organization!: MNYN: Mass Care Volunteer
06830.org: American Red Cross - Greater New York Region

06830.description: Family Centers' Early Care and Education program is seeking volunteers who can assist in the classroom with children ages 3-5 years old. Volunteer sessions are available Monday through Friday in the morning between 8:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. or in the afternoon between 2:45 p.m. - 5:45 p.m. at one of two locations in Greenwich: The Grauer Preschool (40 Arch Street) or The Gateway Preschool (2 Chapel Street). All volunteers will be supervised by licensed early childhood education teachers, and will help facilitate activities and learning experiences for children between the ages of 3 and 5 years old. Interested volunteers should have some experience working with young children, and/or experience in an early childhood setting. All volunteers are required to come in for a personal interview and to complete an application. Volunteers must meet the minimum age requirement to volunteer (15), and those volunteers over the age of 18 must submit to a background check. Family Centers' Early Childhood Education Program is accredited by the NAEYC.
06830.title: Early Care and Education Classroom Assistants

06830.description: Greenwich Head Start and Family Centers' School Readiness Program (located at Armstrong Court in Greenwich) seeks dedicated volunteers to work in our classrooms with children ages 3 & 4 years old. Volunteers should enjoy being around young children in a preschool classroom setting and should be comfortable talking and listening to children with the ability to \"get down on their level\" both physically and mentally. Volunteers should enjoy books and stories that are age appropriate and also have the ability to \"ad-lib\", enhance stories and ask questions as they go. The goal of this volunteer position is NOT to teach young children to read, but to inspire good feelings about reading and books and to increase interest in reading and books both inside and outside the classroom. This volunteer position is very flexible and can take place either in the morning (between 9:30-12:00) or in the afternoon (between 3:30-5:30). The minimum age to volunteer is 15, and those volunteers over the age of 18 are required to complete a background check. All volunteers are asked to schedule a personal interview.
06830.title: Head Start/School Readiness Reading Volunteers

06830.description: Mega Blocks, Duplos, and Legos (o my!): Greenwich Head Start and Family Centers' School Readiness Program (located at Armstrong Court in Greenwich is always looking to expand our collection!! These materials are an excellent way for our children to develop fine motor skills and create mini-figure stories and scenes which inspire so much language! Dramatic Play: We are always looking for gently used dress up materials (skirts, lacy gloves, sports gear, heals and loafers, purses and wallets) to encourage the children to explore the different characters and roles in their lives. Loose Parts: We are looking for large tires to add to our back playground. These versatile materials can be used for climbing, jumping, stacking, creating an obstacle course* *Please note that loose parts materials must be able to be delivered directly to Armstrong Court Family Centers’ Site Manger will work directly with the donor regarding delivery of items
06830.title: Materials Drive for Greenwich Head Start/School Readiness Program

06830.description: Greenwich Head Start and Family Centers' School Readiness Program (located at Armstrong Court in Greenwich) are interested in afternoon volunteers (3:30 PM - 5:00 PM) to lead special group activities. Activities may include: dance, yoga, art, reading, introduction to sports, musical instruments, cooking and science. Volunteers would create and implement three to four mini classes (20 - 30 minutes in length) and visit each of our four classrooms. Throughout the day our children have opportunities to explore learning areas, but this volunteer opportunity could lead a teacher-direct/more focused activity. Our teaching staff would support the volunteer and partake in the class with the volunteer leader. Family Centers’ Site Manger will work with the volunteer details regarding space and supplies needed to make the visit a success. The minimum age to volunteer is 15, and those volunteers over the age of 18 are required to complete a background check. All volunteers are asked to schedule a personal interview.
06830.title: Preschool Recreational Activity Leader

06830.description: FamilyFIRST is a new collaboration between Family Centers and the Greenwich YMCA. This fall a number of students are enrolled and are committed to the program five days a week with a goal of closing the achievement gap by providing supportive services to them and their families. We are seeking High School Tutors to assist both K-5 students, as well as middle school age students who are attending this program. Tutors will provide academic support in math and reading for students on an as needed basis. Instruction and activities are designed expressly to promote subject mastery, develop grade-level competencies and to teach study skills. Tutoring shifts are available Monday through Friday from 3:30-4:30pm and is hosted at two locations: the YMCA located at 50 E. Putnam Avenue, and S t. Roch Church located at 10 St. Roch Avenue.
06830.title: FamilyFIRST Tutors

06830.description: Family Centers' Early Care and Education program provides full-day/full-year care, and offers the highest quality education and development opportunities for young children ages six-weeks to five years. At Family Centers, we accept each young child as a unique and valuable individual and group member, honoring and respecting family language and cultures. Our curriculum, goals and objectives guide our staff's ongoing assessment of children's progress, while facilitating each child's individual growth and language acquisition and cognitive, social-emotional, physical and creative domains . We are seeking a volunteer(s) to provide reception coverage in the program as assigned, assist in the administrative office by performing clerical duties including but not limited to: filing, answering the phone, completing assigned program specific paperwork. Office assistants will also tend to deliveries and visitors, represent the program positively in the community, and support their site manager with data entry (experience with Shine, Evolve and Teaching Strategies Gold). The hours for this position are flexible between 7am-6pm Monday through Friday. Volunteer shifts will be scheduled in blocks of 4-5 hours. The position is based in one of three locations in Greenwich: The Gateway School (2 Chapel Street), The Warburg Early Childhood Center (22 Bridge Street), or Armstrong Court Preschools (Armstrong Court).
06830.title: Program Receptionist/Office Assistant: Early Care & Education

06830.description: With over 45 trained volunteer facilitators, the Den for Grieving Kids provides vital services to families in lower Fairfield County creating a safe environment for children, teens, parents and caregivers to discuss their bereavement issues. On-going supervision and instruction help the facilitators develop their capacity to be a helpful presence to the bereaved. We offer two types of facilitator positions: the nights of service facilitator and the school based group facilitator. Nights of service facilitators are asked to commit to either a Monday or Wednesday evening schedule (meeting twice a month from 6:00-9:00pm). The evening consists of a pre and post meeting between facilitators and staff to both prepare and debrief about the interaction with participants. If interested, please reach out to Jennifer Flatow to receive the 2016-2017 Den calendar. School based group facilitators commit to a weekly schedule of about one hour onsite at their assigned school, with some preparation time required outside of the school visit. Currently there are Den groups taking place in 18 schools in the greater Greenwich/Stamford area. The time for this position varies slightly from week to week so students do not consistently miss the same class. If interested, please reach out to Jennifer Flatow to see a list of current school based group locations. The Den hosts an annual training for new and returning volunteers each fall. If you are interested in becoming a facilitator, please reach out to Jennifer Flatow, to inquire about becoming a Den Facilitator and receive the 2016-2017 Den calendar.
06830.title: Den Facilitators / Den for Grieving Kids

06830.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE To assist with follow up casework after the Red Cross responds to fires and other emergencies, ensuring that all of the appropriate data is entered in to the Client Assistance System and that the appropriate reviews are occurring. Support the Client Casework activity on a day to day basis. OPEN TIME DAYS 2- 8 hours｠ a week｠ or more if candidate has availability and if case loads are high. ｠ REQUIRED TRAINING Disaster Cycle Services: Overview Casework/Reponder workshop Recovery Services: An Overview Psycological First Aid, Basic CAS 2.0, ｠
06830.title: Casework, disaster relief: MNYN: Client Services Caseworker
06830.org: American Red Cross - Greater New York Region

06830.description: The Greenwich Department of Health is actively seeking to recruit both medical and non-medical public health volunteers in the community to assist during public health emergencies and related health programs. The Medical Reserve Corps program focuses on registering volunteers to staff mass dispensing clinics (e.g., dispensing antibiotics or vaccines) and to respond to threats ranging from pandemic influenza, bioterrorist attacks to severe storms such as super-storm Sandy. However, the MRC could be activated for a wide range of support services needed in the community, such as health fairs and seasonal influenza clinics
06830.title: Greenwich MRC Volunteer

06830.description: Supermarketing for Seniors is recruiting volunteer shoppers to help frail, elderly, and home bound seniors who live in Greenwich CT with their weekly grocery shopping needs. Volunteers are needed to shop once a week. Volunteers must possess a valid drivers license and a car. This program helps our senior population remain independent and living in their own homes. Your help is greatly needed and appreciated. Our shoppers will spend a minimum of 2 hours a week shopping for seniors. We are also looking for volunteers during the winter months to do light snow shoveling for seniors.
06830.title: Supermarketing for Seniors
06830.org: Jewish Family Services of Greenwich-Supermarketing for Seniors

10601.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
10601.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Cinema De Lux City Center in White Plains, NY!

11221.description: The Salvation Army of Greater New York provides free or very low-cost day care to families in need. We would like to give the centers a little facelift and need your help. No experience painting required, just the desire to make a difference and the motivation to work hard for a few hours. An experienced painter will be there to give instructions.
11221.title: Painters Needed to Beautify Daycare Center
11221.org: The Salvation Army - Brooklyn, NY (Bushwick Ave)

11221.description: This opportunity is available every Thursday morning! Help rescue bread, pastries, and other delicious food that would have been thrown out and help feed the hungry. This event lasts just 30 minutes and will end at St. John's Bread & Life, located at 795 Lexington Ave in Bedstuy. Mediumweight: the average amount of food rescued on this event is 15-30 pounds. Sign up directly on our website: Thursday 2/16/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16343 Thursday 2/23/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16344 Thursday 3/2/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16345 Thursday 3/9/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16346 Thursday 3/16/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16347 Thursday 3/23/17 http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/16348
11221.title: Fight Food Waste and Feed the Hungry in Bushwick every Thursday at 10AM!

11221.description: 826NYC hosts after-school tutoring Monday through Thursday from 3:00pm-5:30pm at the Williamsburg Library. Because it is a homework-help program, you will sometimes get to flex your writing skills, as well as your math, science, and history muscles. Don't worry if it's been a while since you've thought about the Pythagorean Theorem, though, staff and volunteers are always around to help! Tutoring offers the chance to give back to the community while also getting to know a bunch of awesome students and volunteers. Why not come check it out?
11221.title: Help NYC students as a tutor at the Williamsburg Library

07936.description: STEM Mentors act as coaches for the purpose of inspiring, motivating, and educating the students in a science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) subject matter. S/he answers student questions about the professional work environment. Staying with the same group of students throughout the day, and throughout each of the three visits during the school year, s/he is an ambassador for sponsor corporations. The Mentors makes themselves available to answer questions about the career application of the laboratory techniques being used and insures safety of the students. HOURS - 8:30am to 3:00pm on days when students are present.
07936.title: STEM Mentors

07936.description: STEM Instructors for Students 2 Science (S2S) are subject matter experts who provide instruction and guidance to students who visit the organization's $4 million laboratory in East Hanover where the students are able to conduct scientific experiments. The STEM Instructor provides information in a clear and concise manner, encouraging participation, helping to reduce the intimidation often associated with laboratory work, and shares his/her interest and/or passion for science. The Instructor strives to generate confidence and enthusiasm for the scientific technique being used while insuring the safety of participants. There are also Virtual lab opportunities for scientists serving as Instructors. HOURS-- 8:30AM to 3:00PM on days when students are present If you are interested, please apply at http://www.students2science.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=86&Itemid=251 or contact S2S at (973) 947-4880. To learn more about S2S, see our About Us video at https://students2science.wistia.com/medias/hbxylzpw5o. If you have additional questions, please email us at volunteers@students2science.org.
07936.title: STEM Instructors

07936.description: The STEM Lab Assistants assist students in following procedures; performing calculations, using instrumentation, and offers recommendations to instructor (after students have completed the program) for modifying experimental procedures. Lab Assistants insure safety of the students by monitoring student activities. HOURS-- 8:30AM to 3:00PM on days when students are present If you are interested, please apply on www.students2science.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=86&Itemid=251. If you have questions, please email us at volunteers@students2science.org. To learn more about S2S, click here: https://students2science.wistia.com/medias/hbxylzpw5o.
07936.title: STEM Lab Assistants/Mentors

11220.description: Provide a warm welcome to patients and families. Demonstrate professionalism, compassion and problem-solving. Assist same - day surgery patients and families navigate electronic tracking system. Provide information and escort patients and families to appropriate areas. Demonstrate the highest customer service experience for patients and families. Able to work with a diverse population including all age groups, ethnicities and genders. Assist in communication between the OR staff,Ambulatory Surgery Liaison and patients/families.
11220.title: Ambulatory Surgery Ambassador

11220.description: The NYU Lutheran ~ Super Sprowtz program is an engaging, fun way to teach kids and their families about healthy eating. The Super Sprowtz Volunteer will read stories, use puppets, coloring pages and other interactive material to engage and inform kids about vegetables with super powers and healthy eating as they wait in the Emergency Room and Family Health Clinics. Make a difference in a child's life, help them form good eating habits now, and keep a community healthy.
11220.title: Brighten a Child's Hospital visit - Be a Super Sprowtz Volunteer

11220.description: Join a group of dedicated clinical and non-clinical professionals who provide excellent patient and family care to a diverse population. As a specially chosen LMC volunteer in the Emergency Room, you will: Escort visitors within the ED Provide Friendly Visiting to patients and vistor Assist clinical staff as directed
11220.title: Action packed - Emergency Room Volunteer

11220.description: Floyd Bennett Composite Squadron is currently seeking private and commercial licensed pilots to perform missions for America. Homeland Security, Aerospace Education, Counter Drug Operations, Search and Rescue, Disaster Relief and other opportunities available. We operate the largest fleet of single piston engined aircraft in the world including Cessna 172 and 182 as well as Gippsland GA8 Airvans. Come be a part of the Eyes on the Home Skies. Locally, our aircraft operate out of FRG, ISP, HPN and TEB.
11220.title: Pilots
11220.org: Civil Air Patrol - Floyd Bennett Composite Squadron

11212.description: Project YOU, Formally known as, NYC Community Services is hosting our third annual, \"Lunch For Friends,\" on Monday July 4, 2017 from 11:00 AM -2:00 PM, at The Women in Need Facility located at: Junius and Liberty Shelter, 51/25 Junius Street, Brooklyn NY, to help give the families of our community who are in need a chance to celebrate Independence Day like millions of other families will We need volunteers and as many helping hands as possible From 9:30 am (for set up) - 3PM (for clean up) Please come out and help support a great cause!!! We especially need face painters, singers, arts and crafts instructors for the children so please share and email us your talents! We are also seeking a volunteer coordinator to help out with the event. I need the help! If available to volunteer please email us. We are getting shirts for all of the volunteers at this event and would need your sizes ahead of time. Food and drinks will be available for all volunteers. Please email Anne Marie annemarie@projectyouny.org or call 718-382-4424 ext. 114 Event Information: Location: 25 Junius Street Date:Monday, July 4 th 2017 Volunteer needed from: 10:00 AM - 3:45 (Flexible with different shifts) Event Starts: 11:00 AM - 3:00 PM Contact person: Anne Marie Grillasca annemarie@projectyouny.org or 718-382-4424 press coverage of last year's event https://projectyouny2016.wixsite.com/mysite https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ex5GRXKyE-A More about the event While most will be thinking of fireworks, and barbecues in celebration of our National Holiday, we want to focus our attention on those who may not have a warm meal. We will be serving free hot meals, snacks, and drinks to all those in need. In addition, we will be offering fun activities to engage the younger members of our community. Over a million New Yorkers will not be able to celebrate this 4th of July due to hunger and poverty. Help us bring light to the issue of hunger in our local community, which is not only a community issue, but a long standing issue within our society. So far, Project You \"Lunch For Friends\", is expecting over 1000 attendants from the local Women in Need Shelters in the Brooklyn area, as well as, other local community members and political leaders to speak. We thank you for your support. If your unable to attend the event and would like to make a donation please contact us at 718-382-4424 or at our website www.projectyouny.org
11212.title: Independence Day "Lunch for Friends" BBQ (July 4 2017) Volunteers Needed

11212.description: The Salvation Army of Greater New York provides free or very low-cost day care to families in need. We would like to give the centers a little facelift and need your help. No experience painting required, just the desire to make a difference and the motivation to work hard for a few hours. An experienced painter will be there to give instructions.
11212.title: Painters Needed to Beautify Daycare Center
11212.org: The Salvation Army - Brooklyn, NY (Riverdale Ave)

11212.description: The community and Brooklyn Public Library needs you. If you are a leader, having leadership experience, and can work with minimal supervision, becoming an executive on our Friends Group Board will be excellent for you. STATUS Instructors create their schedule, but must work for approximately 5 hours per week , unless told otherwise Position Description : Instructors are creative, crafty, or have a specific niche. They will work alongside BkMSCC staff members to help create tasks, request inventory, and assist in programing . Class sizes vary, with a minimum enrollment of 8 to 10 students preferred, and generally a maximum of 20 students (approximately a 10-1 student to teacher ratio maintained). Specific dutie s include, but are not limited to: * Participate in instructor meetings and training sessions. * Work closely with the Youth Programs assistant director to understand the process of program planning. * Develop an itinerary/ lesson plan that involves hands-on/minds-on learning. * I nstruct session in a student-centered environment while ensuring participant safety and well-being. * Submit all paperwork in a timely fashion (itinerary, budget, supply requests, and incident/injury reports). * Read, review, and follow guidelines outlined in the Instructor Handbook. * Enjoy working with students of ALL ages who are excited and inte rested in learning. * Maintain a positive work atmosphere by behaving and communicating in a manner that is successful in getting along with students, staff, partnering organizations, parents, and the public. * Data ent ry, volunteer hours tracking * Photographing sessions * Class promotion * organization * Strong communication skills (verbal and written). * Strong attention to detail. * Able to listen and communicate effectively with students of diverse backgrounds. * Dependable and punctual. * Self-directed and willing to take initiative. * Computer literate (familia r with Microsoft Office suite, google docs) Volunteer Benefits * Training and experience with managerial, back-end, and administrative procedures. * Opportunity to meet new people and help enhance Brooklyn neighborhoods. * Networking and community building opportunities. * Gain an awesome reference working with the Brooklyn Public Library and BkMSCC. LOCATIONS Pick preference or multiple: schools, library in ENY or Brownsville, office
11212.title: Adult & Youth Instructor (Art, life skills, development +)

11212.description: BkMSCC is seeking motivated educators , humanitarians, and those who want to help other. Those d edicated, ambitious, and committed to student success and education reform. Qualified candidates must demonstrate records of achievement, high degrees of personal responsibility, and the drive to do whatever it takes to ensure that every child achieves academic success. This individual must be committed to excellence, led by example, and see collaboration as a key component of success. Position Description You are the backbone of Brooklyn Multi-Service Community Center, Corp. You will help perfect our programs. This position is ideal for candidates that wish to fully pursue a crede ntialed lead teaching position, activism, and other community based programs. Becoming an educational associate serves as an internship for candidates who wish to develop their expertise through observation and experience in preparation for a meaningful and successful teaching career. QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS Applicants must possess strong communication and administrative skills; an understanding of arts education; the capacity to multi-task and to work independently; along with the ability to problem solve. Ideal candidates must also have a strong knowledge of photography-its history, techniques, and aesthetics. A familiarity with computer programs such as Microsoft Office and Photoshop are required. Must have excellent customer service skills and thrive in a high-energy, fast-paced environment. BENEFITS I nterns are also invited to attend private openings and artist talks. Part of programing. Compensation * Modest honorarium awarded to intern upon completion of internship * School credit/letter of recommendation Required education: * High school or equivalent
11212.title: Community and Instructional Programs

11212.description: ABOUT Great opportunity for a creative, ambitious college student or recent graduate looking to gain professional experience in all aspects of the event planning industry. Must be personable, detail-oriented, and comfortable working in a fast-paced work environment. STATUS Hours are flexible, but we prefer to set a definitive schedule with a minimum commitment of 15-20 hours per week. Can work virtually REPORTS TO Event Coordinator and or Board ACADEMIC CREDIT If intern wishes to receive academic credit for the internship, it will be the intern’s responsibility to make arrangements with his or her school. BkMSCC will provide the necessary job description and performance review upon request. POSITION SUMMARY The Intern serves as a key member of the Brooklyn Multi-Service Community Center, Corp. (BkMSCC) team. Upon completion of the internship, candidates leave with a foundation of knowledge for producing successful events and ideally have the tools with which to tackle producing an event of their own. Duties will include but are not limited to the following: Assist in all aspects of event coordination including planning, design, marketing, fundraising, and sponsorship Perform responsibilities as assigned at BkMSCC events (some evenings and weekends necessary) Meeting preparation: scheduling and coordination of appropriate materials for client and new business meetings Research new event spaces, restaurants, and resources related to our industry Office reception: answering phones, receiving deliveries, ordering supplies Mailings and list management: compiling and updating mailing lists, tracking RSVPs for events, and coordinating large mailings Being creative, collaborative, and having fun! Qualifications: Good writing and communication skills Strong computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Strong organizational skills and exceptional attention to detail Internet research Ability to handle multiple tasks Availability to work occasional evenings and weekends Interest in pop culture, food, arts, travel, health and wellness, and nonprofit fundraising Required education: High school or equivalent
11212.title: Event Planner

11212.description: The Volunteer Services Department at the Brookdale Hospital and Medical Center is seeking volunteers to participate in their Volunteer Child Life Program. The volunteers will assist the Child Life Specialist in providing a safe and developmentally appropriate environment for the children in the hospital. Volunteers are trained by a certified Child Life Speacialist in child development and hospital policies so they feel confident working with the children. Child Life volunteers work directly with the children and their families by bringing toys, games, crafts, movies, music or other resources to the children's room. Volunteers also bring childen to the playroom where they can play games and hold arts and crafts activities. We are seeking compassionate, caring individuals who enjoy working with children.
11212.title: Child Life Volunteer
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: TheBrookdaleUniversityHospitalandMedicalCenter’s Department of Volunteer Services, in conjunction with the Department of Pediatric Cardiology and the Live Light Live Right Program is launching a new program called \" Let’s Share\" Volunteer Program to assist the LLLR staff in training and educating the local community about health risks related to childhood obesity, poor food choices and lack of physical activity. Live Light Live Right (\"LLLR\"), an award winning childhood obesity program supported by the Robin Hood Foundation, treats children using a scientifically proven treatment model that transforms lives and achieves remarkable health outcomes.
11212.title: Let's Share Volunteer Program - Pediatric Obesity Community Education
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: The Brookdale University Hospital and Medical Center is seeking a bright, energetic individual to assist with External Affairs. The individual will possess excellent communications and computer skills, including graphics and web design. Candidate will be exposed to community affairs, public affairs, and health care administration.
11212.title: Community Affairs Intern
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

Greeters work collaboratively with hopsital and medical staff to help maintain our commitment to ALWAYS provide the highest personalized quality care and service excellence.
11212.title: GREETER PROGRAM
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.title: Pharmacy Partners Volunteer Program
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: The purpose of this volunteer program is provide assistance to patients being treated in the Emergency Department, their family members/escorts. Volunteers will interact with family members/escorts of those patients keeping them appraised of the patients' progress. Volunteers will provide only non-medical information. Other duties will include: * Escorting patients and or family members to treatment areas. *Providing general information to persons waiting in the Emergency Department, * Assisting medical staff with patients as needed.
11212.title: EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT CARING LINKS PROGRAM
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: To help improve the care of the dying patient by providing Comfort and Friendly Visiting, Advocacy between Hospital staff and patient/family, respect religious, spiritual and cultural values of patients at end of life.
11212.title: CARE-ing Doula
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: A hospital stay for a child can be a lonely, frightening experience. Reading books and telling stories can brighten a young persons hospital stay and stimulate the imagination. Volunteer are needed to read to pediatric patients at Brookdale University Hospital and Medical Center. You must be 18 years of age, and have a good command of the English language. Experience with children is highly preferred. Volunteers are required to commit to a minimum two hour shift one day per week and a total of 150 hours. To find out more about our reading program, or to inquire about other exciting volunteer opportunities, please call the Volunteer Services Department at Brookdale University Hospital and Medical Center at (718) 240-5277between 9:00am- 5:30pm, Monday through Friday.
11212.title: Bedtime Storybook Reader
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: Several volunteer opportunities exist in the hospital and/or nursing home. These include: Clerical, Surgical Advocate, Emergency Room, Pediatric Storybook Reading, Elderly Friendly Visiting, Pastoral Care, Book Cart, Recreation Therapy, plus more..
11212.title: VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNTITIES
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11213.description: Love soccer? Want to share the joy of the game with underserved kids in central Brooklyn? Join us for this exciting opportuntiy to create a brand new league for youth who need it in Crown Heights! Yes, you can empower youth and their families to get active in a neighborhood without many options. Help us build the first-ever youth Crown Heights Soccer League! Seeking anyone who can play soccer or support the program from July through December. Saturdays and Sundays, and possibly Thursday evenings. We are thinking to do a few sessions in JULY if volunteers step up. Have a few spare hours on the weekend or even Thursday eves? Have fun, play ball, make a difference. Yes, high school students are welcome and we give community service credits. Our program started in 2009 just to get kids active. Now, we want to build a league. Kids love it, but don't know the game. Help us create teams! We're also seeking LEAD COACHES, who can set up schedules and organize volunteers and parents. Great experience. Recommendation letters given. SCHEDULE - July (if possible) - tell us any dates you can do these hours in July FALL: Sept. 9 - Thanksgiving! THURSDAYS, 5 - 7 pm SATURDAYS, 1 PM - 3 PM SUNDAYS, 4 PM - 6 PM INFO: No coaching experience needed. Just love of the game and able to collaborate with others. Of course, we'd love it if you have experience... Practices are co-ed, and players range from 3 to 11 years old and are at beginner to intermediate level. If youi're self-motivated, love kids and are good with them, can handle the unexpected, and just love this game and want to share it, you're for us. Looking for reliable and flexible players who can commit to at least 2 practices. This is a great community service opportunity for high school and college students. Yes, we do give letters and service hours. WE ASK VOLUNTEERS TO COMMIT TO AT LEAST 2 TIMES ON THE FIELD. If you aren't able to coach, but still want to help, we need folks to: - advertise with flyers, post flyers, drop off flyers at schools and community areas for Crown Heights Fest - blast on social media - take attendance and register players - other administrative tasks Please send us information about you- a resume or some information on your backgrounds so we get to know you a little to soccer@seedsinthemiddle.org YOU CAN ALSO LIKE US ON FACEBOOK - Here's our pages: SEEDS IN THE MIDDLE BROOKLYN-CROWN HEIGHTS SOCCER Soccer for Harmony
11213.title: Soccer Players!  Share joy of game, help NEW league for underserved kids!

11213.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org/support/volunteer/adult-literacy-volunteer-tutor .
11213.title: Volunteer Information Session
11213.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11213.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org/support/volunteer/adult-literacy-volunteer-tutor.
11213.title: Literacy Volunteer Tutor Information Session
11213.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11213.description: LOVE TO GARDEN AND WANT TO SHARE THAT PASSION AND SKILL WITH KIDS? We have schools and teachers who want gardens and need help either during the school day... and help to maintain them over the summer months. These children live in food deserts and growing food is a way to ensure they get to eat fresh! If you can share your knowledge of gardening or environmenal education with eager students in Brownsville, BK, Crown Heights or Flatbush, contact us. Even two hours a week is helpful. Give us your schedule. But we are most looking for right now is: GARDENING TIMES Mondays - 8:30 - 12:30 Thursdays - 8:30 am - 2 pm If you have other times or can only do a few hours in these time slots, let us know. Also - HIP2B HEALTHY MARKETS if you want to help us run Hip2B Healthy Markets, where kids sell healthy snacks at school, please let us know. They usually run early morning before 8:30 am or 2-4 pm. KIds can sell their plants at the market, along with fun, fresh snacks like bags of strawberries, etc. Everything is 50 cents. WHAT TO DO - SEND RESUME OR BIO TO INFO@SEEDSINTHEMIDDLE.ORG and tell us what you want to do and what skills you have, and times you can commit YOU DON'T HAVE TO BE A SKILLED GARDENER - JUST LIKE TO HELP KIDS, AND LEARN WITH US. We're also creating a widespread healthy food box program in central Brooklyn. If you'd like to help farm or distribute or do anything related to this, let us know. We welcome healthy cooking demos, also. We need folks interested in education, nutrition, cooking, growing and more, or just want to do something good to address health and food disparities hurting underserved kids! All skills welcome. Just be reliable and a self-starter. Please send us a resume or tell us something about yourself. We are excited to hear from you. Tell us what you'd like to do and what experience you have and why you want to help. Send to info@seedsinthemiddle.org. We take all time commiments. Just make sure you commit to only what you can do! Yes, we do internships and community service letters. .
11213.title: Garden? Want to work with kids? Share green joy in Brooklyn

11213.description: Do you live or work in Crown Heights? We are looking for kind, patient, firendly volunteers who are interested in getting to know their frail and/or hombound older neighbors. Become a Friendly Visitor and spend a few hours a week walking and/or visiting with an isolated older neighbor who will benefit from your company!
11213.title: Crown Heights needs Friendly Visitors!

11210.description: The Brooklyn Apartment Programs offer transitional and permanent supported housing for adults 18 years of age or older who have a mental illness. Services are specially designed to meet the unique needs and goals of each individual resident, whether that means learning to take care of a home, seeking employment, or achieving educational goals. As a Client Companion, you will be a freind to one of the clients. This clients lives in Flatbush and likes to draw, color, read, listen to music and watch classic movies. We are looking for a volunteer to accompany the client on walks, promote a healthy lifestyle like cooking healthier meals and show encourgement to participate in fun activities.
11210.title: Client Companion - Brooklyn (Flatbush)
11210.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. This is a part-time 14-hours per week, unpaid telecommuting internship. The internship is 4-months and responsible for leading public and political outreach in the state and district assigned to. Key Responsibilities: - Must be available Mondays 4:30-6:00 PM PST for The Borgen Project’s national conference call. - Meet with members of Congress and/or Congressional staffers in your State and District. - Represent The Borgen Project at various business, political and community events. - Assist with fundraising. Create a personal fundraising campaign and meet targets. - Mobilize individuals to contact their members of Congress in support of key poverty-reduction legislation. - As needed, speak to groups, classes and organizations. - Write letters of support for key programs to political leaders, media and other groups. Qualifications: - Outstanding writing skills. - Self-starter who can produce great results with limited supervision. - Strong oral communication skills and ability to lead meetings and give speeches.
11210.title: Political Affairs Internship

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. This is a 12-week, part-time, unpaid internship. The selected candidate will be able to work from home and set their own schedule, but must meet weekly deadlines. Articles submitted will appear on BORGEN Magazine or The Borgen Project Blog. Key Responsibilities: - Interview sources and research topics in-depth. - Write 2 well-researched articles per week. - Communicate with editors and supervisors. - Assist with fundraising. Create a personal fundraising campaign and meet targets. - Attend national conference call and/or training every Monday at 4 - 5:30 PM PST. Qualifications: Strong journalism writing skills. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines with very little supervision. Experience writing for newspapers is helpful, but not required.
11210.title: Journalism Internship

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. This is a 12-week, part-time, unpaid internship. The selected candidate will be able to work from home and pick their own schedule, but must meet weekly deadlines. Articles submitted will appear on BORGEN Magazine or The Borgen Project Blog. Key Responsibilities: - Write 2 articles per week. - Research topics. - Assist with advocacy efforts. - Assist with fundraising. Create a personal fundraising campaign and meet targets. - Attend national conference call and/or training every Monday at 4 - 5:30 PM PST. Qualifications: Strong research and writing skills. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines with very little supervision. Experience writing SEO friendly content is helpful, but not required.
11210.title: Writer Internship

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. The Borgen Project is hiring an HR Intern who will work remotely. This human resources role will focus on national recruitment and updating job postings. Key Responsibilities: - Update job postings (80% of internship). - Inform groups and classes of openings. - Take on various tasks as needed. - Everyone who is part of the organization assists the team with fundraising, 25-hours of this position is dedicated to creating and implementing a personal fundraising campaign. - Assist with advocacy efforts. Details: This is an unpaid internship, although college credit is available. The HR internship is 16-hours per week for 12-weeks. Must meet weekly deadlines and be available Monday evenings 5-6PM PST for meetings and national conference calls.
11210.title: HR Internship

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. The Borgen Project is hiring a Public Relations/Marketing Intern who will work remotely. This public relations intern will be involved in a variety of aspects of marketing and communications. Key Responsibilities: - Create a branding campaign. - Conduct an informal focus group and gather feedback for market research. - Pitch story ideas to print, broadcast and digital media. - Create and implement a fundraising strategy. - Plan, market and present at an informational meeting. - Utilize social media and develop strategies for web-based messaging. - Assist with The Borgen Project's advocacy efforts. - Take on assignments as needed. Details: This is an unpaid internship, although college credit is available. The internship is 16-hours per week for 12-weeks. Must meet weekly deadlines and be available the first Monday evening of the month, at 5pm PST for meetings.
11210.title: Public Relations/Marketing Internship

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. You don’t need to be a lobbyist to help influence foreign policy. As a Regional Director, you’ll serve as a Borgen Project Ambassador in your city - mobilizing your friends, family and colleagues to contact Congress in support of key poverty reduction legislation. This is an unpaid, volunteer position. Key Responsibilities: - Attend one (30-60 minute) national conference call per month: 5PM PDT 6PM MDT 7PM CDT 8PM EDT - Meet with local congressional leaders and lobby for legislation that improves living conditions for the world’s poor. - Mobilize people in your community to contact their congressional leaders to support poverty reduction legislation. - Manage and implement fundraising campaigns. - Build a network of people engaged in the cause. - Serve as The Borgen Project’s ambassador in your city. Qualifications: - Basic understanding of U.S. Politics and international development. - Highly organized with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks while managing their work time efficiently. - Strong team player that loves to bring new ideas to the table. - Ability to demonstrate frequent independent judgment with decisiveness. - Excellent overall communication skills: oral, written, presentation.
11210.title: Regional Director

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. This is a great entry-level volunteer position for someone looking to be part of The Borgen Project. Advocates can operate from anywhere in the U.S. This is an unpaid, volunteer position. Key Responsibilities: - Attend one (30-60 minute) national conference call per month: 5PM PDT 6PM MDT 7PM CDT 8PM EDT - Serve as an ambassador for the world’s poor. Build awareness of the issues and ways people can help. - Manage and implement fundraising campaigns. - Represent The Borgen Project in your city - attend events and engage people in the cause. - Contact congressional leaders in support of key poverty-reduction programs. Qualifications: - Excellent overall communication skills: oral, written, presentation. - Ability to self-manage and prioritize assignments.
11210.title: Advocate

11211.description: RoHo Compost will be collecting food waste from the Smorgasburg events in Brooklyn. This include their Williamsburg and their Prospect park locations. Smorgasburg is an annual food festival. We are looking for volunteers to help us guarantee that all food waste ends up in the appropriate bins. This will require some interaction with event goers and kitchen staff.
11211.title: Support Composting Efforts in Brooklyn!

11211.description: RoHo Compost will be collecting food waste from the Smorgasburg events in Brooklyn. This include their Williamsburg and their Prospect park locations. Smorgasburg is an annual food festival. We are looking for volunteers to help us guarantee that all food waste ends up in the appropriate bins. This will require some interaction with event goers and kitchen staff.
11211.title: Fight Climate Change by Diverting Food Waste

11211.description: Bring your experience in fundraising and communications to help secure philanthropic support for a legal services non-profit. Established in 1968, Brooklyn Legal Services Corporation A (Brooklyn A), advances social and economic justice and community empowerment through innovative, collaborative, neighborhood-based legal representation and advocacy. We assist individuals, families, community-based organizations, and coalitions in sustaining and developing vibrant, healthy communities. The Development and Communications volunteer will work as a part of the Development and Communications Team which consists of the Director and two AmeriCorps VISTA volunteers. You will assist in executing the annual Development Plan. This is an excellent opportunity to utilize your skills in fundraising, communications and non-profit management. Responsibilities of the Development and Communications Volunteer Develop resources to retain existing donors, recapture lapsed donors, develop new donors, and increase gift size. Help develop and execute a communications program including but is not limited to generating online content that engages audience segments and leads to measurable action. Support the grant proposal development and submission process - ensuring that proposals, reports and other documents are well written, strategic, and submitted on schedule; Assist in creating and executing a strategy for a large sustained base of individual giving. Knowledge, Skills, Qualifications (Required): Prior work experience Strong interpersonal communication skills and be motivated Self-starter able to work independently and as a team player Strong writing, organization and multi-tasking skills; as well as creativity The ability to multi-task, handling logistics and follow through on multiple projects at the same time Adaptable to changing environments and multiple deadlines Microsoft Office skills including Word, Excel, PowerPoint required Application Process: Please send a cover letter, resume, short writing sample (no more than 3-pages) as soon as possible to sferrell@bka.org with \"Development & Communications Volunteer\" in the Subject Line. The position is expected to be filled immediately. No phone calls, please. We strongly encourage people of color, of diverse gender identities, women, and LGBT persons to apply.
11211.title: Experienced Development and Communications Volunteer

11211.description: We are looking for a volunteer chef or someone who really enjoys cooking, to teach a small group of 10 people to prepare healthy low cost meals to individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Time commitment: Once a week or 2 or 3 times a month depending upon your availability. You will cook at an industrial Kitchen located in Williamsburg Brooklyn.
11211.title: Volunteer Chef to prepare healthy, low cost meals

11211.description: Purpose Regular exercise is an essential part of a healthy lifestyle. Lead a weekly zumba class for seniors to help keep them in shape. Responsibilities * Lead a group of seniors in a weekly zumba class * Create routines suitable for individuals with varied physical abilities * Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills * Relevant exercise certification * Experience leading seniors in exercises * Experience with group exercise classes * Patience and sense of humor * Comfortable leading a group of varying skill levels Other * Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week * Ongoing opportunity * Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11211.title: Zumba Instructor - JASA Cooper Park Senior Center

11211.description: Time's Up! is a 27-year-old grassroots non-profit environmental organization located in New York City. Time's Up! organizes hundreds of educational workshops, events, and campaigns to promote environmental sustainability. We are currently seeking an Assistant to the Director Intern. Applicants must be flexible, computer savy, and fluent in English, with excellent writing, proofreading, and organizational skills.The position involves working in several different locations in lower Manhattan and Brooklyn, assisting the director in a variety of activities, including setting up events, managing spaces, organizing committees and meetings, and communicating with other organizations and volunteers. Commitment is approximately 15-20 hours per week (flexible hours). Time's Up! has a unique structure in that it is operated 100% by volunteers and has an incredible track record of accomplishment. This is an excellent opportunity to learn how a grassroots organization can effect substantial change. Please see our website at: http://times-up.org/
11211.title: INTERN- Time's Up! Assistant to the Director

11211.description: Time's Up! is a 27-year-old nonprofit environmental organization located in downtown New York City and Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Time's Up! is currently seeking a Volunteer Coordinator. This position involves overseeing and updating our volunteer database and identifying/recruiting prospective qualified volunteersto fill open volunteer positions. This position requires excellent organizational, communication, and computer skills. Experience with Gmail and FileMaker Pro or other database experience is preferred. The Volunteer Coordinator may also help with designing and implementing HR policies. Check out our website http://www.times-up.org
11211.title: Time's Up! - Volunteer Coordinator

11216.description: John J Joyner Jr (D) Candidate District 36 Bedford Stuyvesant & Northern Crown Heights. ( Field department ) Campaign Manager Position Filled Field Manager - 1 Field team 30-up The field department focuses on the \"on-the-ground\" organizing that is required in order to personally contact voters through canvassing, phone calls, door to door canvasses and other campaign events. ( Fundraising department ) Fundraising operations director 1 Fundraising team 1-5 The finance department coordinates the campaign's Fundraising operation and ensures that the campaign always has the money it needs to operate effectively. ( Legal department ) Legal Department Coordinator 1 Legal Team 1-5 The legal department makes sure that the campaign is in compliance with the law and files the appropriate forms with government authorities. This department will also be responsible for all financial tracking and implementation of document into systems ; making sure that the campaign's activities are legal. ( Technology department ) Chief Information Technology Officer 1 Technology Team 1-5 The technology department designs and maintains campaign technology such as websites, social media managing all visual communications and ensuring consistency of campaign materials/merchandise (both print and digital) through web design, graphic design, advertising, promotional items, working closley with the fundraising department. ( Scheduling and Event Department ) Scheduling coordinator 1 Scheduling team 1-5 The scheduling and advance department makes sure that the candidate and campaign surrogates are effectively scheduled. The scheduling coordinator is responsible for developing and executing with the scheduling team events. The scheduling coordinator manages the candidate's personal and campaign schedule Setting up interviews between the candidate and reporters, and perform other tasks involved in press relations , insure that the campaign responds quickly to the attacks of the other campaigns, constantly monitoring candidates.
11216.title: Volunteer with Vote 4 JJJJR Campaign Representing Bedford Stuyvesant & Northern Crown Heights

11216.description: SMART Recovery NYC is looking for volunteers interested in facilitating meetings. You do not have to have been through a recovery program in order to volunteer for SMART. Facilitator training will be provided free of charge for interested parties. Alternate volunteer opportunities can be found on our website: www.smartrecoverynyc.org
11216.title: SMART Recovery NYC Volunteer

11216.description: Children of Promise, NYC (CPNYC) seeks additional members for the Executive Board of Trustees to increase the capacity of its Board of Directors and act responsibly as a steward of the organization’s mission to embrace the children of incarcerated parents and empower them to break the cycle of intergenerational involvement in the criminal justice system. This is a special opportunity to help shape the course of a nonprofit organization management and fund development Children of Promise, NYC offers an innovative and unique after-school program and summer day camp, the only one of its kind in New York City, specifically designed to meet the needs, interests and concerns of children left behind by parents serving time in prison. We are looking for Executive Board of Trustee members who can: Raise awareness and act as an ambassador for CPNYC Create partnerships with various respected businesses/individuals Engage with the community Role and Responsibility: Host at least one small \"Friendraiser\" event consisting of 5-10 contacts that you would like to introduce to the agency Contribute a Give/Get of $5,000 annually Arrange agency site visits and meetings with Founder and President for at least two (2) prospective supporters In addition to the above responsibilities, CPNYC seeks board members who: Act as an ambassador for the organization, interpreting its mission and values to the community, professional and personal networks Attend 85% of the Board meetings, committee meetings and organization’s special events Make a meaningful personal financial contribution Stay up-to-date with the status of the program and it’s support offerings Are active participants in policy-making discussions, stay informed of best practices Send letter of interest and CV/Resume to President & Founder, Sharon Content, at scontent@cpnyc.org
11216.title: Seeking Active and Engaged Executive Board Members

11216.description: Food Not Bombs Mission Statement:Food Not Bombs recovers and shares free vegan or vegetarian food with the public without restriction in over 1,000 cities around the world to protest war, poverty and the destruction of the environment. Each group is independent and invites everyone to participate in making decisions for their local chapter using the consensus process. Food Not Bombs is dedicated to taking nonviolent direct action to change society so no one is forced to stand in line to eat at a soup kitchen expressing a commitment to the fact that food is a right and not a privilege. With over a billion people going hungry each day how can we spend another dollar on war? Hello Neighbor,I'm a volunteer with Long Island Food Not Bombs (LIFNB.com).We have Free Food Shares (Free Food, Clothing, Books, Baby Items, Household Items, Art, etc.) throughout Long Island and Brooklyn. Depends what donations we get from stores, churches, neighbors and volunteers. Usually there are fruits, vegetables, milk, dairy, bread, cakes, pies, canned and dry goods, pet food, etc. We also have clothes, household & baby items, books, art, etc. depending what is brought to the Food Shares that day.Ask for Volunteer Jon or Vincent if you have something to share. Say hello for me. Thank you, Volunteer Dennis A new release video: We start at 13:55: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fixP0UR_G_UCraigslist Post:Free \"Long Island Food Not Bombs\" Food SharesEvery Sunday at 2 PM, West Columbia Street & Station Plaza, Hempstead, NY 11550Every Tuesday at 7 PM, East 6th Street & Fairground Avenue, Huntington NY 11746Every Thursday at 7 PM, Horseblock Road & Woodycrest Drive, Farmingville, NY 11738Every Saturday at 12 PM, noon, 1556 Straight Path, Wyandanch, NY 11798Every Saturday at 3 PM, Lafayette Ave & Marcy Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11216All outdoors. Rain or Shine. No umbrellas or strollers by tables.Come Share With Your Community.Free Food, Clothing, Books, Baby Items, Household Items, Art, etc.Whatever is brought by our Volunteers, You (if you can) and Your Neighbors in Your Community.A Community is its Neighbors, not the towns they are in.Get there a few minutes before start time. Help us unload our Volunteers vehicles and set up tables.Bring empty bags, food, clothing, household items, baby items, books, etc to \"Share with Your Community\".See Volunteers if you do bring items to Share, or you want to volunteer to hand food and items out. Say hello for me, Dennis. Nothing to bring? Then bring yourselves.We'll help you get food and items you need. You don't need to bring any type of papers or ID to our Food Shares.Everyone is welcome to get Free Food, Clothing, Household Items, Baby Items, Books, Art, etc. Depends what is brought by our volunteers and other neighbors to share.We average 8,000 pounds of food and merchandise each Food Share.Just please be polite with your neighbors when we Share.We will not tolerate any type of racial slurs or bigotry.Please thank and help our Volunteers by taking recyclable cardboard (boxes to take home your food and items). Put out on your recycle day for pick up.More info go to our website: LIFNB.com Start Sharing:1) Pass this on to family, friends and neighbors in your community. 2) Copy flyers at LIFNB.com or this Craigslist post. Hand them out. Schools, Libraries, Senior Centers, Churches, Stores, etc.3) Maybe you are an owner, manager or employee of a store, supermarket, distributor, wholesaler, farm, or manufacturer. Do you have soon to be expired food, drinks and/or merchandise you will be throwing out?Help us help you save money. Less carting fees. Great Community Relations.Call the Hotline (631) 223-4370 - 10 AM - 2 PM.4) Next time you are in a store where you shop. Ask the owner or manager if they would like to donate soon to be expired food, drinks and/or merchandise they will be throwing out shortly. We'll pick up and they save money on carting fees and help the community. Give our Hotline Number (631) 223-4370 - 10 AM - 2 PM.5) Share on Facebook:\"Friend\" - Li FNB\"Like\" - Long Island Food Not Bombs6) Become one of our volunteers. Come and join us.No Food Shares in your area, volunteers will help you start one.We are not affiliated with any religion, church or political party. Community churches do donate food and items to our Food Shares.\"Long Island Food Not Bombs\" is the largest \"Food Not Bombs\" in the World.We do all this with no government funding, all volunteers. Volunteer to help us obtain funding.We are always in need of Plastic Folding Tables for our Food Shares. Donate when you can at: http://www.LIFNB.comThank you, Volunteer Dennis Peace
11216.title: Brooklyn Food Share - LIFNB

11216.description: Become a Volunteer Children of Promise, NYC (CPNYC) is a Brooklyn based non-profit organization committed to embracing and empowering the lives of children of incarcerated parents to break the cycle of intergenerational involvement in the criminal justice system. Volunteers contribute skills, time, knowledge, perspective and personal connections towards the advancement of CPNYC. Your support as a volunteer s is vital to the organization's growth and health. BECOME A MENTOR Mentor an individual child - mentoring works! Studies show that students who have a mentor are 52% less likely to skip school and 46% less likely to start using illegal drugs. 11217.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3)non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 4-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. After a very incredible and successful year and in order to help as many kids as possible, we are seeking a Public Relations Coordinator/Manager volunteer who can commit 15-20 hours per week for a minimum of 3 months(150 hours). Responsibilities: Working with a small team, conceptualize and implement traditional and social media strategies and campaigns aimed at generating coverage of AFB's programs, key advocacy issues and marketing and celebrity-driven campaigns. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Produce blogs and other content for external publication. Edit commentaries produced by other AFB staff. Coach and supervise PR Intern Assistants. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Expand and nurture AFB's mainstream and social media network. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Build and manage our Twitter-sphere. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Help manage the AFB's media database, build lists and track media coverage. Qualifications: Excellent writing and editing skills with ability to produce polished and compelling copy on tight deadlines Creativity in tapping and cultivating mainstream media and social networking communities Keen insight into the news business and understanding of what makes journalists tick Proven ability to identify and market good story ideas Prefer candidate with local or hyperlocal media relationships A positive, energetic and proactive multi-tasker who can work independently or very collaboratively, as part of a team Ability to work effectively, efficiently, diplomatically and calmly in a high-pressure environment on issues that are often complex and politically sensitive Strong listener, with a high degree of professionalism and flexibility, including the ability to prioritize and effectively manage assignments in a timely fashion
11217.title: PR Social Media Coordinator

11217.description: Looking for a fun experience this summer? Help be an usher, front of house or assistant director for our theatre shows. Great for early education majors, or theatre majors. Several days per week, flexible schedule. Nice staff and fun opportunity. Mostly mornings through 2pm. Meet lots of fun people. Very people oriented opportunity. Please email your resume along with a few sentences explaining your interest in this internship.
