10031.description: The videographer will work as part of the marketing/social media unit to develop a marketing campaign that engages our existing stakeholders, and grows our digital presence through film profiles of current and past tutors. We are seeking a videographer who is able to 1) work with the marketing team to produce video packages that profile tutors 2) communicate with the marketing team to understand the actions in the script and locations of scenes 3) keep the camera steady 4) be familiar with shooting from different angles (wide angles, medium angles, and close-ups) 5) edit the video footage (fixing background noises, overlapping videos and sounds, etc.) Skills Needed - Video production - Video editing Requirements & Commitments There will be multiple video shoots to profile the tutors and the time requirement for each video may vary (depending on scheduling and editing of videos)
10031.title: Videographer for the Social Media/Marketing Unit

10030.description: Behind the Book is a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to love reading. We bring accomplished authors into high-needs pre-K-12 classrooms, where they guide students in creating their own writing and art projects. Our rich, innovative programs, which are part of the class curricula and meet Common Core Learning Standards, have a record of building literacy skills and creating engaged, motivated readers at schools around the city. BtB is looking for volunteer photographers and videographers to document students and authors during classroom workshops and field trips. This is a challenging task involving several children and a lot of activity, so it's a plus if you have experience with pre-K to high school-age students. Photographers may also cover events for fundraising and events. Images might appear in social media, organizatio publications, and/or the books written and illustrated by our students as their classroom projects. To apply, or for more information, please contact volunteer@behindthebook.org. Include a link to your website, portfolio or samples of your work.
10030.title: Photographer/Videographer

10030.description: Are you an evangelist for getting more girls and young women interested in STEM? Have a knack for teaching or encouraging students to try new things?Then this is the perfect activity for you! Come join us in events that is geared to inspiring young women and girls to BE all they can be. The theme of the overall summit: Mind, Body, Spirit. STEM Kids NYC will be facilitating hackathon workshops throughout the summer, called STEM-Fabulous!, which will be a series of hacktivities that include: 1. Building an app that addresses an issue affecting young women and girls 2. Designing chemical free skin care products 3. Engineering an invention that will revolutionize the ___ industry (the young engineers will fill in the blanks) No STEM experience necessary. We are looking to involve as many volunteers who can serve as those 'holding the space' and supporting the STEM-Fabulous participants in using their creativity and ingenuity to make things that inspire their mind, body, and spirit.
10030.title: Young Women and STEMpowerment!

10030.description: We're looking for Raspberry Pi GURUS who have the ability, fluidity, and patience to work with students in grades 3-8, with instruction on creating with Raspberry Pi. The creations will be entered into a competition where they will be judged on creativity and Ingenuity. You will utilize the existing creativity that already exists within the spirits of children, as well as their knack for apps and video games, and channel this energy into supporting them in learning program on Raspberry Pi. If you are into Scratch, Raspberry Pi, JAVA, or HTML, this is a PLUS. Come contribute your mastery to increase the interest in STEM in our students in HARLEM!
10030.title: Make Fun With Raspberry Pi!

10030.description: Do you have a love for Science and engaging in hands-on science activities with students? Do you enjoy speaking with students about what you do? Then join us at least once, or frequent our STEM Kids NYC Science Cafe that will open on alternate Fridays throughout the year. In this cafe, which will be run mostly by the students, you'll have the opportunity to share your love for Science and engage with them on a hands-on activity that supports what you do for a living, or some other area in Science you have a penchant for. Don't worry about teaching! You'll receive all the support you need from us who will develop the lessson plan around your expertise, and be there with you to help facilitate the sessions. Your presence and contribution of mastery is invaluable in helping students tap into their natural ability for Science, as well as enable them to develop their own identify around being a Scientist themselves. Your time commitment would be for a 3 hour segment for one or multiple Fridays. It's your choice. Thank you in advance for your consideration!
10030.title: Calling All Scientists! Join Our Student Science Cafe!

10030.description: We're looking for instructors who have the ability, fluidity, and patience to work with students in grades 6, 7, and 8 with instruction on app development, website development, robotics, or game development. You will be on the cutting edge of teaching computer science concepts, as less than 10% of New York City and Northern New Jersey public schools has a computer science curriculum! What's more, 10% of US schools have a computer science curriculum. You will utilize the existing creativity that already exists within the spirits of children, as well as their knack for apps and video games, and channel this energy into supporting them in learning wireframing, weibsite, app & game development. We operate within an afterschool model, in that schools and community based organizations utilize our expertise to provide quality programming to their students and program participants. Your schedule and availability will be matched with the school or community-based afterschool program. If you are into Scratch, Arduino, JAVA, or HTML, this is a PLUS. Come contribute your mastery to increase the interest in STEM in our students in Harlem!
10030.title: Scratch, HTML, JAVA Instructors Needed - NYC!

10033.description: Our program depends on a lot of volunteer labor for many jobs and tasks. Our population is diverse and many of the parents of our students speak only Spanish. We need a point person to co-ordinate all of the volunteers, motivate them and train them and make sure all jobs are covered each week. This person should be outgoing and friendly, very organized, and needs to be bilingual Spanish/English. A major part of our mission is community building, and this is a crucial role for accomplishing that. We want all parents and other volunteers to feel like a part of the team and important to our organization's work in the community.
10033.title: Volunteer Coordinator

10032.description: The City Tutors (CT) is looking for tutors to provide academic support in reading and writing for the Sugar Hill Project’s Homework Club in the Fall semester of 2017. Sessions meet three times each week on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays. The sessions run from 3:00 - 5:30 PM. This is a great opportunity for students who are majoring (or have already earned a degree) in the course area to enhance their knowledge and experience and who are interested in tutoring. In this role, you would take the lead to improve students’ performance while being supported and guided by City Tutor’s coordinators. The tutor for Sugar Hill Project’s Homework club is expected to commit a minimum of an hour and a half to support one of the above-mentioned days. You would identify and support students who are struggling, and provide feedback to students so that they may improve their fundamental understanding of the material. You might also design assignments, identify/track students who are struggling and create differentiated instruction as the need arises. You will be supported throughout this process by the City Tutors staff. All tutors are also expected to complete a four session comprehensive, professional training regimen. 6 hours of live training, plus another hour and a half for orientation. This is a commitment of 7.5 hours of in person training, and 4 hours of supplemental training for a total of 11.5 hours of training over the course of the Fall semester. Training days will be determined based on your schedule and that of the Tutor Training Coordinators. CT's tutoring program has been successful in helping students gain access to support that they otherwise would not have received, given their limited time spent on campus. Having tutors in these sessions early in the semester will allow us to employ strategies to reduce withdrawals and student failure rates. Your work with us would help the students’ overall subject area performance, and help us improve this educational support model, reaching more students and departments with comprehensive academic support. Learn more about Sugar Hill Project here: http://www.bhc.org/sugarhill/ To apply, you must: Have received an A- or A in the introduction to the subject course you are applying to tutor Have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have completed a degree program Submit monthly reports, keep a log sheet of any tutoring appointments done outside of class, and regularly communicate with the tutor training coordinator.
10032.title: Fall 2017 Reading/Writing tutor needed for Sugar Hill Broadway Housing Communities

10032.description: The City Tutors (CT) provides in-class academic support for a 9th grade algebra class (a total of little more than 30 students) at Community Health Academy High School (located a block away from the 157th stop on the 1 train). The teacher has really enjoyed working with City Tutors, and we would like to continue to support her course in Fall 2017. The times of the classes are to be determined. This is a great opportunity for individuals who have a strong foundation in the material, and are interested in gaining practical experience working in the classroom. As an embedded tutor, you will collaborate with an instructor to improve students’ performance, while being supported and guided by an experienced academic support professional. All embedded tutors commit three hours for the week. You will sit in on the class, and sometimes provide tutoring support after class (or on a different day if that's more agreeable) depending on students’ availability and interest. You will speak with the instructor weekly to prep for the next class and debrief after the Wed session. You would identify and support students who are struggling and provide feedback to the instructor regarding students' concerns and difficulties that can lead to changes in future lessons. You might also design assignments, identify/track students who are struggling and create differentiated instruction as the need arises. CT's embedded tutoring program has been successful in helping students gain access to support that they otherwise would not have received. Your work with us would help the students’ overall subject area performance, and help us improve this educational support model at the site. To apply, you must: Have received an A- or A in the introduction to the subject course you are applying to tutor. Have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have received a degree recently. Be willing to complete 11.5 hours of College Reading and Learning Aligned (CRLA) training at City College of New York. We can accommodate your schedule for the training sessions.
10032.title: Fall 2017 In-Class Tutoring Support for a 9th Grade Algebra Class

10032.description: Are you age 61 or older? Would you like to help scientists learn about language? Please consider participating in our research study! Study involves approximately 2 hours of interesting pencil and paper language tasks and you will receive $40 for your participation. Location: Either Columbia University Medical Center (transportation costs reimbursed) or your home at your convenience! Requirements: Must be in good health (e.g. no neurological or psychiatric disorders) and must be age 61 or older. Please call Alicia at (212) 305-1801 or email at aw2165@columbia.edu to learn more about the study
10032.title: Paid Research Study - Adults Ages 61 and Older
10032.org: Columbia University Medical Center/National Center for Children in Poverty

10032.description: Sunrise on Wheels brings the fun of day camp to children in hospitals. We play games and toys with children, have arts and crafts projects and we seek to help the children get through a very difficfult day with a little fun and laughter.
10032.title: Sunrise on Wheels Hospital Volunteer

07738.description: Volunteer for iCan Bike, a program that teaches individuals with disabilities to independently ride a conventional two wheel bicycle over the course of five days. Volunteers, aged 16 or older serve as spotters for the riders, walking/light jogging alongside their camper. They help the rider to learn, keep their balance, steer, and most of all offer encouragement and motivation. The same two spotters work with the same child all week, so they truly share in the pride and joy of their success at the end of the week!! From increasing self esteem, to more inclusion in the community, to more physical fitness, to independent transportation, you will be helping these individuals in countless ways! Check it out: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5d82gFzxJOw&feature
07738.title: Help a child with a disability learn to ride a bike!
07738.org: iCan Bike! (formerly Lose The Training Wheels)

07738.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New Jersey citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
07738.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Central NJ

08820.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers.

Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. 08820.description: Mentoring needy children while teaching basketball skills and drills that will stick with these kids for the rest of their lives. Setting an example as a role model while teaching kid's lessons about life through sports. Many children never have the opportuniity to play in a team setting because of the lack of finances, health challenges, or fear. This is where you will have an opportunity to help a child soar to their life goals and guide them through the process.
08820.title: Basketball Coaches Needed for Youth

08820.description: Get Fit / Equipped to Rid Diabetes program Offers children from 5 years to 21 years the opportunity to engage in physical fitness exercises to combat diabetes and obesity. What are the health risks for children who are overweight or obese? Doctors and scientists are concerned about the rise of obesity in children and teens because obesity may lead to the following health problems: Heart disease Type 2 diabetes Asthma Sleep apnea Social discrimination Obese children may experience immediate health consequences which can lead to weight-related health problems in adulthood. Obese children and teens have been found to have risk factors for cardiovascular disease (CVD), including high cholesterol levels, high blood pressure, and abnormal glucose tolerance. In a sample of 5-to 17-year-olds, almost 60% of overweight children had at least one CVD risk factor and 25% of overweight children had two or more CVD risk factors. In addition, studies have shown that obese children and teens are more likely to become obese as adults. Stigma and Self-Esteem. In addition to suffering from poor physical health, overweight and obese children can often be targets of early social discrimination. The psychological stress of social stigmatization can cause low self-esteem which, in turn, can hinder academic and social functioning, and persist into adulthood. While research is still being conducted, there have been some studies showing that obese children are not learning as well as those who are not obese. Further, physical fitness has been shown to be associated with higher achievement.
08820.title: Mentoring Special Needs Children

07732.description: With nearly 27,000 members, the U.S. Coast Guard Auxiliary actively provides safety patrols on area waterways and regularly meets with the boating public at marinas and in classrooms. We also directly assist the U.S. Coast Guard in non-law enforcement programs such as search and rescue, and marine environmental protection. Flotilla 22 is based at the tip of Sandy Hook, NJ at the USCG Station. We operate over 12 surface facilities and have more than 50 active members supporting Station Sandy Hook in all aspects of Search & Rescue, Marine Safety, Environmental Protection, and Recreational Boating Safety. As a member of our Flotilla we will provide you with hands-on training in the programs and activities that interest you. You can perform safety examinations of recreational boats, or crew on Search & Rescue patrols, and much more! Contact us today to learn more! http://boatsafenj.org

This oppurtunity is 12-15 hours pers week.

11351.description: Do you want to educate, motivate and have a blast all while volunteering to promote healthy living and well-being? There is an opportunity waiting for you to share your creative expertise. You would get the chance to offer your services for those living with mental illness or substance abuse issues. Join WellLife Network as we embark on a game day program that will be a fun way to engage individuals, and when carefully selected, will add substantially to their functional abilities. These games will allow for improvements in social interaction, memory and attention and problem solving. This is a great opportunity to enhance the lives of those who suffer from substance abuse, with encouragement, positivity, and peace of mind. It is also a great way to build experience in your field. Contact us TODAY!

11351.description: WellLife Network executive office needs YOUR help! We have a huge administrative project coming up and we need all hands on deck. We are seeking reliable and competent volunteers to provide support to our staff for weekdays or after school. If you are looking to learn more about the administrative side of a non-profit organization, this is your opportunity. You must have great organizational skills and great attention to detail. WellLife Network serve individuals and families who represent a diverse array of populations including, youth; homeless families and those with mental, developmental, physical, and emotional challenges. We give flexibility to scheduling your volunteer activities, whether it’s a few hours a week or one day a month. Contact us TODAY!

11351.title: Mural Designers Needed

11357.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at College Point Multiplex. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
11357.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at College Point Multiplex in Whitestone, NY!

11355.description: Assist Technicians in Selfhelp’s \"Virtual Senior Center\" dept. with various duties including: a) entering info into database b) picking up computer systems from Seniors homes in Flushing, Queens area c) help with imaging computers. If you have good basic tech skills you’ll use them and learn more! Very friendly office environment working to provide homebound Seniors with activities by attending online classes via videochat. We supply the Seniors with Senior-friendly touch screen computers. If you live in or near the Flushing area, have friendly, patient demeanor, good tech skills, are at least 16 years old & can volunteer reliably for the summer for about 5-10 hours per week then this is for you! Also if you’re bi-lingual (English and Mandarin or Korean or Russian) that would be a help as well. Contact Carmella Chessen to find out more at cchessen@selfhelp.net or 646-259-4987
11355.title: Tech Ass’t. for Virtual Queens program

11355.description: The Friendly Visitor Program matches homebound seniors with volunteers in the community who make weekly visits in the seniors’ homes. Friendly visiting helps relieve the senior’s social isolation and is an enriching opportunity for the volunteer to develop a meaningful friendship. Seniors and the volunteer can take part in fun activities like playing card games, discussing current events, sharing stories, learning/teaching new skills, and celebrating special days in the lives of the seniors. Your time and companionship as a friendly visitor is invaluable! We ask for a minimum commitment of six months of weekly hour-long visits. Matches are based on your availability and geographic location. Volunteers must be 18 years or older. Interview, training, references, and background check are required.
11355.title: Friendly Visiting

11355.description: Job Description: As a member of the committee, you are responsible for helping to plan and prepare for The Bridge to Life’s annual gala (scheduled for April 2017) and other events Solicit in-kind sponsorships and auction items Plan and execute logistics of the event Event marketing and promotions Work with the President and Director of Development to identify prospects and relationships Work as an event volunteer the day of an contribute to the event’s overall success Required Skills, Interests or Education: Must be supportive of the mission of The Bridge to Life, a pro-life pregnancy resource center Enthusiasm for planning a charity event Attend meetings Attend event as a volunteer or paying guest Beneficial Skills, Interests or Education: Event planning and execution experience Experience with running a gala-type event Experience working with charities and volunteers Experience fundraising, obtaining corporate sponsorships or soliciting auction items and prizes

11355.description: The Bridge to Life seeks a development assistant volunteer who is enthusiastic and self-motivated. This person will assist with maintaining our donor database, production/editing of newsletters and grant writing. We prefer someone who is bilingual and familiar with Queens and/or Manhattan. The position reports to our Director of Development & Communications, who primarily works in our Flushing office. Hours are flexible and can include Saturday mornings. To apply, please send an email to development@thebridgetolife.org with a resume and a brief description of why you are interested in volunteering. Please note \"Development Assistant/Grant Writer\" in your email’s subject line.
11355.title: Development Assistant/Grant Writer

11355.description: The Bridge to Life seeks a graphics design volunteer to assist with the following: 1) Creation of a quarterly newsletter template 2) Development of brochures and flyers 3) Re-designing our logo 4) Updating our web site You will need your own graphic design software for this position. The position reports to our Director of Development & Communications, who primarily works in our Flushing office. Hours will vary and can include Saturday mornings. To apply, please send an email to thebridgetolife@verizon.net with a resume and a brief description of why you are interested in volunteering. Please note \"Graphic Designer\" in your email’s subject line.
11355.title: Graphics Design Volunteer

11355.description: The Bridge to Life is looking for someone to assist with managing our social media pages (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Tumblr, Pinterest and MailChimp). This is a great opportunity for a college student who is interested in learning more about nonprofits. While our schedule is flexible, we prefer a volunteer who can regularly visit our Flushing office between 11:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. on Wednesdays. Email thebridgetolife@verizon.net with a resume and brief description of why you are interested in volunteering. Please note \"Social Media Volunteer\" in the subject line of your email.

11354.description: The American Cancer Society Making Strides Against Breast Cancer walks raise awareness and funds to save lives from breast cancer. Each event is a noncompetitive 3 to 5 mile walk that brings people together to make a difference for everyone who has been touched by breast cancer. The events raise money to fund innovative research, provide free information and support, and to help people reduce their breast cancer risk or find it early when it's most treatable. From the opening ceremony to the post-walk entertainment, a Making Strides event is a celebration of survivors and opportunity to remember loved-ones lost. It's a day that shouldn't be missed and won't be forgotten. Here in Queens, we are seeking local residents who have a passion for our mission and want to make a difference to those facing breast cancer. We are forming a committee to support our annual walk in October. This is an on-going volunteer commitment that works directly with Event Staff. Committee Positions: *Logistics Lead *Survivor Lead *Mission Lead *Registration Lead *Entertainment Lead *Merchandise Lead *Volunteer Lead *Sponsorship Lead Volunteer Requirements: *Must live in the borough of Queens *Must be able to dedicate 2-3 hours per week towards role, attend monthly committee meetings (1-2 hours), and assist with event including set-up and clean-up *Must be able to attend role-specific training (1-2 hours) *Must be able to communicate effictively with the community and event staff *Must be comfortable leading volunteers *Must be able to work collaboratively with all staff, volunteers, committee, and participants *Must be able to conduct oneself in a professional manner consistent with a representative of a national organization Desired Qualifications: *Quality oral and written skills *Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel & Word *Outgoing & Positive demeanor *Shows passion and urgency for the mission to end breast cancer *Able to work collaboratively as well as independently *Able to leverage own network of community & business contacts to grow event For inquiries, please email QueensNYStrides@cancer.org with Subject: \"Strides Committee\" To learn more about Making Strides or the American Cancer Society, visit www.makingstrideswalk.org/queens or www.cancer.org
11354.title: Making Strides Against Breast Cancer Volunteer Committee

11354.description: MJHS Hospice provides a specialized program of care and services for end-of-life patients. MJHS Hospice provides care for pediatric and adult patients in homes, nursing homes, assisted living communities, inpatient facilities and hospitals. MJHS Hospice Volunteer opportunities include: Providing support and companionship to patients and their families Participating in leisure activities such as reading, listening to music, playing games with patients Supporting or organizing group activities for patients Listening compassionately to patients and their families Providing office or clerical support for our hospice team Complementary therapies Requirements for all categories of volunteers: 18 years or older 15 hours of training (4 hours training for clerical/office volunteers) Background Check (no charge to applicant) Medical Clearance (no charge to applicant) 3-4 hours per week 1 year commitment Required skills for patient visits: discretion, patience, compassion and dedication Preferred clerical and office support skills include: receptionist skills, computer skills, organizational skills and filing For more information on how to become a MJHS Hospice Volunteer please call: Queens and Nassau County: Mical White-Huffstead, Volunteer Coordinator; 718-490-1900 or MHUFFSTE@MJHS.ORG
11354.title: Be Part of Someone's Legacy--Become a Hospice Volunteer in Queens!

11354.description: Looking for warm compassionate persons to provide companionship and emotonal support to terminally ill patients. Patient care volunteers visit patients in Nursing homes, assisted living or in patient's own homes. All Volunteers will be provided training, supervision and support. Hospice volunteers: Visit patients in their homes and in facilities offering companionship and a chance to reminisce Read books, newspapers and other favorites to people when they aren’t able themselves Contribute to volunteer newsletter keeping volunteers and staff in tune with the Hospice Volunteer Program’s activities Assist with small errands for the patient and family to supplement the care received at home Share their talents and gifts... Play Music, create photo albums Provide patient the opportunity to tell his/her life story through the use of video, (if patient or caregiver has one available), audio and/or the written word. Office Volunteers assist office staff with basic tasks such as copying and filing, helping with web research, spreadsheets and more.
11354.title: Queens Patient Care Volunteer
11354.org: Caring Hospice Services of New York

10552.description: Pamper our residents in the Walemade Nursing Care Center, at the Meadowview Assisted Living or our Adult Day Care with hand massages and manicures.

10552.description: Assist our residents at the Waltemade Nursing Care Center with crafts projects and helping pour and mold the creations in our kiln.

10550.description: MISSION - Our mission is to introduce the marvels of science to children on a systematic, frequent and regularly scheduled basis, enabling them to experience, explore and personalize the resulting discoveries. Science centers embedded in the community, embraced by the school system and freely available to children, parents and teachers alike have proven to be successful interveners needed in the metropolitan areas around the country. We seek to duplicate and expand the success of those centers in Mount Vernon. VISION - Our vision of success includes directly impacting the lives of the 9,000 students attending public school inMount Vernoneach year with a state-of-the-art facility that is embraced by current and succeeding generations of students, parents, the school system and the surrounding corporate community. Our facility will impact academic studies and outcomes and influence career choices for years to come, further validating the community value and impact of such well-thought-out initiatives for urban areas.
10550.title: The Real Cost of Educational Injustice
10550.org: Northeast STEM Starter Academy at Mt. Vernon

10550.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
10550.title: Mount Vernon>>>Advice Counselor

07940.description: Spending time with youth is a fun and rewarding experience. While mothers are attending a Dress For Success seminar to build the skills needed for a new job or interview, volunteers are needed to watch over the children. Arts & crafts, reading stories, homework help and playing games are just a few of the fun possibilities volunteers can engage in with the children. Ages range from 7 - 17 and the total number of youth can reach up to 15. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07940.title: Kiddy Care in Madison

Most students come from China, Korea and Vietnam. They are all high school students looking to earn a quality education. Have friends or family who might want to host? Sent them our direction!

07424.description: We are looking for sporting enthusiasts (ie. Basketball, Baseball, Tennis, etc.) who are interested in sharing their passion with individuals who are striving to embark on having a more active and healthy lifestyle through our Active Life for a Healthy Mind program. We have regularly scheduled activities for individuals who self-identify with anxiety and/or depression. Volunteers would be expected to help in guiding individuals in these activities, while maintaining a fun and safe atmosphere during the activity. Candidates volunteering in this capacity should be proficient in the basic skills of the sport(s) in which they would volunteer to lead and be interested in teaching them to individuals with little or no experience with them. Active Life for a Healthy Mind activities will be held throughout the northern NJ/Tristate area.
07424.title: ALHM Activity Leaders - Sports

07424.description: We are looking for outdoor enthusiasts who are interested in sharing their passion of the outdoors with individuals who are striving to embark on having a more active and healthy lifestyle through our Active Life for a Healthy Mind program. We have regularly scheduled hikes for individuals who self-identify with anxiety and/or depression. Volunteers would be expected to help in guiding individuals on local hikes of varying difficulty levels and help in maintaining safety during the activity. Candidates volunteering in this capacity should be comfortable with being outdoors and knowledgeable about hiking in general. Active Life for a Healthy Mind activities will be held throughout the northern NJ/Tristate area.
07424.title: ALHM Activity Leaders - Outdoor

11507.description: The Viscardi Center Mentoring Initiative (VCMI) is a new mentorship program for at-risk youth with disabilities in collaboration with three other centers: Partners for Youth with Disabilities (PYD) in Boston, MentorABILITY in Wyoming, and Orangewood Foundation in California. The goal of the initiative is to improve the outcomes for at-risk youth (between the ages of 11 and 17) with disabilities through high-quality one-on-one mentoring. The Viscardi Center is seeking adults aged 18+ years to be mentors for at-risk youth living with any kind of disability. Benefits of Being a Mentor: * Gain a sense of fulfilment and personal growth * Develop leadership and management qualities * Improve communication and interpersonal relationship skills * Build a larger professional network * Be recognized for your talents and experience * Strengthen your own self-worth and confidence * Learn new things about yourself and others * Enhance your CV with community involvement * Better understand how people perceive you * Grow your circle of friends * Contribute to the overall well-being of your society For more information, contact: Michelle Licata at mlicata@viscardicenter.org or 516.465.1415. \"Mentoring is a structured and trusting relationship that brings young people together with caring individuals who offer guidance, support and encouragement aimed at developing the competence and character of the mentee.\" - Elements of Effective Practice MENTOR/The National Mentoring Partnership
11507.title: Join The Viscardi Center Mentoring Initiative

10990.description: We are still accepting volunteers for week long volunteer experience that will change your life. The Warwick Conference Center's is a christian center, in New York's beautiful Hudson Valley, with a mission to provide a safe and fun environment for children and adults to grow in there faith. The position is for Volunteering a week at a time with individuals ages 8-55 with developmental and physical disabilities. Sleep away Camp involving arts and crafts, recreational games, christian education, swimming, singing, hiking and field trips. You will be trained in all aspects of disabilities and personal care before starting. For more information and to apply visit CampWarwick.com. 9th, 12th, college age students and Adults are welcome to inquire.
10990.title: Special Needs Volunteer Ministry

11501.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE The Volunteer Engagement Specialist is part of a critical team that helps to on-board new Red Cross volunteers into the Disaster Cycle Services department. OPEN TIME DAYS 8 to 12 hours per month, depending upon the activity REQUIRED TRAINING Orientation to the American Red Cross Disaster Cycle Services: An Overview (Classroom or Online) Complete Step 1 Volunteer Leader training program Understand the Red Cross activity in which you are working Learn Red Cross computer systems as needed

11501.description: This is an opportunity to advocate for residents living in nursing homes, adult homes and assisted living facilities in Nassau County. Before placement in a facility a volunteer must complete 6 days of training to satisfy the NYS Certification requirement. Ongoing training is required and provided throughout the volunteer experience. As a NYS Certified Ombudsperson, you would advocate for the residients to ensure that their rights, dignity and quality of care are being met. The volunteer works in collaboration with resident, resident's family, facility administrtion and regulatory agencies. This volunteer opportunity requires a two year commitment to visit their assigned facility for approximately 2 to 4 hours a week, one day a week. Margaret Hromada, Program Director,Family and Children's Association Ombudservice 516-466-9718
11501.title: Advocate for residents in nursing homes, adult homes and assisted living facilities.

07306.description: looking for hosts! Anyone can apply. Generous Monthly Stipend Provided. Student Needs: Private Bedroom, 2 Meals on Weekdays, 3 Meals on Weekends. Contact Katie at: 267-205-3682 or hosting@anbeducation.com Most students come from China, Korea and Vietnam. They are all high school students looking to earn a quality education. Have friends or family who might want to host? Sent them our direction!
07306.title: Host A Student!

07306.description: My name is Zachary Hill and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a non-profit educational organization that assists families with hosting international students. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are rewarded with a generous monthly stipend. A 1099 is availiable for tax purposes. Our International students need . . . -A private bedroom (not in the basement please) and a shared or private bathroom in a safe and clean environment. -Breakfast and dinner during the week. (The student would buy their lunch at school) and 3 meals during the weekend. (Most international students like to share meals with their American hosts every day. They benefit from speaking English in relaxed, natural situations outside of their English courses. ) http://www.anbeducation.com/
07306.title: Host an International Student and Receive a Generous Monthly Stipend!

07306.description: \"We have absolutely loved having an exchange student. We have learned so much about another culture and have enjoyed introducing our student to American traditions. It has been a wonderful experience for our whole family!\" - Gayle My name is Michelle and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a Non-Profit Organization looking for willing host families in your area. We wanted to reach out with this opportunity to host an international exchange student in your local community. Every year thousands of host families across the United States welcome International Exchange Students, AnB Education is grateful to be working with hundreds of host families across the country. An exchange student not only attends school, but becomes immersed in our world. Host families welcome a new sons, daughters, sisters and brothers from across the world. To us Host Families, you, are an essential part of helping create a better world! Through the personal relationships, language and cultural immersion we can help teach tomorrow’s leaders today. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are supported with a generous monthly reimbursement. Our International students need : -A caring and friendly host family who is willing to provide quiet space for studying, access to TV and internet, and access to laundry facilities. -A private bedroom (not in the basement please) and a shared or private bathroom in a safe and clean environment. -Breakfast and dinner meals with host family during the week. (The student would buy their lunch at school) and 3 meals during the weekend. (Most international students like to share meals with their American hosts every day. They benefit from speaking English in relaxed, natural situations outside of their English courses. ) http://www.anbeducation.com/become-a-host-family.html
07306.title: Spring Host Families Needed- Help Change the Life of an International Student

07306.description: The Retired & Senior Volunteer Program Center (RSVP) Center of Essex and Hudson Counties is a comprehensive community service organization through JFS MetroWest NJ designed to mobilize members of the community who are 55 and older in giving back to their own neighborhoods through volunteer service within Essex and Hudson Counties. For potential volunteers, RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties provides a single location where they can review a number of local volunteer opportunities and receive the help of a trained Volunteer Coordinator. This assistance ensures that volunteers are placed in a position that matches their skills, desired time commitment and interests. RSVP also provides volunteers with supplemental insurance while volunteering, annual volunteer recognition events and connection to a nationwide network of volunteers. We are currently placing volunteers in opportunities where they can assist childen, people with developmental disabilities, domestic violence victims, aging adults, hungry families, etc. Our placements occur throughout local hospitals, non profits, daycares, food pantries, public agencies, and many more. Contact us for a full listing of opportunities.
07306.title: RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties

07306.description: Marketplace in Jersey City is a project dedicated to battling hunger and poverty in our community through an emergency food pantry. This project provides a meaningful volunteer experience in a positive, safe environment that is perfect for individuals, families, and groups of almost any size. Volunteer today and make a measurable difference in the lives of many by, helping sort and organize the food pantry, and package the items for distribution to needy families. On Friday, volunteers do prep work for Saturday which is distribution day. Tasks may include, but are not limited to the following: Setting up Bagging perishables Cleaning Up What to bring? Gently used plastic trash bags for clients. This is not required but is certainly helpful. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07306.title: Marketplace in Jersey City

07306.description: This church program distributes lunch to people who are less fortunate in the Jersey City area Monday - Friday (12pm - 2pm). What is needed: - People to prepare sandwiches and/or pack food into containers and in lunch bags for the needy - Food left over from parties are welcome - Cash donations are also welcomed.
07306.title: Feed the needy

07306.description: CASA volunteers are ordinary people - men and women, students and executives, retirees and busy professionals. We are looking for individuals with a desire to help children and a willingness to commit themselves to a foster child in need of the unique one-on-one attention of a CASA volunteer. The first step to becoming a volunteer is to attend an information session. Please join us for a half-hour to learn how you can make a difference in a foster child’s life. For more information or to RSVP for an information session, email Clare Daley at cdaley@hudsoncountycasa.org or visit our website www.hudsoncountycasa.org.
07306.title: Become a Volunteer Advocate for a Foster Child

07306.description: Hudson Community Enterprises is looking for volunteers to help out on several levels. The objective of our program is to bring fourth any training or materials that may help our young people transition into the employment arena despite their disabilities. We are searching for volunteers who may be able to help with job traing. resume writing, computer training. independent living skills, motivational speakers, employers and any other helpful tools the motivates our young people. This is a great opportunity to give back to the community and also show our youth that their are good people who do care.
07306.title: Getting Involved!!!

07018.description: The Program Coordinator is a part-time opportunity (up to 10/hrs week) and is responsible for successful coordination and implementation of our programming. This includes working with our College Readiness Facilitator and Allied Professional Partners (AAPs), coordinating community service activities, college tours, and engaging events for students, support with recruiting and selection of students, data entry, supporting with fundraising activities and initiatives and support with major events and other tasks as necessary. The Program Coordinator will also support with social media and telling our story and create visual aids. The Program Coordinator will be a direct link to program outcomes should stay current on college access/retention best practices. Position Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or higher; graduate student pursuing degrees in education, higher education, nonprofit, leadership, counseling, urban studies, community development or related field Must be able to commit for at least 6-months Experience in urban environments, self-motivation and initiative Passion for the success of young women and higher education Organized and poised with strong communication and presentation skills, attention to detail and event planning experience Experience in recruiting and interviewing (preferred) Punctual, organized, goal oriented and an independent self-starter Knowledgeable of Microsoft Office Suite, Google Drive and other online data-driven platforms Ability to work independently and possessing initiative and creativity Flexible schedule, during school hours and evenings
07018.title: Program Coordinator - Empower Young Women to achieve College Success!

07018.description: The Pearl Club has a mission to educate, empower and support young women to overcome poverty by fostering advanced educational pursuit. Through our programming, The Pearl Club University, we strive to empower young women to overcome poverty by attaining a post-secondary degree. The position of the Board of Directors is a voluntary position that serves as the leadership, sustainability and growth of the organization. In this role, there are three focuses: Strategic Oversight : approve annual budgets, strategic plans and review and measure outcomes; provide strategic leadership Sustainability : actively participate in fundraising initiatives, see this as a philanthropic priority and assist in identifying board members and contribute to annual performance of ED Commitment: actively participate and attend board meetings and take a proactive approach to the growth of the organization Within these three focuses, the Board of Directors is responsible for the following Actively attend board meetings, including preparing for meetings Strong commitment to the organization's mission and purpose Open, honest and unbiased communication Thorough decision making that aligns with the mission, is student- and future-focused Actively participate in a board fundraising goals and organizational fundraising initiatives Think outside of the box to produce outcomes, develop relationships, generate partnerships and provide opportunities for young women Stay current on important trends that relate to their expertise as it relates to the growth and success of the organization Be inspired to share their involvement with their networks to garner support and build relationships, including inviting them to all events and providing contacts to include in our email distribution lists Willingness to step out of comfort zone to produce outcomes, including trainings and professional development
07018.title: Join Our Board of Directors

07017.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
07017.title: East Orange>>>Advice Counselor

07013.description: City Green is seeking volunteers to work at our 5-acre farm, located in Clifton, New Jersey. Farm volunteers will assist our urban Farmer in completing farm tasks while learning basic concepts of organic food production. We rely heavily on farm volunteers each season to help us keep our farm productive and beautiful. Farm tasks will include: seed starting, planting, weeding, harvesting, and other farm maintenance as needed. This is a great opportunity to participate in a unique community project, enjoy the great outdoors, and get hands on farming experience. No previous farming / gardening experience necessary. But, a willingness to get dirty, work with your hands, and a passion for learning, growing, and community building are! Farm volunteers are welcome every Wednesday from April 19th - October 25th from 5pm - dusk. Volunteers must complete a new application form each year prior to starting work. You can fill out the form when you arrive to the farm or fill it out in advance and bring it with you. You may download a copy of the volunteer form at: http://citygreenonline.org/uploads/uploaded-files/0001-volunteer-application.pdf

07013.description: Love to teach? Share the power of fresh local foods through education! City Green is looking for enthusiastic volunteer outdoor field trip educators to work with students PreK-6th grade at City Green’s Farm Eco-Center and Learning Garden. City Green hosts classes from northern NJ school districts with a focus on schools from urban at-risk communities. These outdoor field trips are used as an opportunity to enhance students’ academic achievement through hands-on experiential learning and interaction with the natural world. Volunteers will be trained to work as field trip educators to provide lessons on gardening and farming, sustainable agriculture, healthy eating and cooking, animal husbandry, native plants and wildlife, and a variety of environmental topics. Spring field trips are held throughout the month of May, and fall field trips are held in October. Volunteer shifts are Monday - Friday and are typically 8:30am - 11am and/or 11:30am -2pm. Time commitments should be 1-2 days per week, 3-6 hours per day. Experience working in child education or an environmental field is preferred but not required. HOW TO APPLY Send a brief email with the subject \"Field Trip Volunteer\" describing your interest and background as it relates to: info@city-green.org
07013.title: Volunteer Outdoor Field Trip Educators

Excellent area for volunteers looking to explore potential career choice in therapy related fields. Responsibilities include organizing/straightening closets/shelves in treatment rooms. Clean/returns toys to proper locations. Assists therapists with set-up/clean-up of activities. Performs necessary office/clerical tasks including copying, filing and organizational tasks. Assists therapist with engaging patients in play activities.
07013.title: Therapy Gym Assistant

07013.description: Gardening Volunteer Program Becoming a garden volunteer is a great opportunity to learn hands on horticultureal skills best suited to the ornamental gardener. Our Learning Farm in Clifton, NJ features many \"themed\" gardens, all geared towards nature-based education and an appreciaton of nature's diverse eco-systems and dynamic beauty. These themed gardens include a Story Grove, Enchanted Forest, Native American Prairie and Mr. McGregor's Farm. All of these gardens are framed by native plantings designed to attract beneficial insects and pollinators to our farm. The gardening volunteer will be working side by side with our Director of Horticulture enhancing and maintaining these gardens. City Green has many fun and rewarding garen installations planned for this upcoming season. Come be a part of the fun and make a difference, all while learning skills which you can take back to your home garden. Our garden volunteers are a vital component of our operation and we could not maintain these beautiful spaces without your support! No previous gardening / farming experience necessary, just a willingness to get a little dirty, work with your hands, and a desire to learn, grow, and make a difference! Join us! We are open for volunteers every Wednesday from April 19th - October 25th in 2017.
07013.title: Garden Volunteers

Some areas we need help with: sports swimming arts and crafts STEM tutoring nature hikes yoga dance General supervision This position is flexible. Contact us directly for more information. Kind regards, Theodore Tasoulas

07012.description: Good day, Today's Learning Center is private school with almost 40 years experience in the process of converting to REACH Charter School of Clifton for 2016-2017. The board is scheduled to hold an initial meeting in late February contingent on intial approval from the NJDOE. More information: www.todayslearningcenter.org and www.facebook.com/reachcharter Below is a brief summary of our application: For almost 40 years, our unique mission has been to: 1) Educate the Whole Child Engaging Curriculum -Field Trips -Swimming -Music -Art -Violin -Theater After-school programs: gardening, Rotary Interact, sports, dance, tutoring & more 2) Develop Strong Parent/Community Engagement PTO, frequent communication, monthly family events and performances 3) Provide Individualized Student Support Student Support Team works with teachers to use student portfolios to create personalized learning programs 4) Integrate Technology to Support All Areas of Study Each student has a device, Smartboard access, online learning programs We will remain in our exceptional facility with access to: -500-seat theater -Swimming pool -Gymnasium -Playground -Baseball/Sports Field -Library/Media Center -Large Cafeteria Over half of our diverse student body resides in Clifton and Passaic with one-third qualifying for free/reduced lunch. Last year our school scored in the 89th percentile on a national standardized test. We find that many local families are unable to pay our already low tuition. Converting to REACH Charter School will offer Clifton and Passaic families a choice and allow us to serve more children in the community AT NO ADDITIONAL COST TO TAXPAYERS OR FAMILIES. We are looking for applicants qualified in ANY of the following areas: School leadership, administration, and governance; Curriculum, instruction, and assessment; Performance management; Parent and community engagement; Professional development; General operations; Facilities management; Financial management; and Fundraising and development; If you are qualified and interested in making a difference in the lives of families and children, then please email me for further information. Thank you, Theodore Tasoulas

07011.description: When you help an adult learn to read and write, you help an entire family. Literacy can lead to a job, a better job, the ability to read to one’s children, help with their homework and read correspondence sent home from school. It can lead to a driver’s license, a high school diploma or equivalency, to citizenship, to a better life. At Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties, we help adults achieve all of those things. But we need your help: We need more volunteers to teach Basic Literacy and English for Speakers of Other Languages. No teaching experience or knowledge of a second language is required, just a desire to help. We are plumbers and secretaries, job seekers, administrators, retired teachers, journalists, even a former Peace Corps member or two. Our students are from the United States and more than 150 other countries - from Albania to Zimbabwe. Many are waiting for help. A great way to help is to join our tutor training workshop in Clifton, which meets on five Saturday afternoons at the Clifton Public Library, 1:00-4:15 pm, June 17, 24, July 1, 8, and 15, 2017. Attendance at all sessions is highly recommended. It’s not too late to help improve the life of an adult and his or her family. For more information, visit our website at www.lvaep.org or call our office at the Bloomfield Public Library at 973-566-6200, ext. 217.
07011.title: Help an adult learn to speak, read, and write English
07011.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07011.description: Life is limited when you can't read medical label warnings, correspondence from your childrens' teachers, instructions on a new appliance, complete a job application, read a street sign, directions, or apply for a driver's license. Yet many adults find themselves in exactly that position, particularly here in Essex County, where one in every four adults is considered functionally illiterate in English, according to U.S. Department of Education data. When you help an adult, you help her or his entire family. At Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties, we have a long list of U.S. citizens and immigrants, among them refugees and asylum seekers, waiting for help in learning to speak, understand, read, and write in English. But we need volunteers to teach them. Here's how you can help: Become a volunteer literacy tutor by attending our tutor training course at the Clifton Public Library, 292 Piaget Avenue, Conference Room A, Clifton, NJ 07011, Saturdays, 1:00-4:15 pm, June 17, 24, July 1, 8, and 15, 2017. Volunteers work once per week for two hours and earn a certificate as tutors of Basic Literacy and English for Speakers of Other Languages from Literacy Volunteers of America (LVA), one of the largest non-profit adult literacy organizations in the country. And more than that, they help improve the lives of adults and their family members. For more information, please contact LVA at 973-566-6200, ext 217, via email rbenali@lvaep.org, or register throughg our website www.lvaep.org
07011.title: Tough times. Here's how you can help.

07011.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07011.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07011.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07011.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07011.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07011.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07011.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.

07011.description: Do you like fundraising, have an interest in mental health but have a limited amount of time to volunteer? If so, this position may be a good fit for you! Work with a team of mental health professionals and community members to organize fun and creative fundraising events for the Mental Health Association in Passaic County. The money raised goes towards fighting stigma and educating the community about mental health. It also supports parents, family members and individuals who are struggling with mental illness. Help plan and organize fundraising events such as trivia nights, awards dinner, raffles, etc. Secure participation and solicit donation items for events via phone, internet and by visiting businesses in the area. Prepare materials for the fundraising event and help with setting up event. This position will be an opportunity to learn how to plan special events, approach potential donors, and work in a team setting. You will learn about the non-profit world and meet other people in the community who are concerned about mental health issues. The committee meets once a month on a weekday evening in Clifton. Before an event meetings are twice a month.
07011.title: Fundraising/Special Events
07011.org: Mental Health Association in Passaic County

07011.description: Passionate about mental health? Looking to help a dynamic community organization with innovative services? The Mental Health Association in Passaic County is seeking qualififed individuals with a background in fundraisnig, finances, and marketing. Board meetings are held the second Thursday of the month. MHAPC Board of Directors Job Description: Have a willingness to secure financial support for the organization. Be an advocate for the organization and its mission within the community. Serve on at least one board committee. Provide personal financial support to the agency. Attend monthly board meetings. Stays informed about board matters, prepares themselves well for meetings, and reviews and comments on minutes and reports. Volunteer for and willingly accept assignments and complete them thoroughly and on time. Assist with the identification, cultivation and recruitment of potential new Board members. Participate actively in MHAPC fundraising and donor cultivation events and educational programs, etc. Monitor and evaluate the job performance of the Executive Director. Govern the organization and ensure adequate financial resources and stability. Be an ambassador for the organization in the community and serve with dignity and professionalism. Get to know other board members and build a collegial working relationship that contributes to consensus. Is an active participant in the board’s annual evaluation and planning efforts.
07011.title: Board Member Position
07011.org: Mental Health Association in Passaic County

07011.description: St. Peter's Haven Food Pantry serves over 1,000 Passaic County families and individuals in need by providing them with supplementary groceries every month. V olunteers are needed to unload the food donation truck and under the supervision of St. Peter's staff, organize items on shelves and tables. Volunteers will also make up shopping bags for families to pick up on future dates.

11413.description: Volunteer with Habitat for Humanity in Queens! Habitat for Humanity New York City transforms lives by building quality homes with families in need, and by uniting all New Yorkers around the cause of affordable housing. We build year round to move waiting families into their new homes and repair homes still badly damaged by Hurricane Sandy. Volunteers are at the heart of everything we do and we need YOU to help us continue making an impact throughout NYC! As a volunteer you will have the opportunity to: Make your own schedule - volunteer as little or as much as you would like Receive on-site training in construction - learn new skills or enhance the ones you already have Meet other volunteers committed to affordable housing Give back to your community in an amazing way Make a positive difference in the lives of others No construction experience is necessary -- just enthusiasm! _______________________________________________________________ How to Sign Up: Learn more before signing up by visiting our website (habitatnyc.org) OR create a profile on volunteerhub and sign up for a volunteer orientation (see instructions below). Please note: orientations are optional and are not required for Construction volunteers. If you are ready to start making a difference, follow the steps below to create your volunteerhub account: 1. Log on to habitatnyc.volunteerhub.com 2. Click the \"Create an Account\" button to create a new profile Choose a username and password Leave the Join Code field blank and click \"Next\" Input your full name, contact information, date of birth, and emergency contact's information 3. Select \"Construction\" and click on the event that interests you 4. Click on the \"Sign Up\" button and follow the directions to register for the event 5. You will receive a confirmation email letting you know you successfully signed up for a volunteer day! Please email volunteer@habitatnyc.org with any questions We hope to see you soon!
11413.title: Build with Habitat for Humanity in Queens!
11413.org: Habitat for Humanity New York City

11439.description: College Summit will connect 1.8 million students from low-income communities to college and career over the next decade. We do this by training influential high school students - Peer Leaders - to motivate their classmates over the school year to enroll in college. You can join College Summit and help train these Peer Leaders at Summer Workshops on college campuses across the nation. Summer Workshops are the cornerstone of the College Summit program. This is where the transformation occurs from student to Peer Leader. Training includes: Filling Out College Applications Financial Aid 101 Developing a List of Good Fit Colleges Crafting a Personal Statement Four days on a college campus changes the trajectory of a student’s life. Eighty percent of students who attend a Summer Workshop enroll in college. In the past two decades, College Summit has worked with 250,000 students from over 500 schools across the nation. College Summit’s peer-to-peer model doubles the likelihood that a low-income student will enroll in college. You can help by volunteering as a Writing Coach or College Coach. For four days, Writing Coaches work in small teams of 8-10 students to jump start the college application process, beginning with the personal statement/essay and College Coaches work one-on-one with 8-10 students to help build a personalized list of good-fit colleges. By volunteering, you’ll participate in one of the most inspirational weekends of your life, connect to students and other volunteers in your community, receive free room & board for the entire Workshop, and most importantly, empower students from low-income communities to reach their true potential! Workshops will be hosted in Florida, New York, Southern California, and Maryland. Check out the College Summit website for specific dates and locations. If you’re interested, you can learn more about College Summit at http://www.collegesummit.org/volunteer/. You can submit a volunteer application and register for a Workshop at https://college-summit.force.com/Volunteer/. I’ve attached documents with more information for you to review. If you have any questions, please contact College Summit’s Volunteer Engagement Manager, Natasha Bailey, at nbailey@collegesummit.org.
11439.title: Connect Low-Income Students to College & Career at St. John's University this Summer!

With a warm smile, a tender touch, a listening ear, a heartfelt willingness to help you can make that difference. Palliative Support Volunteer must be 18 years of age or older. If you are under 18 you can volunteer with a parent with you. Please include your phone number.

If you hold certifications or licenses in any of the following therapies we would love to have you as a part of our hospice team. Aromatherapy Imagery Work Music Therapy Palliative Massage Reiki Relaxation Training Integrative Therapies will be utilizied with our hospice patients that are experiencing acute pain, anxiety, physical discomfort, agitation and restlessness. We also offer mileage reimbursement! Pleae include your phone number.

11432.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
11432.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Jamaica Multiplex in Jamaica, NY!
