11430.description: We are being flooded by shelters and other rescues to take in the over flow of puppies and kittens in need. We are looking for special people to open their hearts and homes while a shelter dog awaits their forever home. What better way to spend your time than helping a homeless pet in need? Without rescue they will not have a chance at life! Make sure to click on [+] READ MORE button below to read more information on this opportunity! WHY? Saves 2 lives for each 1 dog fostered -- freeing up a space for another dog to be brought to our kennel (helps us to save more dogs from euthanasia)!!! Provides a loving home for an animal that is looking for a fur-ever home!! Very rewarding Tax-deductible No money is needed! Puppies can be cared for in an xpen provided by RHR. We also provide food, toys, bedding, etc. Vetting is done by the rescue!! REQUIREMENTS: Be local to Freeport, New York -- 20 mile radius or less. Must be at least 21 years of age Home enough hours to care for pups but you don't have to be retired or a stay at home mom. We ALSO have a Foster-to-Adopt program!! The \"Foster-to-Adopt\" program is a little unique. It allows potential adopters to take a pup home for up to two weeks to ensure that a pup is the right fit for the family. Situations include, but are not limited to: if your current pet needs some transition time to accept a new pup and vice versa, a pup that needs to complete heartworm treatment, or a pup that has a medical condition. If you are interested please visit our website at www.ruffhouserescue.org. NEXT STEPS FOR FOSTERS: Check out the dogs in need of fostering on our Facebook: \"Ruff House Rescue NY\" or Instagram or Twitter: \"Ruff House Rescue\" Complete Foster Application: (takes less than 5 minutes) on our website -- click on the blue \"Ruff House Rescue\" link in the upper left hand corner to get our website address. Go to \"Foster\" tab and then scroll down to \"Foster Application\" If you do not get a response from us within 3-4 days please outreach to us at ruffhouserescue@gmail.com If you are undecided, ask us questions --- Please click on the red button \"I want to help!\" on the upper left hand corner of the page and Include in the comments: 1) If you completed the on-line Volunteer Application. 2) Your residence (City in New York). 3) Question(s). MORE INFORMATION: Go to our website -- click on the blue \"Ruff House Rescue\" link in the upper left hand corner to get our website address. Go to \"Foster\" tab and go down to \"Foster Resources\" OTHER INFORMATION: Only serious inquiries please AGE REQUIREMENT: Head of house must be at least 18 years old UNDER AGE REQUIREMENT: See our \"Junior Volunteer\" positions REQUIREMENTS: Must be located near our Rescue in Long Island, NY. We have a Foster Application that once approved we can suit the right dog for your home. TIME COMMITMENT/DURATION: Depends on baby-adult/Approx. 1 to 2 months commitment (sometimes shorter, sometimes longer). For Foster-to-Adopt program up to 2 week commitment. PROVIDED TO FOSTERS: All expenses are paid by RHR (food & medical/vet bills) we just ask for you to give the dog a loving and comfortable place to stay while he/she awaits their forever home. We provide the crate/puppy play pen and water bowls. COMMUNITY HOURS: Letter ONLY provided for some In-person Opportunities BUT if you do a \"drive\" for Kennel Supplies, Pennies for RHR Fundraiser or a Garage/Tag Sale at your school/church/community center you could have someone LOCAL be a Coordinator of your hours. Also see the \" Exercise + ResQWalk\" or \"Exercise + Wooftrax\" volunteer opportunities where your time and distance exercised is recorded on the cell phone application. MORE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES: PLEASE CLICK ON THE BLUE \"Ruff House Rescue (RHR)\" LINK (located on the upper, left-hand side of the page ABOVE the red \"I want to help!\" button). Click on \"Volunteer Opportunities\" tab. ************************************************************************* Our mission is to rescue homeless pets that suffer from abuse, neglect, and indifference. Our goal is to create awareness of the epidemic of homeless pets and educate on the importance of spaying and neutering, ID tagging, and training these pets. Through our rescue efforts we are both saving lives and cultivating the natural connection between man and his best friend. THANK YOU FOR LOOKING AT OUR VOLUNTEER POST AT RHR!
11430.title: Foster-to-Adopt |or| Foster Dogs or Puppies ** Urgent** (Freeport, NY)!   Short Term

11430.description: Travelers Aid at JFK International Airport is seeking volunteers to welcome passengers and provide information regarding a variety of travel-related services. This is an excellent opportunity to be a welcoming ambassador for travelers from all over the world, improve your communication skills and gain experience assisting and working with people. Volunteers are placed at key locations throughout the airport. Shifts are available 7 days a week from 10-2 and 2-6. We require one four hour shift per week. In addition to the satisfaction of helping travelers, volunteers also receive transportation (local subway and bus fare) and meal reimbursement! Please contact us at (718) 656-4870 to arrange a tour of our program! Visit and like Travelers Aid JFK Airport at facebook.com/travelersaidjfk.
11430.title: Travelers Aid JFK Volunteer

10022.description: Cathedral High School (CHS) is a Catholic, college preparatory school located in the heart of Manhattan, which welcomes young women of all faiths and cultures. Since it opened its doors in 1905, Cathedral has been a place where young women feel at home and are encouraged to be strong, smart, independent women who can do anything they set their minds to. In 2012, Cathedral High School was ranked by The New York Observer as one of New York City’s top 160 schools and among the top 35 private high schools. Almost all of our students are daughters of immigrant working families. 645 young women representing 72 countries attend CHS. Many of our students come from families who earn at or below the federal poverty level (60% of students are eligible for free or reduced lunch). Over 82% of our girls are Hispanic or of African American descent. Through the decades, CHS has continued to enhance its academic curriculum and extra-curricular activities to ensure that students graduate equipped with the skills necessary to be successful in college and careers thereafter. CHS routinely graduates nearly 100% of its students - compared to a current graduation rate of 61.3% for NYC public schools - and assists students in securing tens of millions of dollars in college scholarships. CHS graduates have the skills to be competitive in the global workforce and a sense of obligation to others so that they give back to their New York City community. We are seeking Volunteer Board Members to help us fulfill this mission.
10022.title: Volunteer Board Member

10022.description: Since 1917, Catholic Charities has been supporting New Yorkers of all backgrounds and religions - those in need of food, shelter, foster care, day care, counseling, immigration assistance, services for the physically and mentally challenged, employment assistance, and more. 10022.description: Nonviolence International is a decentralized network of resource centers that researches and promotes nonviolent action and seeks to reduce the use of violence worldwide. We believe that every culture and religion can employ appropriate nonviolence methods for positive social change and international peace. Nonviolence International NY focuses on the United Nations, and on the community of New York City. We aim to share with the New York community the important things happening at the UN in our areas of work: Culture of Peace and Nonviolence, Disarmament, Palestine: Peace and Justice, UN Goals, UN-Civil Society Relations, Women's Issues. We are looking for a volunteer to produce photo and video content on a weekly basis while working closely with our social media team. We have our own basic equipment, but if you have your own tripod or lights, that is helpful but not at all required to be chosen for this position. The responsibilities will include vidoegraphy and photography of live events, people, and our work. Volunteers will also have the opportunity to propose ideas for content.
10022.title: Photography and Videography for NGO

10022.description: Nonviolence International is a decentralized network of resource centers that researches and promotes nonviolent action and seeks to reduce the use of violence worldwide. We aim to share with the New York community the important things happening at the UN in our areas of work: Culture of Peace and Nonviolence, Disarmament, Palestine: Peace and Justice, UN Goals, UN-Civil Society Relations, Women's Issues. We are looking for an intern to run our social media accounts and write original content for our organization. Interns will gain both the expeerience of social media marketing, and working at an NGO.
10022.title: Social Media and Content Management for NGO

10022.description: Interested in serving as a high impact agent of change on a New York City nonprofit board? Contact BoardAssist. BoardAssist is the leading personalized board recruiting resource available to the tri-state nonprofit community. We offer New Yorkers who want to make a real change in the nonprofit world hundeds of board options and advice on selecting the right one for them. Our nonprofit clients range from start-up organizations to some of the most established names in the nonprofit community, and serve interest areas from arts and education to the environment and poverty relief. Though most BoardAssist clients are New York-based, they serve locally, nationally and internationally. BoardAssist has been responsible for bringing over $80 million into the nonprofit community through our board placements over the last 15 years. We are a nonprofit ourselves. Please send your resume or LinkedIn link when emailing BoardAssist at info@boardassist.org, or simply fill out our new Candidate Application We very much appreciate your interest in giving back! Most boards require board members to give at least $5000/year to their nonprofit.
10022.title: Join a NYC Board of Directors - BoardAssist has 100s of New York board member openings

BoardAssist is the leading personalized board recruiting resource available to the tri-state nonprofit community. We offer New Yorkers who want to make a real change in the nonprofit world hundeds of board options and advice on selecting the right one for them. Our nonprofit clients range from start-up organizations to some of the most established names in the nonprofit community, and serve interest areas from arts and education to the environment and poverty relief. Though most BoardAssist clients are New York-based, they serve locally, nationally and internationally. BoardAssist has been responsible for bringing over $80 million into the nonprofit community through our board placements over the last 15 years. We are a nonprofit ourselves. Please send your resume or LinkedIn link when emailing BoardAssist at info@boardassist.org, or simply fill out our new Candidate Application We very much appreciate your interest in giving back! Most boards require board members to give at least $5000/year to their nonprofit.
10022.title: Join a NYC board of directors - BoardAssist has 100s of New York nonprofit board member openings

10022.description: We are working at the United Nations to strengthen the influence of civil society and the enforceability of international human rights and humanitarian law, as well as get the American public more involved with the work of the UN. This includes work with Agencies and NGO committees at the UN focused on NGO relations, women's issues, Palestine and disarmament, as well as the activist community in New York and across the USA.
10022.title: The United Nations:  This is Your World !!

10022.description: Working In Support of Education (W!SE) is seeking volunteers who are interested in speaking about personal finance in any of the five New York City boroughs. The Speakers Bureau gives schools free access to professionals interested in helping young people become financially literate. As a volunteer speaker you can provide New York City high school students, parents and/or staff with real-world insight on financial issues - from broad themes like the inner workings of markets to more specific \"pocketbook\" personal finance concepts, such as credit, insurance, subprime mortgages, college financial planning, and personal investing. Schools request a speaker, and identify dates, topics and/or questions to be addressed. W!SE coordinates speaker placement. This volunteer opportunity is ideal for those with an interest in teaching personal finance and enjoy interacting with young people in high school.
10022.title: Volunteer Speakers The McGraw-Hill Companies’ Financial Literacy Now SPEAKERS BUREAU, managed by w!s

10022.description: Serve as a consultant/mentor to an elementary school administrators in the planning and implementation of their development and marketing efforts. Volunteer positions available throughout the Archdiocese of New York to assist administrators with some of the following projects: *Organizing fundraising efforts *Running specific campaigns *Alumni outreach and solicitations *Developing school publicity materials (school brochures, special project brochures) *Exploring potential grant sources (writing for grants possible) *Organizing volunteers to staff events. * Assisting in long-range planning and goal setting. Please contact the danielle.forsythe@archny.org to participate.
10022.title: Development/Marketing Volunteer Consultants Needed

10022.description: Groups needed to help the schools of the Archdiocese of New York with various projects such as painting, moving, cleaning etc. Week-ends best. Manhattan, Bronx, Staten Island, Westchester, Putnam, Ulster, Orange, Rockland and Duchess county locations. Please contact the Office of Educational Development at (212) 371-1011 x.3359 or at eddev@adnyschools.org to participate.
10022.title: Fun Group Service Projects!

10022.description: Enthusiastic professionals needed to lend expertise to the elementary schools of the Archdiocese of New York in a local advisory board capacity. Please contact Champions for Quality Education at 646.794.3322 or email susan.madon@archny.org to participate.
10022.title: Searching for Great School Advisory Board Members!

11434.description: Complete Girlz is seeking a Asst. Program Director to assist our Program Director in Rochdale, Queens. Please contact us for more details at info@completegirlz.org.
11434.title: Assistant Program Director for Rochdale

11434.description: To provide respite support to families that attend our foster and adoptive support network meeting and events. Pllan activities for youth of various ages Engage children/youth in varies activities Food preparation and serve Event planning
11434.title: Youth Activities Coordinator

11434.description: Grace Episcopal Church of Jamaica is currently focusing efforts on a program to empower the Youth within the Jamaica Queens environment. The program will include initiatives that will play a supporting role in upskilling inner city youths, and will prepare them for a successful and productive future. The youth empowerment program will include leadership & financial education workshops, career talks, health and wellness seminars, skill building workshops, and a scholarship program. The Church is currently looking for a Program Director to assist church members in developing the program framework, operations plan and overseeing/supporting the youth empowerment committee.
11434.title: Youth Program Director

11435.description: To serve campers Breakfast, Lunch and Snack, which are supplied by the City of NY Board of Ed.
11435.title: Volunteer Food Server
11435.org: A BETTER WAY FAMILY & COMMUNITY CENTER INC

11435.description: We are looking for volunteer board members to help lead and strengthen our programs and services for young women and children. If you are able to contribute your time, dedication, skills and leadership, one evening a month and are interested in exploring this opportunity, please contact us to find out whether this opportunity is right for you. We are especially looking for individuals with experience in accounting, legal, grant writing and fundraising.
11435.title: Great Board Members Wanted!

11435.description: Become a Mentor/Personal Empowerment Coach! We are looking for individuals committed to excellence, to help empower our young women to succeed in life. Menotrs/Personal Empowerment Coaches will help their mentees develop social, educational/vocational and leadership skills that support personal and academic achievement. Mentor/Personal Empowerment Coaches wil meet with their mentees bi-weekly, document their contacts and facilate monthly empowerment workshops. As a mentor/personal Empowerment Coach, you will receive orientation, ongoing training & support and be a part of a growing team of professional who share your passion.
11435.title: Aim to Inspire! - Become a Mentor/Personal Empowerment Coach

07642.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07642.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07642.description: Bergen SWAN has to clean house! We need organized, logical minds and strong backs to help us make better sense of our files and documents from over the years. If you have some office administrative experience and want to help out an environmental cause, this would be ideal for you. Call Lori Charkey if you're interested. Thanks!
07642.title: Help Get our Environmental Group Organized!
07642.org: Bergen Save the Watershed Action Network (Bergen SWAN)

07642.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07642.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07642.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07642.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.

07643.description: Ascend Hospice Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients ; mind, body and soul.

07643.description: Project Coordinators (PC's), volunteer in a leadership capacity at our volunteer opportunities and provide organization and a team atmosphere for every volunteer experience. We encourage these exceptional community leaders to make a commitment at one specific program usually once or twice monthly for the span of six months. Project Coordinators (or PCs) provide leadership in Jersey Cares’ recurring volunteer opportunities by serving as a liaison between volunteers, nonprofit partners, and Jersey Cares. They encourage volunteers to \"Be the Change\" and provide directions during projects. It’s a fun learning opportunity where you get to network with nonprofits and other community leaders while being supported by a cohort of other volunteer leaders. Project Coordinators commit to 1+ projects per month for 6 months at a time. READ MORE: https://www.jerseycares.org/JC_Project_Coordinator Contact: Gabriella Fernandes Programs Manager, Leadership Development Gabriella@jerseycares.org (973) 533-1993, ext. 20

07901.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE The Fiscal Reviewer is part of a team of about 8 people who review each of the cases opened for clients after a fire. Normally it takes only a few minutes to check each case and certify that it meets the requirements for financial assistance; however, there are times the Team Member must get in contact with the Manager in charge of the county where the fire was, to get information corrected before the case can be passed through. OPEN TIME DAYS There are four 3 hour shifts each day, Monday through Friday; however, you don’t have to be available during the full hours, unless we are trying to meet a deadline. Shifts needed now are 9 to noon and/or noon to 3. REQUIRED TRAINING Disaster Cycle Services: An Overview Recovery Services: An Overview Direct Client Assistance Fundamentals Casework & Recovery Planning Fundamentals Meet the Client: What is a Family? Two Youtube videos (optional): Creating a Case and Recovery Planning Familiarization with a  job tool : ｠Fiscal Review Job Tool After you’ve finished the training, you will work with the Team Manager one on one to make sure you understand the whole process.｠ Once you are comfortable, you can take a couple shifts, always being able to communicate with the Manager if you have｠questions. ｠｠
07901.title: Are you ready to put your head, your heart and your love of finance/accounting to work supporting th
07901.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

07901.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE Deploy to Disaster Relief Operations and provide testing of financial controls. Monitoring specific financial areas of control environment such as purchasing, warehousing and financial assistance. This will be accomplished using tools, checklists, processes and procedures of the American Red Cross. OPEN TIME DAYS Each deployment is for 2 weeks physically deployed to Disaster Relief Operation and 1 hour a month for training REQUIRED TRAINING We will provide all training required to perform the duties assigned.
07901.title: Are you ready to put your head, your heart and your love of finance/accounting to work supporting th
07901.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

07901.description: We are currently seeking a club facilitator for the Girls Who Code Club in Summit, NJ . Girls Who Code Clubs is an after school/weekend program providing access to computer science education for 6th-12th grade girls nationwide. You will team up with another coach to support the girls. Why Volunteer? Expose girls to a comprehensive and unique CS education Empower young women in CS and help transform tech into a better, more inclusive industry Develop powerful leadership skills while positively impacting your community Interact with large tech companies and industry leaders through field trips and guest speakers Join a community of professionals and students who share your passion for gender parity Qualifications: Proficient in at least one backend programming language. Immediate knowledge of data structures and algorithms. Some experience working with youth preferred but not required. Ability to pass a background screening. Commitment to volunteer 2-3 hours a week. Apply at https://girlswhocode.com/volunteer/
07901.title: Girls Who Code Coach- Weekends
07901.org: JerseySTEM

07901.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE The American Red Cross Disaster Cycle Services (DCS) is launching the Home Fire Preparedness Campaign (HFPC) in October 2014. Its goal is to reduce the rate of deaths and injuries due to home fires by 25 percent over 5 years. Its strategy includes participating in a community coalition that targets neighborhoods at-risk for home fires; installs and tests smoke alarms; and provides fire safety and disaster preparedness education/planning. This position exists primarily to appropriately install new smoke alarms or batteries in working smoke alarms and to test them. It is part of a smoke alarm home visit team. OPEN TIME DAYS - 5-10 hours per weekend, once a quarter on average - Weekdays REQUIRED TRAINING American Red Cross Volunteer Orientation Disaster Services: An Overview Home Fire Preparedness Campaign Guidance and Training: Safety for Home Visists, Smoke Alarm Installation , and other required training.

07901.title: GET TRAINED TO BE A KOMEN SPEAKERS BUREAU VOLUNTEER

07901.description: Are You a caring person looking for a meaningful experience? Do You think you could provide companionship for a patient, such as reading, journaling, playing cards, sharing hobbies, and relieving family members and friends? Do You have a special skill that can be used to provide comfort such as Pet Therapist, Massage Therapist, Beautician, or do you play a musical instrument? Could You support family members by sitting with and providing company to the patient so that the caregiver can take a much-needed break? Kindred Hospice Volunteers provide friendly visits to patients with life-limiting illnesses so they can live out their days as fully and as comfortably as possible. Volunteer work is flexible and based on your availability; we are grateful for as much time as you can give. Currently serving patients wherever they call home in Mercer, Middlesex, Monmouth, Morris, Ocean, Somerset, Ocean & Union Counties. Free screening and training is provided. Please contact Elaine Carlsen, Volunteer Coordinator at Elaine.Carlsen@gentiva.com or call 888-556-8880.
07901.title: Friendly Visitors Needed in Summit area
07901.org: Kindred Hospice

07901.description: We are looking for mentors to coach motivated Newark and Jersey City area students through their four years at high school. Mentored youth have significantly better chances for high school graduation and college acceptance, thereby significantly increasing life's opportunities. You can make a huge difference in someone's life's outcome!!
07901.title: Be a Mentor - Make a difference for a lifetime!
07901.org: Student/Partner Alliance

07648.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe, comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers.
07648.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice - Norwood

07648.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.
07648.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Norwood

07648.description: Ascend Hospice Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients ; mind, body and soul.
07648.title: Music Therapy for Hospice - Norwood

07648.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07648.title: Companion Hospice Volunteers - Norwood

06840.description: Volunteers and their dogs who have been certified by a pet therapy program (e.g., Good Dog Foundation, Pet Partners, Therapy Dogs International) visit with their dogs on Wednesday and/or Saturday mornings in one or two of our patient programs. All visits are approximately 30 minutes in length and are in a group setting. New volunteers will receive an orientation from the director of volunteer services and supervision by our staff during each pet therapy visit. We love pet therapy at Silver Hill! We hope to hear from you soon and have you join our existing pet therapy team. If you have a loveable dog and would like to learn more about how to become a certified pet therapy team, contact the pet therapy certification programs listed above to learn more. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero 203-801-2320 or lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org for additional information about the pet therapy program and pet therapy visit schedule at Silver Hill Hospital.
06840.title: Seeking certified pet therapy teams!
