Assist with coordinating activities in advance and on the day of an event. Its goal is to reduce the rate of deaths and injuries due to home fires by 25 percent over 5 years. Its strategy includes participating in a community coalition that targets neighborhoods at-risk for home fires; installs and tests smoke alarms; and provides fire safety and disaster preparedness education/planning. OPEN TIME DAYS 8 hours per week (may increase near a scheduled event.) REQUIRED TRAINING • American Red Cross Volunteer Orientation • Disaster Services: An Overview (optional) • Home Fire Preparedness Campaign Guidance and Training: Safety for Home Visits, Fire Safety and｠ Disaster Education, and other required training.
06840.title: Save Lives by Helping Manage the Home Fire Campaign in your Community! : Home Fire Campaign - Local
06840.org: American Red Cross - Connecticut and Rhode Island Region

06840.description: We are seeking mature college students, recent college graduates or graduate students who are interested in the mental health field and who would like to volunteer to support our teen patients (ages 13-17) during their school time period on weekday mornings. Volunteers work with the teacher to support teen patients while they complete homework assignments or engage in other structured activities (puzzles, arts/crafts, board games). Volunteers provide supportive, positive dialogues that motivate and support our youngest patients who are in treatment for a psychiatric or addictive disorder. After being selected for this position, volunteers must complete a one-day hospital orientation that takes place on the first Monday of the month (except on holiday Mondays). Candidates must also provide one written reference and complete a TB screening (PPD).
06840.title: Adolescent Programs-School Time Assistant

06840.description: Please volunteer at Silver Hill to share your love of baking and some simple recipes that allow a group of patients enjoy Sunday morning with you, each other and the staff. Our baking group volunteers arrive at 10:45 a.m. to set everything up in the kitchen of a residential program for patients living with chronic mental illness. You will teach the residents how to follow a recipe, organize the ingredients, and end up with a tasty (and sometimes healthy) treat for all to enjoy. You select the recipe and we will buy the ingredients or you may do so and we will reimburse you. You do not have to be a professional pastry chef; however you should be mature and comfortable with yourself and others. Ideally, we would like you to participate in one of our hospital orientations that take place on the first Monday of the month (except holiday Mondays). A background check (hospital conducts) and a current reference (you provide) are required.
06840.title: Calling All Sunday Morning Bakers!

06840.description: Share your skills, hobbies and interests by being a companion or assisting in therapeutic recreation programs. Opportunities exist to perform on our world renowed Main Street in the village or design your own program such as sharing a collection, gardening or teaching a class. Some serve lunch, dinner or tea while others prefer to greet visitors at the reception. Waveny is a five-star non-profit healthcare continuum that seeks volunteers with warm hearts and a wide array of interests.
06840.title: Friend

06840.description: Show patients in our new residential eating disorders program located on the second floor of our Main House how to knit and to also appreciate the value of knitting. Choose Monday, Tuesday OR Friday from 6:30-7:30 pm to offer your talents and supportive conversation. Your ongoing (weekly) presence offers you and the patients an opportunity to develop a rapport and to pick up any threads of conversations from the previous weeks. It's all in good fun and gives patients a creative outlet for eating disorder recovery. To ensure that you will have what you need each time you volunteer, you will select easy to use (simple) knitting supplies and yarn and the hospital will reimburse you for your purchases. Hospital orientation and criminal background check are required and ongoing volunteer supervision is provided.
06840.title: Knit One, Purl Two: Teach Knitting to Patients

06840.description: We seek mature, personable, and discreet individuals to greet and direct visitors to the inpatient adolescent unit during regularly scheduled family programs and visiting hours on the weekends (12:45-2:30PM Saturday and Sunday). This volunteer position will afford you with an opportunity to interact with patients, family members and staff and gain exposure to the operations of a psychiatric hospital and various staff roles and functions. You will also learn about the types of services offered to individuals with psychiatric or addiction disorders. Volunteers may select available weekend dates that work with their availability.
06840.title: Adolescent Unit-Greet Visitors on Weekends

06840.description: We seek mature individuals to share their love of art in a relaxed home atmosphere with adult patients on Mondays at 10:00 a.m. You do not have to be a professional artist; however, if you love art, you have likely been dabbling in it for a while as a hobby or in a classroom setting. Alternate your volunteer schedule with other volunteers who also support this program that provides an enjoyable pastime for our patients. Hospital orientation required and ongoing supervision is provided. Please tell us more about yourself by writing to volunteer@silverhillhospital.org
06840.title: Monday 10:00 a.m. Art Group for DBT Program

06840.description: Patients at Silver Hill Hospital who are struggling with addiction or psychiatric illness engage in many therapeutic activities, including volunteer-led groups that also allow volunteers to share a hobby, pasttime or talent. We are seeking volunteers to share their love of music and their musical talents (e.g., voice, guitar, keyboard) once or twice per month on an ongoing basis on Tuesday or Wednesday before lunchtime. You don't have to be a virtuoso, concert master or a stage performer, but you should be comfortable working in a group setting and have a relaxed, warm manner. We will provide you with an orientation and staff support. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at 203-801-2320 or volunteer@silverhillhospital.org
06840.title: Do you play an instrument or sing?

06840.description: Using any format that you practice, lead a 30-45 minute group of adult patients in a seated yoga and/or meditation session that helps patients achieve a more relaxed state and acquire new skills. You must possess outstanding communication skills, practice meditation or yoga in your personal life and be comfortable leading an educational group. All volunteer-led groups are monitored by our professional staff. Hospital orientation and training session required. Must provide one reference and authorize criminal background check. All volunteers must also have a recemt TB screening test (PPD) prior to starting as a volunteer. We are looking for volunteers for Tuesday at 10:30 am or any day Mon-Fri at 4:00 p.m.
06840.title: Seated Yoga/Meditation Group Leader

06840.description: The admissions department is one of the central hubs of activity at Silver Hill Hospital. Play an integral role in our admissions department by taking ownership of a key administrative task: patient chart assembly. Each new patient chart contains standardized forms that allow the clinical staff to record the patients' treatment and discharge plans. These charts must be complete and ready to go for each new patient admission. We are looking for organized individuals who thrive on doing a job well and efficiently! As a member of the admissions intake team, you will learn about the vital role this department plays in the successful operation of a psychiatric hospital.
06840.title: Admissions Office Assistant

06840.description: We seek mature, personable, and discreet individuals to greet and direct visitors for our Main House facility during regularly scheduled family visiting hours and patient dining hours on the weekends (12:30-2:30PM Saturday and Sunday). This volunteer position will afford you with an opportunity to interact with patients, family members and staff and gain exposure to the operations of a psychiatric hospital and various staff roles and functions. You will also learn about the types of services offered to individuals with psychiatric or addiction disorders. Volunteers may select available dates that work with their availability.
06840.title: Greet Patients & Families During Weekend Visiting Hours

06840.description: Have you made a difference in your community? Here's a great idea, change a life - with just one hour per week you can help a blind person continue toward their goal of independent living. Read their mail, drive them to the grocery store or bank, help them label household items. It's easy and you can set your own schedule! This is a great way to spring into action and dust off to achieve that olde New Year's Resolution to make your world a better place!
06840.title: Spring into Action:  Can You Change a Life in One Hour a Week?
06840.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

06840.description: Patients in our Women's Transitional Living Program (28-day program) attend volunteer-led 12-step discussion groups and workshops as part of their therapeutic program and personal recovery journey. Volunteers who are women in recovery play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of strength, hope and recovery and how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Volunteers use AA literature like \"Living Sober\" and \"The Big Book \"and discuss a variety of themes/topics, i.e., Slogans, Acceptance, Living Sober, Relapse Prevention with small groups of women at our Barrett House residence
06840.title: Women's Group 12-step Meeting Leader

06840.description: Adolescent patients in treatment for substance abuse disorders participate in a wide variety of therapeutic programs and also attend 12-step based discussion groups as part of their recovery journey. Volunteers, who are also in recovery, active in a 12-step program and working with a Sponsor, play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of messages of hope, as well as how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Daytime and evening volunteer opportunities are available in our adolescent inpatient and transitional living program (residential, 28-day program).
06840.title: Help Teens Overcome Addiction (12-step group)

06840.description: Assist the business office with administrative tasks or special organizational projects
06840.title: Business Office Assistant

06840.description: Patients at Silver Hill participate in a wide variety of therapeutic programs and also attend 12-step practicum meetings as part of their recovery journey. Volunteers, who are personally active in a 12-step program and are working with a sponsor, play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of strength, hope and recovery and how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Daytime and evening volunteer opportunities are available for both adult and adolescent inpatient and transitional living program (residential).
06840.title: 12-Step Discussion Group Leader

06840.description: Work directly with our patients and recreational therapy staff to provide recreational activities that enrich and enhance our patients' existing treatment programs in our adult psychiatric unit on weekdays at 2:00 p.m.
06840.title: Recreational Group Assistant

06840.description: Join our volunteer team as a Library Resource Assistant! We are seeking volunteers to serve as ambassadors to our residential houses to ascertain the residents' current book preferences and to make these matierials available to them using the resources of our library. The Silver Hill patient library boasts a broad selection of self-help, fiction and nonfiction books, magazines and newspapers for our patients and their families. Your job will be to help bring these resources to the residents in our houses and also help ensure that materials are returned before patients discharge. We prefer volunteers who could be available during the week to interact with patients during their free time (Mon-Fri 10:00-11:30 or late afternoon). Volunteers will receive a hospital orientation (offered on the first Monday of the month 10:00 a.m. to 5:00) and also access to our on-site medical education seminars. This is a great opportunity for a college or graduate student, recent college or graduate school graduate , or individuals wishing to enter the healthcare and mental health field in the areas of nursing, social work, medicine or clinical psychology. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at volunteer@silverhillhospital.org or 203-801-2320. We look forward to hearing from you!
06840.title: Library Resources Assistant/Ambassador

06840.description: Join a very special group of gardening enthusiasts who have, for over 30 years, been making stunning floral arrangements for Silver Hill Hospital's patient units, reception areas and dining room. This group meets only on Tuesday mornings from 9:00 am to noon to arrange nature's floral bounty in vases and whimsical planters that delight patients and bring even more vibrancy to Silver Hill's indoor spaces.
06840.title: Delight Patients with Your Floral Creations

06840.description: The Admissions Office at Silver Hill Hospital is where individuals experiencing distress due to psychiatric or addiction challenges first come to determine where they will be assigned in the hospital to receive the best possible treatment. You will work alongside the admissions staff, who are expertly trained to help people in crisis and to ensure that each patient will receive the most appropriate care. After training as an Admissions Office Greeter, you will use your interpersonal skills and empathy for others to offer support to patients and their families by providing written information, food and beverages, and descriptions of our programs and facilities. Your calm presence and good people instincts will guide you so that patients are made to feel welcome, respected and encouraged. Volunteer candidates are selected on the basis of their maturity, ability to handle sensitive situations in a discreet and professional manner and a willingness to also accept supervision and ongoing feedback.
06840.title: Family & Patient Greeter-Admissions Office

07080.description: Contact us for more information on working with hospice patients close to where you live. We provide FREE volunteer training for you along with free TB and Rubella/Rubeola testing. Your pet will need to be a certified pet therapy animal. You and your pet will bring joy and love to the lives of our patients and will receive so much love and joy in return!
07080.title: Share your pet's unconditional love with hospice patients!

07081.description: Trinitas Children's Therapy Services is looking for responsible individuals to volunteer at its Springfield-based outpatient pediatric therapy center. Volunteers would be responsible for assisting therapists during recreation and therapeutic programs, organizing and cleaning materials and equipment and possibly performing a few light office duties (chart organization, filing, etc.). This is an excellent opportunity for high school or college students interested in allied health professions to gain valuable experience and obtain required observational hours or for any individuals who want to help kids succeed in life. Trinitas Children's Therapy Services is an affiliate of Trinitas Regional Medical Center and a leading provider of school and center based occupational, physical and speech therapy services for children of all ages. Our Springfield office hours are 8:00 AM - 8:00 PM Monday through Friday. Recreation programs (when volunteers are most needed) tend to run after school and in the early evenings.
07081.title: Children's Therapy Service

07083.description: The Gateway Family YMCA -Wellness Center Branch has immediate opportunities for Clerical Volunteers to help with filing, office management and paperwork organization. Please contact Judith Mapp jmapp@tgfymca.org for more details. Volunteers must complete our YMCA Employment application and attend training and orientation. We are looking for committed volunteers to remain with us over time.
07083.title: Office Volunteers
07083.org: YOUNG MENS CHRISTIAN ASSOCIATION OF EASTERN UNION COUNTY

07083.description: The Theater Project is currently interviewing candidates for its board of trustees. We are looking for those who believe in the power of live theater and its' ability to awaken thought and evoke passion. If you'd like to contribute to the growth of a very successful professional company, we are seeking board members who can help us to diversify and fund raise.
07083.title: Board members - The Theater Project is committed to an inclusive hiring and volunteer recruitment po

07083.description: requires organized individuals who can adopt one of our many outreach programs and work through email, telephone, and with other volunteers to promote and advertise events such as YOUNG PLAYWRIGHTS COMPETITION, BILINGUAL CHILDREN'S PRESENTATIONS, audio described programming for the blind and events focused on audience development and fund raising
07083.title: project managers for theater -The Theater Project is committed to an inclusive hiring and volunteer

07086.description: Protect our environment and the special world in which we live. Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New Jersey citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Together we can protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. Want to know more? Please join our weekly Introductory Conference Call. The next one is on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. It is a live call, about an hour long, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. Please register for the call at this link so that we can follow up with you: https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/ We look forward to working with you!
07086.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Weehawken NJ

07086.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
07086.title: Union City>>>Advice Counselor

07087.description: Project Coordinators (PC's), volunteer in a leadership capacity at our volunteer opportunities and provide organization and a team atmosphere for every volunteer experience. We encourage these exceptional community leaders to make a commitment at one specific program usually once or twice monthly for the span of six months. Project Coordinators (or PCs) provide leadership in Jersey Cares’ recurring volunteer opportunities by serving as a liaison between volunteers, nonprofit partners, and Jersey Cares. They encourage volunteers to \"Be the Change\" and provide directions during projects. It’s a fun learning opportunity where you get to network with nonprofits and other community leaders while being supported by a cohort of other volunteer leaders. Project Coordinators commit to 1+ projects per month for 6 months at a time. READ MORE: https://www.jerseycares.org/JC_Project_Coordinator Contact: Gabriella Fernandes Programs Manager, Leadership Development Gabriella@jerseycares.org (973) 533-1993, ext. 20
07087.title: Project Coordinator - Be a Leader

11726.description: Camp Adventure is a one-week sleep away camp that takes place on Shelter Island at the Quinipet Camp and Retreat Center. Every year we have a theme with over-the-top events, like personal fireworks shows, concerts and carnivals. It is completely run by volunteers, including our medical team. Our dedicated team of healthcare professionals have allowed even children who are critically ill to experience camp. Camp Adventure is for children ages 6 - 18. Young people 17 - 18 can take part in our Leadership in Training and Counselor in Training programs, that operate year-round. This landmark children’s oncology camp, is MoRE than a program to its members, it is what we lovingly refer to as our \"Camp Family\".
11726.title: Do MoRE for KiDS with Cancer

11726.description: From time to time we need volunteers to assist with mailings - folding letters, stuffing envelopes and labeling envelopes.
11726.title: Office Work

11726.description: BBCC a 501c3 serving patients affected by breast and gynecological cancers in Babylon Township is looking for volunteers to help us update our contact database.
11726.title: Data Entry

11726.description: Volunteer to be on a committee such as our annual Chefs for A Cause fundraiser being held at the Venetian Yacht Club, our annual Golf Outing our perhaps our Bowling event. Several opportunities available. Duties can be varied: PR, decorating, raffle/giveaways,program, liason with restaurants/distributors. Also looking for someone who can type, and a photographer is always needed.
11726.title: Fund raising committee

11721.description: This July, Good Shepherd Hospice and the Bob Sweeney Foundation present their annual Camp HOPE. This 2 day Camp hosts 80 school aged children who have experienced the loss of a close loved one. The Camp boasts a professional staff of grief counselors who help the children to process their loss and develop coping skills. The Camp would not be possible without the volunteers who give of their time and talent to make these young people feel safe special and supported. Each volunteer is assigned as a Personal Pal to a child, who they work one-on-one with for the entire two days. This relationship ensures that each child is given all of the special attention they deserve. In addition to three, hour long grief groups, the children participate in typical Camp activities, including sports, recreation, and arts and crafts. The opening and closing ceremonies celebrate bravery and hope, encouraging these beautiful children to support one another and remember their loved ones as they walk through life. Volunteers are needed to help make this year's Camp a success. For more information or to be added to our distribution lists, please contact the Volunteer Department at 631-828-7611. We look forward to hearing from you!
11721.title: Camp HOPE 2017

08861.description: Be a positive representative of the Raritan Bay Area YMCA by providing a safe and fun environment for children to learn, grow and thrive. The Child watch Volunteer assists in the drop-in the babysitting program for members and their children 11 years old and under. Qualifications Experience playing with and watching young children. Pass a criminal background check. Possess patience and understanding for children. Be dependable and well organized. Have current first aid/CPR training. If not, this training is available at no cost to volunteer. Child Watch is a service provided to our facility Members. Our caring team provides age appropriate activities, arts & crafts, storytelling, and physical games in a safe and fun environment, while the parent/guardian workout at the Y. Volunteers are needed during the following hours: Monday-Thursday: 4:30pm-8:30pm Friday: 4:30pm-7:30pm Saturday-Sunday: 9:00am-12:30pm
08861.title: Childwatch Volunteers

08861.description: \"The willingness of America’s veterans to sacrifice for our country has earned them our lasting gratitude.\" - Jeff Miller If you are a Veteran we could use your help! Compassus Hospice is looking for Veteran volunteers to spend time with fellow veterans at the end of their lives. Veteran volunteers have the unique ability to relate to patients with military service and understand their needs. The camaraderie created between veterans has proven to be supportive for all involved. Join our Veteran to Veteran volunteer program! What can volunteers do? Make friendly visits in facilities near you Provide caregiver relief and respite Complementary Therapy such as Reiki, Massage, and Pet Therapy Read Listen Share a special talent like music or crafts Administrative support What do we provide? Free training at your convenience Free health evaluation and TB test Ongoing educational opportunities Flexible scheduling and patient assignments close to you
08861.title: Military Veterans Needed as Hospice Volunteers

08861.description: Body: \"Reading gives us somewhere to go when we have to stay where we are.\" - Mason Cooley If you enjoy reading, share your love of literature with hospice patients! Some patients have limited eyesight or mobility and cannot enjoy a book the way they once could. Help them escape into the world of Jane Austen or maybe help them enjoy a biography about John F. Kennedy! Contact us for more information. Be the bright spot in someone’s day! What do we provide? Free training at your convenience Free health evaluation and TB test Ongoing educational opportunities Flexible scheduling and patient assignments close to you
08861.title: Love to read? Become a hospice volunteer!

08861.description: \"The difference between friends and pets is that, friends we allow into our company, pets we allow into our solitude.\" - Robert Brault Animals have an overwhelmingly positive affect on so many hospice patients. So many of our Compassus patients have owned pets in the past and miss being around animals; With that being said, please consider sharing your pet’s unconditional love with fellow animal lovers! Your pet will need to be a certified therapy animal. Request more information today! What do we provide? Information on how to get your pet certified for visits. Free training at a location near year and a time based on your convenience Free health evaluation and TB test Ongoing educational opportunities Social activities and events Flexible scheduling and patient assignments in your area
08861.title: Pet Therapy: Share your pet’s unconditional love with hospice patients!

08861.description: \"Our bodies communicate to us clearly and specifically if we are willing to listen.\" -Shakti Gawain If you have professional training or certification in Reiki or Massage therapy we hope that you share your talents with our patients! Massage therapy as numerous benefits for those suffering from illness and their dedicated caregivers. Be the bright spot in someone’s day! What do we provide? Free training at a location near year anda time based on your convenience Free health evaluation and TB test Ongoing educational opportunities Social activities and events Flexible scheduling and patient assignments in your area
08861.title: Reiki and/or Massage Specialists Needed for Hospice Patients

08861.description: \"Sometimes music is the only medicine the heart and soul need.\" -Anonymous Do you like to sing or play guitar? Do you enjoy sharing your musical talents with others? If the answer is \"yes\" consider becoming a Compassus hospice volunteer! Help bring comfort and joy to patients and their families. Be the bright spot in someone’s day! Because music reaches a deep, non-rational part of the human spirit, it is ideally suited to address complex end of life feelings such as grief, fear, anxiety, sadness, and anger that stand in the way of a clear passage. Music can release blocked or painful feelings and can stimulate positive ones such as hope, love, and gratitude. What do we provide? Free training at a location near year anda time based on your convenience Free TB testing and background check Ongoing educational opportunities Social activities and events Flexible scheduling and patient assignments in your area
08861.title: Music Volunteers Needed- Singers and Guitar Players Wanted

08861.description: \"If it scares you, it might be a good thing to try.\"- Seth Godin Healthcare and human service undergraduate students can play a valuable interdisciplinary treatment role in the Compassus Hospice Summer Student Program. Compassus offers both volunteer and internship opportunities throughout the entire state of New Jersey. By making a commitment of at least 8 hours a week, you will be trained to become an integral member of our hospice team. Your role will include participating in patient assessment, treatment plans, patient care and medical records documentation. Volunteers and interns are trained to provide physical, psychosocial, and spiritual support to the hospice patient and family. Interns visit with our patients to provide socialization, sensory stimulation, creative arts and companionship. How can you benefit by being a volunteer or intern? Build your resume: Volunteer experience shows proof of motivation, commitment, initiative, dependability, and flexibility Acquire knowledge about hospice and experience in the healthcare field Develop patient interaction skills Experience significant opportunities for growth and development- this is not a sit and observe us internship! We offer you: Free training at a location near year anda time based on your convenience Free TB testing and background check Ongoing educational opportunities Social activities and events Flexible scheduling and patient assignments in your area
08861.title: Healthcare/ Human Service Volunteer – Summer 2017

08861.description: \"No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.\" - Aesop By volunteering with Compassus hospice, you have the wonderful opportunity to make meaningful connections with patients and their families. These non-medical visits may take place at an assisted living facility, nursing home, or in the patient’s own home. We work around YOUR schedule- hours and patient visits are based on your availability. Come be the bright spot in someone’s day! What can volunteers do? Make friendly visits to patients in homes and facilities near you Provide caregiver relief and respite Read Listen Share a special talent like music or crafts Administrative support- in our office or from your home computer. Complementary Therapies such as Reiki, Massage, and Pet Therapy (with proper certifications) What do we provide? Free training at a location near year anda time based on your convenience Free health evaluation and TB test Ongoing educational opportunities Social activities and events Flexible scheduling and patient assignments in your area
08861.title: Love to help people? Become a Hospice Volunteer!

08861.description: The clothing closet attendant will organize and manage all donated items that come into the medical center for our patients. The volunteer will maintain the inventory of donated items and make sure the closet is organized and stocked.
08861.title: Patient Clothing Closet Attendant

08861.description: Volunteer will manage the inventory of in-kind donations, assemble and organize activity packets, puzzle packets and other items used for distribution to patients, and maintain the donation database. Volunteer will also assist with patient experience initiatives as needed.
08861.title: In-Kind Donation Assistant Volunteer

08861.description: Assist Volunter Services department with clerical duties such as patient chart assembly, filing, sorting, collating, and preparing mailings. Other clerical and computer task as requested.
08861.title: Volunteer Services Clerical

08861.description: Provide comfort to families in the surgical waiting room. Answer telephone in waiting area to assist with communication for patients and guest/family/doctors/staff. Set up beverage and light snack service cart for waiting families. Maintain waiting area. Be warm helpful, warm and understanding to waiting families.
08861.title: Surgical Waiting Area Volunteer

08861.description: Provide comfort to families in the surgical waiting room. Answer telephone in waiting area to assist with communication for patients and guest/family/doctors/staff. Set up beverage and light snack service cart for waiting families. Maintain waiting area. Be warm helpful, warm and understanding to waiting families.
08861.title: Surgical Waiting Area Volunteer

08861.description: Visits patients on all nursing units to offer reading material. Bring reading materials to outpatient waiting areas.
08861.title: Book Cart Volunteer

08861.description: Volunter will provide clerical support for designated departments. Task include; answering telephones, filing, sorting, copying, faxing, data entry and other clerical task as needed.
08861.title: Clerical Assistant Volunteer

08861.description: Assists staff by running errands. Volunteers deliver various items throughout the medical center. For example, inter-departmental mail, pharmacy orders, lab orders, drop off mail to departments outside of the medical center, charts, flowers and gifts, medical records, and patient supplies.
08861.title: Volunteer Courier

08861.description: The ED Liaison will provide rounding and facilitate communication between patients and providers in the emergency department acting as a customer service liaison between emergency department staff and patients. The ED Liaison communicates with patients about the patient care process and addresses any needs or concerns that patients or families may have during their stay providing information about wait times, delays, or directions within the facility.
08861.title: Emergency Department Ambassador

08861.description: Sunshine volunteers bring good cheer and smiles to our patients and guest, lifting spirits and brightening their day. The Sunshine volunteer will round the medical center with M.A.C. the Mobile Activity Cart visiting waiting areas, the emergency room and Pediatrics department to offer activity packets to youth guest making their wait time in the clinical areas easier. They will also visit our new mothers in Maternity upon discharge to bring a special gift from the Volunteer Services department. The Sunshine volunteer will also round on patient floors with activity packs for our adult patients. Time commitment is once a week for 3-4 hours depending on patient/guest volume. Ideal start time is 10:00am. One volunteer each day Monday-Friday.
08861.title: Sunshine Volunteer

08861.description: The Hospitality Specialist will provide excellent customer service to patients and guest to ensure that all guest are comfortable and answer any questions they may have. Centrally located on the concourse the specialist will addresses any needs or concerns that guest or their families may have during their visit or redirect them to the proper department. The specialist will provide directions, escort guest to their destination, serve as a liaison to fulfill request from staff (in patient care areas) for patients (i.e.... books, newspapers, bibles, magazines, activity packs etc.)and provide service that exceeds the guest expectations.
08861.title: Hospitaltiy Ambassador

08861.description: Provide rounding on out-patient waiting areas to serve as a point of contact, and act as the medical centers eyes and ears to ensure that all guest are comfortable and answer any questions visitors may have. The specialist will facilitate communication between out-patient guest and the department they are receiving services from. The specialist will addresses any needs or concerns that guest or their families may have during their visit providing information about wait times, delays, and directions within the facility.
08861.title: Service Excellence Ambassador

08861.description: Visits patient floors and spends time with patients deemed either a falls risk, or in need of a little extra TLC. Bedside Buddies can service all designated in-patient adult areas (they are not stationed in one place) and carry a \"buddy kit\" stocked with games they can play with the patient, small projects, or simply to sit and chat for a while.
08861.title: Bedside Buddy Patient Visitor

08861.description: To provide patients the opportunity to interact with trained and certified dogs during their hospitalization to improve thieir emotional and social status.
08861.title: Pet Therapy (Perth Amboy)

08861.description: To welcome medical center visitors (outpatient) and provide directions and/or personally escort visitors to their destinations. To reinforce the medical centers misson to provide exceptional customer service.
08861.title: Medical Center Greeter

08861.description: A patient with a terminal illness could benefit from compassionate visits from a Spanish speaking visitor. Visits can be scheduled according to your availabilty and are usually 1-2 hours in length once a week. Become a part of the Kindred Hospice team; a very special group of compassionate people who dedicate their time to a truly noble cause. Free training is provided. Contact Elaine.Carlsen@gentiva.com or call 888-556-8880 today.
08861.title: Spanish Speaking Visitor Needed

08861.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08861.title: Mentor Disadvantaged Youth

08869.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/.
08869.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice - Raritan

08869.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
08869.title: Companion Hospice Volunteers - Raritan

08869.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe, comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers.
08869.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice - Raritan

08869.description: Ascend Hospice Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients ; mind, body and soul.
08869.title: Hospice Musicians - Raritan

07308.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
07308.title: Jersey City Area>>>>>Advice Counselor

08904.description: The Crossmen World Class Drum and Bugle Corps is comprised of 150 members, ages 15-21. These members travel the country and perform a 17 minute marching field production, competing against other Drum Corps from around the world. We serve 4 meals a day to all members, staff, and volunteers (around 220) from a semi trailer converted into a food truck. Each meal requires at least two hours prep, an hour of serving, and an hour of clean up, for a four hour shift.
08904.title: Come feed some youth performers!

08904.description: Churches Accomplishing Long-Term Recovery (CALTR) is currently doing Sandy restoration work in upper Monmouth County, NJ. We welcome skilled and unskilled as well as those who are unemployed/underemployed. This is a great way to share your skills or to mentor those who are learning (and a great way to pick up new skill sets). Availability during weekdays is helpful. Our Project Manager is at the shore Mondays, Tuesdays and Wednesdays. You can meet us at the church in Highland Park or at the work site. 18 and older preferred, though we do special occasional Days of Service where youth groups are welcome. We also do occasional Saturdays for groups who cannot do weekdays.
08904.title: SuperStorm Sandy Rebuilding at the Jersey Shore
08904.org: CLASSIS OF NEW BRUNSWICK COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION

08904.description: We are looking for volunteers to help us distribute fresh produce to those in need this summer, as well as volunteers to help us pick up food deliveries in New Brunswick, stock our shelves, and take part in our regular distributions of non-perishable foods. There are lots of ways you can help -- even if you just have just an hour a month to give. Contact us or learn more on our website: http://sites.google.com/site/hpfoodpantry/ Volunteers are needed on Tuesday mornings, Wednesday mornings and evenings, Thursday mornings, Thursday evenings, Friday late afternoons, and Saturday mornings. Mostly we prefer volunteers who will commit to a regular schedule of volunteering at the same time every month, but one-time or occasional volunteers are allowed on Wednesday evenings and Friday afternoons. Wednesday evenings are the only time that we can allow volunteers who are younger than 18. It's a great group of people -- come lend a hand and meet some of them!
08904.title: Highland Park Food Pantry

08901.description: Parker is a non-profit senior service organization, serving elders throughout the central Jersey area for over 100 years. Our campus, Parker at Landing Lane, is a Nursing Care Residence for elders in New Brunswick with physical and cognitive needs. We are in search of pet volunteers to visit our loving residents at Parker at Landing Lane. Requirements: Animals:Dog/Cat Must be friendly Must have up to date vaccination records Must fill out volunteer application
08901.title: Pet Volunteers Needed at New Brunswick Nursing Home!

08901.description: Every year more than half a million abused and neglected children are in need of safe, permanent, nurturing homes. Too many spend years moving from one temporary home to another. They have no family to call their own. They are more likely than other children to face homelessness, unemployment, even prison as adults. That's why CASA (Court Appointed Special Advocates) is important. CASA was created to make sure the abuse and neglect these children originally suffered in the home doesn't continue as abuse and neglect at the hands of the system. As trained advocates, CASA volunteers get to know children in foster care and talk with their caregivers, schools, therapists, and other professionals, in order to gather information about their wellbeing and advocate for them in court. CASA volunteers advocate for the appropriate services to be offered to the children and their families and assist the Court in determining the appropriate permanent plan for each child. No special skills are required and you will receive all the training you need through CASA for Children in Middlesex County. Please note that we primarily serve children originating from Middlesex County, New Jersey, and that travel to other counties is possible.
08901.title: Stand up for a child in need!

08901.description: Transports children/patients in wheelchairs/stretchers or walks with patients to and from therapy departments. Important functional area of volunteer service requiring reliable and conscientious person who is able to make a reasonable long term commitment
08901.title: Internal Transporter

08901.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New Jersey citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
08901.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Central NJ

08901.description: George Street Co-op in New Brunswick NJ is seeking volunteers to join our cafe prep team. Volunteering just six hours per week will earn you a 25% discount on all products the Co-op sells. We'll schedule a shift time which fits your needs while still benefiting the Co-op. Applicants for this position are expected to be enthusiastic, trustworthy, and principled. You'd be challenged to find a more enjoyable work environment. Everyone working at the Co-op is here because they love it. See our Facebook page to get a sense of the buzz!
08901.title: Volunteer Cafe Worker

08901.description: To offer 1:1 assistance to boys and girls ages 3-10 years old who are participating in an adapted swim program. Having 1:1 volunteers with children promotes safety for children, encourages participants to feel comfortable in the water, and gives individual attention and encouragement to help each child do his or her best. You do not need any special training or certification. You must be 15 years old to volunteer.
08901.title: Swim Volunteers Needed

08901.description: George Street Co-op is a non-profit natural foods store operated by its members, offering the best earth-friendly goods we can find. We’ve got a great team of enthusiastic workers, and we’re hoping to upgrade our facilities a bit to make working here more efficient and enjoyable. We’ll provide parts & materials, of course. Depending on your time commitment, you’ll earn a discount up to 25% on all Co-op merchandise. Please indicate the best days and times for you to work. Also, please include your phone number, and let us know if you can receive text messages. Thanks!
08901.title: Carpenter / Builder / Savior for an Ancient Building!

08901.description: The Co-op has a six-hour shift open for a volunteer weekend produce manager on either Saturdays or Sundays. In addition to teaching you everything about organic fruits and vegetables, this opportunity will earn you a 25% discount on everything the Co-op sells -- an amazing deal! The Co-op is a non-profit natural foods store owned and run by its members, selling vegetarian foods with the greatest nutritional value possible, and only minimal processing or additives. Everyone is welcome to shop at the Co-op and choose from our excellent selection of fresh organic produce, bulk foods, vitamins & herbs, body care products and more.
08901.title: Weekend Produce Manager

08901.description: The Co-op has a spot open for a volunteer cleaner/closer. This is a great opportunity if you prefer to work in the late evening. This shift can earn you a discount between 8% and 25% on all Co-op goods. It's a great deal, so contact us here if you're interested, and we'll get you started real quick! The George Street Co-op is a non-profit natural foods store owned and run by its members. We sell vegetarian foods with the greatest nutritional value possible, and only minimal processing or additives. Everyone is welcome to shop at the Co-op and choose from our excellent selection of fresh organic produce, bulk foods, vitamins & herbs, body care and earth-friendly products, gifts, and more.
08901.title: Volunteer Cleaner/Closer

This shift can earn you a discount between 8% and 25% on all Co-op goods. It's a great deal, so contact us here if you're interested, and we'll get you started real quick! We'll schedule a shift time which fits your needs while still benefiting the Co-op. Applicants for this position are expected to be enthusiastic, trustworthy, and principled. You'd be challenged to find a more enjoyable work environment. Everyone working at the Co-op is here because they love it. See our Facebook page to get a sense of the buzz!

08901.description: Various Garden Volunteer Opportunities. Chance to learn new skills, while meeting people who have similar interests. Activities include indoor and outdoor horticulture, Seasonal programs, Children's Activities and Special Events.
08901.title: Rutgers Gardens Volunteer Program

08901.description: Our 1902 Carnegie library building needs a variety of small handyman-level tasks done. This beautiful building needs someone who has the skill and who will take the time to do these jobs properly.
08901.title: Handyman

08901.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08901.title: Adult Mentoring

08903.description: Child Placement Review Boards review children that have been placed in out of home placements such as foster care or residential placements due to an abuse and neglect case that has been filed againt one or both parents. The boards receive information from the Department of Child Protection and Permanency fomerly the division of Youth and Family Services With the reading material and meeting with Foster parents, parents and any other interested parties they collectively make recommendations to the Judge as to what is best for the child. The recommendation is very helpful to the Judge in proceeding with the case and has an important impact on the families.
08903.title: Assist children in out of home placements become a Child Placement Review Board Volunteer
08903.org: Superior Court New Jersey Middlesex Vicinage

08903.description: Juvenile Conference Committee Superior Court of NJ Middlesex County is seeking volunteers to become members of the the Juvenile Conference Committee. The Juvenile Conference Committee meets in the evening once a month. We would like citizens from the community to sit on this board as volunteers and help guide the children. They make recommendations to the Judge as to how the complaint should be handled within the community. The goals are to involve community members in the court process and to prevent young offenders from future delinquency. Child Placement Review Board Superior Court of NJ is seeking Middlesex County Residents to volunteers and become members of the Child Placement Review Board. There are two 45 day review boards located at 120 New Street in New Brunswick, Family Court House. Residents of Middlesex will monitor the cases of all children who are placed outside their home by the Division of Youth & Family Services. Review case files, discuss cases with team, and make recommendations. Division of Youth and Family Services (DFYS) workers are at the meetings to clarify any questions pertaining to the cases. The Volunteers in Probation Program is staffed with volunteers from the community who mentor adults on probation. Each volunteer will be assigned to supervise an adult on probation. You will meet once a week with the probationer to make sure they are fulfilling the requirements of their probation & to maintain regular contact with the supervising probation officer. Volunteers address issues in the court order that include employment,education and counseling. Only probationers with minor or non-violent offenses are allowed to participate in the program .
08903.title: VOLUNTEERS MAKE A DIFFERENCE
08903.org: Superior Court New Jersey Middlesex Vicinage
